But the point of this app is to set a 25 minute timer to stay focused, and then to “nudge” you mentally back on task when your mind starts to wander, or if you think of other things to do—check email, get up and get a glass of water, whatever. This app is a reminder that whatever you think you need to do immediately, it can wait and it’s not that hard to stay focused for the time remaining in your 25 minute work session—and if you succeed you will be rewarded with a new “tree” for your forest (if that is important to you).  It’s also good to see your progress day by day and week by week.

title: Need a timer ding
review: So far I’m loving the app it’s really helping me stay on task and focused. The only things I think could make this app that much better are if you set your timer for 30 mins maybe have it make a “ding” sound when you’ve reached your 30 mins at the end of your timer. Or if your still studying after the timer has been set have the app count up and those extra 5 or 10 minutes that you were studying could count toward something bc what happens is I’ll tend to keep looking at my phone when the end is near (bc my phone locks and goes to sleep to save the battery so I can’t see the countdown timer) to make sure I’m not going over my timer bc what’s the point of studying if it’s not being counted and getting points for it. Right?! 😜 Seriously, I’m loving the app though and I’m loving the little tags that you can write your own notes on.
developerResponse:
{'id': 7077455, 'body': 'Can you check if you have done the following:

1) Turn on Notification in the Forest settings page.
2) Allow Forest to send notification in your phone settings.
3) Turn off the Do Not Disturb Mode
4) Turn off the Silent Mode or allow vibration during Silent Mode 

If you have done the above and still receive no notification, feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system!', 'modified': '2019-01-30T08:34:18Z'}

title: Not ideal for Pomodoros but cute
review: I purchased this app hoping that this could help improve focus on my tasks and support use of the Pomodoro method.  The idea of having a visual outcome of a virtual forest to show a productive day sounded great.  The issue is, while you can certainly set the timer to 25 min blocks of time, this means you can only get the less ornamental (just above the base-model/bush) version of trees since the fanciest versions require setting the timer to longer stretches of time.  Over time, this has led to me having to use a second timer to break down a 2 hour block into the 25 min/5 min Pomodoro segments, which ultimately shows the app’s limited usefulness as a fun, standalone task timer. As a result, my use of the app has gradually fallen off (still trying though). One thing that revived my interest was the  developers putting holiday themes for the trees/bushes in December.  It was a nice touch.

title: Enhanced my Productivity
review:
I spend way too much time on my phone and use it as a way to procrastinate or distract me from things I need to get done. This app has been so helpful. I recommend it to friends and I love that we can plant a tree and focus together!! I look forward to buying and adding new trees and the new additions have been so cute.

My only complaint is with the forest aspect. My forest is not very aesthetically pleasing because there is no option to rearrange your plants or trees. Sometimes the organization by time focused is not what i’m looking for. I would be much more inclined to use it as a widget and really care about which plant i’m growing if I could change the way it looks. 

Highly recommend. The little price you pay for the app is incomparable to the pay-off of the way this can help you focus.
developerResponse: {'id': 26551938, 'body': "Hi there, we're glad to know that you find Forest helpful! Although it's not \ncurrently possible to rearrange the forest to the user's liking\n, but we have already forwarded your request to our team. Thank you for your suggestion! :)", 'modified': '2021-11-30T06:58:52Z'}

title: Great, but could use some more features
review:
I absolutely love this app. I’ve gotten into the habit of using it so much that it’s part of my studying routine. There are some things I wish it had. 
1. It would be really nice to be able to pause a tree. For example, if you were planting a tree at work, but then needed to step away from your desk for a few minutes to help a coworker or something, it would be really nice to be able to pause the tree and then come back and restart it. Otherwise, you either have to kill it, or just let it grow - but letting it grow isn’t a truthful measure of your focus time. 

2. I think the “Plant Together” feature could be updated. It would be nice if friends could plant a forest in a room together, but not be constrained by the planting time of the other person. For instance, if my friend and I started a forest for the day, it would be nice to independently add to it at the same time with different trees and different lengths of study times. Right now, you need to be planting the same tree and the same time and for the same length of time as your friend. 

Overall, I really do love the app. I just think a few updates could make it even better ☺️
developerResponse: {'id': 7341557, 'body': 'Hi,\nThanks for this idea. It seems nice to add this feature in future updates! We will take this into consideration and put it in the product roadmap. Thanks again for the suggestion! Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions or suggestions! :) Forest', 'modified': '2021-07-19T12:56:31Z'}

title: Amazing if you make too many excuses!! :)
review: Alright, I’ll be honest here. I’ve only had this app for maybe a week. However, like many people, I’m a big procrastinator and I always make excuses to not get things done. As much as I hate to admit, I am definitely a little addicted to my phone. Forest does help with this, so long as you have the little bit of money to spend on it and just a little determination to change things. Forest gives me a little extra motivation to put my phone down for some time every day, and get things done. I would recommend using their other apps too, and I would really recommend to anyone that has the same problems that I do. Thank you to the developer(s) of forest for helping us all out a little, I hope this app can become more popular! :)

title: i enjoy it, but i’m missing some things
review:
i really like using this app to track how much time i spend on my work and it helps to take breaks with timed sessions so you avoid burning out. i like the tagging system so you can see specially how much time you spend on a certain task, such as certain classes or chores. i like that it shows which days you’re most productive and other interesting stats, and you can plant actual trees after awhile. 

some features i wish were included would be the ability to add a tree/chunk of time for the times i do work and forget to set the timer. id also like to be able to set a stopwatch without an ending because sometimes i want to keep working past the original time set. it’s annoying to have to pick it up and set an extra 10-15 minutes. at the same time, sometimes i’ll finish my work sooner than when the timer goes off, and then i need to kill the tree i’m currently growing or just let the timer finish, but then my times are slightly inaccurate. i know this is nitpicky, but it’s just some features i’ve used with other apps that i really enjoyed. i will continue to use this app regardless because i like their commitment to helping the environment and i think the forests are cute ways of tracking time spent.

title: Different Timing Options
review:
I really like the idea of planting trees and getting coins as rewards for staying off of my phone, but choosing how many minutes to set a goal for is hard because I never know how long something is going to last.  If I set it for 30 minutes but then get an important text message from my mom, I have to give up and kill my plant.  

I would suggest having a mode that lets you just turn off your phone in the app for as long or as short of a time as you want without setting a goal.  And if we leave the app, it doesn’t kill the tree.  Just the amount of time we stay in the app without leaving it results in different colored plants and trees.  Like maybe 1-5 minutes could be a flower and maybe like 60 minutes could be a willow tree and so forth.

title: Helps you stay on task!
review: This app is good for those who unconsciously move their hand to their phone and then get distracted for 4 hours! In other words, someone like me... If you have a heart and do not have the audacity to kill a pure, growing, virtual plant, then give this app a shot. It helps me stay away from mindlessly going on social media just to check “something”. I get sidetracked very easily and I’ve been wanting to improve that habit because I end up being less productive. Unlocking my phone and witnessing my little seedling growing seems so pure that I allow it to grow. (Most of the time. There had been some incidents.) If you’re like me and are easily distracted and you lose focus often on what needs to be done, by all means try this app out if you lack the mental stability of ignoring your apps.

title: Absolutely lovely and effective, worth $2
review: I have really really really been enjoying this app. I have spent considerably more time off my smart devices and in my real life simply by planting virtual trees :). Everything is perfect about it, it has daily forest growth squares that adds into the larger grid of your long term forest and keep the data for when and how you were of you smart phone. If that isn’t complete enough, it has a setting to turn on to track your phone usage, very compare his experience and pretty, if not horrifying data haha. It’s really just been a joy, and very effective. Haven’t made an account or even explored the online factors, oh and get earned only (non purchasable 😌) coins to buy a super fun variety of trees and bushes, which I hope continues to be built up. Okay, worth two dollars, bye.

title: Super Helpful!
review: So whenever I do work, my mind usually drifts off because I feel like I can think two things at the same time (if that makes sense). Basically, my attention span on my work is super low. But ever since I got this app, whenever my mind starts to drift off, I think about how I’m planting my tree. Honestly, if anyone is afraid because you have to pay, this is really worth it if you’re a procrastinator or have really low attention span like me. Think of it like an investment for your future! Great app! The only thing I don’t like is how I study for like a good hour but only get 15 coins or something little like that. I think I deserve more coins since buying a new tree is like 500 coins. In a way, I hate it because it takes longer but I love it because it helps me strive for a new tree.

title: One of my favorite apps...
review:
Update:
I mistakenly said this app was missing a feature which it actually does have. I wouldn’t have noticed if it wasn’t for the quick and friendly response by the app developer. That just goes to show that these guys really do care about their users’ experience. 
...
This is a great app. It helps keep me away from the phone. The previous version gave you extra coins if you stayed off your phone longer than your set time. Now it only gives you coins based on your set time. The drawback to this is that you have to repeatedly go back and set a new goal once the time is up if you want to be rewarded. That means being distracted by having to reach your phone. Overall, a useful app, just a little less than before.
developerResponse: {'id': 1907283, 'body': 'Hello,\nWe would suggest you to go to settings and switch on "counting exceeded time". By doing so, you can get extra coins with the exceeded time counted. We thank you for your feedback :)\nForest', 'modified': '2017-12-03T23:02:43Z'}

title: Good! But I’d like an Autoversion
review:
The app is good at helping me keep track of the number of hours I work on art and teaches me to take periodic breaks for my own health. In that respect it’s successful. And it even has a pledge to plant trees. That’s always fun. You can look back on your productivity and keep track of how "good" you were that week.

I’d be interested in a version of this app that works automatically, though. Like you set up a date and times when you intend to be productive the following day, and if you don’t make it to those things you promised yourself, it keeps a record by showing you how many trees you "could have planted" if you had been on time. Like maybe some transparent trees in your forest. Just a thought!

title: Best Productivity App Ever!
review:
I very rarely spend money on virtual things, but this app is definitely worth the $2. I have never been this productive in my life. The sheer quality of this app is amazing. Forest has a beautiful Graphical User Interface. I end up spending the most time on my phone using this app, if you don’t count Safari and Messages. Forest has a feature that displays a graph that implicates your productivity throughout the day. The feature that breaks down how much time you spend on individual activities is also quite useful and interesting. It’s genuinely a great app.

My only complaint is that you cannot rearrange the order of your tags, or the order that they show up in the pie graph. Also the Time Line tab is a bit useless. Other then that, this app is perfect.

title: Focus for a good cause
review:
This app has been a helpful asset to building better habits in my life. Sometimes I use it as a timer/ dare to get stuff done , e.g. “I have two tasks to do, I’m going to see if I can get them done in 30 minutes.” It takes personal work to build habits and work ethic, and this app acts as a good support of that. When I first bought the app I was studying for the GRE, by the time I collected enough seeds to plant a real tree outside of the app, I was one year into graduate school and that was a pretty cool moment. (I definitely would have accumulated enough hours work before that if I used the app EVERY time I did work or studied)
I recommend this to my friends and family! We need more trees in the world, more time applying ourselves to meaningful work, (and less time on our cellphones.)

title: My productivity has grown
review:
I usually don’t buy apps, but this one is worth it! I am a very task driven person, and being able to see a concrete thing being accomplished by setting time aside to be productive helps me not give in to picking up my phone. I love the little trees you can see that you’ve built over time, and that eventually you can build a real life tree!

The only criticism I have is that I think it takes way too many coins to buy new digital trees or a real one. I understand it’s expensive to plant a new tree and they make money by people buying things to make them get more digital currency, but it seems hard to set your goals to plant a real life when the goals seem unattainable. 

Regardless, this is definitely the best productivity app I’ve used! Worth the $2!

title: Must have for people with problems focusing
review: If you’re like me, your phone is one of the biggest distractions in your life. No matter what you do, you can’t seem to go more than a few minutes without using your phone to browse social media, text friends, etc. Even the most urgent tasks get put to the wayside so you can give your phone all of your attention. This app has done wonders for me. Having that immediate reminder upon opening my phone that I need to keep this tree alive and well forces me to put my phone down and get right back to work. Additionally, by using the Pomodoro method along with this app, I’ve managed to be more productive and satisfied than ever before. This app is must have for everyone!!

title: Very helpful app!
review: I have an anxiety disorder and one of my coping skills is to scroll through Facebook or play a game on my phone.  Mentally it can be very hard to break that habit, and sometimes I’m not even anxious, I just get distracted.  This app plays so well on how humans bond to things.  If you’re anything like me, the adorable plants you grow will quickly become your little buddies and you’ll want to avoid killing them, which makes it so much easier for me to just leave the app open as the timer counts down.  If you find yourself bonding with small things like stuffed animals or a rock that looks interesting, I highly recommend this app for when you need to stop playing on your phone for a little while!

title: Great app!
review: I wish I could give this 10 stars because I’m actually getting things done!!! I love it! Every time I think about messing with my phone I think, “No! You’re hurting the environment!” Lol. I wish they had one for journaling your eating habits or completing tasks. I would totally pay for an app like that! Maybe you could feed farm animals as you complete your food diary and you could send money to feeding America or something. Or you could be running a digital marathon by completing tasks and send money to St. Judes or something. Either way. This app and the sleeping app have made two of the worst parts of my day into the most enjoyable parts of my day! Keep making more apps! I’ll pay for all of them!! Amazing amazing amazing!!!

title: Gives me another reason to do those hard things
review: I just downloaded this app and although I haven’t used it long I really like the aesthetic of this app as well as its functionality. It gives you a visual representation of what you are achieving inside when you focus and study. For me it’s hard to justify studying even though I know it’s good for me, but seeing a little forest starting reminds me that my brain and discipline is also growing. I like the idea of seasonal challenges too it kind of reminds me of animal crossing. It would be cool to eventually see animals, pets introduced that could live in the forest and grow as you log more time. Super cool! I just studied 2 and a half hours and that is usually very difficult for me.

title: $2 for this type of productivity is worth it
review:
Love the app. 

The Home Forest screen is good. Only thing I would change is I’d like the ability to edit my own forest/garden. Almost like a game appeal so that it’s a bit more fun. You can still do everything you’re doing (because I like seeing my productivity) and add this feature as another tab after “year” if you catch what I’m putting down

The timeline is super cute and I like the fact that I can see a detailed view because I’ve tagged my tree to what I’m doing. 

I love that I can see my friends but I hate that I can only see what they’ve been doing on that day only. Again I’d love for everyone to be able to edit their forests and for their friends to view it too. 

Achievements are cool, I haven’t unlocked any yet. It’s only my 2nd day out here 

The inventory in the store is selective and I love the choice of trees. I’d add more sound choices and I think bushes should be worth less than trees lol

It’s so cool you can actually help plant real trees with the coins you built up in the game! 

The news tab is well organized and appealing to look at. Everything about this app has a very “fun” appeal, it’s easy to use and it all ties together ☺️

title: This app is charging my life
review:
First, I would like to say thank you to the creators of Forest. I am a highly distractible person, and my life has been a battle for focus (often a losing one). I honestly didn’t think this app was going to work so well. I’ve tried many techniques to attempt to focus, including the Pomodoro technique that this app employs, but have never been successful. Forest is the perfect blend of Pomodoro timer + game.

The reason it works so well for me is that I love trees and flowers. Thus, it provides me a reward that I actually want, that convinces me to not just give up and let the tree die in order to indulge my Pinterest addiction. I have a feeling that if wanting to “grow a forest” isn’t something that interests you, this may not work as well. It does help that you have the opportunity to grow real trees, thus adding an altruistic reason to succeed in focusing.

Forest is also simple to use, has adorable art, and sports a decent selection of trees and bushes to work toward for continued motivation to use the app. I hope they continue to add new types of flora as once I “complete” the game aspect of this app I may not feel as compelled to use it. 

All in all, an elegant solution to phone obsession.

title: Have used app for 2.5 years, and I love it
review: I’ve been using the Forest app for the past 2.5 years, and it’s survived the chopping block this whole time. Being a college student with ADHD, this app has helped me so much because there are times where I can get distracted by Instagram or FB for hours. I love the concept of planting trees and being able to see how much you’ve stayed focus for a day, week, month, or year. I also love that you have the ability to help plant a real tree. That being said, I do wish I was able to see the timer on my lock screen, so that by just turning on my phone I would be able to see the time left. I usually leave my phone on silent or do not disturb while studying, so I don’t get the notification that my tree has been planted.

title: As Effective as You Are Honest With It
review:
Forest has been a good tool for preserving both my productivity and phone battery. The pie chart it provides (after you tag each session with a category) also helps break down where your time on Forest is going. 

As a more competitive person, having a ranking system between my friends and I is helpful. Having more trees and bushes is something I enjoy looking forward to; the last update was a fun experience. While I understand the idea of an increasing 100 coin cost with each tree bought, I found myself taking a mental L after prices started going beyond 1000.

Otherwise animated trees. That’d be amazing, and I wouldn’t mind earning a ton for coins for those.

Something that might be fun to see in the future are personal challenges. I enjoy the achievements and their rewards offered by the app (i.e. X consecutive days rewards and X many days’ worth of focus time for coins), and it would be nice to see more of them. Reward variety in the form of exclusive trees/bushes or planting actual trees is also something that’d be cool to have.

TL;DR: effective app. More trees (animated trees? ✨) and bushes to purchase/earn and more achievements with rewards would be cool.

title: WORTH THE PURCHASE :)
review:
really helps me get my work done, a YouTuber who made a video on time management recommended this app to me. I decided to check it out. I am a student & a content creator and I have a bad habit of picking up my phone sometimes when I don’t need to. This app helps me feel accomplished and ACTUALLY get work done. It works, it’s worth the $1.99 purchase for all the work you will get done. 9/10 recommend. 

SUGGESTION: please make it to where if you use certain apps during your work time, your tree dies. I saw this because there are certain apps on my phone I use to help me with homework, but I cannot use them while in “focus mode” if there was another mode that allowed you to ONLY USE educational apps and if you use SOCIAL app your tree dies. THAT WOULD BE AWESOME!!!! Thanks :)))

title: Changed The Way I Spend My Day!
review:
I’m very easily distracted, a habitual phone checker and struggle with my ability to focus. I used to pick my phone up every 2 minutes, even less, just clicking the phone screen to see if anything new had happened or just to check the time (even if I jut checked 45 seconds ago). 

When I downloaded Forest, it took some time for me to actually get the ball rolling and utilising it as much as I can. 

I love knowing how I spend the minutes in my day. I love the productivity I feel when I’m in a flow state and am not distracted by a cellphone going off, I love how much work I get done when I’m not spending one minute refreshing all my apps for every five minutes I’m working on something. 

I use it to time things I hate doing, like the dishes or studying or mopping. I use it for things I love, like yoga, running and reading. 

Plus, every few minutes I spend allows me to receive a coin, which will eventually build up until I’m able to plant a REAL tree. This inspires and drives me to spend mindful minutes in order to have the reward of doing something good. 

All in all, I LOVE Forest. 

I do wish we could customise our dashboard, though. 

10/10

title: AMAZING APP FOR STUDYING
review: So I’m going to medical school right now and I have to study pretty much all night after 8 hours of classes. Its hard to not want to take a break and look at your phone. A innocent 5 min break turns into 30mins...etc. It’s something I see a lot of my friends do, but not me, thanks to this app! These guys give you such incentives with in app rewards and real life rewards (helping save the word by planting trees!!). I 100% recommend this to anyone who is trying to put real hours in. You'll be surprised how much you check your phone without realizing it. Its such a cheap price for the real life awards you will get with all your hard work you put in. I have a study group and this app has helped all of us. Thank you to the developers for making this !!

title: Great App for Focused Production!
review: I find that Forest helps me maintain productivity and lends a solid framework to getting things done. I currently use it while I learn programming, specifically JavaScript. I would tend to either cram to much or get infinitely distracted and not do enough, and through consistent practice I’ve managed to improve my abilities through repeated 30 minute sessions with 5-8 minute breaks in between. I’m not saying the app is a magic cure all - really, it adds a gamified framework that rewards you slightly with points when you complete your timed sessions. However, this importantly makes the act of training your mind into solid shape more focused and fun, and has helped me at least get more productive at work I found very boring at first. I highly recommend this app!

title: Excellent time management tool!
review: Forest helps me manage my time and stay focused. I set the timer and focus on doing one task during that time period. I don't do anything else until the timer is off. It helps me be present and get more done without wearing myself out trying to multitask. I have never been good at multitasking and I don't use it in my life. Forest helps me avoid playing mindlessly with my phone and it gets me into the habit of concentrating on whatever I am doing in the moment. I am motivated as well because I don't want to kill my trees and want to unlock other types of trees. Additionally, I appreciate that I can see how much time I have spent focused. Time is the most valuable resource we have so I am very happy Forest helps me manage it effectively.

title: Very Useful!
review:
Incredibly useful app, helps me stay on task! I’ve recommended it to friends, and they’ve told me they like it too. The different types of plants are not only really cute, they provide a nice incentive to keep you going. The option to plant real trees with the coins you’ve earned is also really great. It’s really easy to look back on all your different forests, and you can even connect with friends to compare, if you’re the competitive type ;^) Granted, you still need the self control to open the app and stick to it in the first place, but that’s not the app’s responsibility, haha.

Smooth design, some customizability (phrases to motivate or keep you in check while you work), reminders, and even ambience. Forest is my go-to whenever I’m studying!

title: high school student and I love this!!
review: my phone is the most distracting thing when I’m working. I’ll even put it in another room and I’ll think about it or want to check it. This app is perfect because it’s impossible for me to do that! I also don’t really think about my apps or social media, instead I think my nice little tree. It’s so fun because you can customize so many things, save up money, unlock new trees, and even sync up with friends. Every time you plant a tree you get a visual reward in your forest and some coins, which can be spent to unlock more things. If you get lovingly attached to little plants or creatures like me, this is perfect! I feel way more productive and this app actually makes me WANT to work!! Money well spent :)

title: Helpful/inspiring app
review:
This is fun to use and inspires me to not only focus but to get things done. I’m strangely inspired to get digital trees planted. It’s probably due to the colorful interface. My suggestions are when I start planting a tree give me 2 options. 1) is to allow me to select whether i can interact with my phone during the planting. I know the app is about focusing and ignoring my phone but sometimes my focus involves working on my phone and sometimes it doesn't. I know this is in my settings but it would be nice to have a toggle available to select when I start planting my tree. 2) the app works by setting a predetermined time which counts down. It would be nice to start planting with no set time limit and I just tell the app when I’m done and the app determines how large of a tree I grew. 

Overall, I’m loving this app.

title: Wonderful!! Recommend
review: At first the price may seem a bit high for the app, but it’s 100% worth it. This has by far been my favorite app. I struggle with wasting time on my phone and avoiding doing stuff that has to be done. But even though it sounds silly, having the motivation of planting a little tree truly helps. And, when I do start doing something I don’t get sidetracked on other apps because my tree would wither away. I wasn’t reading as much as I used to but with this app I’m reading quite a bit. It also greatly helps with doing chores, studying, and practicing flute. And when you complete your task, it’s like being rewarded with a little tree! If you need to be more focused or just want to plant a cute garden, I strongly recommend this app.

title: Amazing app!
review: I have been able to read countless of pages for school using this app. Not only does it have a friendly interface, but it also has lots of cute features such as being able to use coins collected to add to an array of plant life. If you choose not to use your coins like myself and save up, you can also help out a nonprofit organization by giving them coins to plant trees in 3rd world countries. I have tried many pomoduro timing apps before this, even my own Apple timer. But nothing seemed to work. This app has truly be able to save me from failing classes, but also helps me manage my school and social life. I was hesitant about investing money in this app at first but it truly has been a lifesaver. 10/10 would purchase. 👍

title: Engaging and Efficient
review:
For those who don’t want to read my “life story”, this app is awesome and yes, you should invest in it.

The first day I looked at this app, I thought it was a flunk, thinking I could time manage and be focused on my own. I slowly figured out that wasn’t the case, and I was more distracted than I said I was. Being on my phone was a huge factor to it as well.

So after two years, I come back and invest in this app. Sure, the ole’ planner and “hide your phone” prioritizing strategies were something. But I always knew where the phone was and my planner wasn’t getting filled consistently. When I tell you this app saved my work life.

The first day I used it, I played around with the settings and tried it without the Deep Focus. Once that seemed to do something, I grew my determination to turn it on. It was a challenge at first, but as I continued to use it, I realized my screen time went down, and I was getting workload after workload done. That’s when I knew I made the right choice. This app is everything and I plan on judging this more. Thank you for making this awesome time manager.

title: Simple and Effective
review:
I love this app so very much! It’s quick and simple to use (without unnecessary complications like to-do lists, etc) and so effective at getting me to put my phone down and just stay focused. And I love being able to look at my growing forest to see a visual representation of how productive I’ve been!

Two suggestions:
• I would love to be able to create an exception for a single app to use during my focus session, if the work I’m focusing on requires that app. 
• I love that Forest also credits for extra time when my focus session goes long... and I think that means I deserve to get birds in my trees! Maybe one bird for every ten minutes over? It would be such a fun bonus to work for.

title: Best app for self-controll and study
review:
I usually do not write a review for an app, yet this app is one of the only ones that I am continuously using for almost 3 years and never regret purchasing. (To add more credit, I’m currently a graduate student, so there you go.) Not only collecting and planting trees give you a satisfaction that you did something meaningful without seeing your phone, yet also this app can actually donate the “real” trees—so, your money actually goes somewhere that is needed. 

One thing that I have in mind, though: I want to donate more than 5 trees. Please, like, we want to donate more. It’s a good thing, isn’t it? 

Overall, if you want to focusly do something without phone distraction, I highly recommend you to purchase and try this app. :)

title: Great resource!
review: I’m not going to lie I was a little skeptical To pay for a timer. But honestly this has been a game changer I'm a type a guy that I've never had a problem to study but when I had to start studying for a big state exam I need something to help me stay off my phone the fact that I continuously get notifications to go back to my Forest app to help me stay off my phone and stay focused on the task and hand. And the fact that I got a little tree every single time is able to do the study time release little bit of dopamine which help me keep going I've been using this app continuously for about 3 to 4 months now and almost I hit 1000 trees. Anybody has problems with staying off the phone this is a great resource

title: i really like this app BUT
review: i love this app, it has helped with focus a lot, especially since my friends and i get competitive with it. i have one issue with it though and that’s calls. there should be an option to pick up calls and have it end ur tracking instead of killing ur tree. I missed the hang up button and ended up switching to the call and didn’t get back fast enough to save my tree twice, both times losing over 90 minutes of work and coins to keep the dead tree out of my forest. And then sometimes you have to pick up an emergency call while studying and can’t end ur session first. :(. that’s my only issue with it though, aside from that i love this app and think every student should use it.

title: This helps so much!!!!!
review: This app has helped me stay focused greatly, because I struggle a lot with being on my device for too long and not staying on task due to my device distracting me. I love this app because it rewards you for keeping on track, with coins that you can use to customize your experience, with sounds and different trees, etc. I personally  love the feature where you can do a group forest, with friends, so that you HAVE to be determined to get work done so you don’t let them down (because if you fail, they do too). Also, I like that it gives back to the environment- if you save up enough coins, you can plant a real tree!! I’m so happy I was introduced to this app... I use it ALL the time. Totally worth the money.

title: Amazing!
review:
Update:

After the developer responded to my review not more than 1 day after I left it, I wanted to update my review. Just as I state below, the app is wonderful. I forgot to mention they also offer a program where you can spend your earned coins to have an organization plant a REAL tree. It’s a really great app. I totally recommend!!

I absolutely love this app. I’ve tried every other anti-procrastination app out there, and none have worked for until I found Forest. The fact that it still plants your dead tree makes you feel guilty because you’ll be able to see it. I feel like that’s the key right there. The saying “out of sight out of mind” really applies here. It’s NOT out of sight so it’s NOT out of mind. I really like this app, it is definitely worth the price

Also, there’s a chrome extension. You manually put in which websites you are NOT allowed to go to, so you can still use your computer for work (blacklist), or you put in the specific websites you ARE allowed to visit, and anything else will kill your tree (whitelist). 

All in all, this is a great app and totally worth the money if you really need help with procrastination.
developerResponse: {'id': 2991532, 'body': 'Hello, we made the price of trees like that to motivate users to use the app more often. We hope you understand :) In addition, unlocking achievements is a great way to earn coins! Forest', 'modified': '2018-04-01T17:04:46Z'}

title: Great Just one Issue
review:
This app is great! I started using it a year ago for school and it has helped me a ton since I’ve always been the procrastinating type. I never want to kill the cute little trees and always feel so proud after I’ve stayed focused for the time. I also love the option to take a couple minute break in between timers. It helps me calm down but not forget to get back to work....
However I have just ONE issue. The problem for me is I sometimes over estimate how much time I will need to get my work done. Usually it’s fine but on the rare occasion where I do finish early there is no way for me to stop it without killing the tree. I simply wish there was a way you could tell the app you completed your work and no longer need the timer without murdering an innocent tree.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4341679, 'body': "Hello,

Thanks for the feedback.
We'll consider implementing this feature in future updates. 

Please feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions or suggestions. :) - Forest", 'modified': '2018-07-22T04:52:50Z'}

title: Review
review: This is an extremely cool app that has proven to really keep me focused. It basically disables the use of your phone and other apps until you finish planting your tree- your set focus time. This has been super productive for me since I always lose hours in Instagram, Snapchat, and Facebook. It’s also really awesome because once you grow a certain amount of trees a company that’s connected through the app will actually plant a real tree. I’m trying to get to that point but it’ll take some more concentrating! Overall, this app keeps me super on track and gives off a very calming and zen vibe. Highly recommended for those who have trouble paying attention, especially if that distraction comes from your phone.

title: MUST have for students
review:
I’m in the final years of pre-med, and it is grueling. You cannot be wasting time and being on your phone and unfocused if you want to have any semblance of life outside of school. 

This app, for me, is a godsend. Coupled with using a dedicated study space, scheduled study times, and frequent breaks, this app has assisted me in getting all A’s and B’s more than once, and I now have 1,000+ hours logged. 

I really can’t recommend you get this app enough. For the price of a small candy bar you can start your path to optimizing your study times, allowing to do better in school, allowing you more time outside of school and more time to do the things you love.

title: Incredible! I’m amazed.
review:
In the first stage, you ignore the app. You continue procrastinating and slacking, the app serving only as a reminder of your ideal, more focused self.

In the second stage, you open the app. You fail numerous times and your efforts come to little fruition, until finally one day, after a week of focus, you reach stage three. In this stage, you rely on the app to guide your focus. Things are actually getting done and you’re amazed at how such a simple thing has reigned in your potential for productivity. And the one day...

One day, you reach the fourth and penultimate stage. You no longer need the app. Simply having the icon on your phone is enough to deter you from using your precious time doing anything extracurricular... including even using the app. All focus had finally become internalized, and the app, being a mere external vehicle, also seems to waste your potential for focus.

In the final stage, your phone vanishes, app and all. I’ve obviously not reached this stage as I’m reviewing from my phone, but you get the point.

App really does work, if you’re willing to put in the work yourself. Otherwise, it’s useless.

title: Please, be aware…this app collects LOTS of personal data!
review:
I used to use this app and loved it. I had earned just about all the trees and many badges. The app isn’t glitchy and it’s just plain cute. (I didn’t like the update that changed how to select trees with the scrolling time ticker, etc.) Overall it’s a fun and useful app. 

HOWEVER, in all reality it’s a timer/time-tracker. There are many others out there that are equally functional yet DO NOT collect personal data. Maybe this isn’t important to you? If not, I would suggest you read about data collection to see if its something you ought to consider. Apple makes it easy to check what each app tracks and this one is a greedy little thing. 

For me, it’s a deal breaker. I had to remove it from my devices. There are other plant growing timers in the app store along with many Pomodoro type apps. I’m a student and teacher and this app has been a part of my life for years. I was disappointed to let it go. If they ever stop tracking personal data I’d be glad to return. 

If you really want to see a greedy data app, check out the App Privacy for that one major social media app that begins with F. Eeesh. (Don’t forget to click on the “see details” under the App Privacy section in the app store.

title: Forest App Review
review:
This app is a great app for productivity, especially for students who are behind on classes and want to stop procrastinating. I think this app is definitely worth the money! There are only three changes I think could take place to make the app a 5⭐️ rating!

I think Deep Focus mode is great, but I think they could ask you for a list of allowed apps that you can use during Deep Focus Mode. I also think that they could add more free trees considering you have to pay for the app, and I think that they could add more details to trees that take a while to earn, like the 120 minute version of a tree.

Overall, I think this app is great for people who want to get off of their phone and enjoy the moment or be productive!

title: It works but...
review: Theres no alarm to let you know when time is up for ether the time you staying focused or for the break.  If im elsewhere and the time for my break is done I wont know until i pick up my phone and look at the app. Isn't the point of this app to help stay focused. I feel detracted by the fact that I have to periodically keep looking at my phone just to see if the timer for my break or my focus moments went off.  An actual alarm and a choice to keep going when your in the grove would be nice.  I shouldn't have to depend on the timer that comes with my phone, that was the whole point of getting this app. Edit: Problem fixed
developerResponse: {'id': 20609225, 'body': 'Hi,\nSorry for the inconvenience. Please go to Settings page, enter FAQ, and go to "Tree-planting and counting", then "Why don\'t I hear the notification sound...". If it isn\'t solved, for the free version, please contact us via in-app feedback. Thank you.', 'modified': '2021-01-25T01:09:34Z'}

title: Helps me be more productive
review:
This has been a great find for me. I set it like a pomodoro timer, 25 minutes at a time. I’ve been getting a lot of writing down, as well as getting work done on some other goals. Now, you can definitely “cheat”, so to speak, but like my teachers back in grade school would say, “you’re only cheating yourself”. 
Thing is, you might want to use your phone for the task you are working on. I like writing on my phone over paper and pen and even my laptop. So you can set the app to allow you to grow your tree even when you’re not in the app itself. And that’s how one could “cheat”. 
But I highly recommend the app. It’s been a fantastic help in me being more productive lately.

title: Fun Incentive to Stay Focused
review: LOVE this app! I have ADD and tend to procrastinate the important things I need to do at work and social media is the perfect tool to do so- however this app has been super helpful with staying off of it. The premise of it may sound cheesy or like it wouldn’t be that motivating but it’s become a game for me to see how long I can stay off of it. And the fact that you get to plant real trees once you’ve earned enough coins to do so is 1. personally a good enough reason to pay for the app and 2. an even bigger motivation to stay off my phone while it’s turned on or else it’ll “kill the tree” (just on the app) that I’m in the middle of “growing.” Definitely recommend to anyone who needs help with self-discipline!

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE😍😍
review: Forest is one of my absolute favorite apps. I use it every day when I am doing my homework to help me get rid of my distractions. The tag feature is really cool and lets me see just how much time I am spending on certain subjects. I have just recently started using Forest to lock down my phone and track my other activities such as soccer practice, family dinners, and school. The only thing I wish would be different is if Forest would be more customizable so there would be more things you could do with the leaf coins you earn. More things to buy with the coins would give me A LOT more incentive to earn them. Even still this app most definitely completes its purpose and I will continue to build my forest.

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-09-21T07:24:49Z'}

title: Thanks
review: I get distracted very easily (I have ADHD and chronically poor time management skills), and this app has been so helpful for me. Sometimes, you just need that little push to get yourself started on a task, and when you know that it’s not going to be endless, and that in 25 minutes or so you can take a break, it makes it seem much more doable. That’s the best way to get anything done—break it into bite-sized pieces. Sometimes, just starting a timer on Forest is enough to get me started on a task that I would not have started otherwise. Also, I like the calm ambience of the app, and the cute trees and other plants that you can earn. I also like that I can use the app on my computer as well (on Chrome). Thank you!

title: It's a neat app
review:
I have a hard time doing work because I easily get distracted but this app is certainly helping. I don't know how but I guess it's just how the app makes me consider that giving up on my task kills tree motivates me to keep going. The app also has features like being able to adjust the timer from 10 minutes to 2 hours of studying, get different kinds of trees, use gained coins to plant actual trees, has different kinds of study sounds, and my favorite is the deep focus mode where you can't leave the app at all. 

While I can force myself to focus on my own, this app makes it way easier to focus and makes it fun in an endearing way. And while they have lots of types of trees, I wish they had more kinds of study sounds and trees though.

title: Fantastic!
review: I use it to get some study time in. I have a huge procrastination problem and had my doubts since I never spend money on apps, but i caved in and spent the two dollars and THANK GOD I DID. One, if I don’t use the app i feel guilty since i spent money on it. Two, there are goals within the app, like growing a real tree and customizing the trees you plant in your forest which makes it kind of fun. Three, you see all of your focus progress and it makes you feel like a focus BEAST. It makes you really appreciate the effort you put into your work, whether it be school or your job or whatever. Definitely recommend, coming from a big cheapo! Thank you forest team for promoting healthy habits, I could never be more grateful

title: I love the Forest app!
review: I am a doctoral student and Forest has been with me for years through out this journey to help me focus when I am studying and writing! I love that I can pick a beautiful plant to watch grow while I am working that I can redeem coins to plant a real tree. One my favorite features of the app are the personality tests that are sometimes posted in the news section. They are so sweet and high-quality, such a welcome break from the scholarly work. I am so happy I purchased the Forest app and am proud to recommend it to everyone! I never write reviews, but Forest is so deserving of one. THANK YOU Forest team for this wonderful and beautiful app and for staying by my side while I get my PhD!

title: DONT BE HARD ON YOURSELF
review:
This is a WARNING: you do not do as much work as you think. LOL. 
Before I first started using a timer I was, in comparison to my teammates and age group (‘97 baby woot), what I thought, very productive. I don’t even remember the last time I was “late” for a deliverable or anything... I just wanted to organize my brain with a timer. 
OMG. The first day or two... phew. I felt DUMB. My total work time was maybe 2 hours. (Then I started wondering what the heck my teammates we doing all day, if they don’t even work that long, but whatever.)
Breaking everything down into tiny steps? Used to that. That’s business, baby. 
Breaking everything into 15-45 min tasks?Mind-altering. 
I usually stick to 20 or 25 with 5 min break after. That sounded counterproductive to me at first, but HA. I can genuinely say after using this app that I did not truly know what it was like to focus on one task for even 10 minutes. 

Tip: Start on and ALWAYS stick to deep work mode. This will give you the discipline you are most likely looking for. Trust me, it makes you very sad to see that dead tree.

title: Wish I knew this existed when I was in school!
review: Throughout my entire academic career, I’ve never been the type of student who could study for 6-8 hours a day. I got really anxious and resorted to checking my phone to avoid studying. I’m currently preparing for my licensing exams and desperately needed something to help me focus on studying and more importantly off my phone! I saw someone on Reddit recommend this app and figured that it’s $2, it wouldn’t hurt. To my surprise, this app has kept me accountable with studying! I follow the pomodoro method (4 25-min sessions with 5 min breaks in between). With each 25 min session, I plant a little cedar tree and my goal is to have 4 trees in 1 study session. Definitely wish I knew about this app sooner!

title: Great app
review: I love this app! It helps me to concentrate and not mess with my phone so I can get more work done. I rated it four stars though because there’s only one thing I really wish they would improve. You earn coins for all of your successful trees grown and you can use those coins to either unlock new trees or save them up to turn them in for the app developers to play real trees in the real world. I wish you didn’t have to choose between these two. It would be cool if there were two different types of coins one to unlock trees and one to plant real trees. Because I love seeing the different types of digital trees that I can plant but I feel guilty unlocking them if it means less trees for the real world.   Other than that one thing this is one of my very favorite apps.

title: Great App; Don’t like additional paid content on paid apps
review: Overall the app works great, looks great, and runs seamlessly. What I don’t like as much is the fact you have to pay to get some forms of “money” in the app. The point is that you get “money” from growing trees and staying off your phone. I feel like if I’m buying the app I should have full access to app content with just my initial payment and shouldn’t have to pay in to get more “money” to access additional content. I also understand having a referral system to get new people on to the app. I don’t like the fact the referral system is based on yet another different in app currency, and referral is the only way to earn said currency.
developerResponse: {'id': 23834472, 'body': 'Hi there, \nWe certainly understand your frustration and we are very sorry about it. We would like to remind you that Time Crystals are completely optional to buy. All special trees are free of charge during their respective events, and they can be unlocked with Crystals if you miss out on the events. If you participate in the event, you can get the tree for free. Stay tuned with us and we will keep releasing more special themed trees in the future!\nThank you for your feedback! If you have any other questions, feel free to contact us via the in-app feedback system. :) -Forest', 'modified': '2021-07-09T06:27:34Z'}

title: A modest, but wonderful app.
review:
I’ve owned this app for about a year and a half. I’m trying to write a book and Forest has helped me immensely in this regard. Previous attempts have always ended fizzled out, either because of lack of time or inspiration. Since February 2018 I’ve been using Forest as a means to take time and focus on my writing. I use the Pomodoro technique of 25 minutes of pure focused work and use Forest to track this.

I now have over 90,000 words and while I still have a ways to go, for the first time ever I feel that I am reaching my potential as a writer. I don’t normally write app reviews, but Forest has been such a great part of my writing process that I felt it deserved five minutes of my time to praise it.

title: Productively Addictive
review:
This app is really good at helping you get into the zone and get things done. Every time I hear it finish my timer, I just wish I had more time to keep focusing. Great companion for studying and working. Plus it gives you a feeling of achieving something when planting your trees and donating your Focus coins to plant real trees!
If there is only one recommendation I would do to the developers is that I wish there is a feature that lets you sequentially plan tasks with breaks in between. This way you can jump from focus time to break time to focus time without setting up a focus time every single activity you want to focus.

title: Love it but has HUGE, KNOWN BUGS.
review:
I’ve used this app for years and I love it, but recently I’ve noticed huge bugs that I was very disappointed to find support was aware of. Instead of responding in a way that told me they were working on fixing the bug, they just explained it to me as if I should work around it. 

I have dead trees on my plot because of this bug, and it made me feel crazy. 

Basically if you get an app notification and you unlock your screen with Face ID, forest falsely thinks you’ve left the app. It’ll give you a notification to go back to the app before your tree dies, but if you miss this your tree is obviously a goner. 

Not only this, the app also seems to constantly crash lately. When I look at my plot, when I open up the tree selector, etc. Support kept asking me for screen captures of this behavior even though I explained it’s inconsistent. 

As a developer I understand how important it is to capture and reproduce buggy behavior, but as a user I found the lack of listening from support to be really aggravating. In general they were unhelpful with my issues.

title: This keeps me so productive!!
review:
Every time I would download this app I would delete it because I never opened it. About 2 months ago I decided that I was on my phone way to much and I wanted to challenge myself to do better. I re-downloaded this app and it has been going great! The layout is fantastic and the motivation tactic works like a charm. It is 100% worth the $2 and I recommend this app to everyone. Even without the extra trees/bushes this app is great to help you stay focused on your tasks. The cute extras are just an added bonus.
In short, this app is great for getting what you need to get done, done. All you have to do is find how this app works for you and get in a routine for using it.

title: Arboricide a great deterrent against slacking
review: Forest has been my go-to solution for making my phone inaccessible when I need to buckle down and work, or when I just need a break from my phone. The threat of killing a digital tree before it’s had time to grow is real! I love the variety and number of different tree and bush types - it keeps me eager to unlock more - and I love even more so that you can use your points to plant real trees. My only complaints are the limited range of times you can choose and how long it takes to accumulate points for smaller intervals, but these are minuscule gripes. I would highly recommend Forest to everyone looking to gamify putting down their phone to live a better, fuller life!

title: I LOVE THIS APP !!!!
review: The only bad thing about this app is that it costs money, but it was worth it! I always plant a tree while I'm in class, doing homework, at work, or while I'm sleeping or out! It's addictive to watch you beat your own personal best daily scores and to see where you rank every week, globally. I think one of the main reasons I chose to pay for this app is the way that it immediately is giving back to our environment and to people across the globe! How cool is it to be able to log out of our social world and sit back and provide something so basic, but so useful to groups of people who are struggling? This app is amazing and I am committed to using this app for over 400 minutes a day!!!

title: Inaccurate Timer and Clunky
review:
This has happened to me a couple times and it’s so very frustrating. For example, today I set a 30minute timer to do homework/study and I’ll ignore the notification and keep it running until I’m ready to stop. I then go back to the app and it says that my “overtime” is only like 3-4 minutes when in my notification center it’ll read as 36 mins since the timer has stopped (tree has grown). It’s so very annoying and a little bit discouraging bc I would like an accurate read on my study timer. 

The next critique is that the app itself is kind of clunky. When I click on something it will take a bit to process my request. I have updated just now and it is the same and not very smooth at all.

title: Love it
review:
I think you have to be ready to use this app, as in you have to be pretty organized and highly motivated in your work/study to begin to benefit from it. At least in my experience, it took me several attempts at using the app, before it became a part of my daily work routine. What I mean is, when I didn’t know what I was doing and didn’t know how to concentrate or deal with procrastination - the app didn’t have the same effect as now that I am more organized and intentional about my work. 
Now that I am more advanced about my work habits, this app is indispensable in getting the most out of my day. Thank you to developers!

title: Turned things around
review:
Legitimately, this app, along with a new system of 45/15 work and relax gave me the tool I needed to get my work together. This big thing it does is give your brain a new thing you haven’t seen before to get you in the zone to focus, so use it wisely. Don’t buy this app if you’re going to be careless with it. Get it because you’re committed to change, but you don’t feel like you have the tools to do it. Also, use the app as an excuse to keep you phone far out of reach. 

Seriously though, this app was incredibly helpful for me to get my life together and really start doing work when it needed doing.

title: best app on my phone
review: i have had so many issues with getting distracted and not getting my work done in the past. Now that i have this app, i have been able to get rid of my normal distractions. it's definitely worth the money. u can even change the category of what ur using the app for and it can show u how much u have used the app for schoolwork/ hw/ work/ sleep, etc. ive also used the app before i go to bed. i always get bored while trying to fall asleep and pick up my phone, so i just plant a tree for an hour or two and i am able to sleep. the most motivating and useful app on my phone. ive recommended it to so many of my friends and they all love it. get this app, no doubt.

title: App-tastic!
review: Absolutely love this app! Finally a productivity app that doesn’t require me to use my phone MORE! One of my biggest issues with other productivity apps is, when I get notifications and reminders from them, it encourages me to USE my phone and before I know it, one little reminder to be productive turns into me scrolling Twitter or Pinterest for half an hour or something like that. This one rewards me for NOT being on my phone, and the rewards add up! I especially love that if I earn enough rewards I can have a REAL LIFE TREE planted. So it not only benefits ME to be off my phone, it benefits the environment! Thanks so much for helping me make the most of the time in my days, and for being earth-conscious.

title: Works amazingly well, even if it’s painful, haha
review:
Really, this app made me painfully aware of how much I pick up my phone. I didn’t realize it had practically become subconscious for me to pick up my phone to do something literally every few minutes. Like, it was shocking for me. 

I do wish there was an ‘allowed app’ feature or something, because I love to use this at work, but in my work team it’s pretty common to use texts to communicate, so I usually end up setting it for short 30 minute bursts, and then checking for team member texts. I get it would somewhat defeat the purpose of the app, but it really would make it more work friendly. 

10/10, would recommend though
developerResponse:
{'id': 6257684, 'body': 'Hello,

Due to the limitation of the iOS system, we cannot determine what app the user is currently using. Therefore we cannot implement the whitelist feature for the iOS version. As a workaround, we built a "Work with Phone" feature, which can be enabled in the settings page. This feature enables users to use work related apps during their planting periods, but users will have to be honest with themselves when using this feature. 

The trees planted with this feature enabled will not be counted towards the leaderboard, and users will only receive half the reward if they exit Forest during the planting period. 

Currently, the whitelist feature cannot be implemented for iOS. If you see features similar to whitelist on other apps, please let us know so that we may figure out how it was implemented. 

Thank you for your suggestion. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-12-05T15:30:29Z'}

title: Fun!
review:
App motivates me to just hang on for just a few more minutes and keeps track of all the work I do! It makes it feel like 25 minutes (the min for a tree) isn’t soo brutal and I definitely try to fit in some assignments whenever I have down time! 

However, the global competition is ridiculous! I don’t think I’d ever be able to get on to the top 100 unless I’m whitelisting all apps and constantly refreshing the minute it’s done! It seems people are doing 24 hours a day 😂 and thats kind of unfortunate because I want more accomplishments to get trees.
Still love the app! It’s obviously not that important if I can still rate the app 5 stars;
More accomplishments in general would be nice :) 🤷‍♀️
developerResponse:
{'id': 5227690, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-09-25T15:49:50Z'}

title: Ok game, feels a bit empty
review:
The game is okay, but with the features it has it feels worth $1 as opposed to $2. The main issue I have is that the forests each only seem to last a year. My goal for the game was to have this bog reminder of how much I’ve focused, not have it all be for nothing after the year of playing. 

The other issue is the few options. Being able to select the trees you want is nice, but you only start with about five and there aren’t many in total. Besides, with the charity option staring me down, I feel guilty buying any trees that aren’t gonna convince me to keep the app longer. There could be more events or a further-expanded second currency to get most trees, but instead I’m stuck with the five trees I have now.
developerResponse: {'id': 26195137, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for the feedback. You don\'t actually have to pay money for the trees, you can earn the coins by focusing more. You can get coins faster by completing longer planting sessions and unlocking achievements. The main purpose of this app is to help users stay focused on their tasks and the coin mechanism is there to motivate users to stay focused more and unlock the trees that they like. If you would like to make the trees grow faster, there are also options such as "Sunshine Elixir" for you to purchase. You can completely decide whether you want to purchase or not on your own. Please let us know if you have other questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2021-11-10T14:17:47Z'}

title: Best concentration app out there
review: I’ve tried several methods to focus on studying or schoolwork, and this is the only thing that works for me. Even though the tree isn’t real, the thought of killing it hurts me worse than I would like to admit, and it really helps me focus!! And the sounds are so nice to listen to, it’s wonderful. I do have a suggestion though!! I wish that when we have our phone locked to preserve battery, we could see how much time we have left without unlocking our phone. That way, we don’t have to unlock our phone every time we wanna see how much time remains and we don’t break focus as easily. Just a suggestion!! The app is fantastic and I love it to death, good job

title: Serious issue
review:
I just wanted to say that I love this app but there is a serious issue that has been plaguing me for months,

I love forest and have been using it everyday for months but I began to notice a problem... I have it so exceeded time counts but sometimes it glitches and doesn’t count it and I have lost around 24 whole hours of forest time to this glitch and I find it very irritating as i get no acknowledgement whatsoever... it had been happening more and more lately - it used to happen maybe once a week; no it happens every to every other day. Could you please look into this? It’s a wonderful app and I use it a lot but please fix this it’s a major issue

title: Very Simple:)
review: It’s very simple in its design and rewards simple focused attention to whatever activity you are doing. I would like to also say as feedback to add a little more things to the app it has a lot of potential, for example a graph to track our consistency on the app with days or minutes graphed, and a habit tracker to see which habits we are lacking to focus by setting a reflection of the time segment of that focused time to see if we get easily distracted, something to give us integrity of ourselves to ask ourselves or I if I did the most productive with my time, but overall I like the app, more improvements can truly make a excellent and efficient app for focus!:) Thank You for Listening!

title: Must have for students!
review: I’m a full time student, and it’s impossible for me to stay on track with whatever I’m doing (thanks ADHD!). I was in desperate need of something to keep me accountable, and this was just the thing. The motivation to build a beautiful forest, unlock cute trees, and even plant an irl tree was enough to get me to spend the money to buy this, considering I never ever purchase apps. This was the best purchase I’ve made for productivity, and I will continue to recommend this to everyone I know! It’s simple, effective, and surprisingly really fun. I’ve tried several other apps similar to this one, but nothing comes close to its overall simplicity and graphics. I can’t get enough!

title: Amazing: Works Brilliantly!
review: When I got a new phone, I really hoped not to spend an absurd amount of time texting, gaming, etc, so I searched for an app that could prevent it. That led me to Forest, which has worked astonishingly well. I do think it could improve, however. My main suggestion is to have a feature where if say, you plant a 2 hour tree, but use your phone after 1 hour, you get the rewards for a 1 hour tree. This would allow users like me to still get rewards if they actually do spend time off of their phones but don't quite reach the set time to still accumulate "coins". Thank you so much Forest team for helping me and thousands of others focus! 😁❤️🌱

title: Fantastic!
review: I struggle with managing my time from studying, cleaning, exercising, etc.  This app has definitely helped me to manage my time, and I 100% recommend this app to anyone who needs help managing time or even if you just want to pay more attention to whatever task it is that you are doing.  I also love the fact that you don’t just get coins for nothing it makes you work to get them so you can earn new adorable plants or really relaxing background sounds (I adore the background noise feature) whilst also getting tasks that you need to get completed, completed.  I overall love the relaxing vibe that this app lets off!  And again I recommend that you get this app! :)

title: AMAZING APP but one request pls
review: this app has completely saved my grades and has changed the entire way i do my work for the better. like this is such a good app and i cannot recommend it enough!! my one request is that i really really wish that we had a local leaderboard or at least like a country leaderboard bc there’s no possible way to get on the leaderboard unless you leave the app running 24/7. so like if we were able to see it by state or country it would become more competitive and there would be less bots taking over the leaderboards all the time. this is just a thought! love the app!!!

title: Great app! Would love more options!
review: I don’t know if it would defeat the purpose of the app for most, but I’d like there to be a function to be able to make phone calls or texts. I don’t use my phone for calls or texts unless it’s important and I hate not being able to use it to write or call back right away. Since the app is working for me I’ve avoided doing it but today I finally had to kill a tree to call someone back. I like that I can at least accept calls and it doesn’t kill the trees. I know some people can’t stop texting or talking and maybe having this function would be detrimental to the intended use but it would be nice. I think people’s main problem in all honestly is social media, then text messages.

Thank you for your suggestion. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-11-24T07:03:47Z'}

title: Amazing!!
review: I’ve never been so excited to not look at my phone! Recently, I’ve been struggling to put down my phone whenever I’m studying. I will always put my phone away, work for about 5 minutes, get a notification or make a lame excuse and before I know it, it’s been an hour and I’ve done absolutely nothing except scroll through Instagram. Forest has helped me sooooo much! Now, every time I glance at my phone I see a message telling me to hang in there and get back to work, and I do! There are so many great things about this app, I could be here forever, but I have to get back to planting trees! Truly a wonderful app!

title: Makes it easy to stay on track
review: I have tried several things to try to stay focus and not get distracted working from home.  I have tried timers, alarms, etc.  The Forest app works so much better!  The reminders that flash on screen to stay on task help me to do just that.  I don’t stop to fold laundry until my break, because I don’t want to kill my growing tree.  Getting a new tree each time I complete an allotted amount of time seems small, but I find myself looking forward to it and checking to see how many have grown so far in the day.  I also find I like collecting the coins to buy new types of trees.  Really fantastic, game changing app.  You really have to try it!!!

title: Please add!!
review: I absolutely adore this app! Everything is super cute, tidy, and useful. There are a few things though that I believe could make this app better. I'd like to see more events where there are limited time trees/bushes. I remember there being an Earth Day bush and little cakes too. I think it would make it a little more fun and cute to see new stuff, and could maybe even motivate some people to use the app so they can receive the limited time offers. Something that I REALLY would appreciate is if we could change what "year" meant. I use this app mostly for tracking studying in school, and i would like to set my years according to school years or even semesters.

title: Practice Deep Work🫡
review:
We all know the hard work but we rarely take into account how to effectively do the hard and difficult work. The fact is your BRAIN needs a break too and focus is metabolically exhausting. This apps intuitively and friendly incorporation of the Pomodoro technique to encourage focused work has allowed me the make the most of every hour and minute as I strive towards my goals. I also have a healthier relationship towards work because it's no longer exhausting and overwhelming since I tackle it in increments.

Give it a try, you might just build and enduring and positive habit and that serves in all areas of your life
developerResponse: {'id': 31460138, 'body': "Hi there, thank you so much for taking time to write this review. We're so glad seeing that you've recognized the value of Forest app and practice it with us. It makes all the hard work Forest team has put into the app so worth it! Support and feedback like this really become our greatest motivation to strive hard for improving the app. Thank you so much! :)-Forest", 'modified': '2022-08-15T08:24:49Z'}

title: It feels like a game! But I have a question
review: This app does not feel like a boring list of obligations.  It feels like an actual game!  This is mainly due to the amount of work that went into the actual design of the game.  By making the trees appealing, you feel like you want to get as many of them as possible and after getting the trees you want, you feel a sense of care for your garden tycoon.  It’s worth every penny because you also know that your money is in good hands that are willing to help the world by planting real trees.  However, I have a question:  How do you change the color of the oak tree?  I have seen so many people changing it but I can’t seem to find a way.

title: No trouble so far.
review:
Setting a time limit on the phone is great. It's even greater your data will plant real trees around the world. There is no lag whatsoever. Phone doesn't get heated at all. 
Design wise,I wish there was a way I could see my whole field of trees. I would like to know how much I've grown on the app. If anyone know please comment and let me know. 
However, there are too many style of trees I wasn't able to get by coins and not purchasing it with real money. That was a downside. But that is just a greedy customer's opinion. I'm sure they had to made it that way so the company earns money as well. 
Besides from that, I have no complaints so far. Thank you! You're my lifesaver.

title: Great app, currency problem
review: I really like this app. It has a clean, easy to understand design, and the look of the trees you "plant" go well with it. I also like how the app shows your app use sessions in a virtual forest which is fun to look at. However, I feel like it takes too much currency to plant one real tree. You need 2500 in-app coins for a real tree to be planted. I tend to use the app for shorter sessions (15-30 minutes), but you get few coins per session (I get 4 coins for 10 minutes and around 20 for 30 minutes. Though this won't stop me from using the app, maybe there could be free "powerups" you can get for free, possibly by watching ads, that will allow you to receive more coins per session. Still, the app is great.

title: Fantastic!
review: I've been using this app for a few months now, and it's definitely helped me get work done. Even though I don't go on my phone that often, it's a good reminder to stay focused on the task at hand. If I do feel like going on my phone and need to work, I'll just open this app and set an allotted time to stay off my phone. I highly recommend this app to anyone who is serious about getting work done, so that the motive to keep your tree alive accompanies the desire to get stuff done. Even if you lack self discipline, I think it's worth a shot. I really like the assortment of trees, so you can set goals to get new trees or get enough coins to plant a tree in real life. Great app!

title: Fun and motivating Forest!
review: I am really enjoying the use of the Forest app in order to track progress on my goals. I do not suffer from screen addiction, but I allow myself to get distracted from priorities in other ways. Forest makes me aware of making a decision about where to focus. My trees are mostly toward one particular project right now,  but I plan to earn and choose distinctive trees for specific types of activities, so I can see at a glance at my forest over time where my main focus time has been spent. Bushes can be part of that too. All in all a program that seems simple but delivers much more than one might realize with consistent use. Thanks Forest developers!

title: Love but some suggestions
review:
I love this app so much but I do wish there were a few more options for how to make your forest look. The aesthetic part of the app is what keeps me going the most so there’s a few things that sorta frustrate me.
I wish it was time acknowledging! Basically just when you open the app in the nighttime it’s darker like its night time in your little forest. Also I wish you could set the ground match your trees. Nothing too fancy but like a sand flooring for the cactus or coconut trees or a snowy setting. Especially because in the winter it is only the snowy ground but it looks so ugly with most of the trees I tend to get frustrated. That’s about all I have to say currently

title: Amazing app for students!
review:
I learned about this app through numerous study blogs on Tumblr and Instagram. I noticed a lot of students who run those blogs use Forest to help them focus when working on assignments and studying.

Out of curiosity, I downloaded this app and tried it myself. As a graduate student, I love this app. It allows me to set a specific time which correlates to a different tree that you plant. The cute graphics makes me motivated not to use my phone while on this app because it will kill my tree if I exit out of it. I’ve noticed I have been less distracted during those chunks of time I set on Forest. To all students who have trouble staying motivated and focused, try Forest out! :)
