title: Great for procrastinators
review: I can set regular timers but I’ll just ignore them, scrolling on instagram til the timer goes off, and then hit restart. Once the tree is planted, though, it’s study time. The option to plant trees with friends makes it even better because my friends can motivate me without even being there! This is an app worth buying. I raved about this app forever but I know everyone’s apprehensive about paying for apps. I tricked my friends into buying this app by saying “hey, can I have $2?” And when they said sure, I told them “cool, I need it to buy this app on your phone”. 😈 They end up thanking me!! Nobody will regret having this little app on their phone!! Highly recommend!

title: Everything I was looking for
review:
This is an amazing productivity timer! It’s better than any others that I have tried. I love the cute graphics and fun concept. 

I have two suggestions. I wish you got extra coins when you grow trees with friends. Because it is easier for your tree to die, I think there should be a better reward at the end. I also wish there were more even more trees to unlock, that the bushes were less expensive in the store than the trees (because they are smaller and less cool) and that I could whitelist some phone apps that help me be productive. But even with those tiny suggestions, this app is amazing, and I will keep using it.

title: Needed features
review:
I thought when I downloaded this app that I could name trees and dedicate my time to them like watering. Every day come back to my little “chores” bonsai and watch it grow a little more until I have a beautiful little tree on my phone after months of dedicating time. Same for studying and meditation. I thought this app would be a visual representation of time invested but it seems to be a token unlocking game where you choose the price and that seems so dull to me.

What I propose is: you set goals [7 hours a week] and depending on how much time you leave the app open on that plant it feeds off that time relative to your goal. 

But maybe I need to just go make my own app if I want it my way. Good app. Just nothing I’m interested in
developerResponse: {'id': 21358832, 'body': 'Hello,\nThank you for your feedback. We will forward your suggestion to our team.', 'modified': '2021-03-01T07:31:05Z'}

title: Cheating and no breaks
review:
I like the app and use it often but I find there are two major problems: first, the leaderboards and earning points for doing so. I use this app honestly when I’m really focusing, but people who choose to can log onto Facebook or whatever on a computer or another phone and rack up points, climbing the leaderboards for nothing.
Secondly, I wish there was a “break” option during focus sessions. I find I do well with intervals of focus and break like 20/5 minutes or 30/10. The app rewards long uninterrupted focus times and sometimes that’s just more tiring than efficient. Would be nice to get the same amount of points for a two hour max session with a couple 5-10 minute breaks in between.

title: This app is a W
review: The first two hours with the app were as productive as a whole days work. It felt really great to get rewarded for focusing on the task in front of me. Plus it’s really fun to see the tree grow as you complete your projects in the set time you make. There’s so much noise interfering in our lives and distracting us from what we intended to accomplish.  Amongst the noise, tech often hinders rather than helps, but this is a very simple app with a simple concept… “focus on your work and you get a reward. I recommend it for everybody who is struggling to focus right now and needs just a little help being more productive.

title: Forest has Changed my Life for the Better
review: Forest has made me focus more on what is important by putting my phone down while hanging out with my friends and making me give social media a break when I need to study. I highly recommend this app to everyone because we all struggle with time management whether it is on a daily basis or rarely. I believe that this app has changed my life and made me develop better habits than before. In addition, forest actually plants real trees when you stayed focused! So not only are you benefitting yourself, you are improving your environment and the environment of others. Thank you to the forest app and their whole team!

title: The only productivity app that works for me!
review: This app is a fun and effective way to myself on track. I have a lot on my plate (very demanding job, complex family/household to manage)  - and ADD!  I have tried the Pomodoro method and all kinds of other apps to help me focus, and this is the only one that I’ve stuck with.  Watching my forest grow provides instant gratification for my hard work, and I love being able to choose different trees and bushes. I also love earning new items in the store. I appreciate the option to turn on neutral background noise, which I often listen to (via headphones) to block out office environment distractions!  Definitely one of my favorite apps.

title: Good for adhd
review:
Great tool to have but you earn very little coins ex. 30 minutes = 10 coins and every time you buy a new plant/tree to grow, the more expensive the plant/trees get! Then you’ve got to go from 0 coins to +100 more added to the original price making it more difficult to rack up enough to get a different variety of plant/trees. I personally get bored with using the same plant/tree over again unless I wanna waste my money using in-app purchases. 

Either make it easier to get more coins with each use or don’t make them so freakin expensive. Overall this app has been a great tool to make sure I get my homework done before I go check on my phone (because if I go onto another app then my plant will die and I can’t live with that on my consciousness, virtual or not)

title: Useful, helpful, needs some improvements...
review:
Thank you for Forest. I appreciate the motivation the app creates to stay focused.

Several things are bothersome. I’m a tablet user, and I have an attached keyboard. It is not helpful to be limited to portrait view only. That’s kind of primitive, like early 2000s. Please add landscape view.

Second, it seems counterintuitive to have a support page that requires you to scan the page you are looking at to get to FAQs. Scan with what? Another device? Why would you assume I would have two devices? I suppose I can figure out a way to screenshot and then use it to get to support, but that’s not the solution I would expect from a Stanford guy.

Also, the Contact Us link do not create an email or go to a support fill-in form. It does nothing. So, you get to read my support request here. Please fix that.

I also found the app a little hard to work with at the start. The flow from operation to setup to reports to settings were not very easy to navigate. I still have some difficulty with this, and I think this can be improved.

Thank you for the productivity improvement that Forest brings. Keep upping the good work.

title: Dramatic increase in productivity!
review: In my case, the phone has always been a huge distraction of mine. Forest, utilizes evidence based methods of productivity, known as the Pomodoro technique, that many successful people have utilized to accomplish their goals. This technique provides a strict study schedule to follow (25 work, 5 min break, repeat), which not only helps you stay focused for greater lengths of time but the app itself also applies its own twist on this technique by one, making it harder to get distracted by using your phone, and two: allowing you to see the fruits of your labor in an aesthetic and rewarding manner. The one dollar it costs is more than worth it. P. S. I’m also studying for the MCAT.

title: Incredibly Useful Time-Management App
review:
I normally don’t write reviews, but this application deserves an exception. At first I thought it might be somewhat useful; I’ve not found that Forest is an integral and important part of my life. The minimal reward sequencing of Forest, planting a virtual “tree” when you’ve completed an adjustable time commitment to stay away from your phone is a friendly and positive reminder to avoid distraction. The fact that the Forest application actually plants trees when you’ve accrued enough focus currency makes this a wholly incredible idea. 

I would recommend it to anyone who finds themselves scrolling away valuable minutes and hours of their lives.

title: Awesome
review:
This is an amazing app from many aspects. First of all, it really helps you stop procrastinating and get your work done. If you start growing a tree and then go back on your phone while it is in “tree mode”, you will have a dead tree in your forest, which is sad. If you try and go back on your phone, you will see the tree that you are growing and you automatically just turn off your phone to save the tree. 
Second, this is great because by growing trees and doing work, actual trees are planted, which helps keep our planet alive!!
This app is 100% worth the money and your time. Don’t waste another second procrastinating, just get it and spread the word!

title: Thank you, creators
review: I love this app! It's adorable and helps me focus and motivated to work on whatever I should be doing and to stay away from social media and texting. I don't realize how much I check my phone until I plant a tree! There are a couple of things I don't understand, though: when you successfully grow a tree for 30 minutes, you get 10 seeds, but when you successfully grow a tree for 2 hours, you get 31 seeds. Shouldn't it be 40 or more to reward the person for staying focused for a longer period of time? It would also be nice to see a full weeks’ forest and a couple of other features, maybe like blocking certain apps while working with your phone or something?

title: <3 this app
review: I’ve been dying to get my hands on this app and I was so happy when I finally persuaded my parents to make my first app purchase ever!! This app is the real deal and the knock off free apps can’t compare to it. It does really help me stay off my phone which helps me focus and be productive with  schoolwork! One thing I wish tho was that the app rewarded just a bit more coins because it takes a WHILE to get to just 500 coins for a new tree/bush species. At this pace, I could have the app for years and still have so many trees/bushes to save up and buy.  I would definitely recommend this app to anyone who can self-motivate themselves to start using this app!

title: Best app I’ve ever purchased so far.
review:
I typically don’t do reviews unless I really enjoy the app. (This is my second review) and I just wanted to let others know if you have trouble with staying focused, or wanting to have more down time away from your smart device this is the best app for you. 

The gist of it is, you plant a tree, earn coins, buy things via the coins repeat. You can save enough coins (or purchase in store) to actually plant real life trees to help grow more! (Which is literally why I bought the app). 

It helps with school, work, even breaks if I just want to listen to calming music. They have a sleep app as well that I want to purchase!! Totally worth it y’all.

title: Great for school
review:
I use this app almost everyday when school is in session. It allows me to keep track of how much time I spend in each class and it’s fun to unlock new trees. 

Something I would like to see in a future release is the ability to archive tags. I like that I can look back at past years and see how much time I logged in each tag, but most of my tags are only used for 4-5 months before being obsolete and cluttering up the interface when planting new trees. It’d be nice if we could tick a box that would remove a tag from the planting menu at the very least.

title: Absolutely LOVE IT!
review:
This app is just so awesome. There are a few things that I would like, though. First, could you guys make it a little easier to get coins/buy trees (either give more coins or make the trees cheaper)? Second, I got the Chrome extension. I like the blacklist/whitelist feature (yes, I realize it's necessary for the computer), and I wish you could do that on the app (no Pokemon Go; yes music, for example). If you could do this, I will come back and rate Forest 20 out of 5!

Side note: this isn't really relevant to Forest, but I want to say it: can you please make SleepTown accessible to IOS 9? My device can't go to 10 but SleepTown sounds really cool and I want to try it. Thanks!

title: Helpful tool to prevent procrastination
review: Overall, I think the app is worth the price. The little trees and other plants are adorable and I always feel bad when I exit and end up “killing” my tree. The white noise options are nice too, though I only use them occasionally. Although I often lack the motivation to use the app (as I like having the option of scrolling through my phone or of answering messages as a quick break during my work), when I do I’m much more productive. Even just today I was struggling to stay on task and so planted a little cherry blossom. The fact of the matter is, though, that I don’t feel motivated to use it as often as I should which is why I’m not giving it 5 stars.

title: Positive Motivation!
review:
I didn’t want to get this app because A) I kill houseplants and B) I hate being motivated by guilt. But I am a WFH freelancer now and I needed something to help me stay dedicated during my designated working hours.

Amazingly, this app has really helped me to focus because it is strict where it counts, but most of all gives me a visual representation of how much I have been working. Even if it feels like I haven’t been accomplishing much, the little trees in my forest remind me that I have been putting in a lot of effort.

Thanks for this app. I think it should be pretty standard for anyone’s work-from-home app arsenal.

title: Rating this app
review:
I love this app it helped me a lot with organizing my time and actually doing the thing that I need to do which is so fun and makes me relax a lot more. 

About a year ago before I started using this app I was very addicted to my electronics and just couldn’t stop being on them which was honestly horrible and then a friend of mine recommended it for and it just changed my life I really think everyone should have this app it is very very good and organized your life you can even take a quiz on the app that lets you have your own flower which I really love so I really recommend it.

title: Forest app review
review: This app has CHANGED MY LIFE!!! It helped me leave the procrastiNATION nation and become sooooo much more organized with my time. It made me enjoy doing work and actually have free time. I absolutely love the design and ideology behind it. It also offers sounds that make it easier for you to focus, and frankly they’re the only sounds that have actually just been background noise and not distracting. Plus, you get break time after every increment of work time that you do. Even though it costs money, it is TOTALLY WORTH IT!!! Additionally, the money goes to help plant real trees, which makes you feel great about the small amount spent. I love this app!!!!!!

title: Strongly recommend
review: I get distracted very easily and when I’m at work I have several people asking for help on tasks. It makes it hard to focus on my tasks. Not only has Forest app enabled me to focus better and not glance at my phone when a text comes through or I’m simply overwhelmed and need distraction, but it’s helped me create boundaries. (E.g., if the app is running, people know they cannot get ahold of me through my cell, so they’re forced to call my work line or use their own resources for the answer). Additionally, I love when I can look back at the day and say I focused for XX amount of time, with the reward of a flourishing forest. Its simple but extremely rewarding.

title: Great for studying
review: I used this app regularly for studying and find that it gives great motivation. Thus far I have had no problems, but I did encounter one thing that I would do differently. I have my app connected to my chrome browser and, without thinking, started a session in the app and on the browser. I had an extra 30 minutes in my forest and, since I didn’t actually study that long, wanted to delete it. Instead of costing me the 9 coins I earned in my session, it cost me 60 coins. To me, this discourages honesty in your forest should you make a mistake like mine. That said, I would never remove even half a star over that incident. Great app :)

title: Very cute, actually works
review: As a college engineering student with ADHD and a passion for planetary sustainability, it feels like this app was made specifically for me. I do often need notes and such from my phone so I can't use it all the time, but it serves as a constant incentive to choose a phoneless study session when I can. It's the "just break things up into 30 minute sessions" recommendation from every therapist I've ever had, except it actually works. There are a few hiccups/things that could be smoother when connecting with friends and navigating the achievement rewards and such, but they're not detrimental to the overall function and value.

title: Great App
review: This app is great for focusing. Not only does it provide a reward for positive behavior (a cute little tree), but it allows the user to give back to the environment if you get enough coins. I also love how the app tracks daily and weekly focus and how it gives you the option to listen to forest sounds that aid with focusing as well. The one thing that I would suggest to the app makers would be to give an option as the free is growing to add minutes to the timer if the user decides to work longer. Having a dial to set that would give the user the option to take less time and still get a reward which is bad and enforces bad habits, but a button to add a few more minutes to get a better tree would be nice.

title: Love it!
review:
This app is a perfect focus builder. I didn’t notice how often I tend to interrupt my daily activities with checking my phone u til I got this app. The idea of killing a tree to generate a search or check my social media is terrible so generally I tend to stay on track!

Also love that it has a section after each session to journal. I make notes after yoga sessions of what I felt/ need work on, how I felt after reading a certain amount of my book of the day, or other motivating/reflective thoughts after focusing on what I need to per session. 

Highly recommend if you’re trying to stay more organized or on top of your daily habits

title: ADHDer’s assistant
review: As someone who has ADHD, this is a great app. Being able to see myself making progress helps a bit with executive dysfunction, and because I often have trouble switching to a new task because of my ADHD, this app helps me a lot because 1) can’t do something else while it’s running unless I want to lose and I’m too competitive for that, and 2) for some reason, it’s easier to get working once I press that button to start. I think deciding to start the timer is an easier prospect than deciding to start work, but once I press that button, well, I’m in the work mindset now, so I might as well actually do some work!

title: Better than a boring timer
review: I’m enjoying this app! I’ll be honest. Have I looked at my iPad or TV or some other screen while the app is running? Yes. Yes I have. But I’m more conscientious about it. I feel more motivated to stay on task. I’m a teacher and grad student and in spite of my slip-ups, I always manage to get done what I need to. This app gives me a little extra gratification for that hour of focused studying and it provides a friendly layer of accountability. And I have an adorable forest to show for it. Especially given the Amazonian forest fires happening right now, gifting my coins towards a live tree donation is a great reward for something I need to be doing anyway.

title: It Saved My Marriage
review: I was on the verge of divorce because time would slip from my hands. I would peak on my phone just to view a notification and then I’d find myself watching Instagram stories of people that didn’t even look like my wife. My children started to notice I wasn’t fully engaged. I just couldn’t fight the social media addiction. I needed something more than will power and counseling. I needed Forest. Now my garden is so beautiful! Sometimes I can go on for hours without even looking at the phone! My wife hugs me and my children don’t call me by my first name anymore! Thank you Forest!

title: Helps so much to study!
review: I’m a college student and I’ve been getting a lot of homework especially since we’ve gone 100% online now. It’s hard to find motivation on my own without teachers or my classmates interactions but this app helps me a lot. My soul doesn’t want the tree to die lolll, so it keeps me off my phone as I do homework and in turn, I grow this forest. It’s a win-win really. I love how you can also grow plants with your friends too! The challenge helps just to connect when you’re all trying to do work or if you’re all together, it keeps focus of the group. I highly suggest the app if you wanna stop procrastinating

title: Challenging App to Inspire a New Level if Focus
review: Planting trees requires REAL work. 1 simple timer won’t cut it and that’s where your role begins. You have the chance to push yourself to new levels of concentration to save as many coins as you can to plant a real tree at 2,500 coins. 2,500 coins is a daunting challenge that isn’t cut out for everyone. Be the exception. Be better than yourself. The more you study, the closer you get to adding real trees to the world. I thought I’d genuinely be planting at least 1 tree a day. Although I originally thought this was too good to be true, it is very clear the challenge you are presented with to create a better environment. Join the wave and enjoy the benefits of the new you. See ya there.
developerResponse: {'id': 17847659, 'body': "Hi,\nSince the cost of planting real trees is covered by the company, complications might arise when users plant too many real trees; the cost can also easily exceed the app's revenue. Therefore, the price to plant a real tree requires a certain amount of focus time to reach. You can gain coins faster by unlocking achievements. :)\n- Forest", 'modified': '2020-09-14T00:38:18Z'}

title: Best App Ever!!! Highly Recommended!
review: I’m currently a high school student, and I always have a hard time staying away from my phone as much as possible while I’m doing my work. I’ve tried putting it as far away as possible from me, but I always end up trying to get it back after 5 minutes of being productive. This app fixed everything for me! For some reason, the determination of trying to plant as many trees and plants as possible gets me to work and focus better. And, most importantly, I can complete more homework in shorter amounts of time. This app has really made me the best student I can be. It was so worth the money. 🤪❤️

title: At first I barely ever used this app
review: At first, I never really used this app (maybe once or twice, but I never actually went entire hours using it) and it just sat in my phone for months. When finals season came around, this app was my most prized possession on my phone! I recommend just going for it and actually using it maybe hours at a time, over and over. Of course, turn the sounds (like the rainy forest sound or something) in the app so you are notified when it stops and you will not obsessively reach for it just to check the timer! I rambled a lot in this review, but basically I love this app and I do not regret my purchase!

title: This app is awesome
review:
For you study freaks, the Pomodoro Technique is very useful in studying because it emphasizes intense studying. Think of it as intermittent studying where you study intensely, and then take a small break, and then resume again with intense study. 

What is clever with this app is that you can set a pomodoro timer and simultaneously “grow” a tree to create a forest. When that timer is up, take a break; a tree is grown after the timer and you receive coins. You can use these coins to plant real trees. So, this app is designed to increase your productivity and contribute to the environment. I hope this provides whomever is reading this review. 

This app is awesome. Go and download it!

title: Helps me focus, soothing too!
review:
I love forest. I’m a student with ADHD and I have to do a lot of reading, but have trouble... uh.. focusing. This helps combat the phone fixation part of that with small doses of fake guilt brought about by empathizing with a fake baby tree! Plus you can pretend that you’re making a difference to real trees out there if that does it for you. I also feel like I have to use it because I paid for it, which is great too. Mostly I like the nice happy sounds that my little trees make. I’d like a feature where I could authorize certain apps like messaging tho, cus it really does kill your tree if you have to text someone back :-(.

does what it says!
developerResponse:
{'id': 5359445, 'body': 'Hello,

Due to the limitation of the iOS system, we cannot determine what app the user is currently using. Therefore we cannot implement the whitelist feature for the iOS version. As a workaround, we built a "Work with Phone" feature, which can be enabled in the settings page. This feature enables users to use work related apps during their planting periods, but users will have to be honest with themselves when using this feature. 

The trees planted with this feature enabled will not be counted towards the leaderboard, and users will only receive half the reward if they exit Forest during the planting period. 

Currently, the whitelist feature cannot be implemented for iOS. If you see features similar to whitelist on other apps, please let us know so that we may figure out how it was implemented. 

Thank you for your suggestion. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-10-04T14:16:12Z'}

review: This app is wonderful for shooing distractions, and I’m overall pleased with my purchase; however, there are a few minor issues that I have. First, instead of setting a maximum of five real trees planted, I recommend making the first tree more attainable, and each one following more expensive, with no cap. Second, the advertisements claim customizable statistics, but I see no place for customization. I would love to see more visualizations of more data, but I have no way to do this. Finally, this is probably more of a personal thing, but the FAQ section doesn’t load on my phone, which I find a little odd. Overall, it is a great app, but it needs more real world tree planting and data customization.
developerResponse:
{'id': 5580537, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app
feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-10-19T17:17:18Z'}

title: Super effective - one request
review: Love it. Having that extra incentive to keep going when you plant something with another person is lovely and I’m very grateful for that update. Everything about the app is wonderful !!!! I only have one request — can y’all make it so when a group timer is done and the tree is planted, exceeded time is counted (obviously when all parties have not exited the app)? And rather than requiring everybody have it turned on, have it so that it is an option to turn on “counting exceeded time” when creating a room? At least for two people? (since it is just my friend and I who plant together.) Thank you for this great app!!
developerResponse:
{'id': 5067123, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-09-16T14:37:47Z'}

title: Helps you stay motivated and focused!
review:
I am a full time college student and have always struggled with staying focused. This app has taught me to stay more focused and productive. It’s really nice to be able to grow a tree in your forest and see the stats over the day, week, and month.

I have seen a positive improvement in my grades using this app, mainly because I am on a more consistent “studying schedule”. I like the 25 minute studying, then a 5 minute break method. Additionally, they have some nice background noises you can play while studying. Overall, a really good app to hold yourself accountable and stay focused.

title: Forest helps me grow
review: I'm a middle school teacher.  The biggest battle my students face daily is the addictive draw to their cell phones. This app was introduced to me by a student; she explained that she uses it to help her during homework time. Dealing with my own issues focusing while grading hundreds of essays, I thought I'd try it out. I love that I have a visual to remind me that I achieved focus, away from my phone, for a concrete amount of time. It also is a good indicator to remind myself when to take a break. All of the addictive creatures any good phone app has, this phone lock down app has to counter.  I have since suggested this app to other students.

title: It’s a trusty app
review: The thing I have the most difficulty with it, is that there is no alarm for when the timer is done, it just sounds like a notification, which is not ideal for me personally. Also, you can’t stop the timer, so if you need to take a 5 min break between 60 min, you can’t stop the watch. I guess this is the point since you’re suppose to be off your phone while studying, but sometimes it’s impossible because I have emergency texts from my family but I can’t respond without killing my tree. It’s a good app to use when you need to just sit down and do your work. I mainly use it to keep track of how much I study for my ACT and etc. It’s a good app for a good cause.

title: Does what it’s supposed to!
review:
I really enjoy this app, I always feel bad killing my trees so it keeps me off my phone and focused on work! Great idea! I love that you can see all your tree progress and build points for other trees! 

Some ideas to improve! It’d be cool if you could have an “over all” forest! One that you can combine small trees into bigger ones, make it more elaborate, and potentially a tree community! Like wise, if you buy something, like a new type of tree, you get that amount of trees taken from your community forest! Just an idea 😊 I love it! I just also would like to play more with it after having stayed off my phone for so long 😅

title: I’m in love with this app...on accident.
review:
This app was recommended by one of my friends. Don’t get me wrong, I love this app so very much, that even when I drop my phone...I check to see if this app is ok. Ok maybe I don’t do that, but I care a lot about this app. Anyways, my friend recommended this app to me and I was like, “ok”. So I went to the App Store, didn’t see what I was doing, downloaded it, and well..it told me, “thank you for your $1.99 purchase. And I was like WHAT! But its ok that it’s only $2.00 because I FRIGGIN LOVE IT. It has helped me stay organized, on accident. So thank you forest. And thank YOU for reading this very long thing. 

                           P.S. you should get it!

title: Take back your productivity!
review: I have always wanted a productivity app but I have looked in all the wrong places! I previously have downloaded a free app blockers that were no use. This app incorporate positive reinforcement to the negative habit of always using your phone when trying to get stuff done. I love how you’re able to use the coins you earn to get new trees and sounds, it’s also anything how they show an ugly dead tree when you fail to stay off your phone! However using Siri will not spend your time on this app, but don’t let that be an excuse for you to text everyone while trying to do your homework or other hobbies!

title: It works! No joke!
review:
I was totally skeptical. But this really, really helps keep me focused! And surprisingly more even effective than the “threat” of killing a tree, which is motivation in and of itself, is the incentive that if I stay focused for so long I earn points I can use to redeem other kinds of trees.

I’ll be studying/reading along and have a thought like, oh I need (read “want”) to do *this something* on my phone but then I remember that I don’t want to disturb my tree and I’ll get back to it later. And I stay focused!! 

Suggestion: could expand beyond earning additional trees into different flowers and plants and maybe park features like fountains/benches?

title: Make landscape, split view, and slide over view
review: I love this app, but it’s shocking that after years there is still NO support for landscape view, split view, and slide over view. Absolutely not ok for a 5 star rating. I take notes in landscape view a lot as a lot of people do, and it’s frustrating to have to go back to portrait view because forest does not support landscape view. While it’s a small annoyance of rotating my iPad 90 degrees every time I use forest, the annoyance grows overtime hence why I’m writing this lengthy review. I should be able to switch between my note taking app and still be in landscape mode after going to forest. I should be able to use slide over I can get a peek of the time I have left to focus while studying. But instead I have to rotate my iPad making some resistance to my workflow.
developerResponse: {'id': 18688164, 'body': "Hi,\nCurrently we don't have a complete landscape mode interface for iPad users, but you can view your Forest in landscape mode by going to your Forest page and then rotating your device.\nThank you for the suggestion, we'll relay your request to our team. :)", 'modified': '2020-10-25T14:52:20Z'}

title: Super Useful!
review:
This app has been a fun way to stay productive in the last few weeks of my school year! It’s very cute and I love the background sounds available while I work. 
My only problem has been when an alarm goes off or someone calls me that the app automatically closes and kills whatever I had planted at the time. It’s done this a few times regardless of me denying the call and leaving my phone at rest. Not a huge issue since it’s out of anyone’s control, just sad when I lose the coins that are already difficult to accumulate. 
Overall, this app has been a wonderful tool for me to balance my productivity and see where I’m devoting time throughout my week!

title: Seriously improved my productivity / Please make friends more user-friendly
review: I use this app to keep me from getting distracted and to track how much time I spend on each task I’m working on. I love the variety of trees/bushes you can plant, the ability to add tags and see your productivity over time, and the group planting function. One thing I would love to see is the ability to search, sort, and favorite/group friends as well as mass select friends when inviting to plant a bush or tree. It’s tedious going through the list and picking everybody one by one, or having to scroll through a long list to find a particular friend.

title: Tree Doesn’t Die
review: I bought the app and first thing I did was test it. I planted a tree, waited a second, then went to the home screen and opened up pinterest, closed pinterest, and went back and the tree was not dead. Very disappointed to see this as I have a tendency to randomly pick up my phone and check things instead of having my timer up, but this was just another timer and it cost me $2. I hope that this is a bug for the current version and that it will be fixed because the concept of this app is great but the fact that I can go into other apps makes this completely useless.

title: Actually helpful!!
review:
I’m your typical college student/office worker; I’m on my desk at work, home, or school and my phone often keeps me busy doing ANYTHING but my actual work I’m supposed to be focusing on... this app was worth the every penny.

I actually have fun growing as many trees as I can during a work shift, school day, or study sesh in my room. I like that they also have “timed breaks” after you’ve grown a tree. What i do is the Pomodoro Technique: I grow a tree for 25-30mins then take a timed 5min break where I get up and do something else then repeat it!

The visuals of how many trees you’ve done gives this a healthy desire to fill up your little forest each day.

title: Unique app to solve many problems
review: I used to have a massive issue with procrastination and not doing homework, studying, and meditation. This app holds me responsible by planting bushes and trees and prevents me from exiting the app for more than around 10 seconds. It's also really great because I can close my phone with the app still running and I can still receive important calls from others when the app is on- so God forbid anything bad happens, I can still be available. I simply ❤️ how the forest is changed with the Christmas season and I hope that they’ll make the forest also change in the future spring, summer, and fall seasons please 😁

title: Worth every penny
review: Honest at first I thought I wasted money downloading another stupid app that would help me cure my depression, but over time I found out how beneficial is this app. Please tell me what you name is and I’ll send u the money to buy this app, also this app is really helpful with my screen time I went from being locked in my room , my phone controlling my life to going outside and generally enjoying life. To the people who created this app me, my friends , my spouse , and my family thank you it really got us to put our phones downs and just enjoy every minute we have together thank you sincerely a very happy costumer

title: eh - not worth the money
review:
Forest is a great idea, and it works well, but all you get from your productivity w default setting is a shrub and a pine tree. So you just fill your garden with that for a while. You need A LOT of coins to buy other stuff or have to pay $. The only thing I like better about it than flora (another productivity app) is that you can plant an actual tree without paying money, but you obviously still need a lot of coins. I prefer Flora because you just have to be productive for so long to unlock a new tree. It takes less time. The garden isn’t on a square though - which I think I’d prefer. (Written after my first 3 days  of using) 
I also, after about a week, was granted a new plant for free, so things are looking up. :)

title: Keeps me focused ❤️
review: I started using Forest because someone sent me the personality test and I thought it was the cutest thing. I looked more into the app and was honestly a bit skeptically that the growth of a virtual plant would motivate me to stay off my phone and focused. However, the cute layout won me over and I decided to give it a shot. I currently find myself staying off my phone for very productive and extended periods of time for the sake of my virtual forest, and I love it. I’m not sure what it is about the app that makes me care about my virtual plant, but it works and I’m noticeably more productive because of it. Keep up the creative content! Love and Håfa Adai from Guåhan

title: Keeps You Accountable
review:
This app simultaneously irritates me and doesn’t, because it does its job so well! You set the timer as to how long you want to focus on something and a tree starts growing. If you close the app your tree will die. The only downside to it is now I can’t use my phone to procrastinate work. Oh, and, you can’t really change your music while growing a tree because leaving the app kills it. I like the in app sounds, too, they’re peaceful. You can mute them if you like, but I find myself listening to the bird chirping anyways.

Long story short, I love it because it keeps me from getting distracted! 
(And you grow a cute tree)

title: Its so worth it and cute
review:
Get your life together. This app helps if you have focusing problems like i do by allowing you short focus times to work your way up to longer ones. So it helps increase your productivity by increments you can manage. Plus it gives that sweet sweet instant gratification because you earn cute little trees and coins that go to even cuter trees!
I don't like paying for apps but I'm so glad i bought this one.
If you want to change anything give a little audio alert if I accidentally home button out of the app before i lock it. I lose so many trees by something so silly.
Thanks for making this app!

title: Love it
review: I don’t know why I care if these trees die, but I do. Even if I’m working in my laptop, goofing off feels like cheating. I also used the app a ton on my family vacation. We stood in lots of lines at Disney and it would have been really easy for me to just check my phone (and stay on it). Instead, I was engaged with my kids and playing games with them and talking about the trip. I’m sure other people don’t have the bad habit of reaching for their phone the moment they get bored, but I do. This app has been great for curing that habit way back and stopping me from zoning out and then wondering where my last 25 minutes went.

title: Great help to stop procrastinating
review: I was struggling to sit and study, and I’m a Dental student, so that is something I can’t afford. I went around in the app store and got some apps that were free but didn’t really help because you didn’t see that factor of “if I use the phone it will kill the garden, and I have work hard on that”. And you can also use it with friends and classmates, each of you in your study place near or miles away, you set up a timer and just focus for the determine time, and it feels good having someone and knowing they are too focusing on a task.

title: Version for Tablets in Horizontal View
review:
I have always been (and sometimes still) a MAJOR procrastinator, and even with timers and using pomodoro technique, I still struggled with keeping myself from picking up my phone.
I’m a sophomore in college, and this app has been very helpful in making sure I keep myself accountable as far as studying and completing school work. 
Though this app is amazing already, I do have a few suggestions for future updates:
1) Be able to modify how many minutes = 1 plant for timer and stopwatch mode. I think this would be really helpful so that people can look at the trees and know that each tree represents a certain amount of time, especially if they use stopwatch mode.
2) Be able to use the app comfortably in horizontal mode. I think this would make the app experience better overall
3) Be able to use in split-screen mode on the IOS IPads. I think this would be good so users who already enjoy keeping timers through split screen can do so with the app.
developerResponse: {'id': 27090523, 'body': "Hi Fran, glad to know that you enjoy Forest! Although it's not currently possible to modify the number of trees by minute and display Forest in split-screen mode on iPads, we will definitely forward your suggestions to the rest of the team. The good news is, the horizontal mode is now available in the latest update! Thank you for supporting Forest. :)", 'modified': '2021-12-28T03:51:39Z'}

title: Great app! Broke me of my constant phone-checking habit!
review: Great app! I have to admit that I thought, “How can a simple little game like this actually make people more productive?” Then I tried it.... No one was more shocked than me as I found myself going to my phone only to plant my next tree and check on my forest! Rather than constantly checking email, texts, Facebook, news alerts, etc., I’m actually living life the way I used to - which I’ve missed (family conversations, getting work done, exercising, preparing meals, etc.) It’s surprisingly fun, and it works! If you want to get your time back, just plant your first tree!

title: Surprisingly Great
review: I am easily distracted. I tend to look at my phone to respond to a work text, and, before I know it, I’m scrolling through social media. This app helps give me a sense of accomplishment when I set time limits to be off my phone. I like that I can adjust how strict things need to be too. Honestly, it’s just surprisingly great to keep me productive when my mind is wandering. For those with any attention issues, I also find that it helps me know how much time has passed as a reminder to drink water when the timer goes off or eat something, etc.

title: Love it, but a COUPLE SUGGESTIONS
review:
The app reeeeally helps me stay focused so I really love it. But I truly feel like we should be able to 
1. Earn more coins if you focus with a friend! It incentivizes others to plant trees together, which might be a way to attract new users!
2. Earn more coins for each tree that we unlock. It’s kind of annoying that the price of trees goes up after each purchase, but you don’t even get anything extra out of planting them besides seeing the tree in the forest (which I don’t really care about). If the price is going up for each tree purchased, so should the amount of coins we can earn.

title: Great app for concentration
review:
This is a really great app. It’s very well done, easy to use and very rewarding. I like that it tracks your data and visualizes as a beautiful forest. That it gives you coins for each completion to unlock new vegetation and sounds is a really great idea too and makes each session feel very purposeful. 

The only complaint I have is that you only start off with one tree, one bush, and one sound. It would be nice to have a few more options to start, or at least a few quick and easy ones to unlock quickly. I would be nice to have a few more options for the white noise as well.

title: Forest is the best focus app
review: I literally never write reviews for apps, but today, looking at my personal “forest” of trees representing one year of focus time, I felt inspired. As an easily distracted person, this app has helped me so much! I love the simple format and socially conscious mission. Whenever I need motivation, I just think about gathering points to plant a real tree, and it helps me get started. I love the Forest app so much that I recommended it to my friend in another country and now we use “plant together mode” across our 9-hour time difference so that we can make a difference in our own lives and the lives of others — together.

title: Such a good app for students!!
review:
Im a sophomore in college and I have been using this app for about 2-3 years!! I love it. Helps me stay focused for a specific amount of time, which can be useful if you are a big schedule / planner type of person. I have it where I study a certain subject for a certain amount of time and this way I can time it and grow a cute tree! Its also nice because it helps me not be on the other apps on my phone (such as twitter and pinterest) because if I leave the app my cute tree will die :-( 

I also like how you can get back ground noises too with the coins you get from minutes of staying focused.

title: I LOVE FOREST
review: I’ve been using this app since January. It has markedly improved my focus and helped me kick my habit of scooping up my phone and scrolling when I feel a tiny bit bored. I love that it’s simple and it pleases me that there are such a wide variety of trees to grow. My favorite is the banana. It also warms my heart that being focused and planting my virtual trees allows me to plant real life trees! Amazing. Can’t say enough good stuff about this app. If your phone addiction, like mine, is so bad that you need to be forcefully kept from using your phone for no reason when you have some free time, this app is for you. Worth the (very reasonable) investment!! 🌵🌲🌳🌴

title: Yes, it Really Does Work
review: You might be skeptical of this app. You might be thinking, “What’s going to stop me from just not doing my work and watching the timer run out?” It’s a valid objection. This app is great at helping you help yourself. It’s n o t going to make you all of sudden want to do work. But if you get distracted, or you’re procrastination monkey is strong, this app w i l l help you. You’ll be surprised by just how little time you actually spend working each day, but astounded by how much work you’re now able to finish. Get the app if you want to do work but just never get down to it. Don’t get the app if you don’t want to work.

title: Excellent app with one minor exception
review: Forest is an excellent Pomodoro-style app for blocking out time for tasks. The only thing I would change about the app is to allow for time blocks below 10 minutes. Sometimes I have tasks I do not even want to spend 10 minutes on, and I think a five minute or even a one minute timer would motivate me to get those tiny tasks done. These are the kinds of tasks that do not benefit from overlearning, so setting a ten minute time on them doesn’t make sense. You might ask why set a timer for them anyway—but sometimes it’s about tricking the mind to just get started. That’s what this app is great for: tricking your mind to get stuff done.

title: Love my forest!
review:
I know. The app seems silly. My friends laugh at me. I understand. But for those that are serious about limiting screen time, it is a HUGE HELP. For some perspective, I averaged 7.5 HOURS A DAY on my phone! That’s insane. I work in the media, so I’m naturally on my phone a lot but I need to be more in the present moment and unplug. 

This app does exactly that with a fun little game/challenge included when it comes to building your forest. The more lush the better!

Give it a try but only if you’re actually serious about changing your bad screen time habit. I did, and now I’ve cut off 3 hours! Within a single week!

title: Two stars
review: While I love the idea behind this app, I cannot believe that there is no pomodoro timer! While yes, you could theoretically make one by having 2 separate timers, one set for working and the other set for a break but it doesn’t work seamlessly that way and feels like more of a hassle. There IS an option to use a “take a break” after your session but it should be automatic and you should be able to set sessions with a custom amount of breaks! Minus 2 stars for that, any time management app should have it. Another gripe is that you can’t have a timer set for less than 10 minutes, which makes trying to do a work around for the pomodoro timer even harder!!! You can’t even set a custom amount of time, it’s ONLY in increments of 5! Minus 2 stars for that, it’s utterly ridiculous.
developerResponse: {'id': 30205994, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for the feedback. In order to create a distraction-free Forest is designed to help users put down their phones and concentrate on their tasks. We’ll consider incorporating an automatic pomodoro timer into our current system. Thank you again for the request. Please don’t hesitate to let us know your ideas via our in-app feedback system. -Forest', 'modified': '2022-06-07T05:20:41Z'}

title: Fix bugs please
review:
The timer and stopwatch part has bugs. It’s not working properly. I suppose when you click on “timer”, the “timer” text will light up, the button moves to the left, and the “stopwatch” text will go dim. However when I click on “timer”, even though the button is moving correctly, the “timer” text is still dim, and the “stopwatch” text is still lit up. I can only click on the dimmed text “timer” to toggle the button. This does not make sense. Please ask your front end developers to try this feature themselves before launching the new version to production. Also, the “deep focus”, “plant together” and “count exceed” time buttons are not working at all. Why?

I’ve heard this is a great app so I bought it but what’s going on with your software developers??
developerResponse: {'id': 21636760, 'body': 'Hi, sorry for the inconvenience. Please contact us via our in-app feedback system for us to assist you further. Please provide details (for example, screenshots or videos) of the problem if you can.\nTo visit our in-app feedback system, please go to Settings, enter our FAQ, tap on the top-right icon and go to "contact us". Thank you. - Forest', 'modified': '2021-03-14T15:05:29Z'}

title: Perfect for homework
review:
I use this app when I write my 4-5pg essays for my college classes (or any of my other homework), i get easily distracted on all kinds of social media or games on my phone & this makes it so much easier for me to focus! it even has an option once the timer is up to set a timer for a break which i really like so i don’t get pulled away for longer than i want to. My little brother uses this app as well when he’s working on homework & we both really enjoy it!

I would recommend this app for anyone who has a hard time focusing, especially on things they don’t want to do.

title: Glad I found this simple app.
review: I usually don’t pay for apps and I have never written a review for one before. However this app has genuinely helped me study and remain productive despite all the distractions I have. If you look at the price and are on the edge about spending 2 bucks on an app like this like I was it makes sense, but since this app costs money the developers don’t have to throw ads in your face or in-app purchases to make the app profitable. Which in turn helps you stay focused and keeps you on track with using the app. Overall this app has helped me tremendously and I’m happy I found it!

title: I definitely recommend this app!
review:
This app is great and helps me stay focused! Unfortunately, I still have to motivate myself to plant a tree and start a task, but you can set reminders to plant a tree to help with this problem... I love how you can plant real trees in the world with this app and help the environment!🌲🌳🌴🌵There are also no extra fees included, which is great! There are some background sounds you can play, but I wish there were some more options... Overall, I think this is a great app that you guys should definitively check out! Good luck staying focused!! 😉🌲

"Life is short, focus on what matters and let go of what doesn't."

title: Legitimately helped my relationship
review: This might sound stupid, but bear with me for a second. I have severe ADHD, and the urge to pick up my phone to look something up or check social media is a constant issue. It got to the point where my partner told me I was inattentive to her needs and that I was ‘distant.’ So, I installed this here app and, no lie, the quality of our time together has improved massively. Don’t get me wrong, I’ve still killed a fair number of trees at this point, but my screen time has gone down significantly and I feel just a bit more present.

title: Increases focus and concentration
review: The way the human brain works is based off a reward system with the reward of dopamine, or the happy chemical, in the brain. This app is a excellent way to hijack your brain into focus. When we see the tree growing, it symbolizes success and perseverance throughout making your brain think that it rather have a full grown, beautiful tree than a leafless, dead one. This creates a sense of motivation as you can see the tree throughout! Most definitely worth the $2.00.  A must have for people who have difficulty focusing on a subject/ boring online lectures.

title: This app is perfect.
review:
They've really thought of everything with this app. From the tags to the times and incentives. As a student who has finals approaching, I can't think of a better time to use this app. I've already given it as a gift to my mom and plan on "gifting" the app to my friends in college! The perfect $2 present to give to friends. 

Enjoy this so much. 
Only thing: I would make it more know that 2500 coins will let you plant a tree! I didn't know that was a feature of the app until I was showing it to someone and came across it. So much for buying new bushes, I'm saving up for a real tree :)

title: Perfect School Resource
review: I’m currently enrolled in nursing school, which takes dedication to studying beyond anything I’ve experienced before, and yet I have a terrible phone addiction. This app was recommended to me and it’s amazing to have something like this an an encouragement to keep myself off my phone for extended periods of time. Not only that, but knowing that if I continue to do so I’ll be able to use my points towards an actual tree being planted in the real world. It’s inspiring to see a team who cares dually about people and the environment. Keep up the great work!

title: Great tool for incentivizing attention
review: Forest is a fun app that helps users stay focused on a task. I have been using it for about a week and it has been fun collecting trees to build my forest. I’m not convinced one should focus for two hours to get the optimal version of a tree given the research about being to stay on task for long periods of time. I think the developers should reduce it to 90 minutes or even less. There should also expand the types of trees catalog and provide a brief origin for each one. It could be help users be aware of the different types of trees around the world, especially it would helpful to know which ones are rare or becoming extinct.

title: Good so far
review:
I’ve had this for only 2 or 3 days, so I’m hesitant to write a review that risks being too glowing. But in the time I’ve had this app I’ve really enjoyed it! I use it for work and studying; since being on my phone is my #1 distraction it’s a really helpful app! 

As the app was downloading, I thought to myself “oh no what if I want to play music in the background!” Lo and behold there’s a background noise feature. It’s tiny, but it plays the sounds I would have been interested in otherwise. 

Finally, I agree with other reviews that mention the steep coin costs of unlockables. Unlocking things really isn’t the goal here with this app, so there’s no reason for steep costs

title: Like the ideas but need improvements
review:
I use this app for a while and I like the idea of planting trees to record time usage very much. However, several parts could be improved:

1. After I plan a type of tree, I can not change to the other. I would like to use different trees to record different activities. But when I plant wrong trees by mistake, I can not change at all. If you can let me change, it will be awesome even you ask for sunshine.

2. The trees can not be organized or move to the field I would like to plan. I understand a lots of people like trees glow as natural setting, but I would like to manage my field as a garden. It will be awesome if the developer can let me make my field be organized.

3. Do not cover the final version of two hours tree. If I plan a moon tree for 120 minutes, I definitely would like to see the bunny! So please let it show out and not be covered by the other trees or bushes I planted.

Hope this app can be improved soon. Thank you all the developers bring me so much fun and push me improving myself.

title: HUGE fan! would love pomodoro options
review:
I love this app!! I've been using it on and off for 4-5 years and it's so nice. I love getting to sit down, tune out, and work, then at the end of the day seeing the forest of my focus.

My one wish is that there was a way to set a timer for 120 min with a five minute break every 25 min. I find that i get distracted if I try to work straight through, but I also want to be able to grow the full scale trees! Would be a really cool feature if you could set your own short bursts with breaks within the app. 

Still love it!!

title: best app for students
review:
Gonna state the obvious. Of course there’s no ACTUAL enforcement from the app. It’s just perfect for keeping you off your phone. Smooth, runs nicely, has lots of cute plants that evolve as you study longer. For someone like me, who’s weak to cute things, the various plants are the perfect incentive. I also really like the feature that enables you to study with your friends! When you’re studying with them at the library it’s nice to “plant” together. 

If you’re hesitant because of the price—come on, it’s still not that much. It’s worth it in the end, and your higher grades will thank you.

title: Practical. Some limitations due to iOS.
review:
This app is a godsend. Well... not really, but it feels better to say that than to admit “I have no discipline” or “I’m addicted to my phone.”

It is super helpful in establishing some self-parenting/boundaries with my stuff. Hopefully this has a spillover effect on my social media use.

The only complaint I have is that I can’t give certain apps permission to not interfere with the growth of my trees. That’s due to iOS and it seems like the developers are aware of the situation. I make up that the response is “that’s just the way it is, nobody likes it, but we all have to deal with it.”

The way it’s currently set up is: I either pick the Deep-Focus mode that harms my growth if I exit the app or cancel the D-F mode, which means I can go in and out of the app. Basically all-or-nothing, which blows for my particular setup because I do use some apps for legitimate work reasons. I’ll have to find a way around that for now.

4/5 would recommend. If this Deep-Focus thing ever gets resolved, I’ll change it to 5/5.

title: WORTH THE MONEY
review: I love love love this app! It’s been so useful for my studies and makes being productive fun. It does take a long time to earn points, but that’s the point so you have to spend a lot of time off your phone to unlock certain trees/bushes/flowers/etc.! :) JUST LEARNED FEATURE- if you go to the timeline section it can actually track your phone usage (how many minutes you’ve been on your phone, how many pick ups, etc.) throughout the day! I have another app (moment) that does this, but it’s really cool to have a app that can make a game out of being off your phone AND also track your screen time.

title: Learning to use
review: I have used this app since there was only a single species of tree and the number of tree planted represents the number of sessions. I found it really straight forward, clear and satisfying. Then it upgrades to having different species and the tree grows into different stages to reflect the sessions. I personally find this to be more complicate and less clear because it is less easy to see how many sessions I have done. I was very upset because I really loved how the app was before. But I could not find an app that is similar to the before version so I start to use this again and hopefully I will get used to it. Still love the concept though.

title: App glitches out when I get notification
review: Love this app been using it for a year now. Took a 2-3 month hiatus because of summer break but recently got back into it. Started to grow a tree but if I slide down to see notifications or try to determine them from my notifications bar or do anything with notifications my treat dies for no reason. It doesn't happen all the time but it happens about 50% of the time annoying. If app developers can help fix this glitch or tell me why it's happening so I don't do it again. Got 4/5 stars because of this glitch. Also before my hiatus I would do the same exact thing but not get any tree dying.

title: Love this app, but here’s my only complaint
review:
So experience wise, i think it’s great. The only thing i would change is how the tiles form with more trees you plant. Because the tiles keep growing at a rate higher than the amount of trees you plant, your forest is always looking emptier than it should, leaving you feeling unsatisfied.

You could make the argument that the empty tiles incentivizes the users to plant more trees, but I’d wager that users will most likely use the app longer if they’re able to consistently feel that their forest is jampacked with trees, and not sparsely potted. If you’re a designer for the app reading this, hope this influences your decision to update the algorithm for the tiles. :)

title: I love this app
review: This app has actually motivated me to stay off my phone while doing homework. It still allows music to be played in the background which is a huge plus, but also provides various types of relaxing white noise if you need it. The graphics are so charming, and you can save up to buy different style trees with the in app currency. I’ve been using Forest for about three years and have only let one tree die (by accident!), I truly mourned over if for a good few days. Not only does this keep you one task but it’s also for a good cause: our planet. I definitely recommend!

title: Love it!
review: I just got this app a few days ago and I absolutely love it. It’s kept me focused when doing homework and reading and I’m excited to keep using it and letting forests grow. My only problem with it is the two hour limit! Even if I can’t get more trees to grow after two hours, I’d love for the timer to keep going to allow myself to get more coins or to even properly track how long I was actually doing whatever task. I think that allowing actual trees to be planted in real life is also an amazing feature. Would definitely recommend if anyone is looking for a way to stay focused!

title: Helpful for ADHDers
review:
I was skeptical, at first, but this app genuinely helps me get started with my work. As someone with ADHD, it’s very difficult for me to get anything done, and having this app as a sort of crutch is amazingly helpful. I normally wouldn’t think this type of thing would work, but it really does. 

I haven’t been using this app for long, so I can’t say really whether it needs improvement in some areas. I’ll come back with some more feedback in a month or so. But overall, this helps. A lot. Thank you, devs, it means so much to finally be able to finish things like a human being.

title: Best productivity app!!!
review: Want to be more productive? Just set a timer and a little tree will start to sprout. Keep the app open and your tree will start to grow within the set time. If you go the whole time without using your phone the tree will grow to full size. However, if you use your phone then your tree will die. You get coins for every full grown tree you have that can be used for planting a tree in real life! What is better than being productive while helping the environment at the same time?! You can also collect different types of trees and build a colorful forest all your own.🖤👍🏼🌎

title: Best $2 I’ve Spent
review: Ok I never spend money on apps, but this was worth the $1.99. I got it because I saw so many studyblrs and studygrammers using it, and it looked really well designed. It’s really a good way to keep focused, but also to review and see how you’ve been spending your time. The tree system honestly is so cute and actually a good incentive to study, and seeing your garden is pretty satisfying. There are also some community events/features that motivate you too. Even if you are thinking about getting this app but feel like you stay focused pretty well on your own, go ahead and get it. Totally worth.

title: Effective time management and productivity hack
review:
You are human, thus, your willpower and vigilance to stay on task, however great is still limited. Even the most determined, diligent, and goal oriented person, can use some support to stay focused. 
This makes my phone work FOR ME, instead of being a perpetual and unintentional distraction machine. 

This app does a great job of supporting my efforts to stay focused, and intentionally reduce distractions. It's cute, simple, and makes it fun and easy for me to NOT habitually just open Insta, Tik Tok, Email, and whatever else I know can already easily distract me from what I want and Know I want to focus on.

title: Helps me stay on task.
review: I really do love this app. It helps me stay on task when I really need to buckle down to study. They only thing I don’t like is that it takes SO LONG to earn enough points to plant a real tree that it is kinda a joke. Plus the only way to earn cute trees and decorations for you forest is to spend the points that SHOULD be going to plant real trees. The reason I got this app was because I felt that the motivation of planting real trees would keep me from cheating during study time. But like I said, it takes so long it’s kind of a joke. I have been using this app for almost a year and I’ve never gotten enough points for a real tree. I hope this changes somehow.

title: good
review:
it is good. not LIFE changing, but I appreciate the motivation to get off of my phone. 

the first day I had it, I used it for almost 7 hours. second day, only about 2. 3 seems to be the average for a regular school day. it really depends on if I have tests or anything to study for, and if it’s a weekend, etc. 

I like that we can note what the time is used for... you can plan out time to “relax” (I use that for when I meditate, which, granted, is not often, but hey!) and stuff. 

I think that it is too hard to get coins. I earned some 200 odd coins via the first day’s 7 hours. any sort of new sounds, or the next tree variation, is 500 coins. that’s a LOT of use that the developers are asking for one app. it just gets a little old with the only default sound being the forest...

good price. I am happy to spend $2 once for it. I am pleased that there is no subscription or further pushes to make in-app purchases. 

hope you make plant and sound upgrades a little more accessible. other than that, great app for what you pay.
developerResponse: {'id': 6985537, 'body': 'Hi,\nWe will consider modifying the formula of earning coins in future updates. Currently, you could earn extra rewards by unlocking achievements! Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions or suggestions! :) Forest', 'modified': '2019-01-24T04:07:36Z'}

title: Unlike All Others
review:
I personally use these types of apps to motivate me to achieve certain tasks... and many of those tasks are work-related, and thus on my phone. It helps to set a timer, with a motivation like a tree attached, for me to focus on whatever task it is. Whether it be finishing an art project, responding to messages, or clearing out my inbox. 

So many other apps don’t allow me to exit the app. This one does. A+. No glitches. Variety of trees. Fair rewards. 

I only wish I could set it for 5 minutes, or at least have the option for it to send an alert at the half-point mark.

title: I’ve used this app throughout college and now law school
review:
This app is AMAZING. If you’re goal-oriented, you’ll dream of unlocking more trees. There’s a large amount of options and they add new trees during the year as well so you always have a new objective (you have to unlock the trees through planting the ones you have).

Anyone in school NEEDS this app. You can’t use your phone for however long you planted the tree for. Even if you want to spend more focused time on something, this app is for you. You can also plant trees with your friends, too.

title: Oh my god it actually works
review: It's been great for keeping me off my phone and keeping me focused and busy at work or when I'm trying to get my drawings done--and it's such a satisfying feeling to open up your forest for the week and see so many trees and bushes clumped together! Only real complaint is how long it takes to save up coins for other trees and bushes. I suppose it's only really a problem if you're concerned with the sheer cosmetic looks, but it can get to be a real grind saving up hundreds of coins to buy a tree when working for an hour gives you maybe twenty coins at a time. Definitely worth getting the app, though, for its actual purpose!

title: I Love this app but...
review: When I first got this app I loved it. I loved the concept of the pride and guilt surrounding growing (and killing) the trees as a motivation to keep working. It helped a lot until one day I gave in and changed the app. The tree did not die. I experimented and even tried closing the app and the tree just kept on growing. I still use the app and it works with me most of the time but I admit I might cheat for a few seconds and change the app every once and a while. I wish the tree automatically died instead of having to manually kill it when you want to quit. Is it just my phone that does this? Great app other than this one problem. It really helped me get my grades up and improve my time management.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4341754, 'body': 'Hello,

Due to the limitation of the iOS system, we cannot determine what app the user is currently using. Therefore we cannot implement the whitelist feature for the iOS version. As a workaround, we built a "Work with Phone" feature, which can be enabled in the settings page. This feature enables users to use work related apps during their planting periods, but users will have to be honest with themselves when using this feature. 

The trees planted with this feature enabled will not be counted towards the leaderboard, and users will only receive half the reward if they exit Forest during the planting period. 

Currently, the whitelist feature cannot be implemented for iOS. If you see features similar to whitelist on other apps, please let us know so that we may figure out how it was implemented. 

Thank you for your suggestion. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-07-22T05:16:30Z'}

title: Great for ADHD
review: I used to use this app in 2015 but forgot about it over the years and I’m so glad a friend recommended it to me recently, reminding me I used to love it! I’ve recently returned to school AND got diagnosed with ADHD and can’t go more than 5 minutes studying without wanting to look at something on my phone. I also love the different trees and plants you can grow, definitely a lot more than from 2015! My only complaint is that it won’t let me set allowed apps but I understand that’s a limitation from Apple’s iOS and not the app developers.

title: Wonderful and Very Cute!
review: This app genuinely motivates me to focus because I want to unlock more trees in order to make a cute little forest. And if I leave the app my tree starts to die which makes me dedicated to not touching my phone or leaving the app! Easy to use. Love the part where you can eventually plant REAL trees. Customizable labels for different areas of focus are helpful, option of adding a note and ability to track your progress. Also- cool how you can see others’ progress who use the app. I actually recommend this to people I know.

title: Very motivating but could be improved
review: I love this app. I find it is a very helpful tool to motivate me by collecting cool trees and looking back at the progress I’ve made. I appreciate that it tracks my focused hours and conveniently displays the data in an easy-to-understand way. Currently, I’m trying to get a tree that costs 2000 coins. It’s been taking a little while now and one of my strategies is to try and get coins from the achievements. I find that there aren’t enough achievements. I think there should be new weekly challenges or just simply a longer, varied, total list of achievements to complete.

title: So good for when studying!
review:
I love to use this app when I’m studying or doing homework. The cute little trees encourage me to stay focused (which is really hard for someone with a low attention span like me!). 5 stars!
But I do have a suggestion. Sometimes I don’t know how long something I’m gonna do is gonna take so it would be nice if you there was option to have a timer where it times how long you have been focusing starting down from 0 seconds and the tree just goes up from that instead of just having overtime and getting coins. Eh, I don’t know if that makes sense. Oh well! 😂great app 👌🏾

title: Most Productive App I have
review: This app is fantastic. I use it all the time as a student, but I’ve increasingly been using it to be better in my daily tasks as well. The mornings are often when I find myself lounging around on my phone, but now I’ll wake up, send a few quick texts, lock into forest for two hours and amaze myself with how much extra I get done. It’s such a satisfying feeling to catch yourself subconsciously picking up your phone, unlocking it, and then seeing the forest app ticking away with a motivational message to get back to work. It will surprise you how often this happens.

title: Encouraging
review: This app has done wonders for my time management for four years straight now. It’s encouraging for anyone who has a tendency to stop working to look at their phone. My social media urges no longer interfere when I get done with my schoolwork. Because I’m able to set the time limit for myself, it feels very goal oriented. Best $0.99 I’ve ever spent. With each successful session without opening other apps on your phone, you’re rewarded with coins, which can be used to “fund” the planting of a real tree somewhere on this earth. It’s a satisfying and useful app that I would 100% recommend to anyone.

title: Life changing
review:
I had this bad habit of checking a text and then being on my phone for hours. However, this app has changed all my habits. Knowing that I have the opportunity to help the environment just by staying focused helped me to focus on other things in my life. 
I’ve taken up new hobbies, resumed old ones, read over 10 books, and improved my study habits because of this app. 
I will admit that sometimes it’s a tad annoying if I need to answer a message or if I want to look something up for school, but this app serves its purpose, and I highly recommend it to everyone.

title: Put Down the Darned iPad!!
review:
I am an adult woman with ADHD. I am addicted to iPad games, Facebook games, you name it! I also have responsibilities. “Forest” helps with the latter. Once I plant my trees, I am far less likely to pick up the iPad until the requisite time has passed. Yes, I know they’re not real trees, but still, it works. 

I do not use the app in a competitive fashion, but to help me put down the iPad and get on with my life. Once I plant my tree, I often don’t pick up the iPad until well after the tree has grown, but the mere action of planting a cartoon tree in a cartoon forest helps me to put down the darned iPad!

I highly recommend this app!

title: Best study motivator I’ve ever had
review: Seriously, this is honestly so wonderful for me! I absolutely love how motivated it has made me! I only wish they would add other forest features, like different bodies of water that you can have cultivate in your forest. Also have animals that you could get after long study weeks, say you study one hour everyday for a week ( a goal you set in the app) than you get one animal added to your forest and they wonder around. Little bears, rabbits, squirrels Ect. I will say I have gotten so much done thanks to this app!!

title: A Simple App That Can Change Your Life
review: Before I started using Forest, I would average about 4-5 hours a day on my phone, which resulted in my life almost falling in disrepair due to personal goals and chores never being fulfilled. Forest was (and is) a great tool to help get my priorities back in line. I also feel fulfilled when my digital forest keeps getting bigger with a wide variety trees. If you want to be a more productive person, this app is a great $2.00 investment that returns to you ten fold. I also recommend the developers’ new app “sleeptown”. Same concept as forest, but it’s for improving your sleep habits.

title: let me say... distance learning is hard
