review: Especially with distance learning, I struggle with jumping from laptop to phone when trying to get a task done. I spend hours finishing one assignment when it should take less than one. This app really helps down my phone-time so I can get my school work done faster! I’m so much more aware of how many times I pick up my phone when I’m trying to focus. When I first started the app I may have picked my phone up at least 5 times in 10 minutes to distract myself, just because it was such a bad habit. Now it’s maybe once or twice, which seriously saves my time! Thank you!

title: Honestly the best study app I’ve ever used
review: I was recommended this app by a studygram that I follow, and I decided, “Sure why not, it’s only $2.” And BOY they were right!! I have an awful time actually sitting down and focusing while I’m either doing my homework or taking notes, or even staying off my phone in class. This app makes everything so wonderfully easy. It forces me to stay off my phone and actually pay attention. I’ve tried timers and everything under the sun, and this is really the only app that works for me. Spend the $2, or whatever it is now, you won’t regret it!!!

title: So much potential!
review:
Anyone who needs to stay focused to study and or work on tasks, I recommend this app 100%! 

I think it can improve in some things though- I’d love to be able to sync my contacts from Gmail/Hotmail to get more friends. I’ve been trying to recommend this to my friends and I just end up taking a screenshot of my forest to explain the app. It’d be nice to have a way to share the app with my friends through the app. Where I press a link that will allow me to send a brief idea of the app. 

I would love to be able to send some type of nudge to friends when I’m looking for people to start a room with. 

It would be great if it did more analysis on my hours of focused time. For example, that it can tell me if I tend to stay more focused at a certain time of the day or how many hours total I’ve focused to a specific tag this week/month/year. 

I absolutely love it and I’m looking forward to seeing this app reach its full potential!

title: Life Saver
review:
The only reason why I wrote my essays in high school and am currently writing my college essays is because of this app. It allows me to put down my phone for an hour and have no choice but to start these papers. And soon after two or three rounds I’ve got a workable first draft and some plants to show for it! 

When I was in a class is didn’t want to be in I would also plant a tree, so when I picked up my phone out of boredom and there was nothing to do on it, I would have a tree growing and that was a subtle reminder to leave my phone a lone.

Definitely recommend :)

title: Not worth it.
review:
I usually never pay for apps but I thought this one would be helpful. I was wrong. I love how it plants trees in real life but it doesn’t help much with productivity. It’s mostly just a way of setting time and measuring progress. 

This app does not let me know when to stop. It is not ideal for studying. It would have been great if this app was more of a timer so I would know when to stop instead of checking my phone to know if the time is up. It can send alerts for when the tree is planted or when the time is done but so can my other apps, which is distracting. If I let this app notify me with sounds, I would also be letting other apps do the same. It would be inconvenient if I turned off notifications for other apps. 

The app has an option that prevents me from checking other apps while the time is running but the system is not ideal. I would still need to do the work; control myself. I could still open other apps but my tree would die. It would have been great if I couldn’t access non essential apps while trying to focus. 

Basically, I don’t need this app.

Does my payment for the app help plant trees? If it does, I’d feel less bad.
developerResponse: {'id': 18546955, 'body': "Thank you for your feedback. We will forward your suggestion to our team.\nYour coins or focus time do not directly lead to the planting process as the coins are apparently virtual, but once you've focused for a certain amount of time and earned enough coins, you can spend them on a real tree, and we'll donate to Trees for the Future to plant one. It's our way to encourage our users to stay focused while contributing to the environment. :)\n", 'modified': '2020-10-18T13:06:28Z'}

title: Love the app, but Inability to unlock new trees and extension on chrome
review: I loved the idea of the app and how it would boost your productivity with a healthy idea. Bought Forest yesterday and was super excited to synchronize my phone with the computer, but apparently the trees you get from the computer don’t get transferred to the phone, so it’s like you have two different accounts. That didn’t bother me as much, since I was looking forward on the idea of getting new trees, but that didn’t seem possible. I don’t know if it’s a bug, but it’s very disappointing for a payed app to show a lot of different options but not actually deliver them. I hope this gets solved on an update or so, because I did really love the idea, it’s just not working the way it should.
developerResponse: {'id': 18289533, 'body': 'Hi, please contact us via our in-app feedback system for us to assist you further. Please provide details (for example, screenshots or videos) of the problem if you can.\r\nTo visit our in-app feedback system, please go to Settings, enter our FAQ, tap on the top-right icon and go to "contact us". Thank you and sorry for the inconvenience. - Forest', 'modified': '2020-10-06T01:08:31Z'}

title: Love the app but I have a suggestion
review: I absolutely love that the app helps me focus on my work while still being able to play background noise that isn’t too distracting! I would love it if for the trees you planted you could put multiple tags on it (for example I separate my tags based on the school subject I’m doing rather than the activity) because sometimes when I’m done with an assignment I’ll do something else for a different subject, but I can’t mark that down on the tags section. It’s not a deal breaker, but I would love if that would be implemented into the app.

title: Great!
review: I’ve never been more motivated to focus on things. My friends and I love to compete with this. My only request is perhaps to work on the global competitive aspect. It seems rather impossible to me that people are reaching these scores? Or maybe make it to where you can only compete with minutes set in Deep Focus Mode? That way people aren’t just fiddling around on their phones while letting the timer go on and on. Just a suggestion. I may be completely wrong as to how that works. Also it would be nice to see the entirety of your friends forests. Not just the daily one.

title: I love it!
review: I love this app, truly and whole heartily. I’m a chem with forensic major so sometimes getting myself to focus and study while practicing organic chemistry or any reactions can be hard. The application has a nice and easy layout along with the cute “forest” button where you can see the trees you have grown along with the time you’ve spent studying/focused throughout the day, week, month and year. It has a feature for users who like background noise, the free one is sounds of waves I believe. Overall, I’ve been able to do about 10+ hours of studying per week using this app.

title: Always am productive...when I use it
review: This app is indeed a God-send, but if I don’t bother to try to use it or ignore the notifications I don’t end up being nearly as productive. This app helps me feel good about myself because I’m not just being lazy all the time when I use it but I’m still not into the habit of using it. I’d say GET IT if you struggle with being productive for sure, but it’s only going to work if you work to make getting on it a HABIT. But honestly it helped me so much even if I struggle getting on it. Definitely worth the money and definitely some of the best money I’ve spent.

This app has helped me so much, I love how much control I have over my homework now! It has really saved my procrastination problem, which I am very grateful for.

With some work, all of you could do the same thing, but don’t expect it to come super easily. Try giving yourself an award at first for just sitting down an hour (or however long you decide) and doing work. Don’t worry about what you get done, that kind of managing can come later. Focus on the time you spend and your efficiency with that time first.

title: As someone who frequently gets distracted by Twitter & IG...
review: ...Forest is fantastic! If I need to focus on a task for a prolonged period without phone distractions, I can just open forest to minimize notification alerts (both visual & audio) while still knowing that if a call comes through, I can answer if need be. And every time I catch myself mindlessly scrolling through apps, or if I just want to enjoy time with friends without the rabbit hole that I sometimes fall down if we’re discussing something and need to google it, I’ll plant an adorable tree (leaving my screen on so I remember why if I glance down at my phone), and be able to be more in the moment.

title: Pretty Perfect!
review: This app is fantastic and I recommend it to anyone who needs to relax or time away from their phone. But there are a few errors. The app is very hard to navigate around, especially when trying to view your Forest, there’s many timeline and confusing options. I don’t know if there is a way to, but when I try and see all of my trees planted overall on one big garden I can’t. There’s too many options like yesterday’s and today’s trees. That’s my main issue, it’s just impossible to navigate. Also, when using long times like 2 hours I think there should be a customizable brain break in between.
developerResponse: {'id': 3445810, 'body': 'Hello, we have a "big forest" feature with which you can view your forest by week/month/year. You can access it by pressing the upper right button on your forest page. -Forest', 'modified': '2018-05-13T08:44:07Z'}

title: Essential app for ZoomU
review: I really have trouble (or had before getting this app) where I would pick up my phone mid assignment or reading and not put it down for hours. I 100% recommend this app since it feels like I am able to get work done in a timely manner now. The reward of a healthy forrest (something that I personally enjoy since I come from a rural background and grew up with the FFA) is also neat and helps keep me motivated to not break my concentration. I recommend setting it to the “hard” mode where your tree will wither if you exit the app for the best results.

title: Great for focusing!
review: This app was recommended by my professor as a way to guilt yourself into focusing. The pure aesthetics of building a forest is what separates this from other productivity apps, and seeing progress in the form of nature is visually and mentally pleasing. I have no complaints about the inner workings of the app, but I did take off a star for the purchases aspect. Getting a new tree takes a lot of time or money, and it can be discouraging. There should be an easier option to unlock different species of trees. Other than that, this app has put me on track for this semester and I do really enjoy using it!

title: Obsessed.
review: As a task master and person enamored by details, color, and collaborative coworking, I am naturally obsessed with this app. I love the choice they made to develop real forest options, the way that you earn new trees by focusing for longer, and the new personality quiz they developed. This is an all around great app- I almost gave four stars because the collaborative feature technically functions but isn’t amazing to use (the break timer doesn’t count collaboratively for example, and I’d like to see our respective forests while we are planting)- but ultimately that wasn’t enough to knock it down.

title: My Favorite App!
review: I purchased this app years ago and I’m so glad that I did! What is it about the idea of a little virtual tree dying on my screen that is so persuasive? My phone used to be one of my biggest distractions and i would check it constantly at work or while studying. It’s a hard habit to break and I tried many tricks and techniques before finding Forest. Now I have a much more healthy relationship with my phone! I’m so grateful for that. With the updates over the past few years, this app has been fine-tuned into the perfect product that is worthy of the investment.

title: Wouldn’t get work done without it
review:
I am easily distracted, which often prevents me from being as productive as I would like. This app helps me to stay focused and get my work done. I love the little events they’ve been having recently, too!

Edit: The only complaint I have is that I wish the winter event would extend until the first day of spring. It makes me so sad that I can’t have snowy trees right now and it’s January 1st. It would be even more amazing to have an option that we can toggle if we want snow any time of year.

title: Almost perfect!!!
review: I love this app! It really helps me focus! I recommend to everyone else who are having problems is to update to iOS 11. It fixed the problems. On 3 days of having it, it is the first app on my screen. Before Messages! But there is 1 minor problem. I forget things a lot and once I plant a tree I remember that I need to pair my Bluetooth devices including headphones to listen to the awesome quality music and when I go to pair them it kills my tree. Please make a 2 minute exception for leaving the app. But besides that it is perfect!
developerResponse:
{'id': 3880966, 'body': "Hello,
We'll consider implementing this feature in future updates. 
Thanks for the feedback.
Please feel free to contact us if you have further questions or suggestions. :) -Forest", 'modified': '2020-10-21T01:05:56Z'}

title: Amazing tool for students!
review: I have a hard time trying to focus on studying and doing homework, especially when my boyfriend texts me often through the iMessage app. Though this happens, my friend recommended this app to me and I have fallen in love with it! We even have friendly competitions to see how many plants we’ve planted and it gets really exciting when we compare the different plants/trees we have unlocked. I love being rewarded with little trinkets and cute items so this was perfect! I manage my time and study more while being rewarded for it! Love this app!

title: Great App, Helps Me Focus
review: I have been using Forest for about 2 years now. I love the premise of growing trees while I work and gaining coins to buy more trees. It makes my focus into a game as well. You do need to have a bit of discipline still if you aren’t using the deep focus mode, as without it you are able to access any app you want (I believe this is due to  new iOS’s restriction). I need to access my texts for work, so can’t use the deep focus mode or else my trees would die every time. But leaving the app up still gives me the reminder to focus when I open my phone. Love it!!!

title: Dev Request: Pomodoro Feature
review:
Tracks tasks relatively easily with Graphs and Analysis. This is amazing. Thanks for making this!

Developers: Could you create a feature that automatically switches between focus sessions and breaks? Currently I use this app alongside “focus keeper” because they automate the focus/break cycle. This prevents me from interfacing too much with my phone/iPad allowing me to respond just to the “chimes” that indicate focus time vs. break time. This feature could be added in conjunction with the overall timer. Thanks for all your hard work!

Also, the iPad doesn’t have landscape mode!
developerResponse:
{'id': 4341739, 'body': 'Hello,

We appreciate your feedback!
A similar feature has in fact already been introduced in the app. When you plant a tree, a pencil icon will appear on the top-left corner. From there you can take notes as well as change the tag for the tree. This icon will also appear on the finishing page of a planting session. Moreover, this feature can be found in your forest. Simply tap on your trees and choose the tree you want to add notes to from the list that will appear. The same dialog will appear. 

If you have further questions, feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-08-25T18:43:13Z'}

title: This app is FREAKING AMAZING!!!!
review: I got this app because it was recommended to me because I’m the kind of person to be like “oh well homework is boring let me ask my friends what they are up to” and after a while of that I started falling behind so I was told to try this app. I am a crazy about saving the environment and I’m also really competitive and so I never let my trees die by staying off my phone!! I recommend this app it has gotten me through middle school and part of high school. I hope it will get me through college!! GET THIS APP!!!!!

title: Just a suggestion...
review:
I love this app and have just been using it for a few days... It is super effective and also really easy to use. 
I suggest that instead of a countdown you should add a timer feature because when I have a homework task I often don’t know how long it’ll take so if I put 60mins and I finish in 30mins then I can’t use my phone for another half an hour without losing all the progress. Please add this feature because I feel as I finally completed my goal but the app doesn’t reward me because I can’t use my phone so it just ruins the idea. Other than this I really enjoy it and highly recommend...
developerResponse: {'id': 2693892, 'body': "Hello, we'll consider implementing this feature in the future updates. \nThanks for the feedback.\nPlease feel free to contact us if you have further questions or suggestions. :) Forest", 'modified': '2018-02-27T14:24:08Z'}

title: It’s pretty nice
review: I love the cute trees they have that make me want to study more and it’s not impossible to buy more trees which is nice because some apps literally make it impossible for you to achieve anything cause they make the prices so high, it would be nice if they added more trees though in order to lower some other prices of some other trees so you feel like you are progressing more and you are getting rewarded more frequently in order to make us come back more and engage more with the app, but other than that little ittty bitty thing I love the app, it’s so cute and peaceful

title: Excellent for Doing Homework or Studying
review: Excellent for doing homework or studying. The idea of growing your own little forest through you actually doing what you’re supposed to do is a great idea! The only problem with this app is that it costed 2 bucks to get it. But due to this, there are no annoying ads nor any annoying in-app purchases. The only reason you’d spend money in the app is to get limited trees or get new sounds. But you can collect in-game coins while focusing on order to buy these, so there is no need to spend any money in game if you don’t want too.

title: Best Pomodoro App Out There
review: I love this app honestly. I really like the deep focus mode which makes my tree die if I leave the app and I love the comments that are on the screen when you have a session going like “don’t look at me” lol. This app has really helped me stick to the pomodoro technique and truly be more productive than when I was just using my iphones timer. I also like the alerts for when you’re finished. The iPhones timer alerts are loud and obnoxious but this apps timer is really subtle & not jarring. I do wish we got more points for focus time. But it’s not a big deal to me.

title: Mild gamification on top of a pomodoro timer
review:
I like it! It’s attractive and offers gentle gamification, which is really all that sets it apart, but it’s nice. You can only unlock new trees/etc with in game currency, not real money, though you can boost your rate of gain, which I did just to get the sound I wanted to use.

The UI for switching between “timer” and “stopwatch” is a little clunky, is my only complaint so far. It would also be neat to have a lock screen widget like a media player, but I don’t think that’s possible on iOS, alas

title: Great for people with ADHD
review: As someone with severe adhd in high school this app is amazing! 1. It helps me stay focused and not start scrolling social media like I usually do. 2. It shows me how long i’ve worked for and keeps track of it (which is very helpful when entering my attendance for online school) 3. It has greatly improved my time management skills, I am able to set time for work and breaks! So much better than a normal timer app. Four stars because I do use my calculator on my phone a lot for school and it would be nice to have one in the app, but not a huge deal at all.
developerResponse: {'id': 25023514, 'body': 'Hi, thank you so much for your support and feedback. We will relay your suggestions to our team. Have a good day. :)', 'modified': '2021-09-10T11:29:17Z'}

title: Love this app!
review: As I student I spend wayyy too much time on my phone, but this app has helped me to reduce my screen time by so much! There are a couple of things I think could be improved about it, though. For one thing, getting enough money to buy a different type of tree takes FOREVER! Also, different types of trees should be worth different amounts. Like when you use the octopus tree versus a bush, you should get more coins from the cooler tree. Just a thought :) still love the app though & use it all the time!!

title: Time management will improve
review:
This app is a life saver. Prior I was always so confused and unorganized as to what to do. And this resulted in me procrastinating terribly. You don’t realize how much it can affect your life beyond professional life but personal. But having bought this app it has been a life saver. 

Not using your phone and focusing on a task for an extended period has helped me tremendously. So many of my friends/ family noticed how organized and focused I am. 

And all thanks to this app. So yeah, a massive thank you to the developers and this is easily worth the investment. Time is a resource. Do NOT WASTE IT!

title: I LOVE THIS!
review:
I LOVE THIS! It definitely helps me get started when I feel disoriented and am having trouble focusing. I just set it for 20 minutes, study, and then bam that’s all I need for my head to get back in the game. Just a nice little motivator to get started on the tasks at hand. 

I give it 4 stars and not 5 because unless you’ve been using it for a really long time it can get kind of boring. Just because you keep planting the same tree and or bush over and over again. It takes a long time or $$$ to get something different. 

And this can make it less motivating sometimes. It would be nice to have more variety of trees and bushes available from the get go soon as you get started. 

And maybe we could add some other things too like little houses or swings and stuff and maybe people.

It would also be nice if I didn’t have to start a new forest everyday but could also have the option to just add to a world or map that stays as is. 

Other than that I love this app.

title: Review as requested by app.
review:
TOP LINE: Meh, so far. It looks pretty. It’s stable. It’s cheap. Poor user support and tutorial. Limited use compared to other “Pomodoro” type apps.  Buy if curious. Skip if you’re happy with your system.

PRO: the app (1) looks pretty and (2) is stable within the current version of iOS (12.x.x). (3) Reasonable one-time price for most features.

CON: (1) very weak tutorial. Much seems to be figure out as you go. (2) Poor user accessible support. Ex: App Settings -> FAQs -> blank page with spinning circle. Waited for a full minute. Still spinning. (3.) Arbitrary request for review instead of, “How are we doing?”  I’ve seen other apps, in their tutorial, mention they’d really appreciate a review but they don’t interrupt your workflow.

NEUTRAL: I wish Apple didn’t restrict putting specific apps on the Whitelist. That would have been a great boon if possible. That said, I’d imagine the developers are more frustrated about that than I am.

So that’s my review as requested.

Hopefully, I’ll learn how to get more out of this app and will update my review at that point.
developerResponse: {'id': 9670577, 'body': "Hi, thank you very much for the feedback. We'll forward your suggestions to our internal team. If you need help with using Forest or can't access the FAQ page, please contact us via the in-app feedback system. We'll be more than glad to assist you! Apologies for the unpleasant experience with the review thing; we'll relay it to our team and further improve it. Thanks again for all the advice and for your understanding. Feel free to let us know via the feedback system should you have any questions or suggestions. :) - Forest", 'modified': '2019-07-15T16:19:03Z'}

title: Amazing!!
userName: i just really like this app ok
review: I truly love this app, it’s so useful in so many different ways. Like most, I definitely use it for productivity when doing work and forcing myself to stay off my phone. However, the biggest help I’ve seen from this app is turning it on at night before bed. I always struggle with aimlessly scrolling through social media while in bed, and I know it takes away precious sleep hours from me. I set the timer for 2 hours before bed so I am motivated to stay off my phone. Plus, I love collecting all the tree specifies and achievements. Such a simple yet effective app :).

title: Tree growth
review: I’ve used this app for a few years now and I really love it. It does it’s job and keeps me focused. My only issue is I use this with the pomodoro method so I really only use the time for 25 minute intervals so my trees never develop all the way. If I get really focused sometimes I’ll go over. It’s nice that it still gives me coins if I go over time  but it would be even nicer if the tree continued to grow! Or if I use multiple of the same tree the trees grew the rest of the way. If you do the full 2 hours you get like 4 trees.

title: Growing Forest Visual Keeps my Motivation Up
review: There’s nothing more satisfying than having a visual for your accomplishments. Not only am I staying focused at work and getting more done I have a visual that is helping me keep going! New trees to unlock makes me want to stay productive and an adjustable timer/stopwatch setting ensures I’m in control and reminds me to take breaks when needed! Everyone’s productivity toolkit is going to look different so I can’t say it’s a must have, but it’s definitely a must try for folks who want a productivity boost.

title: Perfect way to get offline
review: During 2020, I find it increasingly difficult to stay away from my phone. Even when I’m not Doom-scrolling through the news, I’m playing phone games or just staring blankly at videos. Forest keeps me on task when I’m working, and makes me rediscover fun offline when I’m finished with work. The features are easy to figure out, and I love how I can choose what trees I plant and what motivational quotes come up. Most of all, I love the feeling when breaking my bad habits is rewarded with planting a real tree!

title: Completely Changed the Way I Study
review: I cannot recommend this app enough. I always struggle to stay focused while studying or working. What I really love about working with Forest is that you don’t have to focus for hours on end. I keep my timer at 25 minutes, and the timer goes off just as my mind starts to wonder. I also really love that they provide a break timer right away, so then I can make sire I’m not on my phone for hours before I start working again. Also you help plant trees, so what’s not to love.

title: Adult ADHD: 0 Forest App: 1
review: I have been struggling to focus on work when I’m at my desk, so I did some searching for productivity apps that would lock up my social media during work hours or something.  This isn’t quite that, but it’s better!  It gameifies the whole process!  I set a timer for how long I want to be productive, and for that whole time, I can’t use my phone without making my tree wither.  With more and more time spent, you earn coins to unlock new kinds of trees to grow during your productivity time.  It’s both challenging and fun and worth every penny.

title: Love my trees but is it useful?
review:
There’s definitely a productive benefit to watching a tree grow and focusing on a specific task. That’s what this app does. So, for anyone who creates content, freelances, or is looking to build a skill, this is a SIMPLE way to monitor time and focus. 

But this is not a time management app. 

It’s barely a time tracker and more of a in-app store to buy digital trees. Maybe that’s all the app wants to be. And as someone who has a deep love for tamagotchis, Im into caring for a focus Forrest with different unlock-able trees. That’s totally my bag.  

My issue is that there’s no real analytics behind how you’re spending your time. I’d love to be able to see how my time is being used. That stats they do show you are pretty shallow. 

I know the app doesn’t promise to be a habit tracker, I just see the potential of it being one. I want similar stats to programs like Mint or Instagram analytics. I also wish the animation and actual Forrest function was more dynamic. 

In all it’s an okay app but I think it could become awesome. 

P.s 
I wrote this review for a free tree.
developerResponse:
{'id': 13123783, 'body': "Hello,
Thank you for your feedback in detail. We will forward your suggestion to our team and keep improving our services.
Forest should give you the free plant before inviting you to leave a review. If this doesn't happen, please let us know. Thank you!
- Forest", 'modified': '2020-01-26T17:30:22Z'}

title: Very helpful
review: I actually thought this app was stupid but when I actually used it, it’s super cute and it really does help you stay off your phone if you really want to have your tree and forest flourish and be able to unlock a lot of new trees. I’m studying for my USMLE step 1 exam and I study like 14 hours a day so you can imagine I get a lot of points and achievements. It definitely makes my studying slightly less bleak and gives me a sense of accomplishment when I look at my virtual forest grow and I’m like “I did that!” I show my friends and family like. It’s my study baby

title: Incredible and Effective
review:
I’ve never written a review for an app before because no app has had such an extreme effect on my life. 

I was horribly addicted to Reddit. I was spending 5-6 hours scrolling my life away reading one forgettable post after another. I tried content blockers but addiction just made me delete them when I needed to mindlessly scroll. 

This app is different. The fact that it’s like a game where you can watch beautiful things grow and even make a real difference by planting a tree in the real forest is so motivating. Now when I start scrolling I plant a two hour tree so I can read, practice music, do yoga, or a multitude of other productive things. 

Thank you so much for creating a wonderful app! Looking forward to more trees and more updates in the future :) 

One suggestion. I think it’d be really cool if you could have a custom forest where you could pick and choose trees and bushes to decorate your own plot of land!

title: Love this app!! + a suggestion
review:
This app is amazing because it helps me actually get my work done and make me want to do more. However, sometimes when I put a timer for my break, I don’t actually come back to the app to continue working, but just ignore it.

To prevent this, I think there should be a solution. Something like a 10 second timer to return to the app when the break finishes to receive extra coins or maybe to save a mini tree from dying that was planted during the break. I would love to see something like this incorporated in the app!
developerResponse:
{'id': 3954545, 'body': "Hello,
We'll consider implementing this feature in the future. 
Thanks for the feedback. 
Please feel free to contact us if you have further questions or suggestions. :) -Forest", 'modified': '2018-06-24T14:41:59Z'}

title: Pretty good app, however...
review: All around pretty awesome. Easy to understand, straight forward, but it would be great to make the various sounds offered from the app more attainable. I saved and got the beach sounds and it’s been great to study too. To reach the next audio sound will be weeks away and this is without any other spending allocated to trees. I get the idea of keeping coin value high but maybe varying the price of different items or reducing cost of audio tracks offered might allow for more wiggle room among users and create higher drive to use the app.

title: Motivating with a good cause
review:
To link my focus with something as majestic as a growing plant is both motivating and calming. the game nature of it catches my attention when I’m getting distracted and to see the forest each day and week feeds my sense of personal growth. The real life tree-planting is the clincher, however. To see my staying focused as doing good in the world trumps every other motivator.

I also love that you can do it with friends and family. 

Thank you for the app. so brilliant I wish I had thought of it, so useful I wish I had known about it years ago, so good I hope it lasts forever.

title: Definitely worth a try
review: I wish there was more variety of trees, and I don't like the leader board it seems to incentivize cheating for somebody like me who uses the app to track my deep work sessions instead of just being off my phone. If you just want to stay off your phone through the day this app is great although I'm not sure how much of an incentive planting trees is. Would love a separate app that focuses more on tracking and gamifing actual progress of important projects and endeavors, but for now the pretty tree scape and pie graphs are enough to keep me going. Ps, leaderboards for specific tags might be a cool way to break things up a bit

title: iPad version makes little sense
review: I love the app, it is great help for staying out of my phone. I though there was nothing to be done with the iPad. However, I recently found a Chrome extension really helpful - you can make a “block list” and an “allow list”. I think iPad version should work the same way, as opposed to being similar to the phone with “leave the app and the tree will wither”. After all, I would love to be able to block access to the games and certain websites, while also being able to work in GoodNotes and BlackBoard.

title: I love this little forest of mine
review: This has been an app recommended to me by friends and students who enjoy it’s efficiency with tracking productivity. Im happy to find that it doesn’t only apply to scholarly work, but all aspects of life and can be customizable to your daily routine. I find myself more motivated to do my work or engage in activities that don’t include mindless social media scrolling ! It’s nice to see your productivity in real time often times it feels as if we don’t do enough as humans. This is aesthetically reassuring.

title: Amazing!!!!
review: I’m a student and this app is a life saver. Not only does it keep me off my mind phone, it allows me to see what classes I’m spending the most time on, and which ones I might need to spend more time on. It also has helped me see how much work I actually do, it’s easy to spend all day doing hw and feel like you’ve gotten nothing done, but forest shows me that I’ve done 5 hours a work ! It makes me feel more accomplished, literally the best app I’ve ever bought! And to whoever made it, you’re awesome 🌳

title: Makes me feel that I could achieve my small & BIG goals in my life!
review: Not only am I here for the star coral tree. I wanted to take the time to write a review. I have just recently started this app and it surely will make a difference in my life. Everyone has an addiction with their phone. And I started to realize that I don’t want to keep wasting my time and day on my phone just to waste a day of unproductive time. So I bought this app to see if it would help me be productive. And I surely feel that this app will help with this :D

title: High productivity and fun!
review:
I have used this app for the last 4 years of college and found it to really help me focus on studying on a regular basis. Watching my garden/forest grow after every period of use is enjoyable and worth it for me. I love the feature of nature sounds, tons of botanical options, and the capability to text (IOS) on my lock screen without killing the plant I’m trying to grow. Sometimes I just have to send a quick response to someone mid-study session. 
This app is awesome and I recommend it often!

title: This is great! As soon as...
review:
I heard the sounds of the rain I wrote for 25 minutes straight and before I knew it the time clock said I had 9 (seconds left I think) I was amazed and encouraged at the same time that I wrote for 25 minutes just on what I thought in the instant I heard the sound. But where did what I wrote go? I can’t find it. I’m not a pc wiz that’s for sure but it should be somewhere- the only thing that was exported was a pic & website of the app. 
Anyone have a clue where it might be hanging out- I really want it. I wasn’t able to hook up with the help/faq

title: It’s fun and it works!!
review:
Amazing!  I’ve downloaded detailed, “extravagant” apps and have tried so many different ways to get focused, but somehow this cute little endearing app is the one that works!!  I become excited about “planting a tree” and love that it helps me focus in a fun way (by me knowing if I leave the app to fiddle on my phone — which is my BIGGEST DISTRACTOR! — the little “focus tree” that I planted will die)!!!  A brilliant, creative, and fun way to focus!!  I LOVE it!!!  THANK YOU!!  

PS- Not to mention that the app services REALLY WILL plant a treat for you if you plant enough “fake trees” within the app!  So cool and wonderful for this earth!!👍👍👍

title: A helpful study tool
review: I have had this app for about a year or so and it has been a very useful too to help curb distractions from my phone. I use it to time 20 minute focus segments or long 2 hour study sessions as well as keeping myself off of my phone before going to bed, when the temptation to look at my phone can keep me up too late. My favorite part is the ability to plant trees as a group, it keeps my friends and I accountable while we study and when we hang out we often plant a tree to encourage us to socialize and get off of our phones.

title: Cutest Trees and Quality Time
review: I absolutely love using Forest! I found that I was able to track what subjects/activities I was dedicating time to all in a beautiful layout. The extra motive to stay focused by not being allowed to access my phone was great, though at times difficult if I needed to access a picture/document (but that is more of a matter of planning beforehand). I always recommend Forest to people who, like me, aim to boost their productivity with focused pomodoros! And besides that, you get to grow beautiful trees that add up over time! Happy tree growing and caring for our planet!

title: Super useful!
review: I usually hate doing reviews but I have used this app for maybe 2 years now and it has never not been useful to me. It can take motivation for me to even use this app but i do so whenever I know I need to focus. It puts me in a mental state of don’t lose focus or you’ll hurt the tree, i.e. you’re only hurting yourself by not focusing. i use it for studying, doing homework, reading, etc. it’s great!!! 100% recommend. they have adorable trees and you’ll find yourself wanting to fill your day’s forest with cute trees and bushes. plus why not plant a real tree every now and then?

title: Nursing school focus life saver
review:
With being in nursing school and working full time taking the time to put my phone down and strictly focus on my studies can be hard. This app makes it so much easier. I recently started using the pomodoro technique when studying and this app is perfect! 
The only thing I wished it has was a free timer for when you are studying for a short amount of time and aren’t sure when you will be interrupted. You would be able to notate you time like a stop watch and just stop when done without losing your progress.

title: I highly recommend it!
review:
This app is amazing and it’s helpful specially the deep focus mode keeps you away from wasting your time on your phone. But i wish if you the developer or who ever own this app could discount the tree prices, there are a lot of beautiful trees that I’d like to plant when i study but they are difficult to unlock bc the lack of coins! I’ve already purchased the app I don’t need to purchase coins to get trees 🥲🥲 please consider my request to be done “ discount the coins” thats all i ask.

Thanks.

title: Amazing app! Would recommend to any student.
review: I love this app. The only downside I can find is that landscape mode is not offered on my iPad Pro 2020. This can be incredibly annoying at times. I’m hoping to see the devs add this simple feature even if it only works for the “tree planting” page of the app. That’s my only complaint that I can find since having this app for 2 years. Overall my favorite study app. I just hope to see landscape options for the iPad are coming in an update soon.

title: Great way to encourage off time with your phone
review: If you’re like me you spend too much time looking at your phone. Many hours of the day checking social media or email or texts. This gives a small reward for even short intervals where you simply put it down. Family dinner is a great one. And other times I find this useful for keeping me off the phone long enough to allow me to fall asleep. I wish coins weren’t so hard to come by and the prices didn’t constantly go up. But it gives you something to strive for.

title: Not Awesome on iPad
review:
As a time-tracking/management app, Forest is both easy to use and fun to engage with. That said, it’s clearly optimized for the iPhone. The iPad version doesn’t support landscape mode, which makes it rather awkward to use while working on an iPad. It’s a shame, since the increased real estate on a tablet offers a wealth of opportunity for, say, streamlining the information gathered by the app.

I also wish there were a pomodoro mode. Yes, I could try to kluge together a series of trees to approximate the pomodoro timer, but it’s a pain to figure out if it’s time for a long break and it’s too easy to remember not to start a break timer.
developerResponse: {'id': 19081113, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for your feedback. We will take it into consideration. Providing our Forest friends a better platform is our pleasure. -Forest', 'modified': '2020-11-13T06:16:59Z'}

title: Definitely worth the money
review: I normally don’t go for apps that aren’t free, but this one was definitely worth it. I’m a senior in high school, so I have to stay on track with time. This app has definitely helped, and I plan on recommending it to others. The one thing I would change though is allowing users to edit their forests. Instead of it just being plopped down in a square, let them create their own beautiful garden on their own. It may give more incentive to have the trees grow. It’s kind of weird how it auto-fills the forest and doesn’t let you play around with it. Other than that, great app!

title: No more procrastination :-)
review:
I don’t know what I did to deserve this app. For the cheap price of $2, I’m able to actually be productive when studying. 

When I first saw it, I didn’t think it would be  efficient because I procrastinate too much and not only on my phone. But when you’re planting a tree you *actually* want it to be a productive time and it’s so satisfying to see the hours spent focusing and how many trees you planted today.

I’m very glad I came across this app and I want to thank the developers for doing this idea, which is simple but very very efficient.

title: Seriously amazing
review: You’d think that a little tree won’t stop you from getting on your phone. Every time you close the app it tells you that your tree will die if you don’t go back to it. This is just a fake internet tree. Why should you care about this tree? You have no idea but you do. You have to make sure that tree grows. Otherwise you feel the pressing guilt of killing your little innocent tree. And then when it does grow, you fee so happy for your fake tree that you want more. And more. And then you’re growing trees and being a productive maniac. IT WORKS.

title: Great App
review: I used this app to move mountains. At the time that I used it I didn't think much about it until a few weeks later when everything I focused on started happening. 1 year later and I'm still trying to catch up on what I focused on and I think I focused a little too hard which happens a lot but I think its better to let it ride out and not correcting it because the wave it started has been traveling for over a year so the ship has sailed and a new era has started ie AE 2

title: Great app for focusing! And I love the widget!
review:
I really like the app and how it encourages me to focus. I like having the widget on my phone because I want to fill it up with trees so it makes me want to use the app more too because it’s cute!

If I had one request, it would be to be able to pick themes that might match some of the more colorful plants. Like there is a coral plant, it would be really cool to have an ocean themed forest, or a fall themed forest, so that it doesn’t look strange being on green grass. But overall, it’s very cute and I love it 😺

title: So far so good!
review: I don’t usually think ‘gamifying’ works on me (since I don’t play cell phone games; i’m way more likely to sit on tiktok), but this is working great so far. My partner and I have matching forests because we’re using the app for chores too. We wish we could have one shared forest between our two devices, and I wish there was a five minute timer for moving laundry and short tasks, but other than that it’s a solid app. It’s a little unclear how to get new trees unlocked, but we’ll figure it out

title: Amazing app
review: Forest really helps me to focus and I couldn’t do anything better during the situation we are in right now. It really helps and it’s worth it. The feature that I love about it is the fact that you can either set it on deep focus mode or not where you cannot go to another app on your phone so that helps when I’m studying and I don’t want to get distracted and when I still want to check my social media and I am not doing heavy duty assignments then I will take it off of deep focus mode and get pretty trees at the end of it. I love this app!

title: Procrastination Eliminated
review: I absolutely love this app. It gives me peace while watching my little tree grow, provides me with a sense of competition and determination to get more coins, and the sense that I can make a difference in the world by using my hard earned coins to make a difference in this world by planting a much needed real life tree. I am one of the worlds biggest procrastinators but I feel this app lets me shove my urges aside to not let my tree die and stay dead on my forest land. Social media has put so much pressure on us these days and I find this app brings peace and balance.

title: Can be a very useful asset.
review:
Haven’t been a long time user yet, but it does help you stay focused by wanting to nurture your plant and forest. I think initial focus/motivation is needed for something like this to work, but it’s a great asset in today’s very distracting world. The phone is basically an extension of us humans these days and just as the mind can pick up a thought and spawn into endless distractions, the phone is your mind on steroids. Because now you’re just working on overcoming your thoughts but that of many.

Anyways practice meditation and use forest. Powerful one-two combo.

title: Very helpful
review: I don’t have a problem with wanting to do productive things but actually doing them can be a struggle. More so than keeping me off of my phone this app helps me greatly with separating purposeful time to get things done. I’ve used it to make progress in my reading list for this year, my video takes, and of course getting work done. It can be a huge help if you utilize it. We all have a creator inside of us, but some of us need help with managing. This app can help you manage your time and be more aware of how you are using it.

title: Definitely helped my grades and my ability to live in the moment
review: I love forest. It’s just a little more motivation to keep off my phone and keep me in check! I always used to unconsciously and randomly grab my phone while studying and start scrolling instagram and once I realized what I had done I had wasted like an hour. When I open my phone and see my little tree I’m like “oh right I’m trying to focus!!!” And the little tree gives me a little motivation omg it’s fantastic. I’ve been recommending the app to all my friends. I’m so proud of my little forest :)))

title: Wonderful App!
review: I never expected to enjoy Forest so much. Initially, I considered it would have been a waste of money. I figured I didn’t need to spend a couple of bucks to stay off my phone, but after seeing countless reviews online, I decided to give it a shot. I’m so glad I did! I’m not sure how to describe it, but Forest is a wonderful app when it comes to studying. I use it every day now, and it really helps me concentrate and focus on what needs to be done. I’m normally not on my phone all the time, but I like having an extra precaution to stay away and focus.

title: Great app, a little buggy
review: This is a really great app for focusing on school, but it's a little buggy. The timer works just fine, but every time I try to put a tree that I've planted in my forest the app crashes. I guess it's not really that big of a deal as long as the timer works, but it would be nice to see my progress of studying throughout the week. Another thing that would be nice is if you could see the timer on your home screen so you know how much time you have left instead of having to open the app. It's a really great concept and would easily be 5 stars if it didn't have the bug.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4768546, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-08-22T13:47:38Z'}

title: Surprisingly Effective
review: I got this app as a last attempt in my battle against severe procrastination, and it is a little bonkers how well this works. An hour of straight work used to seem like a myth to me but with this app it’s like an hour of work is the click of a button away. The different trees and the coin system really makes homework feel like a game. I love how many stats the app keeps on productivity levels and hours studied. Overall a great app that I hopefully continue to use into college.

title: So Many Trees
review: Yeah, the app’s great. Helps me study and focus on every day tasks (including getting ready in the morning). We’ve heard all that before and it’s true! but Here’s the Thing. There are SO MANY TREES to unlock. I’m living for it. Makes me want to study and focus more so I can unlock all of them. That aside, it’s a truly great app. I’ve been in law school throughout quarantine and I’ve been finding it hard to focus. This app completely changed that, and because of it, I might actually do something with myself.

title: It does the job, and more.
review: I really do like the app. It’s not just a tool to keep you off your phone, but it’s also an interactive landscape for you to edit and mess around with as you please—well, to an extent. Your ability to plant different vegetation is limited to how much time you put in to stay off your phone, which is one of the core mechanics of the app. It’s well thought out and relaxing, too. You can even plant with others, and introduce fun challenges, such as “everyone’s plant dies if one person’s plant dies.” It’s not perfect, but it’s great for what it does.

title: Love this app
review: This app allows me to be focused for longer periods of time than I’m used to because it doesn’t allow me to use my phone while doing work. It also has a new feature where you can turn off the deep focus which is nice because sometimes I do work on my phone and I just want to time myself so I don’t need the deep focus feature on. It’s also super cute because you get to grow a garden and it motivates you to do work because you do not want to see a plank canvas. Recommend if you easily get distracted by your phone.

title: Helpful for this teacher
review: Grading 100+ essays is tedious and time-consuming. It can take 10-15 minutes for each one. This is not helped by distractions on my phone, playing games, surfing Pinterest, etc. This app gives me another reason to stay focused and get my work done. I set it for thirty minutes and try to do at least three essays in that time. Then I allow myself a break before going back to work for another thirty. I like the thought of planting real trees in the world for every minute I ignore my phone and stick to growing a tree on this app.

title: Focused
review:
This app is amazing for people with crippling guilt. I can’t stop working to look at any notifications without feeling guilting about killing a tree. 

I’m kidding! While I do feel guilty I’m leaving the app I also just genuinely enjoy using this app to help me stay focused. I love the message behind earning enough coin to plant a tree. I only discovered the app at the end of my semester last spring. I am very excited to use it this semester. Maybe I’ll even be able to plant my own tree with how much I’ll be studying! 

10/10 recommend. Honestly just do it for the trees.

title: Great app for productivity, but has one downside
review: This app is amazing for my productivity. Something in my brain gets excited to see my forest with all types of trees and bushes representing how productive I’ve been. The only downside is that if you use your phone to make business calls then this won’t really work unless you have a second phone. The app knows when you leave it to go to another app which kills your tree. Because of this, when I’m trying to make work calls my tree will die when I actually am in fact working. No way around this except using a separate phone to call.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4415115, 'body': 'Hello,

Due to the limitation of the iOS system, we cannot determine what app the user is currently using. Therefore we cannot implement the whitelist feature for the iOS version. As a workaround, we built a "Work with Phone" feature, which can be enabled in the settings page. This feature enables users to use work related apps during their planting periods, but users will have to be honest with themselves when using this feature. 

The trees planted with this feature enabled will not be counted towards the leaderboard, and users will only receive half the reward if they exit Forest during the planting period. 

Currently, the whitelist feature cannot be implemented for iOS. If you see features similar to whitelist on other apps, please let us know so that we may figure out how it was implemented. 

If you have further questions, feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-07-27T01:55:13Z'}

title: I'm usually focused without help but...
review: ...when I get to that point where I am no longer being productive on my own regardless of how much I try to focus, this is the thing that pushes me into productivity.  I don't use it often (I don't need to), but when I get to a certain point, this has been the best way to spur me into action.  I don't want to kill any trees.  My only complaint is that sometimes I need to use my phone for productivity (calculator, photo reference, etc), but it's possible to work around on the computer without killing the trees.

title: 5 stars but could be better
review:
Giving five stars for putting a noble idea into an app. But there are places where you feel that the app could have been better. 
It mostly makes use of the not so flexible ecosystem of Ios. But, i would have loved some innovative idea on how can they make this app more useful. 
I cant even check my urgent texts, if I do my tree dies, so probably they want to fix that part. Provide more free music and personally that rain music is literally distracting. 

But anyways Kudos to the team for helping me stay focused and plant a tree.

title: The App I never knew I needed
review: The Forest app improves and increases productivity, and helps those that are easily distracted to hone in on channeling energy for meaningful outcomes. When I realized what my focused time could do and birth (i.e., a tree) I understood how precious time was. I love the app, it’s ease of use and the contribution I’m making to my mini forest. I suggest this app to anyone in school or needing to focus more at work. COVID has changed the way we work, our attention spans, our ability to complete tasks, etc. Forest is changing that!

title: Great App!
review: I downloaded this app because I read some reviews that it helped others and I just thought that they were paid to write these things but I tried it myself and for anyone thinking about whether or not buying this app, I truly recommend it becuase it does help. You just press "plant" and continue doing your work, no distractions at all. The more you use it, the more coins you get and it's motivating because once you have enough, you can plant and actual living tree which I think is great for the environment.

title: Very helpful
review: I love the way the app looks! It’s very simple and not distracting. When I do go look back to see how much time I have left there are reminders for me to go back to my work. There are also sounds of nature that helps my space not become to quiet but has a noise that helps me focus! I love how I have the option on deep focus cause then I end up not going on my phone cuz I want to get the coins. It’s also nice to have it as a game too so I can make my forest. I love that we can earn coins for new species and earn enough coins to plant a real tree!

title: Graduate student
review: You don’t realize how much time you spend (or want to spend) on your phone, especially while studying! I’ve become more time effective in my studies as a graduate student through this app. It keeps the phone down from distractions and helps me get stuff done! It’s also fun when you get to connect with friends and use their allocated minutes as motivation for yourself! Highly recommend this app if you find it aesthetically pleasing, and have a difficult time staying focused through your work.

title: I’ve had this app for years: charming, peaceful, practical
review: This was the first non-free app I purchased and have always felt it was a good investment. As someone who is affectionate about plants and a fan of gameified productivity, I was immediately attracted to the mechanic of growing a forest while concentrating on work. I’m motivated to collect a bunch of well designed little trees and get my work/reading/concentrating done! Doesn’t work for all tasks/situations, but my little forest is ready to grow whenever I need an extra kick to put my phone down and finish something.

title: Perfect for Working at Home
review:
I personally can’t stay off my phone, which is a big issue when working at home. So, whenever I’m working, I will set the timer until I take my next break. Take my 15, set another before lunch, another before my last break, and a final one before my end of shift.

I can honestly say that this has been the most effective way for me to stay focused... which is honestly crazy to me because I now get upset when I get a dead tree from checking my phone too early (only once, but still haha).

title: Wonderful
review: I have the attention span of an ADHD laden mosquito and must say that this has done wonders for my productivity. I don't quite know why the prospect of a dead tree littering my admittedly sparse field is so horrifying but I'd sooner die than let that happen. My only gripe is that the Apple Watch app has great potential but is unfortunately all but useless in its current itteration. Give the ability to set a time limit from the Watch (or even just fix the glitch that prevents the timer countdown from being shown on the watch widget) and this will be a flawless app.

title: The most outstanding application I’ve ever used
review: I’ve struggled with procrastination almost all my life, never being able to do anything without losing focus for more than 30 minutes tops, buying this application was one of the best decisions in my life, seriously turned it around, the feeling that I’m doing something productive and at the same time earn points from it is so fulfilling, I’m halfway to being able to plant my own real life tree, and I’m super excited. Seriously, if there is one application you should buy, it is this one!

title: Amazing!
review: My friend showed me that snap first I didn’t think it was that good, but when I started using it it did help me focus. Believe it or not my grades have risen since I started using this app, and since that I have been able to plant a single tree in real life. I think this is a really amazing app, I am able to keep even an organized certain things don’t take up too much of my time anymore. I definitely recommend this app to anyone who is struggling with time management.

title: This app has been super helpful
review:
I love this app and it has been incredibly helpful in getting me to do my homework (which I often have trouble getting started even when I want to do it). I use it almost everyday. 

The only issue I have with this app is that recently it’s been crashing when I try to look at the tag analytics that shows you a graph of which tags you’re using the most, and I’d really like to see them bc I feel like it would be interesting as well as motivating. I can look at daily and weekly tags but monthly and yearly always crashes the app. Otherwise, great app
developerResponse: {'id': 2980379, 'body': 'Hello, the problem will be fixed soon. We apologize for the inconvenience. Forest', 'modified': '2018-03-30T10:11:33Z'}

title: I like
review: Definitely helps me focus and reduce distraction. I would, however, appreciate a “pause” feature. It seems self discipline is the primary focus of this app, so as long as the user doesn’t initiate distractions voluntarily, they get a reward (healthy tree). But there are, unfortunately, distractions beyond our control (doctor calls, children/pet/etc care needs, etc). I feel like we should be able to pause the timer for occasions like this, because “give up” and kill the tree seems to imply voluntary failure on users’ part to remain focused.

title: Helpful as a student!
review: This app has been great at getting me to put down my phone during tasks, and helping me to maximize my productivity at school! A simple yet effective tool. The built in ambient sounds are also incredibly helpful, as I play them while I’m reading and know that when they end, the timer has finished! No need to be preoccupied by my phone, or even the timer. It’s also great being able to log how much time you’ve spent “focusing” throughout the day, week, etc. Definitely don’t regret this purchase!

title: Best Time Management App
review: This app makes time management fun and cute, giving you a virtual reward for staying focused — which is the most effective way for encouraging changing behavioral habits. It’s a great alternative for those who are turned off by time management apps/features that lock you out of your phone entirely. You know that you could still access your phone if you absolutely needed to at any time, but there’s still enough of an incentive to make you not want to in order to save the tree. Time to go back to my forest!

title: Surprisingly effective!
review: I’m someone who struggles to focus but does not do well with punitive methods - this one keeps it lighthearted and fun, yet gives me the kick in the rear that I need when I succumb to temptation. I enjoy it! It also rewards me by counting how much I’ve focused during the day (in minutes, making you feel great 😂) and letting me buy all kinds of creative trees/bushes with focus coins I’ve earned along the way. Everything is 500 coins though, so it keeps it within reach, but not TOO easy 😘 I like this system - very much worth the $2 👌🏻

title: really helpful!!
review: this app isn’t going to solve absolutely all of your problems if you’re a procrastinator like me- but it definitely helps! forest is a fun, cute, and encouraging way to get you off of your phone for certain periods of time (all of which you can customize). it’s worth the money honestly- and another cool feature that i loved was- you cant buy your way through it. after you purchase the app- there’s only two “in-app purchases” but both of which have very little effect on your tree growing and just give you little boosts of coin for new trees (i really love this feature as i didn’t want to feel as if the company wanted my money more than actually being a productivity app💕). i do wish that there were different kinds of bushes (10-15 -maybe 20- minute reward)- but that’s just a tiny detail ☺️ otherwise!! i really love the app and the concept it’s pushing💗

title: Get it!
review: Forest is *the* number one way to get off your phone. I use it all the time whether I’m studying or I need to go to sleep without getting distracted. Forest has actually helped me use my phone less and enjoy my life. The only downside being that you have to pay for the best of the app, but it’s not a subscription so once you pay the amount (less than 2 dollars, it’s been a while since I bought it) you never have to pay again, which is better than I can say for most other apps of this caliber.

title: Who ever created this app was very clever.
review: i have a very hard time staying focused, but this helps. the sounds play a huge part and put you in a environment without even being there. if you use it efficiently it can be very effective. i give it five stars and will definitely recommend to friends and family. thank you for this lovely app i love it so much that it's definitely one of my more productive apps on my phone. it's worth the 4$. trust me. it provides a lot for just 4$.

title: Finally - I’ve found an incentive to stay focused
review: I really struggle to stay focused. I have 1 million ideas and questions and a smart phone at my fingertips. It’s made it difficult to connect with other resources like books and people. Having the Forest app has given me the incentive each time that I’ve gone to pick up my phone when I’m turning away from my book or go to Google a question during a conversation with a friend - to put the phone down.

title: Great Accountability
review:
I use my phone much more than I probably should. The Forest App has helped me to work on setting my phone down for extended periods of time to get work done, have more effective conversations, and feel more focused. 

You are able to set the time increment you want to focus for, and if you make that time without opening any other apps, you get a plant that goes in your forest. It’s a fun way to hold yourself accountable and spend more time focusing on your priorities.

title: Forest is the best decision I have made for my education
review: As an incredibly busy High School student I rarely have time to be distracted by my phone. Unfortunately, I always seem to find the time, even if that means I am sacrificing homework, studying, or even sleep. Forest helps me stay in line and keep my priorities straight. It is super simple and very easy to use. I have had it for about 18 months now and I think I can safely say it is the reason I was accepted into colleges. Forest has quite literally changed my life. If I could rate it 6 stars I would.

title: This app is amazing!
review:
If you are one constantly finding yourself going to your phone while trying to be productive, this is the app for you! 
I always struggled staying concentrated when studying for exams and doing homework; however, this app has completely turned that around. Instead of dreading studying and doing the things I hated before, I now look forward to them knowing I’m going to grow my forest and create my own art. This is the best app purchase I have ever made and quite possibly the best app I have ever discovered PERIOD

title: I love this app
review:
This app really helps me stay focused in class and while I’m studying. I’m an engineering major so it really keeps me focused in on my homework and studying.
If the app developers ever wanted another bigger project to develop, I’d love a mode where you can just plant a tree and it just times how long you go. It would be almost identical to how it works after your tree is fully grown and you just receive coins for staying extra focused. I personally just find myself at awkward stages of picking too long of time for homework sessions. So if there was just a mode where it counted up, that would be awesome!

title: Forest
review: Amazing. 100% worth the money if you have enough motivation and self control to use the app but need extra help staying off your phone. Its enticing to watch your plants develop and your forest grow. It’s encouraging to see how productive you are. And it’s enlightening to see how many times you want to pick up your phone during a 15- or 30- minute period and experience the exceptional feeling of telling yourself no. I can’t even imagine how unproductive I was before this app. Hands-down one of the best few dollars I’ve ever spent.

title: Cute and Helpful
review:
I like the sense the app gives that focus is a practice, the metaphor of the Forest makes sense, the health for your focus is measured in the health of each instance you focus. 

I like that it encourages you to focus for longer periods of time to get more tree types, but I feel like the bar may be a bit high for getting new trees. It starts at 500 coins, which I think is about 10 hours of focus, but once you’ve gotten the 500 coin tree, the next one costs 600, then 700. I imagine it’s going to be months before I get another tree type.

title: Cute app, and it’s really helped me stay focused.
review:
The app is very cute, and it’s fun to plant the trees and other plants. It’s good at keeping me away from my phone when I’m working, because somehow I’ll get distracted and reach for my phone without realizing it, and the app will notify me “Your tree will die if you don’t go back to the Forest app!” which makes me realize that I was getting distracted lol.

Knowing that I’ve planted a tree also helps me study because I feel like I have to be focused now that I’ve planted the tree.

This app is cheap and useful! I recommend it.

title: Love this app!
review:
I have been using this app for almost 2 years now! I already planted 2 real trees, and I collected over 70% of the trees on the app! All the trees are so pretty! I hope more cute and creative trees can come out so I can be more motivated to use Forest! And I hope more trees for holidays will also be great!
I want to make a small suggestions on improvement, and that is to add more sound to the collection, right now there are only a few available options and I get tired of them very easily, so I hope more sound can be available!

title: The best time management tool
review:
The notion of Forest is very simple, yet very effective. You start planting your tree, and your phone is away. The sound feature enhances productivity too. It has helped me in getting over many tasks. With the annual / Monthly data , I can see my progress.
I highly recommend it. 
My tips for the developers are :
1- allow multiple 25 minutes intervals . 
2- expand the notes or allow them to appear more clearly. Because when a phone is locked , productivity and clear thinking increase

title: Great game but I have one complaint
review: First things first, the game is absolutely amazing and works perfect for me. I used to be a really bad procrastinator but since I downloaded this app, I stopped. I am always looking forward to grow my virtual forest. The only thing I wish that would change was there could be a stopwatch option instead of just a timer. Sometimes I do my work for not than the 2 hour max but I sadly can’t track it. That’s my only complaint and if you fix that, this will easily be the best app in my phone.

title: Love love love
review: You gotta find the app that works for you that will make you put down your phone, and this app definitely does it for me! It might seem silly, but if my tree is growing, I will avoid killing it as much as possible. With this app you have an incentive to stay off because you can purchase more trees and bushes to grow and even save up enough to have the company plant a real tree (how cool!). Anyways, it totally depends on what gets you off your phone, but if knowing you’ll have some cute trees grown as a result of your patience, this app is for you!

title: So far Pretty Dope!
review: I really love this concept it rocks i’ve been using it as a way to accomplish my goals and be better with my time management. I think it’s really cute that You get to grow a plant every time something happens. I also like that you can label what you did. I think what I’m gonna do with my gardens is if I plant a certain amount virtually, I will plant something in real life. I think that would be a great way to take it one step further hey sorry about that I was leaving a reminder

title: Awesome app!!!👍
review: It’s fun it’s useful and there are no mistakes it keeps you going with new trees and if you register it gives really really good stuff and makes everything even more fun  you should really get the app it also plays nature music for you if you want to and I need some music is really good and it’s also really nice how do you get to do it with other people and friends I also love how do you get to make a forest of trees and unlock you trees plants and bushes oh you should really get it

title: Cute Little App
review: This is a great concept! It definitely has helped keep me focused, and I love the fact that I am helping plant trees. One thing I will say is that you have to stay focused for a lot of hours before you can actually plant a real tree. Also, you have to use the same focus points if you want to purchase different styles of trees. I think it would help if it took less time to plant a real tree and maybe if there were different points earned to change the style of tree you plant. Just a thought. Overall though, great app!

title: Most useful app I’ve ever bought!
review: This app has seen me through multiple finals seasons, and I wouldn’t have made it through without it. I have such a hard time focusing, especially while reading, and get distracted so easily. Whenever I need to put my phone away and get some work done, it’s a lot easier now that I can set the timer, put on some rain and thunder background noise, and know that my phone will be there when the timer is up and my work is done!

title: So far, so good
review: This is my first day using this app and I don’t know if I was just feeling particularly motivated today or if these little trees made me WANT to study for 3 hours straight... either way, I feel very attached to each tree I grow and don’t want to kill it by going on my phone so I guess the app is doing it’s job. I do wish though that I could move my trees around and arrange them how I want (maybe you can and I just haven’t figured out how to do it). Final verdict: $2 for an app this helpful is nothing and totally worth it.

title: Self awareness overload
review:
This weirdly feeds my addiction for mobile games while being productive. It feels good to fill up my forest while doing things that matter.
Also, it’s worthy to note that they have an social, entertainment and rest category. This is wonderful because you get to see how much of your day gets taken by entertainment and keeps you off your phone which fully helps you enjoy your rest, social life, and entertainment. I wasn’t aware of how much I miss while oh my phone.
Definitely a game changer!

title: It works!
review:
I got this app recommended to me from a friend and I gave it a shot thinking I wouldn’t take it seriously but let me tell you was I WRONG! 

I’ll reach for my phone in the middle of homework and when I open it to see that little tree I nearly throw it!!
If I accidentally open a text and the little notification comes up that I’m killing my tree I ignore my friends and instantly return to the app!
And the best part is I don’t even realize this is getting me to do my homework!!

title: 1 thing would be amazing to add
review: I spend a lot of time on my iPad and phone the only problem is i am mostly doing online schoolwork so i wish i could block of every app but these ones so that if I’m doing school in safari or using Desmos it wont count against me. Same with me art i love to paint and draw but i get caught up but i need references and adding the ability to grow trees as long as your in an app that’s “allowed” overall love the app when I have paper school work.

title: honesty, best app for studying!
review:
this has been one of best apps i have ever purchased. well worth the few dollars!! helps tremendously with time management and blocking off time to set aside your phone and get to work. whether it’s homework, studying, paperwork, sports, or just me-time, it’s amazing how dedicated one becomes to keeping their trees alive through this app. :) i recommend this app all the time to my friends with ADHD, classmates and family. 

trust me, worth the investment if you are willing to work too.

title: Thank you 🙏
review:
I have no other words except gratitude for you AWESOME 👏 app!! Thank you! I missed being in nature and using your app I have been able to handle and complete some overdue tasks. Thank you! Trust and believe I will recommend this app to all. Thanks to you guys, I am even deleting majority of my app. I mean if you are not focusing and living life with PURPOSE what are you doing?? Get focused accomplish your GOALS and live your BEST life while doing it. ✨
-I cannot wait to plant first real tree! 
Thanks once again!! Seriously I cannot say it enough. Thanks! 🙏💖

title: Such a good app for students!!
review: As a college student who is on her phone far toooo much this app is amazing! There’s so much less temptation to check my phone when I know I’m growing a pretty flowery bush for my forest! And it’s crazy to see at the end of the month this whole lush forest!! Sometimes I’ll plant a tree for certain subjects and a bush for a different one to make sure I’m evenly studying! I have a friend who plants trees while she’s driving to make sure she doesn’t text and drive! The music the app has is pretty calming and easy to focus with!

title: LOVE- Use it daily! Perfect for students  who love nature and are easily distracted
review: I use this app every single day. I am a student and I study about 5-6 hours a day and go to class.
