I am easily distracted so I set a timer on this app and grow a little tree every time I can’t touch my phone. If you exit the app, your tree dies. At the end of the day, you can see how large your Forrest is to show how long you’ve studied. The more trees you plant, the more coins you get, and the more tree types you can buy. I always recommend this app to my classmates.

title: Actually helps.
review: So I really love this app. Every time I use it I get good grades & I get the work done. I go to the math lab at my college, play some music & I turn the timer on & I just get my work done. I recommend it to anyone who struggles with staying focus & likes nature well even if you don’t like nature that’s fine too. Also if you don’t complete the time frame that you put like if you go on another app it will stop the timer & the plant stops growing so it’s disappointing to me & keeps me away from my mom. I totally recommend this to anyone!

title: Changed the way I focus
review: Like most people, I’ve always unconsciously  (and sometimes consciously) sought ways to distract myself from getting work done, and then felt frustrated by my lack of productivity. Enter Forest. I skeptically paid for the app, wondering if the reviews were too good to be true. Low and behold, this app has changed the way I focus. It provides the structure and discipline I need to get my work done. I absolutely love the rainforest sounds, too. If you are thinking about getting this app - just do it. Future you will be thankful.

title: Forest is Fun
review:
As a neurodivergent ADHD type person I really like this app. I never write reviews but feel like this deserved one!

This app is really simple - it doesn’t try and do anything except create a timer for your work (ideally pomodoro style chunks of time but whatever floats your boat). You can set the app to not complete your study time (poms are 25 mins) if you leave the app! You can also turn that feature off easily. 

Other than the option to require you to stay in the Forest app and the time you study, it’s really simple. For each study session you complete you grow a little tree and get reward coins. 

The different things you can grow as you keep using it are actually really motivating but not interesting enough to be distracting. I have had a lot of pom timers but this is always the one I use.

title: Great for focusing!!
review: It’s a great app. So proud to see my timeline with how much it accomplished in a day. I was worried from the screenshots that there was only tags and I cannot record with a description of what I accomplished in one focus activity, but later discovered that you can edit the activity. I like the trees but wished there was more info in faq or somewhere that listed how many coins for how much focus time and also have more variety of the free trees. Thank you for building such an amazing app!!

title: A feel good way to be productive
review: A friend suggested this app to help stay focused and off my phone while getting work done by really dedicating the time you can set on the app to WORK. it’s been pretty helpful to keep me off my phone while I try to write papers or make presentations. Then once the tree is done it’s like a little pat on the back and another tree in the forest! If you think keeping track of work time and break time might help you stay focused on work while allowing you to take guilt free breaks, give this app a try!

title: Wonderful App!
review: This app truly helps me focus. I originally found out about it through my book club. They utilize the “plant together” mode to help us read and stay off our phones. Since discovering the app, I use it for everything: studying, reading, social media breaks. I love it! I especially like the “deep focus mode”- as leaving the app will cause the tree to die. I am a high achiever, and having anything less than a 100% tree growth rate drives me crazy. This app works wonders for keeping me focused!

title: Quality app
review:
I’m not gonna say you need this app in order to study effectively, but it’s great if you want to keep track of your study time and have a sort of visual representation of your work. I also like how a dead tree is planted if you leave the app, so it incentives you to actually stay there and finish your work until the time is up.

Another thing I like is that the more you study, the more points you get and you can buy different types of trees to change things up a little bit.

title: I never thought I would enjoy Forest
review: Before I got Forest I was very skeptical. I thought it wouldn’t help me stay focus because I don’t really care about a virtual tree. However I decided to give it a try. After a week of using it, I am completely surprised how much more productive I have become. I hate seeing dead trees on my screen for some reason so I always tried my best t not use my phone. Getting things done was really motivating and seeing the trees growing reminds me of what I accomplished while away from my phone.

title: Productivity app that you’ll never regret purchasing!!
review: Forest is the best productivity app if you have trouble staying off your phone when trying to focus on a task. It has amazing features where you can categorize different tasks so that you never over-dedicate too much time in one category. I love how this app is constantly evolving, rolling out newer user-friendly layouts and adding more tree species to keep users engaged. As a college student, this app has revolutionized my studying and has significantly improved my GPA. Thank you forest!!!

title: Love this app
review: I used this app throughout my 4 years of college to stay off my phone while studying, but also measuring my time to be able to give myself study breaks in order to not burn myself out. It helped me to keep my focus and ration my time on social media. Additionally, now that I am incredibly invested in my work, I continue to use this app during social time with my friends so that I am not distracted by emails that I’m too eager to answer. All in all, the app is easy to use and so incredibly helpful to me every single day.

title: Wonderful for those who tend to work TOO hard
review: What I really love about this app is the ability to set breaks as well as focus time. Too much screen time takes a toll on my health, so I use this to alternate between working 15 min and resting/meditating 15 min. It’s very easy to adjust times, and you get to help reforest the planet while you’re using it! Note: you can block all other notifications but this app when you need to focus, in your phone settings.

title: Worth it.
review: I’m the type of person who is glued to my phone and I’m also the type of person who will procrastinate my studies because of my phone. This app has truly changed my routine. I now have less screen time, and more me time. I know, super cheesy but it’s true. I want to thank the creators of this app, because you’ve truly helped me become a better person. This app helped me concentrate more with my studies and challenged to keep going. It’s worth the download. (:

title: cute app!
review: love this app, super cute and effective for encouraging small chunks of focused activity throughout your day. i have a lot of personal goals so I also love keeping track of all the different steps I take towards these goals using the tagging feature (i get to label each tree with a tag representing the activity I completed). very user friendly and simple design, highly recommend if you have a lot of goals/activities you'd like some help keeping organized :)

title: Great app with small problems
review:
I like this app so much and i love using it with friends but the only problem if you use it with friends you have to make a new room every session which is annoying because we do it 6 times a day and in every time it takes almost 5 minutes just to make a new room and invite friends

Small problem and easy to fix but it wastes a lot of time unfortunately 

Hope developers solve this as soon as possible because its really annoying
developerResponse: {'id': 25150909, 'body': "Hi, sorry for any inconvenience caused. We'll let our team know about your feedback and see if we can work on it in the future. Thank you for your suggestion! Have a wonderful weekend. :)", 'modified': '2021-09-17T00:05:02Z'}

title: Great app to stay focused
review: I found myself focusing a lot more and having it as my first tab to open my phone to. This way I was reminded that I have to study and not get distracted. I have mine personally set to the easier format the one where your plant doesn’t die if you exit the app this way if I have an emergency than I can easily exit the app and also change music without having to worry about my tree dying. Overall I really enjoy using the app!

title: Keeps me focused!
review: I use this to keep myself from being tempted to go on my phone while I write. It’s so helpful. My only complaint is really an iOS issue—you can’t allow certain apps while in deep focus mode. There is an “Allow List” feature that iPhone users can’t use. I wish Apple would make it easier for Forest to do this! I want to be able to use Podcast, Audible, Libby, Notion, etc when using Forest because all those apps are productive for me. Crossing my fingers that Apple makes this possible someday.

title: Favorite Focus App for College
review:
I’m a senior college student and I also do a million other things. I’m very type A and also a Virgo, making this a perfect app for me. 

It helps time things during finals and makes sure I’m not on my phone too much when I need to get things done! I’m also very competitive...so I make it a game for myself to see if I can achieve a certain amount of coins within a certain time period 

I look forward to the new plants that come out and I WISH they would do like a “Turtle Plant” for reptile lovers (don’t have a cat or dog). In case anyone is wondering: National Turtle Day is May 23 and are in dire need of conservation help. 

Or perhaps a horoscope line that would target a large majority of their demographic.

Overall: 10/10 would recommend for anyone who needs help staying on track and focusing.

title: Finally getting stuff done!
review: I’m the kind of person to get distracted very easily and get side tracked for an hour or more, so this app is a big help. As soon as I open up my phone, I’m reminded to get back to work because the last thing I wanna do it kill my tree haha. I’m in my second year of college, I work and am in a music ensemble at school, so I can’t afford to let my time slip away from what needs to be done. From doing homework and studying to practicing and getting chores done, this app helps keep me on track. I love it!

title: I am so happy I found this app!!!!
review: Not only does this app help me stay productive with my school work, it also gives me a chance to help grow trees all around the world!! Which is pretty freaking cool!!! The one thing I wish it was able to do was keep me from getting into my other apps when I loose self control haha. But at the same time I’m also glad it allows me to still text my parents if I need to. Having the app going is always a friendly reminder to get back to work when I turn on my phone. Overall, I strongly recommend for people to get it!!

title: Love Forest; Lackluster Apple Watch functionality
review: Forest provides a fun way to stay motivated while staying on task - an important strategy in a distracted world. My one challenge with the app (and it’s a big one) is the lackluster Apple Watch functionality. I read the Forest dev team’s rationale behind not supporting starting planting from the Apple Watch, however this functionality is critical for people who are trying to fully reduce the need to pick up their phone in the first place. The capability exists in other apps (e.g. Focus) and I highly encourage Forest to consider adding this to keep loyal users like me hooked.

title: Amazing tbh
review: Forest is such a great app to keep yourself focused because you end up feeling guilty if you let your tree die, not only that but it has tons of cute possible trees you can plant and make up your own mini forest. Honestly I recommend if you get distracted super easily like me and I think you’ll like the fact that it’s cute and helpful!  Also if you want to study with a friend you can do that too which I find really nice since sometimes you don’t want to study alone. All in all it is totally worth your money :)

title: Does What I Need
review:
I really only use the app at a basic level, but it does everything I require. I like the interface, and it gives me satisfaction to look at all my trees.

The one thing I wish was different is that the art style for the trees be more cohesive. As it is, it’s sort of a hodgepodge of different themes and styles. I’ve ended up only using the default evergreen because I want my forest to look well planned. Since this is a matter of opinion and I’m sure that some people like the variety, I still rate Forest five stars.

title: Love it, do have a suggestion though
review: I was skeptical that this would keep me honest but the thought of killing even a fake tree by cheating actually keeps me hella honest. I love the sound effect option and that eventually I’ll be able to contribute to planting a real tree! I WOULD love if there was a way to still use a utility like the calculator though. I was very focused on my homework and couldn’t use the calculator to complete it. Not sure if it’s a feasible fix. Worst case scenario I’ll use an old cracked iPhone with no Wi-Fi for just the calculator app.

title: Excellent - the ONLY effective productivy timer for me
review: Forest must have the right kind of reward system for my procrastination-loving brain, because I keep returning to the app to set aside time to work, write, read -- all the things I used to do before my phone put every distraction in the world at my fingertips. Customizable but still very simple and fluid, this is exactly how an app for this purpose should work. I also downloaded the developer's other app for sleep quality, and have had much better luck adhering to a bedtime.

title: Perfect for Focus
review:
I love the concept of this app. It keeps me on track, and I find myself avoiding distractions on my phone—major problem with my and my ADHD—and spending more time studying, working on projects, and finishing stuff I’ve been trying to get done for weeks! Would recommend for any person who needs that extra push to sustain attention on tasks. 

The app let’s you set your own specific requirements (like if you need to work/focus using your phone) and with time let’s you plant your own tree. Love it!

title: I feel like I have a reason to study
review: I’m an engineering major at Stanford and I absolutely despise doing homework, readings, group work, all of it. When I sit down to study, more often than not, I just sit on my phone instead. I do pomodoro technique with this app and it’s making studying feel less futile. I really like comparing my forest with my friends over meals; It makes me feel accomplished in the process of finishing my work. I owe a couple good midterm grades to this app for sure.

title: Great for productivity
review: I’ve used this app on and off over the years. Every time I get into it, I’m way more productive. Part of me hates it because it makes me do stuff that I don’t always enjoy doing—I use it mostly as motivation to do important but boring tasks. But I feel really accomplished afterwards, and my life is in much better order as these important things actually get done. Highly recommend this app, even though I am frequently frustrated while using it. That’s all on me, not the app.

title: Accountability for College and Grad Students
review: I spend way too much time on my phone, so I wanted to find an app that locks my phone. The different trees you can plant makes it feel like a game where there’s incentive to keep using the app and also protect your trees by staying off your phone!!!! This app should definitely be more popular. I’ve also started using it when I’m watching TV or doing something with friends to help stay off my phone. Has definitely helped me limit social media usage.

title: Forest vs flora : both are great but ..
review:
Fantastic ! 
Sounds great 👍👍👍👌👌
It’s better than flora app i think, cause flora app despite it’s being free, uses your facebook account , it’s mean that you have to have an account in facebook and also your trees will be grown up on your profile pic in your facebook account!!  it was a bit unpleasant for me! But in forest app there is no need any account in social medias for signing up or doing your job ! Having more accounts in several social media sites can lead to the phone addiction by it self ! 😃

title: Very effective
review: Though there are other focus apps that are free, I really enjoy Forest. You actually get attached to your forest that you grow, and it’s weirdly sad if one ever dies. I wish the app would actually prevent the battery saving function from locking the screen because a lot of times I’ll receive a notification or open my phone and forget I’m growing a tree. It does remind you to reenter the app before it’s too late, but there was one time where I didn’t see it. Overall, it’s a fun app and I enjoy the many different categories. A great way to keep yourself accountable.

title: Excellent app, amazing customer service
review: I am indebted to this app for getting me through grad school, but the reason I'm reviewing is because I'm so impressed by the customer service. I'm Jewish and was offput by the Santa hat that appeared on the app icon a few days ago. I wrote to the developers and they responded very quickly and agreed to make it an optional feature. I really appreciate their sensitivity to this matter and willingness to adjust the app settings so everyone can use it comfortably. Super stellar customer service. Thank you! It really means a lot.

title: Didn’t think it would work as well....
review:
I have realized how addicted to my phone I am. I would pick up my phone every 12-15 minutes and would put my phone down so I wouldn’t kill my tree. I think this app is really helping me to not be so distracted by my phone. I don’t want to kill the trees!

 I’m using the chrome extension now too to help me with distractions while online. It doesn’t track if you’re actually working but helps to put focus in the right place. Maybe I’ll get enough coins to plant a real tree.

title: Great motivator :)
review:
I’ll be the first to admit I’m not great at staying off of my phone, even when I know I need to be focusing elsewhere. I also don’t have a green thumb AT ALL. Forest helps motivate me to plant a cute little virtual garden that I can’t accidentally kill by forgetting to water them for several days.. and I get to spend the time my plants are growing by being productive (usually with work).

Highly recommend trying if you’re looking for a way to stop the endless scrolling void.

title: Great for productivity
review: I’m the type who subconsciously reaches for their phone whenever there’s a pause between activities, and this has made my studying sessions awfully unproductive. This app gives me an incentive to keep off of my phone and actually do my work. The wide variety of trees and bushes to plant are a great motivator to stay away from my phone so I can earn more coins to unlock them. $2 is less than a cup of coffee, and I feel that the hours of productivity it has inspired is well worth the small cost.

title: Great!
review: I’m a student and like most of us we have some trouble staying focused. I’ve tried several apps but this one is different. You have a little tree that you grow and right now it’s holiday themed! If you leave the app it gives you a little warning before your tree dies. It’s very customizable and I definitely recommend it to anyone who needs a little help staying focused and on task. It’s very rewarding to reach your goal and disappointing if you don’t. I think the small price is well worth it.

title: Plant & Focus 🍃
review: One of the most useful apps I have on my phone....it's easy to use, and doesn't require you to have an account with Facebook or anything, which is always wonderful. It has a calm color palette, and unlocking new plants is a fun way to keep yourself motivated to getting your work done and remain undistracted. It also has the option to have some white noise play alongside the timer. I use this daily just to keep track of how long it takes me to get some things done. Great app! Thanks Forest!

title: Great app for moderating your phone time!
review: As a PhD student, part-time freelancer, and part-time program manger, I spend a lot of time juggling tasks and projects. All of that being said, when I need to focus on a project that requires a lot of attention, Forest prevents me from seeking out my phone. More specifically, I use it when I need to pay attention in a meeting or to take a break (for a walk or be out in nature) and make certain I honor my break time (away from screens and monitors). This app has been extremely useful. ☺️

title: I love this app, but it’s giving me issues now!
review: I have used this app for a few years and it’s really a wonderful way to put your phone down and stick to it. With the most recent update now though it is letting me navigate away without killing the tree! Please help me I have no discipline! Like I’m growing a tree right now as I type this and it isn’t calling me out on it. Now that I’ve discovered this loophole it renders the app totally ineffective. I’ve never had this issue before though so I’m still giving 5 stars.

title: Blah
review: Currently annoyed with this app because it kicked me out of the app with .50 second left on a 1 hour tree and killed it 🌲💀 It’s pretty good most the time though. Needs more of a delay when it comes to killing the trees, it gives a notification but not enough time. Sometimes a check a picture on my phone because at my school teachers have us take pictures of our homework assignments sometimes, and sometimes I have to check it while a tree is growing, then the tree dies. Very annoying when I have been waiting hours... I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS BUT PLEASE FIX THAT!!!

title: Good App, Could Be Improved
review:
This is a pretty good app for helping people get off their phone during work, class, studying, etc.

Some things that could be improved:
1. If “taking a break” didn’t end the extra minutes you can get. As it is, the feature is useless because you may as well have just quit out of the app anyway.

2. If you could take one break during the original time you had allotted. This would be useful for long work periods and/or if you just needed to make a quick phone call or text.

3. Giving up should give you a dead tree and the alive trees you already earned. If you spend 60 minutes working, then have to end 5 minutes early for something, all your time working shouldn’t go to waste just because of that five minutes!

3b. Dead trees also have “stages” based on how much time you gave up on, where giving up on less time gives you a smaller dead tree.
developerResponse: {'id': 2693772, 'body': 'Hello, thank you for the suggestions. As for point 1, it is a known bug. It will be fixed soon. We apologize for the inconvenience. Forest', 'modified': '2018-02-27T14:18:25Z'}

title: Very helpful
review: This app is super helpful in helping me manage my phone screen time. I used to struggle a lot with using my phone -- at one point it was recorded that I used my phone for 12 hours! Obviously this wasn't the only thing I did to curb my phone addiction, but a very helpful assistant indeed. The trees are also very pretty and have a lot of variety, so you're more motivated to keep them alive. I still don't know how the friends and global ranking work tho.
developerResponse: {'id': 31776497, 'body': "Hi, thank you so much for the feedback! We're so glad to hear that Forest has been helpful to you. In your friend list, only the planting time of the day will be display. This allows you to view your friends' focus time and stay motivated with them. For the global ranking, please refer to this help article for more info: https://faq.seekrtech.com/Forest/articles/108. Have a nice focused day! :)", 'modified': '2022-09-01T03:05:40Z'}

title: Really really helps.
review: This app really helps me refrain myself to focus for longer periods of time. I like to spend at least 20 minutes a day intentionally phone free and thh huh is app is amazing for starting slow and working your way up to even hours off your phone if you want. It does it with rewards (new trees! Hurray!) you can also donate points you make to plant real trees. It’s user friendly and the interface is also calming. Highly recommend ✨🥰✨

title: Great App! Definitely Highly Recommend!!
review: This is such a great app to use if you get distracted easily like me or if you have a hard time focusing. I mainly use this for homework and sometimes for studying. I definitely totally 100% recommend this app! The more you do what you gotta do for a certain amount of time, you’ll have your own forest and you will also earn coins, with coins you can purchase plants with them. In conclusion, I’m saying you should get this app and it definitely worth it!

title: Very useful
review: It’s been useful to have this app. I haven’t used it in some time, but even for the two hours that it’s been working today, I’ve been more productive. It’s difficult when the device you use is simultaneously a means of your productivity as well as your distraction. The Forest app helps create a wall there, temporarily, to prevent a person from indulging in distractions. I write down what I need to look up after the tree is grown, and then I look it up. I have a purpose to use my phone.

title: favorite app of all time!
review:
I’ve told so many people about Forest! This app really makes an impact on my life when I use it regularly! Adorable interface ✔️ helps me stay productive and accountable ✔️ shows me my productivity/screen down time for each day/week/month/year with cool stats ✔️ ability to plant with a friend which is great for group projects, meetings, family dinner ✔️ AND by using the app you accrue coins to help them go plant REAL trees! I can’t rave enough about it. 

My only wish is for a night mode! Pretty stars!

title: I’m not sure why this works - but it does!
review:
I was skeptical to try this little app as I didn’t see how it could help me focus, but let me tell you, it does. I’ve been able to get at least twice the amount of work done sense using this app. 

Granted.... my phone battery dies a lot quicker, but that’s what they invented the charger for, right? 

Seriously - if you feel all-over-the-place or find your self scrolling social media for 20 mins (oh crap, that was 4 hours) then this is the app for you!

title: Great for people who like having little rewards for productivity!
review: I used to procrastinate a lot in high school, and wanted to turn my school life around when I started university. I’ve been using this app on my phone, iPad, and Mac because growing little trees in return for getting my work done is awesome! I highly recommend this app! And when your friends start procrastinating, you can challenge them and study with them, grow your forests together! Great for all people focusing on productivity; not just students.

title: Brilliant in its simplicity
review: This is the only app that I have tried that that succeeds in keeping  me away from my phone when I'm supposed to be working. Instead of tracking usage like other apps(many of which require intrusive location permissions), it takes a completely different approach that actually works. If you fail or cheat, your tree dies and you get to keep the dead ones in your forest forever. It's much more fun than a bunch of charts and reminders...and surprisingly more effective.

title: Solid productivity app. Could use a few tweaks
review: I began using this app to aid my studying like most users. Overall it’s a great app however there are a few tweaks that could be made. First is the cost of items is substantial. As you begin to use the app it takes longer and longer together more coins. Also the back button after break is kind of awkward. Instead you should be able to push the tree button to start studying again. Other than that it’s a great app. I recommended for everyone anyone looking to study with more focused.

title: Extremely Helpful
review:
This app has been extremely helpful in focusing on my housework and schoolwork. 
It has provided me with starting my morning focused on small house task for an hour and helping me focus on work the rest of the day by providing a visual of a plant (me) growing from my time away from social media and shopping to better myself. I also extremely love that they plant an actual tree once you earn a certain amount of forest (focus) tokens.

title: Phenomenal ✊🏾💪🏾
review: Since downloading this app it has been more encouraging to use the 25min work 5min break Strategy. I’ve been familiar with the strategy for a while but the structure of this app, from the statistical side as well as watching your garden or forest grow is also encouraging to schedule time to focus. Just invest in this app, after 3 days of using it my return in the amount of time I invested in myself is incomparable. Good luck everyone. Thank you content creators 🙏🏾

title: Worth the money
review:
I’ve had this app since high school and I am now in my first semester at college. I cannot stress enough how helpful it has been to making sure I focus. It has pushed me to be able to focus way longer than I thought I was capable of and does such a good job keeping me off my phone.
I’m also an environmental science major and I love that the trees I plant in the app can go towards planting real trees to help the planet. I 100% recommend getting this app.

title: Increases productivity
review: Very good app to keep off your phone while playing a game of sorts. I’m requesting the developers to increase the functionality of the friends tab and to let us see their forests history for the week, month etc. instead of just the day. And also see what their trees and plants look like. I use this app with friends in a lightly competitive way and this would make that experience way better. Thank you!

title: Pomodoro technique is great
review: I’ve had this app for a while and never got around to using it. But coming back to it with a different mindset is great. I like all of the different plants and all the stats. I’ve only been using it for an hour, but I can imagine after consistently using it for a while it’ll be very satisfying and fulfilling to look back at my progress. I also like the idea with the social features, and the payment model is great.

title: hs student
review: I have an extremely hard time focusing on doing work, but this app is great! I would always be on my phone and have no self control, but this app really makes it much easier to actually stay on task. I thought I wouldn't be bothered by the withered plants but it actually made me feel horrible enough to not want to wither them. Usually, setting a 30 min period for work and a 10 min period to take a break works best for me. Good luck 👍

title: Love it
review: This app is really great for helping me focus. I’m someone who has a lot of trouble focusing and doing my work, and this app has really helped. The encouragements and reminders to set the phone down help, and so do the rewards and the option to play rainforest sounds. It also makes staying focused rewarding, because you can get coins and buy new things to plant. If you are a person who has trouble focusing, I would highly recommend this app.

title: Finally Staying on Task
review: I have ADHD. I often try to work on several things at once, which, is difficult for anyone. This app has helped motivate me to choose one task to work on for a set amount of time. I can then tag it with what I spent the time doing. I’m in grad school and have many classes to study for and clients to plan therapy for. With this app, I can keep track of how much time I’m allotting for each class or client. That way, I can ensure I’m spending equal or appropriate amounts of time on my priorities. Thank you, Forest!

title: SO MUCH HELP
review: This app has literally changed my study game forEVER. Previously I was not able to get through one or two paragraphs of material without looking at my phone and getting distracted but I have use this app so much that I have developed the habit of being able to study for an hour to two hours without distraction and I am so much more productive as a result. Although I was working for 15 hours a week while being a full-time ACCELERATED nursing student I still passed all of my classes with straight As!

title: a m a z i n g
review: This app is a literal life changer. I’ve wrestled with phone addiction distracting me from my studies, but now, all I need to do is plant a tree and boom, I have a guaranteed 2 hours to study, read, play music, write a song, whatever—and my phone doesn’t get in my way. Plus, there’s an option in the app to plant a REAL TREE when you save up enough coins, which you get from focusing. Saving the earth AND saving my grades? This app is one of my favorites ever. Well worth the $2.00, and one of the best purchases you will ever make!

title: AMAZING!
review: I didn’t even realize how much time I wasted on my phone instead of doing homework or whatever else I needed to get done. It’s so simple but so effective for me because believe me, you get very attached to your lil’ tree. The rewards are good enough to not be a distraction to being productive but also encourages you to be like “oh I’ll just plant a tree right now” to earn coins. I especially love the idea that with enough coins you can actually get a real tree planted too! Definitely worth the small price for the app.

title: Essential for modern life
review:
This app allows users to redefine the way they use their phone: make your phone use intentional and your relationship with your phone will change. 

I am always looking to plant trees—which means I’m thinking ahead about how much I actually need to use my phone. Then, if I find that I do need to use my phone, but I’d still rather grow the tree, I hold on to that objective until the tree has grown. I’m using my phone because I want to, not because it’s there or because I can.

title: This app is amazing
review:
This app has been with me for more than 2 college years and I use it almost everyday. It helps me focus my attention when studying and never get bored with using the app. This app just looks more soothing and comfortable to me than flora.

Some suggestions:
-some tree species can only be gotten doing some activities, but can they be available after the activities? Maybe made them available in store with a higher price? Or maybe we need to pay money to get them?

title: Great for someone with trouble focusing
review: My phone is a distraction during what should be focused times: work, dinner with the family, reading, prayer, etc. No matter what I should be focusing on, there’s a little voice in the back of my mind saying “I bet there’s something more interesting on Twitter!” Forest’s method of killing a fake digital tree is remarkably effective at keeping me from exiting out and doing something else on my phone. It doesn’t hurt that the designs are pretty and whimsical, making it fun to collect the various types.

title: Excellent way to keep off your phone
review:
I have a tendency to use my phone way too much, so having a “lockout” app is a great way to keep me from getting lost checking various apps when I wanted to check the time. 

It has an option to quit the timer if you need to use your phone during the timer you set, and an option to keep using your phone with it still going in the background. 

Highly recommend for someone looking to reduce their time at the screen.

title: saved my gpa (and maybe my degree)
review:
i was in a homework funk (senior year of uni in a pandemic <3), but as SOON as i got this app and turned it on, i got my stuff DONE. i took breaks when i needed to, but i felt ready and maybe excited to work with this app?? revolutionary!!!!

i like taking care of trees and plants more than i like doing that for myself (i have a plant watering app that helps me drink water, too (shoutout plantnanny!!)), so if u care for green things at all, these def help break the spell of sluggishness and screen-time addictions!

🌱✨🌳🐛👒🏕

title: Nice but limited watch support
review:
I really wanted to like this app. I've been working to use my phone less and less but still need certain productivity and communication always available. For example, I track my billable hours. 

I hoped the Apple watch app for forest would allow me to simple tap to plant a tree. Unfortunately it does not. It only lets you see what is planted. This makes me grab my phone every time I want to start a new timer. Exactly what I'm trying to avoid. 

I have Apple watch apps to see important text message, phone calls, and track my hours. Unfortunately I will have to look elsewhere to find a pomodoro app that works better with the Apple watch.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4501718, 'body': 'Hello,

It is currently not possible to launch apps on the phone with the Apple Watch. 
If users plant a tree on the Apple Watch, they can still use their phone which violates the main concept of Forest. 

We hope this helps! :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-08-02T13:50:55Z'}

title: Pretty Good But
review: This is a fabulous app but I thought that you could only get coins by planting trees but it turns out that you can also by something that doubles the coins you get after you complete a task. I mean we've already paid $1.99 for this app and the app have a choice to pay another $0.99 or $1.99 for double coins for a certain period of time!!! I think the app should say that the only way to get coins is to plant trees, not cheat to get double coins for only one tree!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! But yeah apart from that the app is quite useful for me. You should definitely get this app.

title: Cool app, can be improved
review: All the nice things have been mentioned by the other reviews. So let me write something on the improvement side from my experience. I wish there can be improvement on the notification. I don’t get an obvious audio notification when the time is up or the tree has grown. Also, there can be a pause button in case something urgent pops up in the middle and I can still came back and keep a more accurate timing. But overall, it’s a good app with a cool idea.
developerResponse:
{'id': 24331432, 'body': 'Hello,
Could you please check if you have the following settings correctly configured:

1. Is it because the volume is too low to hear?
2. Turn on the notification on Forest's Settings page.
3. Allow Forest to send notifications in your phone's settings.
4. Turn off the "Do Not Disturb Mode."
5. Turn off the "Silent mode" (the switch on your iPhone) or allow vibration during "Silent mode" so that you will still receive vibration notifications without sounds.

If you have done the tasks above but there are still no notification sounds, please let us know via  support@forestapp.cc or the in-app feedback system. 
As for the pause button, we will relay your suggestion to our team, thank you!', 'modified': '2021-08-05T09:47:09Z'}

title: Life changing for time management
review: The forest app has been life changing in improving my morning routine.  Before work, I work a side job writing for a legal blog.  Each morning I set aside an hour to write, but I ended up spending most of that hour browsing the internet or making more coffee.  The forest app forced me to realize how much time I was wasting and how to make myself stop multitasking and be productive with my time.  The forest trees and point system feels rewarding! Great way to start my day. Highly recommend.

title: The only app to help me stay focused.
review: I love Forest. It’s great for when I study by myself or when I study with others! I’ve tried many apps to try to stay focused and even when I implement the Pomodoro Technique, my phone can still distract me. Sometimes I find myself reaching for my phone without thinking about it when I see a notification show up on the screen of my phone and I end up wasting a bunch of time. When I unlock my phone, this reminds me not to use my phone. Wonderful app!

title: The rewarding system could use some improvements
review: I think the the rewarding system could use some improvement. To keep the user most engaged, the reward could be more attainable, eg. decrease the cost of new species or increase the amount of coins that are rewarded. I think the more ideal ratio could be for the user to be able to unlock a new species every two to three days if use the app regularly. Moreover, the rewarding amount doesn’t make much sense to me either, the cost gain minute seems to be at best value when one focus for 25mins, which seems to be discourage user to stay focus for a longer time
developerResponse:
{'id': 10841034, 'body': 'Hi
Thank you for the feedback. We understand your points, but if coins were big and easy to get, plants and sounds would all be easily obtained, and users might lose motivation soon. You can get coins faster by unlocking achievements or completing longer sessions.
The coin reward formula can be seen in the FAQ page. Besides additional coins, users will also get more trees when they stay focused over 60 minutes! :)
- Forest', 'modified': '2019-09-23T13:09:29Z'}

title: Great for adults with ADHD
review: I keep getting myself into online courses and then having trouble staying focused (because I’m also a mom, wife, and personal trainer -so there are the responsibilities that go along with those roles). I am now working on y Nutrition Coaching Certification and use this app to keep me at my desk and focused on my school work. I use it for an hour at a time and it really helps. I really don’t like having my trees die off because I’ve touched my phone for too long. It sounds silly but I’m okay with that.

title: Hey I can do stuff sometimes !
review: I have a horrid problem with procrastinating, and with me working on becoming a freelance writer. My procrastination has become my kryptonite. This app although simple keeps me from “sending a quick message” or “checking my ig feed for a sec”. The guilt of killing a tree is too much for my soft heart. It has a decent reward system with being able to unlock new tree designs and organize your forest! Though I wish the app gave you a little more coins with each tree you plant.

title: Great for a busy life style
review: This app really helped me stay motivated to study. It’s great for  analyzing how much time is used doing a specific task per day/week/month. I can divide each subject/task such as organic chemistry, calculus, microbiology and monitor how much time I spend on each section. The tags are color coded and customizable. The ambient sounds are helpful and calming and the trees and shrubs are so cute! I hope they add more options in the future. The ability to plant real trees is one of the main reasons why I had to download this app.

title: It does help you get away from your phone.
review:
This is a great app that does help you concentrate in whatever activity you are looking forward to do. However, I think it still can get better, there's still a lot of room for improvement. Something I think would be nice is a different point of view of the forest. Maybe a 3D kind of exploring through it or something more enticing to the eye. 
A more dynamic environment with more customization. This would make me wanna use the app a lot more frequently.

Above all great app, keep the hard work please!

title: Really Great!! But one minor thing...
review: Gosh I was never able to go more than 20 minutes working on homework before Forest, it has really motivated me and makes me genuinely unhappy when I cancel the tree growth and have to see a dead tree in my virtual forest! I love it so much, I just wish new tree “species” were less expensive than 500 coins, that’s probably 12 hours of “focus time” for one species. I see how that can motivate people to focus and work more, but I think the price should be decreased; people, like myself, like seeing progress and results from hard work:)
developerResponse: {'id': 6949884, 'body': 'Hi, \nWe will consider modifying the formula of earning coins in future updates. Currently, you could earn extra rewards by unlocking achievements! Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions or suggestions! :) Forest', 'modified': '2019-01-22T06:23:46Z'}

title: Forest is the most used app on my phone
review:
Forest really helped incentivise paying attention to one thing at a time. The cute little trees and being held to your comment have really helped me to focus on my work/reading without needing to check my phone. 

I’ve even used it when starting a drive. I’ll set a tree to grow for the estimated length of the trip and I know I punt be able to check my phone so it helps a lot. 

I also like being able to give back and donate my coins to plant actual trees!

title: Amazing!
review: This has been the only app that has actually worked in keeping me focused. I love that there’s also a google chrome extension so that when I need to focus on my work, I can avoid distractions both on my phone and on useless websites. The absolute cherry on top is that this is all for a great cause and that by focusing, not only will that reward myself, but it will also help plant trees in various developing countries! It’s so great that not only does this app absolutely work, but it’s also benefits others as well :)

title: Super cool
review: This app is one of my all time favorite apps. I feel good every time I use it even when I am not pleased with the activity I am doing. I wish we could put more music, such as binaural beats. Also I love the purpose of the app; very morally motivating. I wished we could also use our phones for certain things. I find this app to be truly revolutionary. This app are for people who seek personal development, office workers, entrepreneurs, meditators and even kids. You have to try this app, with sincerity and an open mind.

title: Extremely helpful and cute!
review: This app is amazing, especially if you're determined not to give up. The fear of killing an adorable little tree is great for deterring the urge to procrastinate. I get so much homework done, and I have the satisfaction of seeing my healthy forest when I'm finished working. I love that when you get enough coins (acquired by simply growing trees), you can choose to plant a real tree! I also adore the different types of trees and foliage available- it makes everything so much cuter. All in all, this app is totally worth it.

title: AMAZING
review: I do online school so I get easily distracted by things in my room. I also have adhd which doesn’t help. But this app helps me focus on my schooling! And I love being able to see at the end of the day how many trees I planted! And they have a huge variety of trees you can plant. Amazing and worth the money! I have seen a huge difference in my time management! If you have trouble focusing or need somthing to motivate you to get work done this is the app for you!

title: This so effective for me.
review: I know my distractive self won’t be able to take such an app seriously unless it did some good deed in real life as well. It helped me so much to take the whole purpose of this app seriously since it helps to plant real trees. It’s a bonus how aesthetic the features of the app is. I love this so much. Using this app not only helps me be more productive but it makes me feel better how I am helping the world a tiny bit at the same time.

title: Effective
review: I seriously struggle paying attention to anything for more than 10 minutes because I will always think of 40 more things to do and I get on my phone or browser to mindlessly do menial tasks but this keeps me completely focused by redirecting my efforts every time I unlock my phone. It also is a wonder to keep track of exactly how much time you spent on your most valuable tasks. Much love. I’d buy it again.

title: Great App!!!
review: This is a great app if you have to focus on something without distractions, need time for yourself without your devise, and even if you have an addiction to your devise. This has helped me a lot to get off my phone and do something else more productive. Its also helped me before when I go to bed to take some time away from it to write in my journal or read a book. I definitely recommend this app to anyone and everyone!👍🏼👌🏼😁

title: Great App! Worth the $.
review: Don't let the price scare you away. This app is incredible! In our day in age, it is extremely easy to get distracted, unfocused and lose put attention to other matters. With this app, it is convenient - especially for students to get the work done. Just the set the time you want to study/focus for and begin the time, shut off you phone and set it to the side. Also great for student athletes to stay focused, while divvying up studying into manageable chunks. 100% recommend this app!

title: Very helpful! Wish there was more freedom
review: This app is such a cute way to incentivize someone to focus on a certain task. The animations and plant choices are so cute — I just wish there were more “starter choices” as you can only grow one type of tree and one type of bush when you first start out. Earning seeds/coins takes a lot of time, I just wish you got more seeds per studying session — but I get it, it’s a way for you to earn your new plants instead of getting them all quickly. I think I would enjoy more plant choices in the future!

title: Forces you to use Facebook to create an account!
review: I’ve had similar apps that I’d rated at 5 stars. This is so disappointing and the reason for the 1 star...the only way to create an account is to use Facebook. Seriously? Not everyone is on Facebook and for those of us that are, why in the world should the developers decide they must link this app to their Facebook? That would be fine as an OPTION but I’d like to make that choice myself. Keep checking back to see if they’ve figured out a way to include other sign up options? No thanks. They should have had that figured out before making the app available; it’s not rocket science and every other developer has managed to figure it out.
developerResponse: {'id': 12135050, 'body': "Hi,\nWe're afraid you've mistaken Forest for another app. Forest never offers the option to sign up/in using Facebook. On Forest, only an email address is required to create an account, with the option to connect the account to Facebook to add friends.", 'modified': '2019-11-30T16:50:38Z'}

title: Truly a lifesaver!
review:
I have a very short attention span. In between studying, I often get distracted. Forest was a lifesaver! It kept me from getting distracted by my phone, so I was able to focus more on studying.
Having started out with forest on my mac, I really enjoyed being able to blacklist and whitelist websites. I was really disappointed to have learned that it doesn’t work on other apple products, such as the ipad and iphone. I’d love to have this fixed since I still need some apps while studying, which I cannot open when in deep focus mode.

title: Helps Keep Track of My Hours
review: Love this app! Not only does it keep it me away from my phone, but it also provides a great incentive of planting an actual live tree! I also really enjoy the different kinds of trees and bushes. I use these to separate my work. The pine is for my teaching, the autumn tree is for my dissertation, the bushes are for email and other tasks. I love this app it has definitely helped keep me focused, but most importantly, I use it to track the amount of hours that I work on specific tasks.

title: Worth the buy
review: This app has helped me so much with my studying. Not only does it work as a timer, but it’s a great motivator to stay far away from my phone. There really isn’t anything that could be improved about it, it’s simplicity and cute graphics make it the perfect app. The best feature about this app is that once you save up enough coins from focusing, you can actually have a real tree planted. It’s the best app I have ever downloaded and it was well worth buying the full version.

title: It’s simple and fun!
review: I began doing remote work about a year ago and have had a tough time adjusting to the autonomy. I’ve tried basic timers, but it wasn’t enough to keep me motivated and engaged in the task. I love gamifying boring things and this has helped keep me engaged with those tasks I’d rather forget about. That said, it makes the tasks I don’t mind doing more fun because I earn little coins and can buy fun trees and bushes :) I needed a little boost to help keep me focused and this provides that fun, motivational boost perfectly.

title: Easy to use, holds you accountable, and cute!
review: I use it as a timer while I cook, homeschool, or do other things. You’re able to use music apps along with it, as background so you can also use it to time your workout or study time. It has various options. And the trees that they grow are super cute. When you check your phone it gives you little messages to remind you to get off the app. It also gives you points that you can collect to get different trees and shrubs.

title: The Best Little Motivator
review: I love this app. It’s similar to another app I had in that it’s relaxing but that one consisted of you being on your phone to make the plants grow. I love that this one encourages time OFF of the phone. I use it for everything from spending 30 minutes cleaning parts of my house everyday to doing a full hour work out. Spending time outside with my dog. Spending time every week at my desk getting work done. I love this app.

title: Awesome in General except for One Issue
review: This app is genuinely effective at keeping me focused on my work. However, there’s one issue that frustrates me - I have it set to count exceeded time because I usually get into a groove and work beyond the timer, and the app shows me the amount of coins I should earn from the extra time, but then I receive the coins only from the timer’s original setting, not from my exceeded time. It’s kind of discouraging to not get the full credit for the time I actually spent working! If there is a fix for this, I would love to know!
developerResponse: {'id': 2980397, 'body': "Hello, it would take the system some time to sync the data. That is why you don't earn the coins at that moment. The coins will come eventually. We hope you understand! Forest", 'modified': '2018-03-30T10:15:30Z'}

title: Easy and fun way to get your time back
review: Now that i work remote part of the time due to the pandemic, I’ve found i check my personal devices more frequently and spend a lot of time on them when i do. I also notice my work blends into my personal time. It’s an easy to use fun way to show you where your time is being spent and yells at your to stop scrolling while you earn coins to help the environment. Win win

title: Love my lil trees!
review: So cute, and helps me organize my time, I love that you can create tags. My tags are based on my college classes so it’s cool to see how much time I spend on each class. It’s also really effective to use the pomodoro technique for studying. I used to use my regular clock app but this has a portion dedicated to ‘break time’ and focused time, and they stay set to the time I used on the man before, unlike the clock app, where you have to keep switching the time. Idk, I highly recommend though!!

title: Simple concept but great psychological motivation
review: It’s a simple concept, but somehow, it works. Ever since I took their quiz about finding your study style, I became more aware of the distraction of my phone. The simple distraction of the message in the quiz should be ignored, and that simple trick alone made me realize that while I have the app turned off, I really should ignore all else. It’s helped me stay more focused on tasks, and the little trees are great. I don’t understand he psychological effects, but it works.

title: Love It!
review: I’m in law school and was looking for an app that would help me put down my phone and be present while studying, and Forest has been absolutely incredible. I love that it comes with background focus music, since I tend to study best with instrumental music or white noise in the background (music with words gets jumbled into the words I’m reading on the page). Plus, the plants are adorable! Great for people who are terrible with real-life plants. 😂 Definitely recommending this to friends and family!

title: This is a GREAT app
review: I normally don’t write reviews, but this one deserves an exception. I love the fact that you don’t have to pay a subscription and there is only a one time fee. I also love the fact you get coins for every tree you plant, and that if you save enough coins, then you can plant trees in real life. I wish that there were coins you gained per plant you plant. I also love the fact that you can work with your phone because you can access the apps you need without the tree dying.

title: Yessss
review: This app is high key so helpful when it comes to doing work. I’ve genuinely stayed focus and have gotten so much stuff done. It’s actually a reallllyyyy good app. I do have one complaint though. Everything is so expensive. It costs 500 coins to even get just a sound. I haven’t even gotten to 300 coins yet but it’s fine. It’s actually kind of nice since it’s motivating me to get more work done so I can afford the Cafe in Paris sound. But yea overall would and have definitely recommended this app to anyone struggling with staying on task. OH AND IF YOU GET THIS TURN ON DEEP FOCUS MODE!! IT’LL SAVE YOUUUUU

title: Encouraging, Fun and Enlightening.
review: I absolutely love this app. It’s rewarding to plant trees and build a forest with scheduled time to focus. I find it eye opening to look back on what I have done and time I allocated for reading, writing, gaming, and studying ect. Almost frightening to see all the time I don’t account for outside of work and other forced priorities. If I don’t have it accounted for, I feel as if that time never existed. Otherwise to say, free-time that fell weak to distraction and mindlessness that could have served a purpose. Again, great app!

title: Quick and easy motivator
review:
Simple concept that works well to encourage me to focus on a task without distraction and also take breaks from my phone and be more social or just sit peacefully outside w the real trees!  
Quite often during a task ill think of something and decide oh I’ll just text that to...and seeing the tree growing on my phone actually encourages me to wait!
Surprisingly good way to stay on track and it’s very simple to set it up quickly so you don’t get distracted by the game itself!

title: Motivation
review: I always find myself trying to grab my phone every few seconds when I sit down at my desk. Since I download this app I make sure to set it up at the moment I know I’m about to start doing work. Every time I grab my phone after I see the set timer set, I always remember that I don’t want to lose the tree that I’m planting. When I realize that my timer still on, and immediately put my phone back down. I would recommend this app over and over again.

title: Probably would have failed all my classes without it
review: This app is wonderful. I get the worst feeling when the little tree dies, and so this app works wonderfully at keeping me off my phone. It’s helped me get away and study, but also keep me off of my phone before bed. I highly recommend! (If you need to message someone REAL QUICK you can leave the app for a few seconds, and just double click your home button to go back. I would not change this feature.)

title: So helpful!
review: I’m a student, and in the past I struggled to keep on task and not use my phone while studying. This app allows me to keep my phone close by, but gives me the willpower not to use it. For some reason, the idea of killing a virtual tree is daunting to me. I’ve never even pressed “give up” before, even if I actually need my phone. This app has definitely changed the way I study for the better. I also love how you can change the tree/bush you’re growing with the coins you earn!

title: Very helpful
review: Using forest has been a really good tool to cut back on my wasteful use of time. I find myself being more focused and present, which helps my moods and overall morale. I do wish it allowed you to have like 1 min to respond to a text before your tree dies. That part is a bit annoying. But I know texting is problematic for some people so I can see why it’s not allowed during a planting session. For me it was really to get me off FB and other time wasters. I struggle a lot with phone addiction and this has helped me to start developing better habits.
developerResponse:
{'id': 6949949, 'body': 'Hi,
Thanks for sharing your experience. We have noticed some of users do want to use certain apps while focusing, as a workaround, we add a feature "work with phone" in Forest. This feature enables users to use work related apps during their planting periods, but users will have to be honest with themselves when using this feature. 

The trees planted with this feature enabled will not be counted towards the leaderboard, and users will only receive half the reward if they exit Forest during the planting period. 
Hope this helps! Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if there is anything else we can help you! :)', 'modified': '2019-01-22T06:28:09Z'}

title: Useful if you use it
review:
Useful if you use it. As with any of these kinds of products, there is always an element of making yourself do a thing, but if you can get into it, the gamification part of the app and the structured timing is nice. 

I do wish that it was smoother to just go from taking a break to growing another tree, and maybe have the ability to actually set up a series of recurring grow/break cycles. Maybe say you want to work for 2 hours with set grow/break times that keep repeating until the 2 hours is up. 

Overall a good tool.
developerResponse:
{'id': 5103630, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-09-18T14:48:21Z'}

title: Weakness to Strength - great App
review: I love playing games on my phone and this app is perfect for me to use that “addiction” and turn it into using less screen time. I am working from home now and it’s been harder to concentrate. This app challenges me to stay focus and still give me rewards through pretty tree graphics. Thinking about downloading Floral as well. Highly recommend this if you are trying to stay focused but aren’t as disciplined.

title: Alarm needs to sound without turning on phone
review: I was so excited to try this app, however I soon realized that in order to hear an alarm at the end of my session my phone’s sound needed to be on. If my phone’s sound is on I hear other notifications and phone calls which negates the use of the app in the first place. I’d like to open Forest, set a time to work, and then an alarm goes off at the end notifying me that I’ve reached my target, without being interrupted by other notifications from my phone. I can just as easily set on alarm on my phone without the added addition of growing trees.
developerResponse: {'id': 2844067, 'body': "Hello, we will consider implementing this feature. Thank you for the feedback. If you don't want to be interrupted by notifications, we would suggest you to disconnect from the web. Forest", 'modified': '2018-03-16T09:41:11Z'}

title: Great for alleviating phone addictions!
review:
Truly does help you get off your phone, since you get weirdly invested in fostering the cute little trees. I use this mostly at work, but sometimes also at restaurants or events with people I don’t know well (to make myself get out there and socialize).

Only wish the app explained what bushes were in the shop. I bought one and only realized later that you can only plant them when setting the timer for 20 minutes or less. I don’t typically use the app for such short time frames, so I wasted coins on the bush.

title: Helps so much!
review:
I tend to get very distracted while working - especially by my phone. Using Forest helps increase my productivity exponentially because it forces me to put down my phone (because I don’t want my tree to die) and get to work. 

It helps especially when it comes down to completing task outside of my 9-5 job. Love this app and would recommend to anyone working to cultivate discipline and improve their time management skills!

title: I need IOS app and Chrome extension to synchronize
review: Websites as well as iOS apps distract me when I am trying to work, so I wish I could start one timer with the Forrest browser extension on my Mac and have that synchronize with my iOS app. Right now I have to set two separate timers to achieve this. This results in me being awarded two trees rather than just one, and that feels like cheating in my opinion. It also won’t give me an accurate reading of how much time I’ve spent working, it will be around double the amount of time I have actually worked.
developerResponse: {'id': 22302473, 'body': 'Hello,\nPlease synchronize your data manually in the Settings. If the problem still remains, please contact us again via in-app feedback. Thank you and sorry for the inconvenience.', 'modified': '2021-04-18T08:13:46Z'}

title: Amazing for thesis writers!
review:
I am a grad student writing a dissertation, and, like many other dissertation writers, I am making myself write for 3-4 hours a day. This app is not only great in helping me stay away from twitter and instagram while writing, but also amazing for keeping track of my writing hours in a beautiful manner. I am so motivated to write more to unlock the trees. 

I hope more achievements get added so that it gets easier to collect points and unlock trees. Thanks!!
developerResponse:
{'id': 6733370, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app
feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2020-06-10T02:45:09Z'}

title: great app!!!
review: This app has helped me be able to do my work quickly and make sure I don’t just sit on my phone the whole time. I usually turn it on as soon as I start working and then if I do end up leaving the app to use my phone, it sends me a warning that my tree will die if I don’t get back onto the app. Definitely would recommend if you even have trouble staying on task w your work or just feel like you’re on your phone too much and need a break!

title: Overall, charming productivity app!
review: I’ve been using this app since the early days of its inception and I am please at its growth so far. There are some feature I don’t personally use, but what I do use it for is simple. I love planting new species and while it feels like a struggle to obtain new species at this point (1000 coins) it really does help encourage me to not use my phone during times I need to concentrate. I recommend if you want something visually cute but still works well as an effective productivity app.

title: Really keeps me focused!
review: This app has helped me keep track of what I’ve been doing and how long I spend doing each thing. It’s really helpful that it lets me tag each plant I grow with what I was doing at the time. The only thing I wish was different is the bushes should cost a lower price than trees and it would be nice if we could add different ecosystems for the different forests (it’s a bit strange to see the cactus growing on green grass). Other than that, the app is really awesome with all the different hard modes and also more accommodating ones.

title: Always makes me better
review: Every now and then I think I no longer need Forest. I can just work without a timer. I can stay off the interwebs—I’m an adult. Inevitably my work slugs, suffere, slows to a stuttering halt. And then I remind myself that I got Forest for a reason, and I use it for a reason. It works. I stay on task, I plant all my trees, and I’m far more productive with than without it. I’ve done this cycle enough to know I’m better off just keeping this on my home page, so I always have easy access.

title: Perfect for College Students
review:
This app actually helped two of my issues- starting homework and then surfing on my phone, and always feeling like I’m never working on homework.

The incentive to build trees and make my forest larger is strong enough that I’ll stay off my phone for the full time, and the 25 mins on 5 min break was how I was already studying.

The fact that I can categorize what each time block was for helps me recognize how much effort/time I am putting in each class.

title: Lacking Apple Watch Support
review:
I bought this app thinking it had full Apple Watch support. Unfortunately it’s missing a timer complication, or any visible timer for that matter. The watch app just displays your forest, which is a feat in itself, however, that forest doesn’t reflect the arrangement of the forest displayed on my phone. It seems like a less solidified victory when such details change. Trees also appear on the watch app before their countdown is completed.

I really wanted to give this app a 5 but I get the impression that the developer hasn’t fully considered Apple Watch use cases. The watch’s timer app is more practical to use than this for the time being.

title: Exactly what I was looking for
review: I was looking for an app to easily track the time I spent doing school work/studying and this was it! It also locks down my phone but I wanted an app that kept track of my time spent and also connected to an app on my computer. Forest is the answer. It has a Chrome extension and the time I track is linked to both devices. :) love it and love the extras that are available to save for with earned coins. The sounds and new trees and bushes definitely make it more fun.

title: Eh
review: It seems weird to me that you would have to buy trees in order to customize and create a more colorful forest, even though the app is already paid. Also your forest refreshes every day so it’s not like you have one beautiful and massive forest. I like the idea that if you work hard enough you can plant a tree in real life but it would take so long to do that based on how many points you need to acquire, I’m skeptical of how many trees have actually been planted due to this app. I’ve tried many pomodoro apps (seriously, at least 10 of them), and I’ve found Pops to be the best. It’s free and more effective. You have to put your phone face down during the session, and the phone flashes when the work session is over.
developerResponse: {'id': 3267614, 'body': 'Hello, we designed it that way to encourage users to plant more trees. We hope you understand. In addition, unlocking achievements can be a good way to earn coins. -Forest', 'modified': '2018-04-26T09:11:05Z'}

title: Serenity Now
review: I have loved being away from my phone with the assistance of this app. I love trees so very much, and seeing maples and cedars brings such peace to an otherwise chaotic device. I’m able to focus on healing myself more, listen to music by Ram Dass and audiobooks (“The Overstory”) without the temptation of social media, all while helping to plant a few REAL trees. I really enjoy the default ambient sounds of a rainforest—this app helped me nap today. It will help you, too. For the trees!

title: Nice app but annoying popups
review: The app is nice for what it does but it keeps serving me popups for in-app stuff when I navigate to different parts of the app, no matter how many times I close them (ex. When I got to view my forest it keeps telling me to share my focus statistics, when I go to the store it keeps telling me to invite friends). I think that once you’ve closed the popups they should stop showing. It really breaks the calm mood of the app to constantly have it trying to force sharing.

title: Reclaim Your Time
review:
This app is great. It's helping me reduce how many times I pick up my phone, and get off it earlier at night.

I usually plant a 120 min tree right before bed so I really won't be tempted to doomscroll if I can't sleep.

It would be nice if there was a feature to allow phone calls and several other basic features without killing your timer plant, but overall it's a simple app to help you build different habits.
developerResponse: {'id': 25022638, 'body': 'Hello, \nthank you for your feedback and support! Unfortunately, due to the limitations of the iOS system, we cannot detect whether the user is using other apps or making phone calls. As a result, we are unable to stop trees from dying when answering/making calls. As a workaround, we\'ve made the "Deep focus mode" which you can turn on on the Settings page. If you see features like an App Allow List in other iOS apps, please let us know and we will try to figure out how they did it.\nFeel free to contact us again if you have any other questions or suggestions. Thank you. :) ', 'modified': '2021-09-10T10:41:28Z'}

title: Good app
review: I’ve used Forest before but never really got into it. It’s only been recently, when I’ve gotten more serious in my research, that I decided to give it a try again. I think what’s really changed the game for me is having their Widget on my homescreen. It’s so pleasing to see how full my forest is day to day. Beyond aesthetics, the app is simple and easy to use. I like that they don’t force you to put any money into the app (unless u want cuter trees).

title: Fun and helpful
review: I enjoy this app because it keeps me focused. There’s an option where you cannot go on other apps and that had been beneficial to me not going on my phone and getting distracted. The only thing I don’t like is that I paid for the app and then there are things in the app you have to unlock and you have to have coins to unlock them. It’s just annoying cause I didn’t want to lay for it and not be able to have more accessibility within the app.

title: My forest is starting to grow
review: So happy I found this app and I really feel like it helps me focus and stay dedicated and as someone who loves nature and promoting environmental health and well-being it makes me feel good that my focus is also having a impact on our beautiful planet. I’m only in my first week of using it and I am definitely starting to feel a shift and I know it will continue to get stronger as I feel more and more encouraged and dedicated

title: Holds you accountable
review:
I really like that it keeps track of how many hours you have stayed focused and studied and that you can add notes to each tree. And it works well in holding me accountable...
If you use your phone during a study session your tree dies almost immediately and you are forced to have said dead tree in your forest. I feel so guilty lol. I think it would be a lot of fun with a friend so we can hold each other accountable, but then again they might kill the tree.

title: Makes work fun!!
review: I love forest and have had it on my phone for years:) The social aspect is cool although I can’t get anyone to join me in growing a forest lol. It’s a perfect way to not be distracted while working (I feel sad if I “kill” my tree)which  pushes me to make the most of my workday and be more productive!  I love seeing the “fruits” of my labor in a pretty little forest.  The soundscape is a really nice feature also, as well as the timer choices. Thank you so much to the developers for making this app🙂🙂🙂

title: So far so good!
review: The app premise is simple. To keep you focused or else your tree will die. You get to plant more trees the more you use it. Although it may be ironic to use an app to keep you away from your phone, it does help on your subconscious to be aware that you need to keep off your phone. I've been using the app for over a week, but so far so good. As a person with diagnosed ADHD I've been trying plenty of tools for focusing and this one is getting on that "keep" pile of useful ones.

title: Awesome Little App
review: This app is one of my favorite apps on my phone. Its simplistic design allows me to easily use it and prevents me from getting distracted on my phone. I’d definitely say it does its job and it has its fun little reward system that keeps me wanting to stay focused. I would recommend to anyone who has a habit of picking up their phone purely out of habit. This is also a good tool to see how much time I spend on certain activities. Overall, it is fantastic easy to use productivity app.

title: Really great...but I wish the whitelist app feature worked
review: I struggle with phone addiction and I find this app so useful...but I also actually am required by my job to use a one or two apps very frequently. I bought Forest BECAUSE an online review mentioned a whitelist app feature. When I tried to turn it on I got an in-app error message saying that this feature was not available in iOS, and suggested using the Work With Phone feature instead. That works...kinda meh for me so I hope the whitelist feature works at some point in the future. If it does I’ll come back and rate 5 stars.
developerResponse: {'id': 8706069, 'body': "Hi, due to the limitation of the iOS system, we cannot determine what app the user is currently using. Therefore we can't implement the whitelist feature for the iOS version. We will continue to work on overcoming this issue. Thank you for your support. -Forest", 'modified': '2019-05-16T15:48:13Z'}

title: Awesome
review: As a pre-med student who runs the pomodoro technique “25 mins study/5 mins rest” for many hours amongst many consecutive days, Forest is great. Hoping to help plant real trees one day and the virtual ones you can buy are dope. This app, of course, will do nothing for you unless you use it correctly. However, they should incorporate some sort of break option as I often “kill trees” as something else arises. I prefer this to Flora, because Flora is TOO gamified and actually distracts you from your work. Thanks, creators.

title: Great app super helpful
review: I  love ❤️ this app it helps me focus and get my work done without being distracted by my phone or else you lose your super cute prize. I've been using this a lot recently and it actually really does help me to focus. I recommend this to everyone and in all it is a great app Although some simple things have to be unlocked when you pay for premium but if you create an account you can do more even though it is not as much as paying for premium.

title: Great way to stay focused!
review:
As I started college I have had a constant struggle staying focused. I would always use my phone rather than utilizing my off time. This app has helped me tremendously, love having something to work towards as I study.
That fact that the tree dies when you get out of the app is a great way to redirect the brain to your studies.

Not only is it a good timer but you can save up in-game coins to plant REAL TREES!!! A superb app for students.

title: Fun way to study with friends
