review: I’m in medical school. You always want to study with friends, but in reality, it’s rarely possible outside of a few situations. This app helps keep you focused and also adds some accountability with your friends. Obviously, you can get around it and still waste time, but you can do that without an app. I enjoy using it, and as lame as it sounds, my friends get excited about the different trees.

title: Useful, but could use some improvements
review:
I like this app because it helps me stay off my phone. That said, there is room for improvement. 
1. It would be good to be able to see how much time there is left without unlocking the phone. The way Flora does it is better. 
2. For plants that are supposed to give you multiples for longer study time, you only get plants based on the set timer and not the actual time before you end the session (Eg. it ignores the counting of exceeded time). This disincentives me from continuing to work.
developerResponse: {'id': 28465158, 'body': 'Hi, it is currently not possible to check the timer on the lock screen, and the exceeded time is only for recording the extra time you focus on at the moment - but thank you for the suggestions! We will forward your feedback to our team. Thank you for supporting Forest! ', 'modified': '2022-03-09T08:32:21Z'}

title: Tremendous App that has gotten me out of my procrastination and back on track!
review: Every time I put on the app and get to studying I begin to feel on a role. And the immediate award that you get after completing however long you set the timer is a game changer! That’s really one of the focal points of gaining a new habit is by earning the award quickly which will begin a path to a new habit. Instead of losing sight of your goal as the award is long distance.

title: Helping me have less screen time
review: I notice I am significantly less stressed when my phone is off, or in another room. I try to set aside times to step away from my phone, but honestly need to have it near for work and family communication. This app allows me to take a break from my phone, and focus on whatever I need to at that moment without having to put my phone in another room. I love watching my lil plants grow! It really does feel rewarding.

title: Quarantine useful app
review: I am grateful for having find Forest app to help me keep the phone away. All day long at home, unemployed, away from my country, family and friends. It’s a great excuse to stay unconscious about screen time and how often we need to check it.  I found myself attached to my phone more than ever. So, as I love  challenges and productivity my goal was to plant a tree and finish one task without distractions. Now, I look forward to stop answering messages and scrolling.

title: Cheated
review:
I downloaded this app after its recent hype on Twitter. Basically they falsely advertised it as this sweet concept where you are able to grow a tree which reflects you- I assumed this app would give me great strides in self discovery. In reality: it is an app designed to have your phone on but also off limits. 
Overall, helpful and a nice way to redefine productivity- you can even spend the "money" you earn through staying off your phone on planting real trees! I would recommend this app to anyone I know with phone addiction problems.

title: Love it! 🤗
review: One of the first apps that I decided to invest in to increase my productivity and in my opinion it has helped a lot in helping me focus on my tasks. Keeps me away from the phone and allows me to take the small breaks I need. The store items incentivize using the application to earn different cosmetics for the garden you will be growing as you stay productive. As a developer myself, love the concept and user interface, really easy to use, and helpful in its own unique but familiar way.

title: Great app...wish it had a widget
review:
Really great app! Simple, effective, well designed, and a good solution to keep from wasting time and be more focused. 
Only a couple of things I would suggest:
-First, a widget would be a great addition to make access to the app faster and easier.
-Second, sometimes it can take a really long time to save enough points to buy trees so maybe not making them super expensive or adding more solutions to earning points would be great.
Other than that it is really well made and a very good app, thanks.

title: Best focus app I’ve had
review: Forest is a great app for staying off your phone no matter what you’re trying to focus on. It helps me be present with friends and family and stay on top of my school work. I love the deep focus mode because it makes sure I don’t leave the app because I don’t want my cute little tree to die. I LOVE the fact that our focusing goes towards a great cause and it motivates me to plant as many trees as possible so I can plant a real one. Thanks so much to the developers for this great app!

title: Feel Guilty About Killing Trees = Staying Focused!
review: I use this app whenever I need to get cracking on an assignment. Putting my phone on airplane mode doesn’t work because I know that I can easily disable the feature. However, this app guilts me into studying because I don’t want to kill my tree, especially if I’m studying for longer periods. I tend to stay pretty focused knowing that I can’t access anything else until my time is up. Highly recommend it if you have trouble focusing!!

title: Help toward a good habit!!
review:
I needed this! Growing the trees (and having the fun of “buying varieties” with coins earned) has been a great way for me to stop using apps/my phone too much. I like how it allows phone calls and Siri texting, for times you NEED to communicate. The best part is that it actually “makes me” want to set aside my phone and do a task, errand, “to-do” that I have on my list, without getting distracted by the phone. 
Worth the $1.99. But if the company wanted to give it to me for free, I’d be happy to accept 😉😂!

title: Rooms and groups
review: I just downloaded the app and I like its concept for not using my phone. Also, I like the idea of using a room with friends or family to stay focused. However, it is likely that my friends haven’t downloaded this app or are trying to use their phone when I want to use the forest app. It would be great if we could have some kind of profile and join other people’s rooms that we don’t know. Maybe there is a rating system so that you don’t have too many strangers killing your tree in the room.

title: Great app
review:
I love this app I am a huge procrastinator so I Highly recommend this app. This keeps me on task and I think that it is worth the money. However I wish you could organize the trees instead of them being placed randomly. At first this app seemed like a waste of time and I thought I could find loopholes through this. But when you kill a tree it just leaves you devastated for some reason and it encourages you to work harder. 

10/10 recommend this app to everybody

title: One recommendation
review: Absolutely love the app. It’s honestly one of the few apps that make me look forward to studying and being more productive. The only suggestion I have is to add a “random” feature. Maybe a seed or button that if you choose it, it will randomly pick one of your favorite’s to plant and you won’t find out what it is until you get closer to your goal. Just something to think about!

title: Review
review:
Honestly This app keeps me very concentrated and I loved that because I normally get distracted easily but with the forest app it really Improves my attention span another feature I love about this app is the music selection they have and what I tremendously love about this app is the meaning behind it and what it stands for and what they do for our planet.

Definitely recommend this app to anyone working on how to improve your concentration and what it stand for!!!!

title: Amazing app, probably the best, but...
review: This app is great. The best productivity app I’ve found as it promotes not wasting time on your phone with rewards. It’s just missing 1 key feature that really needs to be added. Can there be an “all time” section when displaying the data? Currently it only goes to each year and there is no way to view your Garden and data from “all time.” Thank you for this app it’s amazing!!!

title: I love this app!
review: I never do reviews or ratings for apps, but I love this app so much that I just had to review it. I’ve had Forest for a couple years and it’s honestly a life changer. I’ve gotten so much more productive with studying. I can track how many hours I’ve been studying and it helps show me how much I can study as well. As other people have said, it’s the best $2 I’ve ever spent. The trees are so cute and the fact that you can even plant real trees from this app is even more amazing.

title: So far so helpful!
review: This app has been a little gem so far, when I realize I’m spending too much time on social media I say.. ok let’s put the phone down and plant a tree. It works! I don’t want my tree to die lol plus it’s a nice incentive to some much needed down time. You earn coins to buy things like relaxing music while your tree grows or new plants to grow. Such a cute app. Also I’m sure you can put a podcast on and then start growing your tree although I haven’t tried it yet.

title: Incredible App
review: During this quarantine I have had a horrible time trying to get time in and motivation to study. I am using this app alongside my best friend and it is so great to see both of our progress! I love the messages it shows while on the timer, along with the ‘threat’ of killing the tree if i stop the timer before it goes off. I love plants and nature so that by itself is a big motivator to tough it out and keep studying. 10/10 have and will continue to reccomend.

title: Love this app. Really does its job!
review: I’ve used many pomodoro and focus timers, and none has been as engaging as Forest. This app makes me *really want* to complete my focus sessions, and I’ve been able to keep my attention on my work much better just out of habit now. Plus, it’s a very well-planned app with plenty of cute and colorful features that make it pleasant to use. Sometimes the English is a little bit botched, but that’s no issue. Love this app. Have annoyed many friends plugging it (lol)

title: Most helpful app ever
review: I needed a way to stay off my phone/avoid distractions while trying to read and rest from the days work and this app has made it so easy to do and in a fun way too! Its also convenient when trying to get work done, and the ability to label different time segments and choose different trees makes it easy to visually track how my time was allocated over the week/month/year when looking at the forest overview and timeline.

title: Annoyed
review:
I was really excited to use this app and heard many good things about it. I decided to download it one night (it was really late) and I must have been more tired that I thought because I put in my wrong birthday. This stopped me from being able to sign up and interact with my friends on the app. I figured it would be a simple fix with an email. WRONG. I was requested to send in two forms of ID.... they suggest a social security number as one. I don’t feel comfortable with an app who wants my personal information. 

So a word of caution while signing up for this app- don’t be tired like I was and don’t make a mistake or else they will make you jump through hoops to use an app that you paid for.
developerResponse: {'id': 11670502, 'body': "Hi,\nSorry for the unpleasant experience. The documents are required in order to verify your identity and to ensure compliance with local regulations. We understand it could be uncomfortable sharing personal information, and thus we are seeking alternatives to authorize user's identity. We kindly ask for your understanding and apologize for any inconvenience this has caused.\n- Forest", 'modified': '2019-11-05T15:32:00Z'}

title: Amazing for focus
review: Forest is a great way to detach from your phone during necessary moments in order to zone in on the work that’s been piling up on your desk. I’ve used it since high school, and as a busy college student now, I’m falling in love with it all over again. It’s a great (free) way to feel rewarded and extra productive after a long study session, or whatever type of work situation is applicable to you. Not to mention, the graphics and design is just downright pleasant. Thanks Forest!

title: My favorite App!!!!!
review:
Perfect! Those trees are sooooo cute! Help me a lot!
SfdjfhdvddofhrbskHssbskskJwb is that time I got the kids in school so I’ll see how they were supposed to go and get some food for dinner tonight if you’re not busy I’m just going home now whshdvdbsakakaysgssbaj was your day hashdududhdj would love gdjdishddj dh we have been like this game but it has really helped us out more than once hdhddududufiuch hus h he had an issue before dhdusj edhdhdnddndndbbddbdbdsjsjajajajaisidkdjwjwgwvevebdfhcucuccuudbw w shxuxjswbwbsn

title: So good for Studying!!
review: I was really unproductive when it came to studying with my phone around. But once my friend introduced me to forest everything changed! I love studying with my friends now because we can all plant trees together creating a super cool diverse forest. Plus I don’t just use it for studying, I also use it when I’m hanging out with others or just feel like I need a break from my phone. And there are so many trees and little bushes to choose from that I never get bored!

title: Helped me pass the RD exam!
review:
I love this app! I know I'm not the only millennial who is glued to my phone so I highly recommend this app to anyone with this problem! I think the best feature is that you can eventually use your points to plant a real tree. You can actually make a difference just by not using your phone and focusing on your studies. I also think that using the timed intervals and breaks helps train your mind to stay focused for that amount of time. Great app,
Keep up the good work!

title: It Really Works
review:
I get distracted at work easily and always reach for my phone. This app has helped me save countless hours off my phone during work hours and has helped me become more productive. 
I actually feel shame when I open my phone while the app is running and it tells me
to put my phone down. 
App is easy to use and understand and I would recommend for anyone who needs help keeping away from their phone during work hours.

title: Great productivity and accountability
review:
Awesome app. I love that it not only locks my phone but also motivates me to keep doing it. I plant with friends, and enjoy collecting all the pretty trees. 

The missing star is for the bugs that I've encountered. At least twice, when planting a tree for 180 minutes (I forgot the first but the second was bamboo), even though I didn't even touch my phone, the tree died. Also, there are some times where I can leave the app and do other things while a plant is growing. This totally defeats the purpose of the app 🤷🏻‍♀️

title: Helpful and fun
review: It really helps you concentrate. The only criticism I have is the tree changes for every five minute mark up to the 25 minute mark, but then after that it only looks different every additional 25 minutes or so. In order to incentivize the user to go for additional time, I think the tree should be larger or thicker for each five minute increment. (I usually just go for 25 minutes every time because the tree doesn't look much different after that.)

title: First Blush
review:
I just got this app and am very excited to start using it to better manage my focus at work and at home. The artwork and UI is phenomenal. Well done!

From a purely technical perspective, I’m a little disappointed that there isn’t a landscape mode for the iPad.  I keep my iPad in landscape mode while charging and working at my desk (because of the attached iPad Pro keyboard), and I would really love to use it as a pure focused display for this app to keep me on track. Hoping this can be added in a future update (or maybe I’m missing a setting).
developerResponse:
{'id': 4505125, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-08-03T01:25:56Z'}

title: Excellent for staying on track
review: Having a smart phone is both a blessing and a curse. I work from home and trying to stay focused is sometimes hard. I find that I am constantly picking up my phone o scroll through some form of social media. This app helps me to be able to stay focused on the tasks I need to complete. I recommend this app to anyone that has trouble focusing on something other than their phone and someone who would feel guilty killing a tree haha.

title: Free from phone!
review: This app really works for me because I love trees. I would never kill a tree, even a digital one, especially for something stupid like looking at my phone. I don’t WANT to look at my phone all the time, but I’m addicted to it. This app gives me that little push I need to stop for longer periods of time than a few minutes and it helps me get things done. I use it for work, reading, spending time with people, and even when I go to bed. Wonderful app, thank you!

title: I want to see the tree grow
review: When I finish the time focused on my things, I would like to see the tree grow with my hard work, and next time I see this tree with a feeling of continuing to help it grow, then it will always be growing or in a state of growth when I use this app to follow my work time allocation. I love this app and hope it will be much more creative in associating with the my mood, just like watching a child grow.
developerResponse: {'id': 25022859, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for your suggestion! We will relay it to our team. Have a good day. :)', 'modified': '2021-09-10T10:53:51Z'}

title: Great for autistic/adhd
review:
I’ve deleted the app a few times over the years as I’ve incorporated other techniques into my day, but I’m keeping it for good with the new widgets and Apple Watch integration.

I have difficulties with executive dysfunction and really benefit from seeing tangible results from focusing on things like housework, writing and drawing. 

The only thing it’s missing is the ability to start a timer via a complication on my Apple Watch 3.

title: CUSTOM PHRASES?! :0
review:
I honestly just downloaded this app because I was struggling to finish my work. It was cute- but nothing revolutionary. It is exactly what it describes- but, DUDE.. customable phrases really caught me off guard. I can write my own encouraging quotes! I now use this feature to quote my anime characters as motivation. 

Suggestion- Can we have customable icons/faces/avatars too? They can be little gardeners! I’d definitely recommend this app to a friend if it had this feature.

title: DEVELOPERS, PLEASE READ!!!!
review: I understand that in iOS you cannot implement App white list. However, is it possible for you to implement group planting where one is in Deep Focus Mode, while the others in the room have disabled Deep Focus Mode allowing those that need the whitelist use only and those who don’t basically “control” the tree. I think it could make the app more engaging in rooms while somehow tackling the whitelist problem in iOS.

title: Great app for a grad student
review:
I really like this app! I’m a full time student working on my doctor of Physical therapy and I study all the time. While I know that each hour spent studying has the great effect of increasing my knowledge, that’s not as tangible as watching my forest grow lol 
I’m more excited to study using the app because I want to have created a super impressive forest every week. The optional background noise is nice and the timer helps guide my focused time. Would definitely recommend

title: The notes section is way too small
review: The notes section is so limited and small. Sometimes I want to be able to write notes without exiting the app Bc I use them to remember my thoughts. 250 characters is way too small. I wish it was at the very least 500 characters. I’ve never been able to finish out a complete thought in forest it’s really annoying. When I use deep work mode it doesn’t allow me to leave the app which is good but it also means I can’t leave the app to write a note or some concept I want to remember. Please make the notes section longer.
developerResponse: {'id': 21359722, 'body': 'Hello,\nThank you for your feedback. We will forward your suggestion to our team.', 'modified': '2021-03-01T07:56:37Z'}

title: Now that my kids are into it, even more exciting.
review:
I have loved this app for years and find it more useful than any other pomodoro technique. I put on my podcasts, set my intention and then decide on a matching tree to plant (I like to use specific trees for specific actions, although I will occasionally just pick a fun one if it isn’t housework or specific action). 

Especially in quarantine, this app is keeping my kids from bugging me to play games and helping us all stay on task.

title: Really keeps me focused
review: I am someone who often get distracted by my phone when studying but after downloading this app it allows me to not let me go on social media apps. It lets you grow plants and create a whole forest with them. There is an option that says “deep focus” that whenever you have the timer on and leave the app it stops the timer and you lose the tree you grow. It kinda of motivates you to not leave the app. I really like this app a lot.

title: Great Studying Method and helps me focus!
review: I love this because it helps me stay focused and motivated. I can organize which “trees” were for what - and I can put in my notes that I want to add. I would definitely suggest this app because it motivates you to build your forest. I would also suggest turning on notifications because they remind you to get back working if you leave the app and your tree will die. I highly recommend this app for anyone doing anything for any age.

title: Great tool!
review: This has been so useful to me in my struggle to stay focused in a work-from-home setting. We all tend to get distracted by our phones, taking us away from our work for just a bit longer than we need to, and I find that this keeps me away from my phone altogether. Knowing I might kill that cute, little tree or bush? Oh no! :) I have recommended this to many people - it’s worth the cost of the app for the time I’ve saved focusing on important things.

title: Love It
review: Before I started using Forest, I knew I wanted to spend less time on my phone but I couldn’t seem to break the addiction. Forest allows me to track how much time I am spending off my phone, which in turn makes me more aware of how much I still use it. My kids love to help me plant trees, and earning enough points to plant a real tree makes me feel like I’m actually doing something meaningful. I highly recommend this app to anyone who wants to break their technology addiction.

title: A1 app, but maybe some updates would be needed
review:
I absolutely love this app when I’m studying, the only downside is that I do sometimes have to text my friends for help on homework which can get tricky with the app. I also think it would be really cool to have a to do list on the app and set yourself a timer for each assignment. Maybe even a timer that blocks all apps on your phone once it reaches a certain time, like after school so the user can focus on his or her work! 

I love this app I just have to many wild ideas😂

title: Amazing!
review: I am the type of person who hates spending money on apps but I heard about this one and decided to try it out. I was very hesitant at first but after trying it out for a week, I am absolutely in love! It has amazing features, doesn’t crash, and helps me stay focused and on track!! I love all the features, I just wish they could add more ring tone/ notification sounds! 10/10 would recommend to anyone trying to get their life back together!

title: Changed My Life
review: Honestly, this changed my life. I'm not in school, I don't use this to study, but I don't lay on the couch for hours on my phone instead of doing something productive. I set it so that it'll still be going when I come home at night so I shower right after work. I don't lay in bed for an extra 30 minutes on my phone when I wake up. Things are so much better! And the trees are hella cute, as soon as I have all the ones I want I'm gonna give my coins for real trees!

title: Great tool to use while studying
review: I often get distracted by my phone while studying, but I no longer have this problem thanks to this app. My desire to grow more trees is stronger than watching videos of people cutting soap on instagram. I only wish that there was a timer to for breaks (rewards is not required ofc). I have a problem with taking long breaks and think a timer for breaks in the app would make the transition from break time to study time a little smoother. Love this app!
developerResponse:
{'id': 4952297, 'body': 'Hi,

We are glad to share with you that we do have a break feature in Forest!
When you finish every session, you could click the "clock" icon to set a break.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-09-05T16:24:12Z'}

title: Just got back, still very great
review: I used to use this app in college, and honestly forgot about it for a while. I finally rediscovered it on a day where I didn’t take my adhd med and was having a bit if focusing issues. Its truly so helpful to have the encouragement to stay off my phone and stick to the time i carved out for whatever it is im working on. The little tree options are very cute too! Thank you forest!

title: Perfect Reading Companion
review: I love to read before bedtime but I am so bad about getting on my phone and getting sidetracked. This app has helped me so much to maintain my goal of reading 25-30 minutes before bed every night. Definitely worth it. The only thing I would add to this app would be a timer or sound when the time is up (for those of us who want to stay within a certain time frame).

title: Helps me focus
review: I’m so glad I bought the Forest app. I saw other people use it so that made me use it as well. I really like this app because it helps me focus on my tasks and prevents procrastination. I recommend this app if you want to get things done without distractions- but in a cute way because the planting is quite nice and adorable. I removed one star because I think I was supposed to get 2 trees for 24 minutes in stopwatch mode but the app only gave me 1. Any way, this app is great. 🌱✨

title: Love it
review: I love the app. Not sure how my points covert to real planting of trees or if I have to donate. It allows me stay focused on my task. I didn’t realize I picked up the phone when I doing work. I thought I had good habits. Surprising what you can discover about yourself. I send a link to my daughter, I think it can help kids stay focused while they are in class or studying. Great app. I only wish the instructions to getting a real tree planted if you gain so many points were made clearer.

title: Faulty Chrome extension
review:
This app used to be great, and its strongest point is the syncing between web browser and mobile app. While the mobile app still gets regular updates, the Chrome extension is no longer maintained. It stopped working in 2019 and was never updated. Trees planted in Chrome sessions are not synced, and the extension is really glitchy. Most of the distractions in WFH comes from web browsing. Developers, please fix the Chrome extension.

EDIT: Devs got in touch to say the Chrome extension was updated. Well, it was not. Everything is still buggy. The screen is not responsive unless you close it and open again. Can't change tree species. Won't sync. Doesn't work at all.
developerResponse: {'id': 16991351, 'body': 'Hi, sorry for the inconvenience, but we do regularly update our Chrome extension. Would you please check the link below? Thanks! \nhttps://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/forest-stay-focused-be-pr/kjacjjdnoddnpbbcjilcajfhhbdhkpgk', 'modified': '2020-08-01T04:45:31Z'}

title: Love it!
review: I love this app, 100% suggest getting it! I’ve been much more focused and attentive to my work since downloading it, and have been spending much less time on my phone. Seeing my forest grow over time is very rewarding. Furthermore, being able to plant actual trees by simply using the app is amazing, and makes me feel satisfied as I am a very eco-conscious person. Overall, I’m very glad I took the chance and bought this app... definitely worth the money.

title: This App is SO Helpful!
review: So I have always had problems with focusing on my homework and staying off of my phone. I downloaded this app and it has helped so much! You can set times for your tree to grow, and during this time period, you can’t go on any other app on your phone or your tree will die. This motivates me to focus and stay off my phone! This app is so helpful and i definitely recommend it for anyone who has problems focusing on homework like me!

title: Life is hard
review:
Sometimes I just can’t stop myself from picking up my phone when I should be doing something else. Sometimes that means I’m eating my data when I should be watching out. This helps to curtail that addiction/habit. It really helps me to focus when I need to.

Just be careful, because I have done it at times that I actually do need my phone to figure something out and maybe it won’t be an issue for you, but I really hate killing my tree/bush.

title: I love this app!!! ❤️🌱
review: This is my absolute favorite productivity app. The phone for me, as a student is definitely a problematic addiction. I didn’t  want to continue procrastinating when I knew my studies came first. Nothing was working well to keep me off the phone until this app! It gave me the push I needed to stay working! I could even encourage myself with little notes as the tree or bush grew. Everything about this app is satisfying and helpful. A definite must have! Thank you Forest 💗

title: Doesn’t help with focus
review:
I’m giving it a 3 star because it does help the environment. I wish I could keep the app open and it only counts down when I’m doing something educational and or productive. With the app. But instead it counts down regardless with what you’re doing. The white out features doesn’t work. And you even have the option to have it keep counting even though you’re not on the  iPad. 

As a grad student. I need something to help keep me focused by blocking the apps but also tells me how much actually constructive time I’ve had . Not jut a timer that counts down.
developerResponse: {'id': 10954087, 'body': "Hi,\nThank you for the feedback. We are aware that the app still needs improvements, but certain features (like a whitelist) can't be implemented due to iOS limitations. We hope you understand, and we will continue to better our services. :)\n- Forest", 'modified': '2019-09-29T13:38:29Z'}

title: Very Effective
review: I’ve tried many ways to stop myself from using my phone but so far this has been the best! I’ve been so obsessed with making my forest as large as possible that I don’t even remember what the real challenge was! I plant a tree one after the other. When one grows I plant another one as quickly as possible and try to beat my time focused every day. It’s extremely effective. It has helped me significantly with focusing on my homework!

title: Help me a lot while studying for finals
review: To be honest, I was always on my phone, like it is just hard for me to not to use it for a period of time. And that’s not good for me during the final study dead week. My friend introduced this app to me and this is the first time I have ever spent money on an app (definitely worth the 2 dollars). Planting a tree is quite a fun thing to do and when I saw that I put down my phone and plant a tree healthily, I feel that I have accomplished something for the day:)

title: An app that doesn’t just want your money
review: This app helped me stay off my phone for months. And when I was ready to improve my focus even more, I realized I no longer needed the app to stay off my phone. I could put my phone away for hours and not think about it now. This app TEACHES you to focus on your own and I’m so truly grateful for it. And, even though I can do it on my own most of the time, I keep this app on my phone for all the rest of the time.

title: Worth every cent!
review: This has by far been the most useful app that I have used regarding productivity! I use it all the time and it really helps with staying motivated and getting stuff done. The only thing thing I wish was added would be making the coin system work more effectively since it is really hard to gain enough coins to buy more trees, especially when you reach having to earn 1000 coins. other than that, i love this app so much!

honestly, this app is amazing. when I first got this app it was because I needed reminders to not be on my phone all the time, and it works. The insensitive that if I play on my phone I’ll “kill” a tree is fantastic! if I just leave the app as the first thing I see when I open my phone, I’ll turn off my phone. no timer needed. and the addition of different plants I can buy is very fun. 
I would recommend the app to anyone looking to take breaks from their phones.

title: I LOVE THIS SO MUCH!
review: I got this when it was still free and they just started and almost 2 years later I’m so close to buying a real tree, only 500 coins later. (It should be noted I wasn’t using it consistently for a while). It’s so worth the money, it actually forces your to study or get to your task and you feel so good about yourself afterwards!  I definitely recommend this app if you have trouble staying off your phone while studying and what to do something good for the planet!!

title: Great app! “Gamifying” productivity works!
review:
I find Forest is a powerful app when I remember to use it. It really works in deterring distraction by my device & encouraging focus & productivity. Of all the apps I use, I wish this one would send me a daily reminder to use it! Other notifications are such a bother, but I’d love to be reminded daily that I could be more productive (& present) if I’d use Forest. Maybe an optional feature for the future?

Edited: There is a notification setting after all! It works great!

title: So helpful!
review: So good at helping me stay on focus and in the moment! Two suggestions though: different options for sounds and an option to write a note to self. So many times I have planted a tree and then realized I need to remember to do something when I could get back on my phone. It’d be nice to be able to have it right on there instead of jotted on a nearby piece of paper. Overall, though, this has been hugely helpful for my productivity and reducing phoning!
developerResponse:
{'id': 4768476, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-08-22T13:42:49Z'}

title: The only app that can keep me focused
review: The app is honestly one of the best things that I have ever discovered. I have tried numerous other app to help keep me focused and organized with my studying time and even just everyday tasks. This app gives an immediate reward (the little trees!) for studying that other apps don’t give up. It sounds a little stupid, but honestly growing these little trees gives me the motivation to continue studying because I see how my hard works pays off.

title: Fun way to limit screen time.
review: After trying a number of screen time products I’ve found that this one does the job. Setting and reaching goals through planting imaginary trees is a positive motivation to limiting the amount of time spent on my devices. And knowing that after reaching some rather difficult milestones I can play a part in planting a live tree makes it rewarding and fun. Kudos to the developers of this app.

title: Great App For College Students
review:
I am a full-time college student and let me just say this app works great for people who struggle with studying and having issues with burnouts. I have a bad habit of doing 1-3 hours studying and not taking breaks, this helps manage my time in a cute way! 

The only thing I think would be great to add is a rotation screen. My iPad is in a case and I would like to sit up my case and still be able to see it. Hopefully this could come in the near future!

title: So calming
review: I love this app! It really helps me to focus when I need to work or want to get some reading in. When I’m tempted to fidget or set my book down, the little tree reminds me that I can keep going! 🌲🌲🌲 I also find that this app works as a kind of meditation as well. I find myself feeling very calm after listening to the tree sounds while reading my book for a half hour. Makes me want to use the app more!

title: wish trees would change with time
review: love this app! been using it for over five years now. I wish that the new trees would change / grow depending on how long you plant them - it used to give me more motivation to plant trees for longer. I don’t like that the new trees have the same design regardless of if you plant it for 30 minutes or 120. but overall, great app, highly recommend. has helped me so much.

title: Great Behavior Shaping Tool
review:
If you are looking for a tool that is a visual monitor of your attention to any task, this is it! If you leave the APP, it automatically kills your tree that you were growing when you were not touching your phone! If you find visual representations of your behaviors reinforcing (i.e. video game points) and/or add back up reinforcers like I can have a snack, a drink, or a break doing “x”, (which the APP will time for you!), you will love this APP.

I am in the field of applied behavior analysis.

title: Love the app! Just a couple ideas
review:
I love this app! It accomplishes its purpose, does exactly as it intends, and I am so thankful to have it! There is nothing wrong with it!
However! I would love the ability to arrange the trees that we have planted in our forests for the day, week, month, and year. I think it would be so fun and would make the app even better if you could have the option of placing your new tree where you wanted. 
Again - great app! Just an idea!

title: Forest is amazing!
review: I honestly love forest before having forest I wouldn’t be able to stay on task and stay off my phone to be honest, now that I have Forest it changed my life I’m able to stay on task for long periods of time, do all of my work and have the benefit of not being on my phone as much! I would recommend forest to anyone if you’re thinking about getting the app, get it it will change you and your work habits or even life for the better.❤️

title: Forest helps me a lot
review: Hello so I have been using Forest for about a month now and all I have to say is that forest actually helps me because whenever my tree dies I get like emotional kind of and Also they have music that really helps me focus and it’s literally just some rain noises but I really love it and it’s actually a very cheap to get the app and it’s amazing so please get this app I love it also I’m not a bot  I’m actually a 13-year-old girl who thinks this app is amazing so please get it thank you

title: Focused (That’s It)
review: I have to say I feel truly more focused since using this app. I see my tree growing and instead of answering notifications that are unimportant I just pu my phone back down and pay attention to what I was doing because I don’t want to kill my tree. I’ve found such great benefit with using this when I don’t want to use my phone. It’s an amazing app and if you haven’t tried it yet. I recommend you give it a try because it’s really helped me a lot.

title: Effective study tool
review: Forest has helped me realize how often I get distracted by my phone. When I set the timer for 20 minutes, and I find myself opening my phone after only 5 minutes of applied work, I realize how little I’ve actually stayed focused. I’ve found that once I get on a roll it’s much easier to stay productive for a longer period of time. I highly recommend this app for anyone who needs help with keeping yourself accountable.

title: Forest is amazing!
review: I’m absolutely loving Forest so far! It definitely keeps me from using my device while studying or doing homework, allowing me to focus my energy on getting it done (though sometimes I cheat by using the multitasking feature on my iPad, lol). Also, the friends feature is superb; we always have mini competitions to see who can grow the most trees. Not to mention the design is super cute! It makes me all the more excited to remain on task. Thank you developers!

title: Great app, worth 4 bucks!
userName: t a l i a the writer
review: It’s improved my productivity so much and it only cost $3.99! I’m always happy and I feel accomplished when I grow my trees and I love how you can donate to grow real trees as well. This is not going to be everyone’s favorite tool because it uses the task and reward trick in a particular way that might not be appealing enough for other people. Despite that, it is my most favorite study and productivity app.

title: Great app
review: Pleaseee add an option for 12 hour time on the timeline instead of 24 so it’s easier to read!! Anyways I love this app so much and it just gives me the extra push i need to put my phone down. It bugs me how some trees have 4 different stages and when you plant you end up with 4 trees instead of just one in the final stage also it bugs me how you have to do a stop watch for 10 min

title: Excellent
review: This app is excellent. Gamifying focused work time is remarkably effective. It also strikes the perfect balance of flexibility and structure. There’s no pause button (structure) but you can run the gamut from a stopwatch with no consequence for exiting the app to a two hour timer that locks you in (flexibility)! I’ve found that the flexibility is really helpful because different levels of intensity match different tasks. Great way to spend $2.

title: The flowers look the same
review: No matter how much time you spend on planting the flowers, they look the same from the start to the end. Like, 10 minutes and 2 hours of focus time makes no outward difference. I feel that the flowers should have different life stages ( from sprout to budding to blooming) like the trees in the app. I want to be able to feel accomplished when I look at my 2 hours flower, but right now I don't feel that way because the flowers look the same regardless of the time I spent on planting it.
developerResponse: {'id': 24180775, 'body': 'Hi,\nThank you for your suggestions and feedback! We will relay it to our team. If you have any other suggestions or questions, feel free to contact us through support@forestapp.cc or the in-app feedback system! Thank you. Have a good day. :)', 'modified': '2021-07-28T14:14:35Z'}

title: It helps so much
review: I love using it to fall asleep to rain sounds and I use it to do online school nowadays. I have used ir for years. I first got it when it was free but it’s worth the money as long as you remember to open the app. But I wish it could go to 5 minutes and all the way up to 10 hours, because sometimes 2 hours it not enough time. It also needs more sounds I’m kinda getting sink of the same ones. But still amazing!💗

title: Helps me focus for class
review: Especially because our classes are switched to virtual, it’s so easy for my hand to reach toward my phone during classes. I start growing the tree on the app and set it to my class time. I forget and still reaches to my phone unconsciously. It’s been helping me a lot:) I pick up my phone without thinking and see the tree growing with a timer. So I put it down right away! Good app for focus:) Satisfying to see my forest gets filled with trees:)🌲🌳♥️

title: Love the idea and the app
review: As a person in college and who has a hard time staying focused and motivated (and just discovered the all time consuming black hole that is TikTok) this app has been THE BEST thing. It’s honestly like a game to me and it’s so fun to see my forest grow and to check my phone every now and then while I’m growing a tree to see my progress. 12/10 recommend to anyone and everyone, especially those with poor concentration and self control skills.

title: Adios distractions!
review: I’m addicted to my phone (who isn’t) but I also need to accomplish things in the day. Those two don’t mix BUT if you get points to unlock cute trees and flowers the longer you stay off your phone, I’m all for it! I set a time for how long I think this particular task will take, then I put my phone away and come back after my time is up (and my tree is grown). Feels great to have my task complete, distractions out of my way, and the cutest collection of trees.

title: Very Helpful!
review: I always get distracted by my phone and I needed something like Forest to make sure I was staying focused. I love all the options available for growing. Initially I was confused by why the number of coins required to unlock a new tree or bush continued to increase with each purchase but this helps me stay motivated. I also like that you can’t buy coins— you can only buy power-ups to increase the number of coins you get. No loopholes, just get working!

title: It works!
review: Whenever I try to get out this app, the guilt of killing a cute tree stops me every time. Especially since they have a variety to plant now. It stinks though that you have to be "focused" for like two hours to see the trees with all their forms. I really love how you can plant trees in real life, however, there’s actually a limit on how many a person can plant-due to the company’s budget. However, this a great app to keep you focused and keep you off your phone.

title: Only thing that keeps me focused
review: I have serious attention issues and cannot stay focused for more than a few minutes at a time. Using this app not only helps me not use my phone when I need to be doing homework , but it helps me ignore my notifications even when I’m not working on school assignments. Plus, for every tree you plant in the app, another tree is planted in real life, so it’s a win-win-win!! Highly recommend this app, it’s worth the price 👍🏻👍🏻

title: Easy to use. Very helpful
review: Very simple premise: put down your smartphone to increase your productivity. The app provides extra incentives for you to put your phone down as do whatever it is that you might have otherwise been distracted from doing. I use it most often when drafting or editing manuscripts. If you need to constantly use your phone to check email or texts to be productive then this app may not be used for you.

title: Great pomodoro, but poor initial variety and monetization
review: I’m usually tolerant when it comes to in app purchases in free apps, but if I already am paying for this app upfront, why not just let me access all of the available trees?  At increase the amount of coins earned per time, if anything.  It is going to take allot of time to unlock the content I already paid for, and the menu incentivizing me to pay extra for a limited time enhancement of this ability leaves a little bit of bad taste in my mouth—especially when other free-to-start pomodoro apps start with more variety.

title: I recommend this app to EVERYONE!
review: I absolutely love this app. It’s really hard to work without getting on my phone bc it seems like every time I try to, I get the perfect quote or idea to post on social media, lol! But this app gives me motivation to post later and keep working now. Every time I use it, I get more done. Period. I can’t remember how much I paid for it but I would buy it over and over again bc it’s that valuable. You’ll thank yourself for getting it 😁

title: Takes a  Little While but Great
review: I've used Forest on and off through the years. I never really figured out the best way to use it (working with phone or not). Now that I know using it with the phone fits my style it's been amazingly helpful. I do have one request. I'm not sure if it possible but it would be great to connect with random friends/people (like a Words with Friends pairing). I'd love to work with other people. I just don't know anyone using it.

title: So beneficial
review: This app has become a really critical part of my mental health management. I use it to designate specific times during my work day to check email and social media, which helps simplify my mental state, I use it to force myself to take breaks when things get overwhelming, and I use it to keep myself honest about no phone use before bed. Since I’ve been using it, I’ve noticed that I can handle longer and longer focus times, which feels great!

title: Best app ever seen
review:
If you are struggling with time management or focusing on the something this app is for you I never paid for apps before friend recommended me and now a days I am very focused on my tasks To be honest If you paid for something you’re more likely to use it because human minds always think that If something have a value It’s have a price. Every single penny worth it.

Thank you developer!

title: Amazing !!
review: I’ve had this app for literally only a day now, but it has motivated me so much. I’ve studied for 4 hours today when most times I’ll study for maybe 30 minutes, and it’s most likely on things that aren’t school related. For each time I earn coins, I get so excited because it brings me closer to being able to buy the various cute trees. All in all, I love this app! Totally recommend.

title: Helps greatly with phone addiction
review:
You’ll find this tool super resourceful if you simply pick up your phone automatically for stimulation. Being rewarded with a tree icon in your forest is all the incentive that you will need to complete tasks or even to concentrate on things such as reading and watching television if you are serious about breaking the habit of peering at your screen. I can’t recommend this app enough, especially considering the price. 

Tim 39
-Mount Laurel, NJ

title: Great for breaking bad phone habits.
review: I often have trouble putting my phone down when I need to, in social contexts and at work. In order to better focus on things I have to do, I like to use this app to encourage myself to put my phone away and handle business. So far, it’s been great! The use of a growing tree reminds me that my time is being well spent, and the ability to assign notes to it helps me stay encouraged in breaking my phone habits.

title: A Need to Focus
review: I get distracted easily but this app helps me to stay focused and get more studying done! Knowing that I only need to study for “15 more minutes” or whatever amount of time I have left it keeps me motivated and focused because I know after those 15 minutes I can get a break. I also am so motivated by a fake tree growing so I avoid using my phone to make sure my tree will live. For me this app is a definite must when I need to study for long periods of time.

title: Super Helpful
review: It’s been a stressful past week at school and I needed something to keep me focused on my work and get everything done in the extra time I have to do homework. The past weeks I’ve been wasting about an hour on my phone when I could be getting homework done. This app helps keep me off my phone and doing joe working and it’s surprisingly rewarding to check back after getting my homework done and see my tree has grown :)

title: Amazing Focus Power
review: As a writer, distractions can eat away at my focus, taking away precious writing time. My word counts suffer. I’ve found this app to my one of my important tools for productivity. With both the timer and the option to add notes to each session, I’m able to track how much I’m doing. The difference in not using the app and using it is very obvious. Thanks for making such a useful, clean app that doesn’t require a whole textbook to learn how to use.

title: Helps a lot with school!📒📚
review: I read for about 40 mins- 1hr every night. This app lets me track my progress and see how much I’ve been reading. This also helps a great deal with studying for tests and quizzes. It keeps me off my phone so I can focus on what I need to do. If there is one feature I would ask for is a widget in the lock screen so you can check your time or grow a tree without entering the app! Amazing app and would totally recommend it!

title: Fun way to stay focused
review: Helps me stay off my phone and focus on important priorities. Still trying to figure out the purpose of buying things with accumulated points and how some of the other functions work. Hope there are enough functions to keep it interesting. Time will tell. Great app so far and most used app on my phone this week meaning that I’m getting a lot of things done while growing “trees” and not waisting time on my phone. Great job Forest team!

title: Highly recommend for ADHD/executive function issues
review:
I love Forest, and it has redefined my approach to work, studying, etc. The digital trees and the promise of new tree types are quick, easy, and effective motivators. 

Forest doesn’t disable your phone, but if you close the app you’re warned that your tree will die, which is, for me, enough to steer me back into the app. If you have ADHD (mine is SEVERE - a diagnosis requires a score of 20 on an assessment and I scored a 38, no joke) this app could easily become a lifesaver.

title: CHANGED MY LIFE
review: Not exaggerating at all, but I am the type of person to be so easily distracted. It’s very difficult for me to sit down and do work, the second I get bored I pick my phone up and I get lost in a loop of social media and distractions. This app has helped me so much and just kept me from touching my phone. Seeing a visual of planting trees and creating your own forest has helped me out. I really recommend this app.

title: Worth
review:
Does this app improve my productivity and therefore happiness? Yes. Is it perfect? No. Some minor bugs and annoyances. Lacks some features I would like. However, best app like it that I know, and I don’t think a further investment of research/experimentation is likely to be worth it.
 I do recommend it.

Edit: 
Example of minor bug/annoyance: menu animates and collapses into a single position.

Example of “missing” feature: a friend of mine tracks a set of activities that only partly intersects with mine. I would like to be able to either: have shared tags, which is what is tracked in the social competition, or be able to see what her activities are for that day- which incidentally brings up: why can’t I see a friend’s activity for the past week?

There’s a lot more, naturally, but those are the first two gripes that came to mind.

Anyway, solid app regardless.
developerResponse: {'id': 2506331, 'body': 'Hello, any suggestions will be appreciated. We would love to hear from you. Forest', 'modified': '2018-02-07T06:03:04Z'}

title: I can’t find my jelly beans
review: Please I bought a pack of jelly beans for my kids (my boys do enjoy their jelly beans) but now I can’t find them! Please help me find them. they’ll be SO upset if I come home from working part time at the Purina™️ Cat Food Processing Facility over in PeePeePooPoo Town:/ and I don’t have their jelly beans!!! Forest is one of the best apps I have ever downloaded! And supports a good cause, well worth it in the long run;) 10/10!

title: One problem
review: I love the app and the trees in it, though how hard it is to get time crystals is a bit annoying, but overall 5 stars. The only problem is that every single time I try to redeem my personal flower, it says “gift already redeemed. Do not redeem again.” So I cannot get my rightfully earned tree, no matter how many times I do the quiz. Is this a glitch, or do you just not want people to get their trees? Fix this and my rating will be 5 stars.

title: Keeps me focused
review: This app rewards you for staying focused on your other tasks. You can choose the type of task you’re about to do (studying, work, etc) and then you select how long you’re going to do that task. Your goal is to not use your phone during that duration, and instead focus on the task you chose so that you can grow a tree. It’s phenomenal. You grow forests after you grow trees, and they have so many cute varieties and custom plants/trees. Great great app!

title: Just Started But Already Seeing Benefits
review: I’ve been using the Forest app for a little over a week now, and can already see that it’s making a big difference in my ability to stay focused. I had become so accustomed to grabbing my iPhone without even thinking about it. Now, I get reminded to put that phone down! I do. Surprisingly, leaving the phone alone has quickly become my default behavior. Gotta grow that forest!

title: Best Study Support App
review: It has every feature that helps you to track the time and place or what you studied, it's easy to use, and most importantly it's cute and the forests are super healing to just looking at it, so you really can't stop using the app. Also it does really help with not using your phone during study, I am a heavy phone-gamer and often they distract me, but after using this app I stopped playing phone games when I'm studying.

title: great productivity tool!
review: I have ADHD and anxiety, so my workflow can be a bit of a struggle. time management is one thing I struggle with a lot–either I’ll have a hard time settling into one activity, or I’ll get so latched onto one thing that I’ll lose track of time and neglect other things I need to do. forest has been SO helpful for me. it lets me structure my work time and feel much more organised and focused so I can get things done. I’m so glad I started using this app!

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS APP
review: This app is worth every penny and more!! My girlfriend and I plant trees all the time and it honestly helps us appreciate the time we spend together so much more! Not only do I get to spend more quality time with her, but I’m also able to get work done when I need to. I just pop on an hour long tree, turn on Do Not Disturb, and get to doing homework. I highly recommend getting this app if you’re looking to get more work done and cherish the present!

title: Awesome Work app
review: As a grad student, I need something that’s going to help me focus for a period of time, and that lets me take a break, while pushing me to get back to work. This app, does just that. I’m able to work for 30mins and break for 5, and do it all over again. I get much more work done this way. Not to mention, I can “plant” trees in the process. Or I can challenge my friends and earn money. Whatever motivates you, this app will help maximize your motivation.

title: Awesome App
review: This app has such a simple interface, and incentivizes its users to remain focus through their tasks. Despite the $2 price, this app proves to be worth it. There is a multitude of different plants one can choose to grow, which is quite entertaining. I also enjoy being able to raise my focusing time past 30 mins. Having more options makes this app worth the price. I don’t really have anything negative to say, so I guess that’s it.

title: Want to be productive?
review:
I have the same addiction that a lot of people suffer from, my phone. I tend to get lost scrolling through IG or playing Clash Royal instead of doing my homework or working on a report for work. I just used it for 3rd time and man, what a great difference of my productivity. It gives me to ability to dismiss my phone and stay focus on the task at hand. It’s just the beginning of my transition to my new life. Thank you Makers. 🙏
I recommend it highly!

title: WOW
review: I cannot express enough how effective and amazing this app is. Not only do I focus on my homework and other things so much better now, but it is also so much fun! It has made studying and being off my phone extremely easy. And though it sounds silly when I explain it to others, I never ever go on my phone now when I’m studying, and the sense of satisfaction I get when I get closer to planting a real tree is even better!!!!! Also, the BEST $2 I have EVER spent.

title: Purely Focused Studying
review: Great app for studying. Haven’t really used it other situations. It’s especially helpful if you use the Pomodoro Technique by acting as a timer with set rest periods (25 mins on and 5 mins off). I don’t get caught up in all the fancy trees and designs like some people do, but I think it’s awesome my study time can eventually accumulate to help donate plants/crops/trees to other people that can use them. Lastly, I think the noises are great white noise and help me study in distracting environments.

title: Delightful and effective
review:
Its so much more fun to get things done when i know i have a sweet little plant waiting for me!

But i still wish there was like a 30 sec pause button so i can change what podcast im listening to or quickly send a text to tell my mom that no im not ignoring her im literally tidying my house. It might defeat the purpose a little bit but like bleas ive needlessly killed so many trees because i ran out of podcast and had to switch to another

title: Very Helpful, would recommend
review:
This app has helped me so much with school and time management, and one of the reasons why I am doing so well in school right now. It has a very “high tech” vibe. I also feel really bad if I let one of my trees die, and I am so inspired to study more so I can get new trees!! 10/10

After using this app for about three months now, I still love it but I don’t like how you’re tree dies of you’re phone dies. It’s annoying. I had 3 minutes left on my timer and it killed my tree. really annoying
developerResponse:
{'id': 4437841, 'body': 'Hi, 

Sorry for your inconvenience.

Due to the limitations of iOS system, Forest now could not support planting trees with phone turned off.

If you have further questions, feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2019-05-03T00:27:43Z'}

title: Helpful
review: I got this app to help me be more productive at work and it helps! It has also helped me be more productive while cleaning my house and more present during conversations with friends and family. I definitely recommend this for anyone who has an issue always checking their phone. I wish there were more awards in the game. I can’t seem to get to 30 straight days, I’ll forget on a random weekend and lose all progress.

title: Love this app!
review: This app really helps me focus on homework and it allows me to get things done faster. It also helps because it makes me feel bad that if I leave the app, I kill the tree I had planted. The money system is a little messed up but its still really nice, and I especially love the fact that if you get enough coins, you can plant a real tree! It’s really motivating for me and it helps me cut down my screen time. I really like this app and totally recommend it!

title: Even better than Screen Time for controlling usage
review:
Screen Time will tell me I’m on my phone or tablet too much. This app keeps me from spending too much time on them. I like to use it when I’m tempted to procrastinate - spend 20 minutes growing a tree and tackling paperwork; take a break; grow another tree and get some chores done. 
I like the variety of sound effects and flora available - and the option of ‘donating your coins’ for a good cause is also nice.

title: Great app for focusing!
review:
I tried a number of different apps to block distractions or restrict access to the internet. The first one to really work was Forest. By making the experience of blocking out my other apps look and feel like a game, Forest made it so that I felt much more motivated to turn away from the distractions. Plus the forests you grow are cute and they become very satisfying reminders of how productive you were.

I do wish there were more trees in general.
developerResponse:
{'id': 5482821, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app
feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-10-13T07:05:39Z'}

title: It works!
review: Does keep me off my phone. When I’m at work there are times where I’m just so bored that I just want to get on my phone and go on Reddit for a bit. Before I know it, I’ve been on Reddit for over an hour and nothing got done. When I have forest on and a tree is growing, I still get my urges to go on my phone, but as soon as I unlock it I see my tree and know that I can’t use my phone. So I go back to work! It’s really helped with me productivity. Thank you!

title: So helpful, well worth the money!
review: I’m someone who won’t download any app I have to pay for, but I got so many positive recommendations that I decided to try it out. In the last week, I have been more productive than in the two months before. This app has more than paid for itself with a renewed sense of self confidence from getting things done. The hours of productivity that I have gotten back make this app worth so much more to me than $1.99.

title: Just Wonderful.
review:
If you are the person who always has the running thoughts and cannot focus like me, this is a great app for you.

It has beautiful designs to track how much time I have been focused on any task - those lovely trees have been motivated me a lot. And seeing them die saddens me, which more or less reminds me that I need to protect them by focusing on my tasks. Fundamentally, the visualisation of how I spent my time leaves no chance for me to find an excuse for not getting work done; now I am confident to say “hey, I have actually focused on my work a lot.”

Moreover, once I have earned 2,500 coins, I can help Mother Earth to plant a REAL tree, which provides me another wonderful motivation to focus on my tasks.

Join now, and enjoy contributing to the Global community by planting real trees and getting your work done.

title: Really works!
review:
Revisiting this review to say-still a consistent user, still love the app, LOVE the new forest species you come up with- but still would like a wider variety of sounds! 

I just need a little reminder not to automatically pick up my phone and this app does the trick! Using the sounds helps as a reminder. I’d love to have a larger choice of sounds! Maybe peepers? Or some kind of simple music- piano, violin etc.

title: Reduces stress!
review: I got this app so I would stop going on my phone when I’m studying but after using it more and more I’ve realized it also reduces my stress and anxiety levels a lot . The optional rain sounds are also great and building your own forest with your hard work is a great motivator! I highly recommend to anyone that has a hard time staying focused or gets stressed and overwhelmed easily like me. Wooo!

title: This app got me a 4.0 GPA
review: I usually don’t buy apps because I’m a broke student but this was recommended to me because I had issues staying focus during study. So I got the app and I’ve never been so satisfied by the efficiency of my studies, I especially love the fact that it provides ambiance study sounds to help you concentrate. I would recommend this to any college student trying to get their sh!!t together.

title: Found a bug
review: When using the Plant Together mode, the person who initializes it will have the selected tree planted, but for the other person, a different tree will get planted - most likely the one they plant in the previous round. For instance, I planted some sunflowers in the morning. Then my friend invited me to plant lilies. I saw lilies in the invitation screen, but as she started planting, my tree turned into sunflowers, while hers were still lilies.

title: Stick With It!
review:
I downloaded this a long time ago and it didn’t impress me. Plant will die? Whatever. 

But this past month I’ve been noticing how much my phone has been distracting me from school. This helps SO much. It helps me track how much time I spend on lectures and actually studying... made me realize how little I was studying before and now I’m determined to change that and grow my cute little trees!!

title: Fun, non-invasive
review:
I didn’t have a pressing need for this app, but I enjoy it. 

The app works as I expected, and keeps accurate time as well as I can tell- minimum time 10 minutes to maximum of 2 hours. The purchase options are apparent, non-essential, but they do look nice. 

I very much enjoy the noise option when doing a task, I had not expected that. I also appreciate that I CAN play music/podcasts if I set them up before starting a task.

title: Fun focus-app for forest-lovers
review: I can’t say enough good about this app. I’ve tried so many things in the past that have never worked. Granted, perhaps, I’m  more motivated right now, but this little app is fun, attractive, and effective. I love it when you’re still playing with it after you’ve set your goal, and it tells me, “Stop phubbing around” or “Put your phone down!” Makes you want to smile and say, “Yes, Sir!” I could go on and on, but just try it.

title: Great!
review: This app is great for those who need a gentle reminder to not be locked into their phones. There is a regular mode that will allow you to use your phone without harming your progress, and then there is the deep concentration mode which will kill your tree if you exit the app. I like this better than another concentration app I used, Flipd, because this app doesn’t completely delete my apps and place them in a different order.

title: It works!
review: This app has helped me get off my phone so much more than anything else I’ve ever tried before! The whitelist apps feature isn’t supported, which is but annoying, especially if you need to access an app and you’re an hour and a half into growing a tree, but if it truly becomes a problem for you, you can simply turn off the deep focus mode. This app is great! I’m glad to see that the developers are active :)

title: Great but...
review:
IMPORTANT!!
This app is great. The thing is, it says 4 and up. If your birthday is not from 2004 and older, and you enter it, you’re screwed. Now, it’s kinda a mess because I have a guardian that does not really want to be involved in this spider web, and now it’s more of a timer than a tool. I wish the specifications were more clear before purchasing, because I’m not very happy on my wasted $2, but I love the idea and the cause. I was really excited, but am a little disappointed/let down. Anyways, make sure you’re born in 2004. Or any other year before this!

title: Lovely App, the little trees make me so Happy!
review: I started using this app upon my first semester of college. I’ve had a lot of trouble practice self control with my phone and get distracted/discouraged easily. Having a new motivation for staying phone-free during my studies and seeing my efforts cultivated through the huge forests I’ve grown across three semesters has been very rewarding. I just donated my first real tree, and am very grateful to the app for not only helping me but helping the earth.

title: Great for productivity, wish it weren’t so stingy
review: First of all, I think this app is great, it really helps me with productivity and focus. I switched from flora to forest because flora didn’t have any variety of trees/plants unless you bought them, and forest seemed to have that option. But it turns out, they mostly don’t. You have to earn new trees very very slowly which I find annoying since I paid money for the app up front. So I wish they would unlock new ones a little bit more quickly.

title: Amazing idea, amazing idea, beautiful design’
review: My friend recommended this app when we were writing our thesis together. Turns out this app is very useful and I use this to keep track on my study/read/work time. Sometimes I will simply use this to give myself a break. I like how those trees are designed and I can donate my time to plan a real tree. It is amazing! I’ve using this for two years already and I will keep using it!! Thank you the developer!

title: Helps me focus on studying
review:
I am currently learning two languages (Finnish and French), and I’ve always had a hard time dedicating a specific amount of time to studying. I would just pick up a book and do a couple of exercises here and there.

This app has forced to spend an allotted amount on studying. If I set it for 45 minutes then I know I will spend the entirety of that time studying. 

Also keeping track of the time I study is very motivating.

title: Stay On Target!
review:
This is The Perfect app to use when you want to stay focused on something! As someone who has problems with ADHD, I use it as a way to stay off my phone and focused on things I need or want to do! Even if it means bouncing around to a couple of things, I’m not getting on my phone and losing myself to multiple hours of social media! So, by my book, it’s a Great app to have! 

Plus, I love all of my pretty trees! Who doesn’t like planting cool and pretty trees??

title: very useful
review: i tend to use my phone a lot during studying, and it gets me off task. forest has helped me A LOT to turn off my phone and focus, whilst growing cute little trees. the only downside is, you cant use apps that you might need (e.g. to look something up, google translate), but i've found ways around it. you can reply to texts and swipe up to use the calculator when your phone is off. i just use a computer for things like google translate.

title: Good app but I want to recommend adding some features
review:
I downloaded this app for checking my study and for my time management.
I think it would be awesome if you guys adding some new features.

1. Setting time for a day for indiviually.
I want to study for 1am-2am but this app counts only by 12am...T.T
Please making feature that i can set time for a day by 1-2am...

2. Adding one app that can access during the time checking

I have to use my mobile phone dictionary but i can’t access it during my studying because the tree will dead if i access the dictionary app.. T.T
So please making a feature that allow accessing one app or two apps during time checking

I’m not native english speaker so my review might have some errors in english...

However it is really great app!!!
I love this!!
developerResponse:
{'id': 4924779, 'body': 'Hi,

We appreciate your feedbacks!

Due to the limitation of the iOS system, we cannot determine what app the user is currently using. Therefore we cannot implement the whitelist feature for the iOS version. As a workaround, we built a "Work with Phone" feature, which can be enabled in the settings page. This feature enables users to use work related apps during their planting periods, but users will have to be honest with themselves when using this feature. 

The trees planted with this feature enabled will not be counted towards the leaderboard, and users will only receive half the reward if they exit Forest during the planting period. 

Currently, the whitelist feature cannot be implemented for iOS. If you see features similar to whitelist on other apps, please let us know so that we may figure out how it was implemented. 

Thank you for your suggestion. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-09-04T03:56:49Z'}

title: I like this...
review:
I really like this app. Way more fun than my usual Pomodoro timer. The only thing I don’t see is an option to view how much time you spent “in total” in a certain category. I see the timeline but it’s broken up by trees planted. I would like to see how many hours I spent working for the day, web surfing, running my mouth on the phone.. stuff like that. But other than that... cool app!

Updated: thx developer! In that case... here are your 5 stars
developerResponse: {'id': 3280881, 'body': 'Hello, you can use tags to mark your focused time. By doing so, you will be able to see how much you\'ve spent on a certain type of activity. If you go to "tags" and tap on one of the categories, you will be able to see the statistics of the tag (total time, average time, time distribution, e.t.c.) -Forest', 'modified': '2018-05-08T22:34:04Z'}

title: Helps a bit
review: This app helped a bit with my procrastination issues. I’m just the kind of person who will naturally find ways to not work, so that’s an achievement (ha). I just don’t like that it costs 60! coins to remove something off your timeline. I had a glitch while syncing the google chrome extension and this app, and it said planted this plant 4 times instead of just once. Now I’m broke and still don’t have enough to remove the other plants. I wish the process to delete plants would be free.
developerResponse: {'id': 4768488, 'body': 'Hi,\n\nPlease provide us the details and the screenshots of the problem via our in-app feedback system. We could investigate this issue further. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-08-22T13:43:51Z'}

title: IT WORKS
review: This works perfectly for my school life and my personal life. Having the option of “planting” 10min-2hr focus periods works for any activity, especially when using the setting that counts up after the time is up. Being provided with seeing my forest grow as the day progresses is encouraging and helps me **see** my hard work when I am frustrated. To top it all off, Im helping plant REAL TREES. I have recommended this app to every friend and classmate I get the chance to.

title: Been using this for more than 5 years now
review: I love everything about this app! You can use coins to plant real trees, you can buy trees with coins that you earn (so many options), there are different modes, sounds, etc. I bought this a few years ago and I use it to this day. I’ve never once regretted it. 12/10 has come in handy more times than you know

title: Favorite app
review: I’ve been using this app since 2015 and it is so helpful. I also love the ability to plant real trees with it. The only feature I’d love to see added is a countdown feature or preset times for a tree to be planted. Similar to an alarm clock, I’d love it if it could be automated so I don’t have to force myself to stop playing on my phone and start a tree. That would make this app 1000x better!

title: Cute way to stay motivated
review: With classes online, I tend to play on my phone while I watch my lectures and I’m not getting the most of out school. This app has helped me put my phone down and focus! The trees are really cute and being able to plant a real tree with the coins I earn from studying really motivates me to keep my phone down. Worth the little bit of money to increase productivity!

title: Please fix the Friend Focus Rooms
review:
There’s only one reason to get it over flora and that’s the fact that your forest stays with you. Flora is free and , as someone with 10 friends who use focus apps like these, has way better Friend functionality: a social media like feed that you can like and comment on and easy ways to join a friends room that doesn’t require codes, starting together, or any prior planning. Not to mention that it’s so much grindier to get plants than Flora.
