If rooms become easier/more seamless to join, then it would most def be a more worthwhile pickup.
developerResponse: {'id': 30572777, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for the feedback! We will forward your request on improving the Plant Together feature to our development team. Thank you again for supporting Forest! :)-Forest', 'modified': '2022-06-27T09:01:27Z'}

title: Mostly wonderful
review: I love the app. It helps me a lot with staying off my phone. One thing I would like to request is that we could manually rearrange the trees in our forest so we can put the different species into a nice pattern of our choosing. I also wish we could have a round forest instead of square and that we could change the color of the grass. And I would like to be able to make the forest snowy at any time of year. Thank you.

title: Helps with my phone addiction
review: I am finally admitting I am addicted to my phone. Since I can’t quit it cold turkey I’m figuring out ways to reward myself for not picking it up. This app helps with that! I get to grow a little tree and the more time I don’t use my phone, the bigger the tree is. I’m still a beginner so I don’t have many trees unlocked yet, but I’m looking forward to making many lovely forests.

title: I never rate apps
review:
I never rate apps on the AppStore nor do I tend to spend money on them, but I cannot recommend this app highly enough!!! 

This is one of the most effective study tools I have come across in a long time, it forces me to focus and makes me feel guilty for going for my phone. If you’re looking to support a good cause while forcing yourself to focus, this is definitely worth the price.

title: A tiny suggestion
review: Hey, I am back. I had another idea. I hope I’m not being too annoying. But, sometimes after I finish my break section and the app tells me to go back, I would be like: “wait let me finish reading this new chapter of manga first.” And the next thing I know a couple of hours had gone by. So I was thinking wouldn’t it be nice if I could schedule a focus section that forcefully starts and makes me snap out of my manga.

title: So helpful
review: Forest is an absolute must for any student or professional. Today it is so easy to be distracted by your phone when working and attempting to get things done and your productivity is often reduced by half because of these distractions. Forest saves you from this issue by blocking off your phone while allowing you to help the environment. I have recommended this app to many people in my life and they have all valued it immensely!

title: Great App!
review: I think overall, it really helped me concentrate more on studying. I really wish that you have a button to take a short break sometimes.. To stop the timer if your mom calls you for example.. I also wish there were more achievements goals because the trees are more expensive as you buy more. Overall though, five stars! It’s better than the other apps that were free. I tried all of them

title: Love it!
review: I love growing my forest and seeing how long I've been focused. One change I’d like to see is a louder and more persistent alarm. I sometimes don’t hear it, even with the volume at maximum, because I’m moving around the room doing physical work. So I go beyond my time, which I don’t like sometimes. If we had options to adjust the alarm features, that would be the best option. Otherwise, it’s a great app and I like earning the different trees and bushes. 😊

title: Always Room for Improvement
review: Overall, I think this is a good app. It’s motivational and satisfying, and I’ve never experienced any bugs while using it. It does exactly what it claims to do. However, I do wish users had more control over where trees in their virtual forests get planted. Getting to choose where to plant a virtual tree would allow users to design the layouts of their forests to make them as aesthetically pleasing as possible, as well as make the experience of using the app more personal.

title: New Algorithm Needs Fixing
review: I have the app on iOS and it's very helpful and easy to use. I would definitely recommend it! However, there is a new method of detecting phone usage that doesn't work well. Everytime the lockscreen lights up, my tree dies and I lose credit for all the hours. Everytime I get a text or notification from any app, my tree dies. I also am not able to listen to music, or take photos from my lock screen, which I sometimes need to do when reading. Please fix this as the app is basically unusable at the moment!
developerResponse: {'id': 10188515, 'body': "Hello, sorry for the inconvenience. This issue has been resolved in the latest version (v.4.10.2). Please update to the new version, and your trees won't die again because of lock screen navigation or notifications. We'd really appreciate it if you update the review and rating when you've seen the improvement. Thank you! :) - Forest", 'modified': '2019-08-15T19:06:35Z'}

title: This app really helps
review: I’ve been using this app for a few years now and it helps me so much. I always use it when I’m studying and I started using it to help me keep off my phone at work and when I’m with friends! I love seeing my forest and the addition of all the new trees you can unlock makes it even more exciting. It’s an app that really motivates you to stay focused, especially with its comments when you unlock your phone!

title: Taking a step back
review: I solely use this app for meditation because I have a desire but struggle to follow through with meditation. Especially with this black box we call phones in my hands 24/7. This app will truly bring you out of a distracted world as long as you let it. My forest has grown quite nicely so far and it’s a great way to keep track and record your time spent specifically for those moments that you desire or care deeply about.

title: Very cool app
review: I love this app for managing myself. When I first bought it I used it every day for months. I want to keep using it like that for sure. I am always weary to spend money on apps, especially with so many free options. But I think investing in the app makes you want to use it even more. Very cool app. I would like to see an option to permanently label trees for different types of activities, but I think besides that it has everything I’d want.

title: Beautiful, useful app!
review: I love using Forest when I’m at work or studying. It’s super intuitive and I always find myself being more productive when I use the app. Every timer you set gives you coins that you can use to unlock different virtual tree species. The trees are also just really aesthetically pleasing. Plus, if you earn enough coins, you can exchange them to plant a real tree! Honestly no down sides to this app at all. Everyone should use it, it’s perfect!

title: Increase real tree limit
review:
I absolutely love this app and I’ve been using it for years. However, the motivation I gain from using it comes from knowing my efforts will actually help the earth. Please increase the real tree limit (I’d be willing to pay more for this feature, even if it was on a subscription basis). I understand the need to make money, but I think there could be a way to make more money and plant more trees.

Thank you for the great app,
Jeremy

title: Love this app😍
review: Absolutely amazing app: great design and very pleasing to the eye, all kinds of fun plants, and makes it easy to be off your phone! I love that you can plant real trees with enough coins. Forest has many relaxing sounds to help you focus, but also lets you play music as long as you start playing it before planting a tree(at least this is what I found with Apple Music). Strongly recommend this app if you want to control your screen time in a fun way!

title: I love it!
review: It definitely helps me to study and stay focused and also read. I like it a lot especially since you earn coins. The only thing I would like to see change is maybe a break button, like on the flora app they had a break button where you would hit it and can use your phone but it would subtract that time from your finished time. It gave you the option too if you wanted to be able to have breaks or no breaks. I would love to see this on this app.

title: I love it!!!
review: I’ve been using forest for a while and i love it so much!!! it always gets me motivated to do work :) with the new phone usage tracking i love it 100x more! i think an interesting addition to the phone usage tracking could be to allow users to have a limit on how long they can use their phone that day and if they go over they’ll lose 100 coins or something. it would definitely keep me off my phone !!!

title: Simple, effective.
review: Most study apps keep me on my phone with flashcards and trivia, but this one is the most effective of all of them. This, with Do Not Disturb on, is one of the best ways for me to let the world turn for an hour so I can do all of my homework and studying. The idea is simple, and has charity built right into the points system. Once you get 2500 coins, you can plant a tree in an area you pick — real world effects for my otherwise trivial coin earnings!

title: Returning after years!
review:
“The Friend Zone” podcast told me about this app while I was in college (2015ish). I loooved the app in school but fell out of practice using it. 

Now I’m graduated and a practicing visual artist. I’ve been having a hard time getting focused after a tough time and remembered how much this app helped me in school! This is my first day using it again and I’m so excited to make it apart of my artistic practice!

title: Fun, Game way to do mono tasking
review: I enjoy using the app to break up my time into sections for study, work, rest, and even entertainment at times. The only downside to it all is that there is an in-game currency market involved. I paid for the app so that I don’t have to spend a cent more on this app. The fact that you can curb the game of the app just to get better looking flora seems counter-intuitive. Just use the app as it was intended to and not as some free Battle Royale game.

title: Some annoying things
review: This app has a weak and short notification ring when your focus time is up. The ring is probably half a second long. If you’re listening to music then you could easily miss the 25 minute mark. So you have to keep going back to your phone to make sure your time is not up, defeating the purpose of focus. It has forest background noise you can turn on, but it’s terrible. There’s an option to leave your phone screen on but it’s at the cost of draining your battery. I expect more for a paid app.
developerResponse: {'id': 32120022, 'body': 'Hi there,\nthank you for leaving a feedback here. Regarding the notification sounds, the volume will change according to your device media volume. We will also forward your request internally for consideration. Regarding the ambient sounds, we would appreciate it if you could give us more details on how you find it terrible via our in-app feedback system. Lastly, as Forest has to continuously detect the usage of other apps to ensure the proper functioning, planting trees requires certain amount of battery. We kindly ask for your understanding.', 'modified': '2022-09-20T08:26:44Z'}

title: Focus+Trees= <3
review:
Started using this app with my roommates, it has been fun using this app together. Because this app actually has a reward (virtual + real trees) it gives the app extra meaning. It does drain my battery if I leave the screen on if I want to see the progress of my tree, so usually I keep it off. Maybe the app can place a spotlight on the tree growing and dim the other stuff. 
Will keep studying, onward nerds!

title: It’s okay but kind of a rip off
review: I love the concept of this and after seeing the reviews I knew I had to get the app. Even though I never purchase apps I’d been looking for a good study tool app so I figured why not. The concept is really cute and I love the options it offers BUT you only get like 2 trees to start out with and you have to buy all the other ones. the first 2 they give you are ugly and the cute ones cost over 1000 coins but I only got 10 coins each time I completed a study option, so I really wouldn’t recommend this app to anyone
developerResponse: {'id': 26703386, 'body': "Hi there! Sorry for the inconvenience. We'll forward your feedback to the rest of the team; In the meantime, please also consider trying to unlock achievements and invite friends to earn more coins. Thank you for giving Forest a try and we hope you'll enjoy Forest soon!", 'modified': '2021-12-08T01:36:48Z'}

title: Great app, but can the devs PLEASE allow rotation?!?
review: Think about an app you use almost everyday, so often that you might be charging your device while it’s being used…and the app doesn’t allow rotation, thus making it awkward to use if on a stand (or in landscape) 😕. Devs should make a list of most requested features like this and release an addon…many of us would willingly pay for QOL features that are sorely missing from this app.
developerResponse: {'id': 24354300, 'body': 'Hi, sorry for the inconvenience. We will relay your suggestion to our team and will take it into consideration. Thank you for your feedback. Have a nice day. :)', 'modified': '2021-08-06T10:44:41Z'}

title: Needs a few minor tweaks
review: This is a great app overall but I don't 100% understand the point of using it when it’s not on focus mode… I think it would be great if when the app isn’t on focus mode, you can select which apps you can still access without killing the tree, that way you can use specific apps for a task without getting distracted elsewhere. I find that focus mode is great but find that it is “all or nothing”

title: Amazing app, but could you add forest page to home page
review:
The UI is great but it seems like a timer. I want to encourage myself by looking at the trees I have planted so far in the forest but I have to go through side bar every time to reach the forest page. That’s a bit odd. I think combination of forest page and current home page will become the best new home page.
Any way, that’s a great app.

title: Great app to stay off phone
review: Overall fantastic app in attempts to stay off phone. Sounds pretty cheesy from the outside, but really is effective and gets you in mindset to create better habits. One suggestion I have is an option to not kill a tree if taking a phone call. Especially when working, phone calls are essential and need to be taken (and not change settings to where you’re able to leave app.)

title: Great app to get rid of procrastination and complete work
review: This app has helped me, someone who procrastinate, to sit down and get the task at hand completed. With these gardens that you have you are forced to complete the work as your trees are at risk if not completed. So i’ve been getting alot of work completed lately thanks to this app. As you go on you also unlock different trees and sounds to help you focus more and make your work more enjoyable.

title: Use the Deep Focus!
review: This app is so amazing for people like me with ADD/ADHD who can’t get our minds off of what’s all going on on our phones. I’m naturally competitive so keeping my tree from dying is a great way for me to have a reason to not use my phone during school work. I also HIGHLY recommend the Deep Focus mode, where your tree dies if you even leave the app. It makes the staying focused challenge like a higher difficulty, which I’m all for. Super great app!

title: Pretty good
review: I was skeptical at first, but it actually helps a lot. The only thing I would change would be to add a pause button... because sometimes I have to pause my studying for small things like bathroom, dinner, filling up water bottle, etc, but the timer still has like 20 mins left, and I don’t want to waste the time while I’m just going to  do something else real fast. But otherwise it works pretty well.

title: Honestly helpful
review: I don’t use it as much as I should, but it does a great job motivating me to keep working on my studies. I could use a timer I guess, but keeping the tree from withering keeps me from cheating myself. I never write reviews but I genuinely support this. I even got some friends to download it and I’ll check their daily progress and be like “well she studied more than me today? I can fix that” and study more than I normally would

title: Great App - Odd Feature
review:
I think this app is great. It certainly provides a unique way to keep your focus. I love the fact that earning in-game coins allows a real tree to be planted somewhere. 

It does seem strange though that to buy a digital tree I have to use coins that could otherwise go to planting a real tree. It seems like there should be a different in-game currency system for digital tree purchases. 

Other than that the app is well designed and has already helped me with focus at work.

title: Superb!
review:
It's useful for more than simply avoiding phone use. It's also a great time management tool. After using it for a while, I've started thinking of my to-do's in terms of how many trees I can grow before I'm done! I have honestly found it to be monumentally helpful in both breaking bad habits, and rewarding good ones.

You really should try it out. Use it every day, and make it a habit! You'll be surprised how differently you can use your time!

title: Love this app 🌱
review:
Forest is a great way to stay off your phone and be motivated to do so. At first I thought the “cute” plant wasn’t going to be able to keep on the app, but turns out, that wasn’t the case. I also love the feature that allows you to plant as actual tree. It makes me feel like I’m helping the planet little by little, just by studying and staying off my phone. This app is definitely worth the money! 
I promise it will be worth it! 
~app lover ❤️

title: Beautifully Designed, Works well
review:
I’ve been using Forest for over a year now, and the beautiful design and ease of use of the app motivates me to put down my phone and get something done.

I recommend this app to all of my friends. Yes, there is a one time purchase, but this app is absolutely worth the few dollars for the time it helps me gain back. For everything it’s helped me accomplish, Forest has paid for itself a hundred times over.

title: Polished
review: I was hesitant at first that the price would be worth it, but have been delighted at the polish of this app that others lack. I first tried Flora, a similar app that I believe originated in the same university lab, because it was free and has all of the same basic functionality as this app. However, the developers of this app have thought through the UX much more carefully, and the result is a useful and fun way to put my phone down and focus. Recommended!

title: Helps me get off my phone
review:
I shelled out the cash for this app, and I do use it during the school year  and work/personal projects. If you need a silly motivator to be off your phone, this is for you. 
I wish there were more species of e-trees (eastern/Texas redbud, magnolia, peach, avocado) and also more flowers (peony, Passion flower, lily, orchid, foxglove, chrysanthemum). 
It would be better if to plant real trees there could be smaller coin increment contributions. Like 1/4 trees, or contributing 500 coins. I would like that
developerResponse:
{'id': 4864949, 'body': 'Hello,

We will continue to release more tree species in the future. 
Any suggestions of tree species are welcome! 

And also, we will take your suggestions into consideration.

Please feel free to contact us if you have further questions or suggestions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-08-30T01:30:19Z'}

title: Great for time management
review: Love this app! It encourages you to manage your time wisely by blocking out life’s greatest distraction (this electronic device!). The visualization of a lush, colorful forest is wonderful. And I just find that once I hit the timer I have a much greater focus on the task at hand. If nothing else, this app does a fantastic job of helping me stay on track on busy days. I highly recommend Forest to anyone that wants to get some of their precious time and, frankly, their life back.

title: The only app I have ever thought, “Man, I have to have that!”
review:
This app had been very useful in helping me focus on my homework and family time. It works just as I imagined it would. I am a junior in Mechanical Engineering, and have the most homework out of all of my friends. This is also the only app I have ever purchased, and I am satisfied with its quality.  

Developers — my favorite tree is a Redwood. Perhaps for a month or so you could make this an option?

title: Stay committed, stay disciplined with Forest!!!
review: I would love to give it a five star rating!!! Why not though???? As a college student, I record my lectures and while I'm studying, I often need to refer back to the audio but I can't, otherwise my tree dies (sigh). Often, I also need to search a word on my dictionary app, but again...I can't.  It would be great if the app allowed you to open certain applications of a productive nature and perhaps totally disable social media apps. The "work with phone" setting is too rigid.
developerResponse: {'id': 2650302, 'body': 'Hello, because of the limitation of the iOS system, we cannot know what app the user is using. Thus, we cannot implement the whitelist feature in the iOS version. As a workaround, we made the "Work with Phone Mode". We hope you can understand. Forest', 'modified': '2018-02-22T11:15:58Z'}

title: Truly helpful!
review: This app really helps you to keep from being distracted by your phone. It is so easy to want to just grab your phone and start scrolling but this app provides just enough of a reminder and accountability to stay off and stay focused. I definitely recommend if you have a hard time with looking at your phone while studying.

title: Useful
review: This app not only helps me focus but it’s also instantly gratifying to see all the trees you grow. Seeing the forest i made by accumulating multiple sessions motivates me to do more. Additionally, I like that we can categorize our tasks and change the categories. We can even add notes on the tree we grew so we can keep track of what we’re doing. This is a fun app that also increases productivity.

title: Highly Recommend
review:
I’ve only had this app for one day and it has helped so much! I got started off by doing 45 minute intervals but actually ended up getting over 2 hours of work done, which is not common for me. Highly recommend if you are the type to love plants and all that stuff. 
I would like if they didn’t make the nice trees so expensive though.

title: Very Encouraging
review:
I made a mistake when I first got on the app, trying to navigate how it works, and ended up killing a tree. Ever since, I refuse to ever let a tree die again, it make me so upset 😂

It’s a very cute app that helps you focus with the motivators of both not wanting your tree to die and to get more coins so that you can earn more trees for your forest. 

Also, for me personally, I loving seeing charts and graphs, so to see the stats of my progresses feels really good!

title: Forest: A cute little productivity app
review:
Yes, it is a timer app that can easily be substituted for your stock timer app on your phone or device but Forest is so much more than that. 

Every time you use the timer, you get the opportunity to plant virtual trees. The more you use the app and stay focused, the more coins you receive that you can use to unlock different kinds of species to plant into your virtual forest. 

Additionally, you can save up your coins and make an even bigger purchase (no real money need to be spent besides the initial fair price of download) and plant a real tree! 

Tags are useful to categorize how much time is dedicated to a specific task you have or will complete. Interface is simple, nice and clean. Definitely a useful app that will be in my devices for a long time.

title: This app is amazing
review: This is the first time I’ve ever done a review. I downloaded this yesterday while I was doing math homework & this definitely got me to put my phone down and study. It is so satisfying seeing the plant grow and it helps me not use anything else on my phone or else my plant would die! Goodness this is something magical here. Best app totally recommend for all students to get or even if you just need to put your phone down!!

title: A very subtle but powerful productivity app
review: This is great for studying and work in general. I love how you can visually quantify your efforts into a cute little forest. I feel guilty letting trees die so I take an extra effort to finishing a session. I used to manually time myself for study sessions and breaks, but this app makes turns the process into a visual account. I love this app and I use it everyday. I don’t generally use it for the purpose of putting down my phone but as a clock.

title: Helps Me Stay On Task
review: I am a college student, and somebody in my class told me about this app. Throughout high school and even now I pick up my phone to do one thing, and then it turns into 30min to 1 hour of time that I should have been using to study. This app, ever since I bought it, has kept me on track and I’ve been getting my assignments done a lot quicker than before! Also, the forests that you can build are so cute :)!

title: So far so good
review:
I will be the first one to admit I have problems staying off social media. As a mom of four, undergrad student, and small business owner I NEED to stay off social media so I can grow in those areas. 

I rarely leave app reviews but other than the app glitching out on one of my first trees and killing it (😭) I’ve been happy with the app. My productivity is up by about 4 hours/week so far. I anticipate that number will grow if I keep planting trees.

title: More beauty please
review: Works well as a gamification of the timer, handy for me with many writing deadlines and a hard time settling. I feel appreciative of the program. I wish, though, they would hire more artists and make the trees beautiful. Not just cartoon cute, as they are now, but rich, thick and organic. I want to love my tree, as a motivation to let it grow, and that would be a lot easier if it was something genuinely beautiful. Maybe those who like cartoons and those who like organic richness could have different skins?

title: Grad school just got a whole lot greener!
review: My program requires A LOT of reading and I have a hard time trying not to multitask and check emails on my phone, waste time on Facebook, etc. There’s something about a little tree depending you that makes it harder to pick up your phone, knowing it’ll cause it to die. Knowing that eventually you can use your time to help grow real life trees makes me more inclined to work harder. I love this app :)

title: New favorite app
review: I love fun productivity apps, and I’ve been in a bit of a rut in terms of focusing lately. This app was exactly what I needed; I’m weirdly super motivated by arbitrary rewards for good habits (e.g. Fitbit, Plant Nanny water tracker, etc). If you’re the same way you’ll love it! I’m hoping that one day the developers are able to create a whitelist feature so I can read in my Kindle app, though I know the FAQ says this may be impossible in iOS. Can’t wait to check out the extension!

title: Best app ever!!
review: I've always had trouble staying focused while doing my homework, especially when I would get a notification on my phone. Without even thinking about it, I would just go on my phone so getting homework done would take AGES. I've had this app for only 4 days and it's already changed my life. I now have more free time and I'm a lot less stressed. I highly recommend this for ALL high school and college students.

title: THANK U
review: I LOVE THIS APP! I’ve been really behind with school work due to always wondering off and going on my phone. But with the deep focus feature it allows me to just focus on my school work and focus on what I have to get done. And i love the idea of being able to grow a plant while completing something! Totally recommend this app to anyone out there who wants to start this year right!

title: So happy to see such a wonderful app
review: This has honestly boosted my productivity significantly. I also realized there’s a feature to plant a real tree (using the coins that you get from staying focused and the developers will plant a real tree). I am deeply amazed by the app and the developers. It’s hard to see apps like this that positively impact people’s lives( depending on one’s definition of positive of course) and the world these days.

title: Like the App, Tree Ideas
review:
The app is straightforward. I like the options to label what I'm spending time doing. The descriptions allow you to get more specific. Adding the stopwatch feature was great because I find having the 10-minute requirement gets me to just continue working.

Something I think would make the app better is adding even more tree designs. Specifically, I would love if more winter holiday ones were added. :-)

title: Cute and effective!
review: I’m a novice gardener and nerd out about anything nature. The different plants motivate me to keep using the app. It would be kind of cool if there was information about each plant. I would have given the app 5 stars if it blocked out the sound of notifications. I enabled the feature that leaving the app would kill my plant, however; they pop up. Other than that it’s a fun experience to tag activity and focus a bit.

title: Great app, but not in Arabic
review: Forest is brilliant, but unfortunately for users who have Arabic set as their device’s operating language, the time log graphs all appear in reverse (starting from 23:00 instead of 0:00 and going downwards to 0:00). For example, let’s say I log ten minutes of focus time at 6AM, this will appear on the graph under 19:00. The hours and minutes are likewise flipped on parts of the application (giving the number of minutes as hours and displaying the number of hours as minutes).
developerResponse: {'id': 20904236, 'body': 'Hi, sorry for the inconvenience. Please contact us via our in-app feedback system for us to assist you further. Please provide details (for example, screenshots or videos) of the problem if you can.\nTo visit our in-app feedback system, please go to Settings, enter our FAQ, tap on the top-right icon and go to "contact us". Thank you. - Forest', 'modified': '2021-02-07T10:23:59Z'}

title: love love love!
review: I always struggled with focusing, and using this app to set small intervals for myself has really helped. I love seeing my forest grow, because it’s a reminder of all the work that I’ve done. However, the only thing that I’d like from this app is for horizontal orientation. I usually use this app on my ipad, and since I like to see the countdown, it’s hard to keep my device propped up vertically. Other than that, it’s totally perfect!

title: I love it!
review: it obviously can’t FORCE u to stop going on ur phone and focus..but it does try. every time I try clicking out of the app, it sends me a notif saying my plant will die if I don’t return. you’d think these little fake plants don’t matter till u start to grow a garden! if you have trouble staying off your phone but you’re committed enough to not kill ur plant, give this app a try! I’ve been using it for years now, it’s my study hack :-)

title: Great so far!
review: I just started using this app, and so far it’s working out great for me! For the longest time I’ve been looking for something to help me focus and this may be it! Is there a feature on the Apple Watch that shows the countdown as well as the forest? That’d be cool if it comes in the future, looking at my phone to see how much time I have left is pretty tempting. The messages that tell me to get back to work haven’t failed yet lol

title: Great Productivity Tool
review: Love using this as a way to stay focused while working from home, as it helps me create a more structured work style. Owning a business can pull me in many directions, so using Forest is a wonderful way to complete specific tasks in a more timely manner. Also love the buddy planting system, making it quite enjoyable to get work done along side others all while motivating each other to stay focused.

title: Best Focusing App for People Who Struggle With ADHD
review: I struggle with ADHD, so, as you can imagine, getting focused and STAYING focused is a hard task for me to accomplish. With this app, though, the time it takes to do school work has been cut in half, and my focus has improved so much because I don’t have my phone to distract me, and I’m being motivated to do something good for the planet!!😊 I highly recommend this app to anybody, but especially to my fellow people who struggle with ADHD like me.

title: Such an amazing app
review: I love this app and it’s definitely worth the money. I love using this app and it honestly helps me focus. Usually doing homework or when I have to work on my computer, I find myself getting distracted and going on my phone. This app completely gets rid of that. When I have this app on, I don’t want to go on my phone so I don’t kill a tree. It really helps and it’s extremely motivating. I love it and I highly recommend.

title: Practical
review: In a world where everything is designed to pull our focus towards screens, this app provides an excellent way to combat this issue. In a very simple, cheeky, way. The plants provide a feeling of satisfaction, and the best part, you receive precious time for your tasks. Whether your trying to take time for yourself, study, read, or perhaps taking on the chore of showering under 5 minutes, this app is ideal for every situation.

title: Love this app!
review: This is the best app I have ever used. Nothing has helped me to stay focus or motivated me more than this app! It really helps me break me work up into manageable time intervals. I am so bad at focusing I usually forget that I’m trying to focus. When I pick up my phone and see the tree growing I immediately remember that I need to get back to work. Love that they really plant trees too! A must have for anyone who needs help staying focused on their work!

title: Amazing tool!
review: The app is beautiful and so useful. I usually try out productivity tools only to abandon them within weeks. I have been using Forest consistently for months because of its excellent design, easy use, and stats on the work I’ve done. Using their tagging system helps me see what I’ve been up to, and their statistics show what days and times I tend to spend the most time focusing on tasks. Cannot recommend enough

title: Stay Focused
review: This app really helps me keep focused when I'm studying for exams, doing homework or even turning it on during lectures in order to stay focused in class & not use my phone. Best part is planting your own forest! My two friends and I even start a tree-growing group during class so we all remain focused and grow our trees together in the app. Super fun to use and it makes you feel good about planting trees and wanting to keep them alive!

title: Very Helpful!!
review: I’ve always struggled with staying on task while at home. I get distracted very easily so getting things done is quite difficult. This app has helped me a lot though! I like that you can plant real trees with it and the noises they have are very relaxing. It helps me stay concentrated because I don’t want to kill the trees. It’s also really nice to be able to see my progress in such a beautiful way! I highly recommend this app! :)

title: Awesome!
review: This app is pretty cool! It keeps me focused for my studies and afterwards makes me feel accomplished for my process when seeing the tag chart which tracks my time and efficiency. Really love how your hard work is rewarded with different types of plants and trees to unlock and grow which indeed incentivizes the user to not only feel accomplished but also motivated to work harder to unlock them. Overall, it’s amazing and thank you for creating it!🌳❤️🎉

title: Simple and effective!!
review:
Forest is fun and helpful in getting me to stay focused and concentrate more deeply. I’ve used it to start my writing habit again and I’ve made more progress the last 2 weeks than in the previous 6 months! Use forest to help motivate and encourage you to start focused!! 

Deep concentration is required for making a significant impact if you are a creative or any kind of leader. Forest is simpler and effective towards that end. Try it out today!

title: So helpful!
review: I didn’t understand how an app would get me to stay off my phone. It seemed incredibly ironic. Out of curiosity, I downloaded the app. I’m so glad I did! Having my forest grow keeps me motivated to participate more in my daily life. The variety of cute trees and bushes that can be purchased in the market (as well as the difficulty of earning coins) also keeps me away from social media and procrastination. I absolutely love the app. It’s worth every penny!

title: You won’t regret spending the $1.99
review: I absolutely love this app! I reach for it constantly because I always get sidetracked when I receive a notification on my phone. This has become so handy, especially during midterms, and one of my all time favorite apps. To add onto all of that the app even has a feature for you to plant a real tree! It does require a lot of coins to do so but that’s just so cool! I ten out of ten recommend this app!

title: Get this app now thank me later
review: This app will save your life. I’m a college student and have a hard time focusing during my studies making it unproductive. This app legitimately raised my gpa from 3.6 to 3.78 because i couldn’t spend my study sessions on instagram. As a result my grades raised and i even spend less time studying because the time I’m spending is quality time. Plus i get rewarded with cute little trees for my effort love this app! Get it and thank me later!

title: This app will get me into Harvard
review: It has all the analytics I need. Time management, tags (study, work, relaxation), and others help keep track of my time. Makes you appreciate further more your time and consider it finite, an elixir that must be used and invested carefully. Thank you developers for making a good cause, making the app interactive , as well as highly productive. 100% recommended.

title: Fabulous app
review: This app is definitely worth the price if used well enough. It gives you motivation to not procrastinate, provides you with stimulating sounds with the background noise offered, and clean graphics that make the app aesthetically pleasing to look at. If you are looking for an app to help you with productivity I would definitely recommend this for you.

title: ADHD Game Changer
review: I learned about Forest from an ADHD organization. I’m so happy I did! I enjoy selecting plants to grow, focusing on my set activity (sport, puppy, learning), and the gratification of growing a healthy plant in my forest! I use the app’s “deep focus mode” so the plant only grows while the app is open. You begin with two plants (a pine and a shrub) and can select more plants as you accumulate focus points. I want to collect points for the candy tree!

title: Fun way to track daily activity!
review:
This is a great tool for those of you that build motivational momentum throughout the day by seeing your progress accumulate.  Once you’re familiar with the interface, it’s a quick tap to start tracking.

A few requests to improve the app:

   Allow users to modify the alerts when the timer ends.  Currently, when a timer ends the notifications are a little too subtle so it’s easy to go over your time.  If users can modify the alert notifications with a different tone or vibration sequence, that would make it much easier to allow yourself to focus on your work without having to worry about missing your intervals.

   Add apple watch complications showing time left and letting you start timers.

title: : D
review: My goal for this school year is to NOT procrastinate and this app really helps me stay focused especially with the deep focus mode. My phone is the main thing that keeps me distracted and this app prevents me from using it while working. The little trees really help me keep going, they’re so cute! Overall, really good app if you’re trying to stay focused, just make sure you turn on deep focus mode.

title: I love it so far!
review: I got the app after seeing the quiz go around and was surprised to see how much it helped me stay focused. Though there aren’t many sounds to choose from it lets other music play in the background and you can mute the sound on the actual app if it’s not something you like to listen to. For $2 it’s a great app to help you focus on any work you need to get done, coming from an extreme procrastinator.

title: Great way to game your productivity!
review:
This app has been great in improving my productivity while working from home! It’s fun to gauge your progress and have a little bit of fun while doing it. 

I love to see (if it’s possible) a live timer on the lock screen or maybe a more minimal timer screen when you start a session. Maybe a tap on the timer and the screen goes black and shows only the number timer. Overall, great app and I’ll continue to use it daily.

title: Changed the way I study!
review: While stuck in quarantine, I’ve found it incredibly difficult to stay focused in a busy home environment, and Forest has given me such a huge boost to my productivity. I’m finally motivated to sit down and REALLY focus on my work for the sake of growing my pretty trees and not killing them. This works really well in conjunction with the Palomino method, so this app is a must-have if you want to keep your focus in any high-concentration task!

title: Actually works
review:
I’ve always been bad at concentrating on the task at hand, so this app has been an absolute godsend! I do find that on really monotonous days I pretty much shut down completely and have little to no motivation to work even without the lure of using my phone, but that is not something the app can really help.

Don’t forget to get more trees once you have enough coins so you can have a nice, diverse forest!

title: Best for premeds!
review: I absolutely love this app! A med student friend of mine recently suggested it and it has changed the game!!! I use the pomodoro method for studying and this really helps me keep track of my study habits and gives me a reward all at the same time! I think its 3000% worth the $2. If you are on the verge, just do it. I look forward to growing my forest and all of my friends know now to not talk to me when they see a tree on my screen, how funny!

title: Great for Autistic people
review:
One of the biggest things I’ve struggled with was learning how to focus on things that I need to, like school or even work, and this app is PERFECT for it. You have plenty of options to be as strict or as loose as you need, but just setting the timer is a great way to hold yourself accountable. Plus, I love the cute trees selection, and love even more the fact they plant real trees. 

I rarely, if ever review things, but this app is worth every penny!

title: Best application for the Pomodoro Technique
review: I’ve been learning to use the Pomodoro Technique I’m studying to make my study time more efficient but I found myself struggling to stay off of my phone while I had my study timer set. The forest app has changed that entirely for me because it’s like a little game and I want to see how many times I can study without breaking it or killing a tree! Definitely recommend for college students

title: Great App- wish it could synch with Chrome extension
review: I love this app. I use it simultaneously on my phone and the Google Chrome extension on my laptop. I do wish that the Chrome extension would synch with the app- ex. Starting the timer on your phone also initiates it on Chrome. This would also prevent double-counting work time and prevent you from receiving double the number of coins for a single session. Is this feature on the way?

title: Great Concept, Needs Something More Though
review: I think this app is a wonderful idea and have loved using it so far, but to be honest, it needs more. Whether that means more tree variety, more bush variety, or different plants for the really long focus times (bush - short, tree - medium, ??? - 1.5+ hrs). I know the app is suppose to get people away from their phone, but if it were more rewarding and engaging on the app itself, it would only increase the time the user uses the app per day as well as the amount of time the user stays enjoying using the app (before users get bored with the app and forget about it).
developerResponse: {'id': 11677560, 'body': 'Hi,\nThank you for all your suggestions. We will discuss them with the team and find ways to improve the app. - Forest.', 'modified': '2019-11-06T01:51:57Z'}

title: Great way to focus on my tasks
review: I have recently been trying to apply the pomodoro technique for studying. I study for 25 minutes at a stretch where I focus only on my task at hand and then take a 5 minute break after each 25 minute session. The forest app has been very helpful in keeping me on track and applying this technique every day. I also get rewarded each time I complete a 25 minute set, which further incentivizes me to concentrate.

title: great for productivity!
review: At first I was hesitant to download the app because I didn't want to spend money, but honestly these few dollars you spend are so worth it. I used it to study through finals because I always checked my phone and I also use it before bed so I won't look at my phone right before sleeping. The different types of trees are awesome and being able to earn coins to plant a real tree feels really nice too. :)

title: Incredibly helpful
review: This is a neat and adorable way to try to be more mindful with my time. I’m very easily distracted and like being able to set time away from my phone. Being able to customize how long the breaks last is wonderful, since sometimes doing a task for 20 minutes is enough to get the ball rolling and next thing you know you’re telling yourself “oh, that was easy, I can do more than than”.

title: The Ultimate Incentive!
review: Now come on, who wants to kill a tree? Not me! I feel so bad when I end up killing a tree, and it makes me want to complete my time of focus. I use it to track my study time, and it helps me set goals for myself. It’s easy to set your designated time, and the coins you earn help you to unlock different tree species. Overall, it’s a very cute and functional app that I highly recommend to anyone who is glued to their phone like me.

title: Worth it
review: I admit, sometimes I’m not always committed to my work, but in those moments I’ll turn on this app and regardless of how motivated i feel I’ll do the work just because of this app. It’s not 100% effective in keeping you productive, you have to put in the effort as well, but it is definitely a way for you to go in the right direction of your goals. I did have to pay for this, but I don’t regret it, it’s worth it’s price.

title: Love it!!
review: Honestly I love this app it’s so cute and it’s a great way to stay focus. If you’re reading this to see if you should buy it- it’s definitely worth the money. As a really bad procrastinator I find it helpful for me to stay off my phone while trying to get homework done because I’m so motivated to get my forest all nice and pretty. It also has relaxing sounds and a nice timer ding and that is not obnoxious and annoying. So basically- get the app.

title: It helps so much!
review: I've had this app since 2015 when I started college. I graduate in less than a week and it has helped me focus studying so much. I am so weak when it comes to being on my phone and having distractions. Growing these little trees keeps me focused! Plus there is a big incentive to earn coins to be able to donate a real tree! If you need to stay off your phone and be focused, this is definitely the app for you.

title: Surprisingly super helpful
review: I wasn’t expecting very much from this but I thought it might help remind me not to check my phone too much. Actually, it does a lot more than that. I’m able to set specific time windows for certain tasks, I get excited for new types of trees, and I like watching my little forest grow. I like the relaxing sounds too. The psychology of this just works for me! I’ve been way more focused and productive.

title: Progress Tracker
review: Forest helps me tremendously by staying off my phone and building/recording my progress in areas I want to improve in or tasks I need to put time in. By far thee most useful app I have to keep me off my phone when my focus really matters. Also it’s fun and addicting to build your forest with all different types of plants they offer at the start and in store.

title: Encouraging for Students; DOESN’T SYNC
review: I love this app so much and the cake trees are so cute, I just HAD to buy both (bought the app 2x for my Note 8 and my iPad). I use it everyday but what I find super tedious is that it doesn’t sync between my Samsung phone and my iPad, I have to manually sync it myself. Even though they’re different platforms, it’s the same app and I feel it should be able to at least sync my account like any other app.

title: Honestly my favorite app to track work
review: Such a helpful tool! Truly does the trick especially for keeping me off my phone to do desk work. One thing I’d love to see is if there was a way to track the same type of tree in weekly or monthly categories. I tend to separate what project I’m working on with different types and it’d be easier if it was summed up instead of tallying each one.
developerResponse: {'id': 2897526, 'body': 'Hello, thank you for the suggestion :) Forest', 'modified': '2021-09-02T18:24:07Z'}

title: Wow! Where has this been my whole life?
review: I’m a PhD student suffering from serious burnout. When I get tired, my phone is the biggest distraction. But this app is the only app that has broken the cycle and helped me get back on track to using my time wisely! Highly recommend for any student who needs a way to stop wasting time on their phone and get things accomplished! 😁

title: The Best Productivity App
review: Forest is a rewarding productivity app, and if you use it enough, you can help the environment. You can use the “coins” it rewards you for planting virtual trees when you are being productive to actually plant trees in the world. There’s a lot of in app purchases as well but they are all for customization of the virtual trees you plant in the app, so it’s okay. If you want to become more productive and want to help the earth, I recommend this app first!

title: A sweet little app
review: Pretty cool! I like this app and how you can also connect/compete with friends to see who can grow more trees (aka study more). Its super straight foreword. I do wish I could go to certain apps, like my calendar or notes app. I also wish there was a little tab that showed the requirements again. For example how long it takes to grow a tree or how long you have to focus until stopping the time wont result in a withered tree.

title: Saving my attention span thru grad school
review: Like most of us I’ve been highly focused on the ongoing news during these troubling times that it’s been hard to direct my attention to what’s immediately important to me—grad school. This app is helping me manage my time effectively by setting how long I will study for in realistic increments and at the end I get a beautiful tree in my ever growing forest. Highly recommend to anyone else similarly distracted!

title: All compliments! No complains!
review:
Awesome app, starting from the fact it helps me stay away from distracting and unsocial mobile phone, it keeps me more into group conversation and family time. Plus, it helps to any Real Trees!!! 🌱🌱🌱🌳🌲🌲 how AWESOME is that?!!! Thanks for doing thus guys! Just PLEASE make sure the trees are keep been planted, if there’s any way this company can validate that the organization keep their agreement so the Earth keeps getting greener and safer! 

Thank you! ❤️🌱

title: Fun little app for productivity
review:
I learned about this app through Digital Marketer. Curious, I tried it, and I really like it. It’s a great little way to keep you focused, and keep your mind off of other things. Well, that takes a little bit of concentration too. 

In return, the company also plant a tree somewhere. That’s a nice benefit. Nothing wrong with planting more trees. But the important part of the app is to keep you focused for a period of time, similar to the Pomodoro technique. Except this one has a tree.

title: I love it, it helps a lot
review: I’ve benefited a lot from this, it fits my particular study habit pretty well. I wish there were more options for formatting my garden with what I’ve grown, or more music options to unlock. Also wish there were different plants like herbs and stuff. I really benefit from the sense of achievement but I’ll probably get bored of the decent number of options eventually. This app is really fun though!

title: Great tool for procrastinators
review: Having Forest has really helped me truly identify how I want to spend my time. I see exactly how much time I really need for things, what percentage of my day goes to what tasks, and how I manage my time. This helps me realize what I do to excess and what I should do more often. A very nice incentive is also being environmentally friendly, planting trees through your hard work being productive. A very fulfilling app. :)

title: Yeet
review: tbh I’m only writing this cause they promised me a a free Star coral unlock but I do genuinely enjoy this app and it has helped me concentrate. Like,, the temptation to answer texts and browse my feed is strong but the sadness I feel when I kill a digital tree is stronger cause my empathy levels are way higher than they should be oof. Anyways good app, works for me but if you have no qualms with murdering digital plantlife in order to secure your dosage of memes then maybe it’s not 4 u

title: Cute method for productivity
review: Its a fun way to unplug from your phone (I only use the app not the chrome add on). Its a simple way to be mindful when you want to use your phone less or focus on a project./task. I could see this helping folks looking to reduce phone usage in a number of settings - even just socially. I am motivated to get more tree types but you have to buy into the concept for this (or anything in life) to work well.

title: Great Study Tool
review: I’ve been using this app primarily for my study prep for the LSAT. It’s cool to see the forest but the thing that makes me happiest is seeing the total time focused. The app also uses graphs to break down your study time so you can see how you do a monthly, weekly, and daily basis. Highly recommend. I just planted my first real tree. Side note, but, I also got my girlfriend hooked on it and it’s a fun little competition tool between friends.

title: If you love little rewards, this will help you focus.
review: I love using my Forest app when I’m writing/making music and want to keep myself in the zone. Also when I’m cleaning, I put the timer on, work for that amount of time, take a break, and in the end you end up planting a little tree. I’m a person that loves any kind of achievement, no matter how small. So seeing my little forest get fuller as the days go by makes my heart happy!

title: 📝Worth It🌱
review: I had a hard time focusing on my work and I always got distracted by my phone. This app helped me stay away from my phone, study better, and even relax better. I listen to the sound effects it has to offer and it helps me focus on what I want to accomplish. I recommend it to those who need something to get them in the “zone.” Also, I think it’s nice how they want to give back to the Earth too.💚🌎💙

title: Really useful app
review: I use it while I’m studying. I can set a time limit for my homework and really concentrate on it during that time instead of feeling like I have never ending homework 😅   Multiple times I’ve gotten messages while I’m working and I don’t want to kill my tree because you earn points by making full grown trees to pay for new cool/pretty trees! So I’m a big fan. The only downside is forgetting to plant my tree sometimes

title: Extremely useful
review: love this app! I am always on my phone and I’ve been trying to reduce my screen time, I've tried using the screen time on my phone doesn't work because I just type the password and I can use whatever app I want. But with this app, I set it for however much time and I'm tempted to check my phone but I stop myself (I don't wanna kill the plant) it really has helped me a lot! Extreme recommend!

title: Great time managing app!
review: Forest is a great way to help me manage my time and has helped me keep track of homework, studying and what I spend my time on. I try to plant a tree as much as possible and it is very rewarding to see my forest grow as I plant and unlock new trees. I would definitely recommend this app to fellow students or anyone who needs to take a minute from their devices, or just to keep track of what they do and for how long.

title: Saves me so much time by preventing procrastinating
review: Whenever I sit down to do homework I am always tempted to look at my phone, and I fall into the trap of saying “just five more minutes and then I will start.” By locking myself out of my phone this doesn’t happen and I get my homework done a lot faster. I just wish there was an option to take a break because it is hard to go for more than an hour nonstop.

title: must have !
review: this is one of the best apps i have ever used. i was skeptical when i paid the upfront cost, because i heard about it from a friend and it didn’t look like it would work for me. however, after i bought it, i loved it! it takes a while to get into it in my opinion, and i didn’t use it for a while. but now, i use it every single day! i love the different designs and plants they offer, they’re so cute and it is pretty rewarding when you get a new plant and see your garden fill up. i think it’s even more amazing that they give you the chance to plant a tree in the real world! it is quite expensive in coins, but it’s worth it. i’m saving up to plant my first (real) tree and i can’t wait. thank you for making this beautiful app

title: Amazing App and so much potential
review: I love that you have to really focus on your work for you to be able to have new trees. And also love that we can do sessions with friends. But i will love to se more analysis on the amount of hours i focus ( for examples analysis per tags of the amount of hours i do )... and also i will love to be able to friend request easily :) but overall its amazing. But most of all i will love for this app to reach its full capacity :)

title: Does what it says on the tin
review:
You grow trees and bushes for not looking at your phone. I like the more “complex” trees for longer time periods and that you can turn on a setting to get coins even after your preplanned time period runs out. It doesn’t block notifications, which I appreciate. 

I wish there were somewhat better faqs or at least a way to figure out why it planted four dead trees for one failed session.

title: My Time Spent Off My Phone Has Increased Incredulously
review: This app is particularly phenomenal at keeping you off your phone, as the risk of killing a tree you have spent time growing overshadows the drive to use your device. For me, I have an added incentive to grow trees in order to save up and purchase the “Grow A Real Tree” option. 2$ may seem like a lot at first, but after owning the app for a month now I could see myself paying more for it.

title: ADHD hero....well as much as it can be
review: Seriously, my impulse control is bad. I use this and pocket. This is my favorite though. It’s sad how much I don’t want to kill a digital tree. But when my impulsively really takes over I will kill that thing! I like that it’s easy to use. And it actually helps. Pocket is alright but I only really use it to track my distractions while driving. This one for work and homework. Pocket for driving. Still need more help lol

title: Worth it!!
review: I usually don’t write reviews for apps, but this one is phenomenal. It allows me to take time off of my phone and social media to get work done. It has so many options and allows you to save the coins you get from growing trees to get cuter trees! I definitely recommend spending the $2.00 to get this app, especially if you are trying to get good grades or trying to spend less time in front of a screen.

title: The solution I need to my inability to get things done be focused and block out my time.
review: Love this app makes me Pavlovs dog. Its an AMAZING idea and well executed. Was the perfect solution to my inability to focus and manage my time. Such a easy to use interface that gets straight to the point. This has gamified my time allotment. Who knew taking advantage of psychology with tech in such a way would work wonders.

title: Not so great.
review: I really want to like this app. but I’m disappointed by its model. I appreciate that an app. that does not run ads. must make money another way, but it’s so annoying that you only start with one tree and to get other trees you must either spend money or wait to build up coins. Side note: for 50 minutes of tree building, you only get 14 coins, so it will take a while to have enough coins to get other trees. I can’t believe I’m actually ranting about my digital forest, but here we are. This app. is not worth it and I suggest other methods of trying to stay focused and away from your phone.
developerResponse: {'id': 3280926, 'body': 'Hello, the default tree is always free to plant. The only thing that would cost coins is new tress species (to decorate your forest). In addition, unlocking achievements can be a good way to earn coins! -Forest', 'modified': '2018-04-27T09:42:32Z'}

title: Cool idea
review: It's a great idea. Build your illusionary forest and have a chance to grow an actual tree. My only two complaints, you have to set a timer for a certain amount of time and it counts down. I actually get distracted thinking about how much time passed and curious how my tree is growing. Instead, they should have a timer running, counting how much time you spent looking away from your phone and rewarding from there. Also, the amount of the points you need to accumulate to plant an actual tree is a bit disheartening i.e. A lot. Otherwise, it's a good idea!
developerResponse:
{'id': 1760120, 'body': 'Hello,
Since the cost of planting real trees is donated by us, we have to limit the amount of real trees every user can plant otherwise we will be running out of budget soon and forced to halt the tree-planting campaign.

Recently we are planning to release a subscription which let users plant up to 5 real trees each month with the price $0.99 per month. Also, during the subscription, the contents needed to be unlocked with coins will be all unlocked. Would you be interested in this subscription?

Moreover, we are in fact considering adding a feature in which users could choose to count running time rather than having a count down.

Thanks for contacting us :)', 'modified': '2017-11-15T14:24:07Z'}

title: life saving !
review: balancing college and work before this app made it difficult to keep my grades up in certain classes due to failure of being able to manage my time. however, thanks to this app, i feel like i can juggle college and work while still being able to give myself free time. i really love the option to swap between a timer and stopwatch, which both have limitations so you don’t overwork yourself! with the breaks and timed studies, i was able to finish my rough draft within a day before it was due! i feel like i can handle all aspects of my life now. this app is definitely worth the $3 and is such a life saver for anyone struggling with managing their time better :)

title: LOVE
review: the only thing i would say is a better way to look at your forest. for example being able to look at your forest without the graphs at the bottom and be able to turn the view around. Also i’d like the ability to pick where i want the plants to be planted. is their a reason they are placed where they get placed?

title: Concentration
review: This app has helped me set goals to focus for longer periods of time: with work, while working out, while interacting with friends, or even when watching a movie. I’ve been more productive at work and more mindful of the frequency that I pick up my phone. Trying hard this year to retrain my mind and be less distracted by my phone. Forest is helping.

title: Needs more animation
review: I feel like more could be done to make it a cooler experience other than just keeping up with your tile management using simple pictures. Something simple like the trees could have more animation, trees could have some touch interaction outside of the timers, could use the phones gyroscope for some trees and have a toggle to turn it off if you’re concerned about battery etc. otherwise it’s good

title: Makes Pomodoro fun and social
review: It’s a fun app, I like the feeling of collaborating with friends while actually doing my own job. It could be more user friendly though, it’s not very easy to find how to keep working in the same study room with friends. I would also love a computer app so that I don’t have to look at my phone, which is itself a distraction.

title: Great for Helping Me Focus
review:
I am a writer and I can’t tell you how many times I have found myself completely off project. Normally because I have been distracted by my phone.
Forrest has helped be reduce that by giving me a simple, fun and encouraging way to block my phone’s ability to distract me.
I highly recommend it to anyone looking to spend less time on their phone and more time focus on what matters to them.

title: Cute!
review: Forest is such a cute app, I love building my own little virtual backyard. There’s a “buy” option where you can get different tree and bush species with coins given every time you successfully go without using your phone. So you’re rewarded for doing what you’re supposed to be in the first place! I love it. They’ve even added an option where you can exit the app without repercussions, which is good for someone like me that needs to change music constantly.

title: First Day Success
review: I recently just got this app after it was recommended by a YouTuber who was top of his class at Cambridge University (med school). I am already seeing results in productivity. I like the concept of having a tree grow because it holds me accountable to work within the time slot i gave myself and not deviate from it. I suggest trying a free version first if you don’t believe me, but this app is awesome and I can’t wait to reap its long term benefits.

title: Props & Praise
review: This has single-handedly been the smartest investment of app space in a long time. It’s also been a long time coming. I always struggle with being in and on my phone too much. This app has revolutionized the way I interact with my phone and the world. Less and more respectfully. The reward of planting trees in a garden you care for by optimizing your IRL time is fantastic. Highly recommended to anyone looking to up their productivity game.

title: A couple stuff that might make the app even better
review: If I was able to see how much time I spent on each task daily that would be awesome and I think it would make the app tons better. It currently just splits it up into percentages but calculating total time for the day and week would be great. Example, I’m a student and I would like to know how much I’m spending on each subject, other than that. Phenomenal app.

title: Actually helps!
review: It actually helps me stay off my phone to do homework??? Bc i want to earn coins and make forests i stay off my phone even though there no real life consequences i convince myself there are to finish stuff. Wish there were more kinds of trees and flowers. I also like how u can still read a quick text to make sure its not an emergency then go back to the app and u dont lose anything.

title: Excellent for encouraging me to focus
review: A lot of times I find myself checking my phone Just Because. I have things to do, or people to be with, but I feel that obligation from habit to check an email or text or social media. This app is a gentle smack on the hand when I lift my phone to put it down and stay present. I use it at work, at dinners, and when working at home on my side hustle. It’s a cute and sustainable way to do good.

title: Worth it
review: It’s interesting to see in overview of the month and how many times you fail and how many times you succeeded. Many have asked for the feature of having the ability to use one app while this is on. I agree they should have a mode where I can have my word doc Open on my iPad Pro and if I attempt to leave or open another app take away the reward. Just a suggestion. Overall it’s all right, simple, effective and user friendly.

title: This app is fantastic
review: Hi! I would just like you to know this app is fantastic for studying! In the day and life of a nursing student it can get distracting to try to study. Yet, with this app is becomes easy and fun. I always love going back and seeing how many trees I’ve planted and it pushes me to try to plant even more. If you are a student who strives to focus but gets distracted this app is for you. I promise you it becomes amazing in a year how many little trees you planted.

title: Perfect for students and writers (and anyone else!)
review: I’m a graduate student and an author, and this app is the only way I get anything done. I have a hard time focusing, and my phone is a huge distraction for me (though I love/need to use it a lot!).Forest is the perfect timer, and keeps me on track. I’m saving up to plant a real tree too. I’ve recommended this app to pretty much everyone I know, and I’d totally recommend it to anyone struggling with time management.

title: Helping me focus on Day 1!
review:
This app has helped me to stay focused. Several times I get distracted and pick up my phone to text somebody by subconscious reflex but then i realize I have my forest timer going and then i quickly get back on task. 

I want to unlock some of the pretty trees like the bonsai tree/ weeping willow so I will be using this app every time I have a homework assignment! Thank you :)

title: One Change Needed/一个小改进
review:
我和朋友一起用这个软件学习，非常爱！但是有个小功能希望能改进一下，朋友进入房间后没有语音提示，我和她经常互等，如果朋友进入房间后，有个语音提示，我开始种植后有个语音提示，那我们就不需要提示候在手机边上等对方了……
My friend and I have been using this app, we loved it. But one little tool function needed, there is no audio notification on room entry of a study friend and on start of study session by the host, my friend and I ended up waiting for each other by the phone, and can’t do anything else, wasted our time.

title: Switches Radio to Carplay!
review: Forest is great for focus, but there's a really odd bug that shows up if you leave it open when you plug your phone into your car. If Forest is either counting down OR has the "Your tree has grown!" notification up, it will cause your Carplay-enabled vehicle to switch from whatever source it's currently using to Carplay every 30 seconds or so (at least with Subaru). Other than this, the app is excellent.

title: $2 TO CREATE HEALTHY, PRODUCTIVE HABITS
review: This app is the only thing that gets me focused on my career and professional goals. Having to put the phone down is so hard given that social media and other apps can be so addicting. This app helps me challenge myself and the trees (virtual or real) feel really rewarding. Anyone who struggles with screen time and is seriously committed to their future goals should get this app.

title: Genius
review: This is great for motivating me to stay on task and taking me time away from my phone. I’m trying to build better habits and improve my mental health and this app is a genius idea; I need to treat and be easier on myself, so growing a virtual forest whose growth is dependent upon me staying on track and maintaining my goals, gives me a sense of responsibility, and something I can be proud of myself for achieving. This app is 🔥💯

title: I have ADHD and home business
review: This app is the best for my ADHD. I work from home and have set my own schedule but it’s difficult to enforce when I’m constantly losing track of time and the task im supposed to be doing. Much less getting bored with said task. This app helps me stay on track while growing something beautiful. It’s helped my self esteem focus and productivity with my work!!

title: Very helpful
review: Its worth the $2, when i study or do hw this app gives me motivation to finish my work! I would recommend if you are a huge procrastinator like me I definitely think you should get it! Also you can plant real trees if you get enough coins which I think is great! Also for another motivation booster you can get into study rooms on discord and group study.

title: So helpful and pleasant
review: This is such a cute idea and is a fun way to get excited about focusing. Growing your forest makes you not only feel accomplished but also gives you the space away from technology to get things done! I have used this app for years and recommend it frequently to anyone who can use tools to help them stay the course.

title: Exactly what I was looking for
review: This app is exactly what I was looking for- I needed a pomodoro timer I could use on my phone or computer as well as something to track where I’m spending my time and didn’t want to have multiple apps or programs to do this one task. The chrome extension syncs perfectly and the app works great. The trees are a cute and fun bonus! Well worth the $2!

title: Great app for focusing
review:
i have a really hard time focusing on my stuff. from stuff like school work to watching movies, all cause i am constantly destructed by my phone. but this app has helped me a lot. these tiny virtual trees mean so much to me, it’s not even funny. like i’ll feel the immense urge to use my phone but i’m like, “oh no, my bamboo. “ and i feel guilty if i let them wither, so i have to follow with me he timer. 

absolutely wonderful.

title: GREAT APP
review: this is such a great app for helping to stay motivated and on task- especially with the start on doing school at home because of COVID-19. this app is definitely worth the cheap price. there’s is an option to turn on “strict mode” which kills the plant if you even exit the app which helps limit distractions on your device. love this app and love how i am able to track my progress and total study minutes as well! :)

title: Motivates focus by offering rewards
review: I really like this app! I love plants and gardening, and I am the kind of person that does best when I can visually see my progress and accomplishments when working. This app provides a fun and effective way to do just that. It is also nice because it lets you work and build up towards different tree species and even plant a tree in the real world after making enough progress!

title: Very Useful
review: This is a great tool for students. Especially if they have trouble with focusing, time management, or phone distraction. I personally struggle with all three! However, in the short time I have used this app it has helped my study habits immensely! I’m not going to say that this works for everyone because everyone is different. Even so, I think this is a great way to improve study habits, and time management!

title: WORKS SO WELL
review: This app has allowed me to get things done so much easier! I haven’t been procrastinating at all. When I’m studying or cleaning up, I can work for a while then take a break with forest. It has working timers and break timers that allow me to only spend a little bit of time resting. I really recommend this app to procrastinators and people who have a hard time getting things done without getting distracted.

title: some bugs, but otherwise great motivation
review: this app helps me motivate, as collecting all the trees and all the achievements has quickly become one of my major goals. i love certain features, such as the messages you can display while planting a tree, and the cute aesthetic display. the leaderboard is a great feature as well, since it motivates me to compete with my friends. however, there are bugs—i can't really plant group trees, as they either always close out, or the timer starts at a different time than the one i chose. customer service is good but spotty. helpers will reply rather quickly, but more often than not, the issue will not be fixed. if these bugs and glitches were fixed, this would be a perfect app!

title: Perfect Study App
review: Love this little app!  Cute and easy to use.  I love that you can use your points for a charity.  The only thing, the cost of buying new trees goes up each time you buy until it reaches 1000 points per tree, and it is extremely difficult to earn that many points as you earn very little when planting.  I wish they would either lower the cost or up the amount of coins earned.  Otherwise, a great app!  I use it almost every time I study.

title: Best focus forest app
review: Although flora let’s you interact with friends on Facebook, I very much prefer forest over flora. First off, forest was the first focus app on the market and has improved a lot. Also I love the personalization of your trees (flora doesn’t do that) and I love how we can plant real life trees. I’ve researched the organization they partner with and I love how I give back just by studying. It makes me feel good afterwards and motivates me to dedicate more hours of studying

title: Essential to my senior year
review: As a graduating senior, this app was absolutely essential to my success this semester. With a busy schedule of classes, thesis writing, interning, and working full time, any time I sit down to work, it has to be dedicated and focused. This app helped me to achieve that level of focus unlike anything else. A 25 minute timer is my go-to, and the small reward of completing that goal and growing a cute little forest is the best. I recommend it to anyone!

title: My Most Used and Useful App
review: This app is the best thing I have ever bought. It has helped my phone usage go down immensely. I get more work done and have much more productive days. I used to have a bad habit of using my phone in social situations as a crutch but now I hardly even think to use it. There is something so satisfying about seeing that full forest on your phone. I recommend to anyone looking to improve focusing skills!

title: Awesome, first timer/pomodoro replacement to help me
review:
This is a very well considered motivation tool.  It allows you to create in a rewarding way rather than simply mark time. It also uses procrastinators’ sense of responsibility to *another* organism since “self” preservation doesn’t always help us focus.
Also, so adorable!!!!

FYI, don’t miss the FAQ—especially if you’re the type who like to know all the rules first. Otherwise the app is fairly intuitive.

title: Love!
