review: I love this app with keeping me off of my phone at work, which I have the tendency to waste my time on. The trees are a nice way of making me want to stay off, just because I don’t want all my hard growing time to go to waste. This is more beneficial to me- a person who has her phone in her hand 24/7, but I can see how it might not work for others who just need it for study or work sessions. Worth a try anyways!

title: Forest for Mac?
review:
Great app, I use it all the time, and it’s the only focus-app I’ve found that actually works for me. Worth the money. 
I know there’s a Windows 10 version available, but having a Mac version of Forest would be awesome. Not sure if it’s in the works or not, but as a college student that writes my papers on my computer, I often struggle with distractions from laptop. 
Thanks!

title: productivity!
review: This app helps me stay focused so much and before I started using it I never realized how much I would pick up my phone just to check the time then try to use it, but even just seeing the app open makes me realize I need to put it down and get back to work and it’s done wonders for me so far! Probably some of the best money Ive ever spent

title: Chrome extension: the opposite of productive
review:
If you have online tasks in progress when you add the extension to Chrome and activate it, all of them will be suddenly unavailable... Even if you specifically make them ALLOWED sites! I guess I missed the memo. Was I supposed to start from 'not doing anything'?
I clicked 'give up' to stop the 'growing a tree' function, but it persisted. The only way to use task manager to make it go away was to shut down everything online I was already working on before this boondoggle began. That isn't productive.
developerResponse: {'id': 25770654, 'body': 'Hi, sorry for the inconvenience. Please make sure all links have been added to the allow lists. Since the Chrome extension relies on the links to decide whether to block it or not, if you only allow the home page of the website, all the other pages will still be blocked. For the persisting window problem, please provide a screenshot via the in-app feedback system so that we can further investigate the problem. Thank you!', 'modified': '2021-10-19T12:42:25Z'}

title: Helps with my adhd
review:
It encourages me to put my phone down and it stops me from checking my phone because I don’t want the little tree to stop growing. 
Gives a good dopamine boost when my cute little tree is done, plus seeing multiple trees reminds me of my accomplishments, which really helps during those times where I feel I’m not getting enough done

title: Almost perfect!
review:
I love this app and I want to use it more. My personal issue is that I have trouble getting motivated to open it and use it. With that said, my only tweaks would be adding shortcuts. That way, like if I want to automate starting a planting session at a certain time, I can do that easily. 

Also, for us iPad users, having landscape mode would be so much more convenient! 

That is all and keep up the good work!
developerResponse: {'id': 24239883, 'body': 'Hi,\nthank you so much for your feedback and suggestions! We will relay them to our team. Stay tuned for our future updates! :)', 'modified': '2021-08-01T12:05:49Z'}

title: This app is great!
review: This app is amazing for school work. It really does keep me focused and help me stay on track. If I get a text I immediately want to go and check it but I don’t want my tree to die, so I wait and continue studying and check it after my time is done. Plus, they are a great company due to the actual work they do to help the earth. I really can’t wait until I have enough credits to help plant a real tree!

title: Love love love this app
review: The visual of planting seeds with my time is really tangible. I’m now tracking so many things in my day including transition time from one activity to another- an area where I tend to get terribly distracted. My ONLY complaint is that I’d like more tree options. Eventually I want a different type of plant to track with different activities. The type and style of plants/ trees is pretty limited. Thanks for a great product. A game changer

title: Good Time Management Tool
review: The only thing about this I would change is a glitch that seems to allow you to leave the app without immediately killing the tree (too much temptation to peak a another open browsing session during a study marathon) but overall beautiful design and I love that it breaks down the amount of time I spend studying different subjects so I know what subjects need more of my time in the future. 10/10 would recommend.

title: Amazing app!
review: This app has helped me be focused on tasks throughout the day. Things as small as reading a book to things like reorganizing my room. It has motivated me 10x more to complete the tasks I have waited on doing or just procrastinated by scrolling aimlessly through my phone. I love everything about this app! Even though the purchase price is $2, I think it is totally worth it for anyone considering the purchase.

title: Really helps me focus
review: Ever since I downloaded this app, it has really helped me be more conscious of my studying and really focus on my work. When you see the little tree growing, it makes me want to keep going and knowing that if I press stop or switch over to another app “kills” the tree makes me want to complete my full time. I really love this app and definitely recommend to anyone looking a for a cute, fun focus app!! :)

title: Really fun
review: I like this app! It has been really effective tool to help me study and there’s so many things you can do. You can even plant real trees! My only real complaint is that there are achievements for acquiring friends but there is no real way to interact with users or find people on this app other than to see the top users. It they implemented this feature this would really help users to study together

title: Morivational App
review: Cool app, love the concept but i was thinking if there was a way to limit time ON your phone as far as phone usage. Say you only want to spend 15 minutes on your phone instead of going over-time and end up spending hours! We set a time and when it is up we get a reminder to get off our phones and go back to studying! would love to see a feature like that

title: just one thing
review: The only thing that could make this app better is ha ing a “stopwatch” option — where you just click start and it just counts until you hit stop and plants a tree based on how much time you spent (but of course still dying if you leave). sometimes i forget to set the timer, but i get more in the zone when im just working. stopping when the timer goes off kind of disrupts my flow.
developerResponse: {'id': 2567277, 'body': 'Hello, we have taken your suggestion into consideration. Thank you for the feedback! Forest', 'modified': '2018-02-13T03:05:34Z'}

title: A pocket version of gold stars — that plants trees!
review:
Like many people, I find it easier to stay on track if I have a tiny (no matter how tiny) reward for doing it. This app hits that sweet spot. And I get to plant real trees. 

Do wish it had slightly more advanced analytics so I could analyze my work habits by type a little more easily, but that would be above and beyond what the app promises.

title: Busy mum
review: I have been needing help with staying focused. I have ADD/ADHD and it’s always hard to stay on whatever I have to do when I have 4 Girls from 25,14(twins)&10 with our house being the hang out house. It’s always a nightmare to keep myself from just giving up and grabbing my phone. So far today I have planted 2 trees so let’s see if I can. The only thing is you have to set it all up and it won’t just start it’s self.

title: Background noise
review: I bought his app a while ago but it’s only recently I’ve been using it and trying to use it more. Forest is a wonderful app which has helped me not only study but also rest. I recommend setting up and timer along with the forest sounds in the background and turning on your favorite Lofi playlist! It really help (*^^*)!!

title: Great solution to an old problem.
review: I think that by gaming focus for virtual rewards it provides an immediate feedback loop that I can use to leverage against the more long term results of the continued efforts that success in my field takes. Great app if used correctly and I think the only way it could be better is if they sent you something like a mug for being an accomplished user over the course of a year.

title: Great for students
review:
I was going to write something else, but where’s the lie? Why reinvent the wheel? I’ve got a test to study for.

I’ve been using this app for years and it’s so incredibly helpful to help keep me focused on school work but also to be able to track my study time each day. I keep coming back to this app because it is so helpful.

title: I LOVE THIS
review: I just think this is such a great idea! This helped me focus and not procrastinate so I could grow my forest. A couple thoughts, maybe you can make trees?? So for some coins, you can get different seeds or something like that, and like for example, if I have a weeping willow seed and a love tree seed, I can make a weeping willow love tree? So you can breed the different trees? I don’t know, just an idea. Anyways I love this app!!

title: Delightful Focusing Method
review: After going through a few months of unemployment, I was having trouble getting back into the groove of my new job. My attention span felt shot and I struggled to focus. This tool has been helping me build some of that mental fortitude again. The promise of little trees in my forest is enough of an external motivator to get me on track again. A lovely little tool.

title: Absolutely love this app!
review: I was looking for something to keep me focused and off my phone while I did homework and college applications, this was a godsend, the plants keep me motivated and the deep focus mode keeps me from using my phone. Also if you wanna study with friends you Can do the shared mode and connect with friends. It’s really useful and I use it daily! It’s helped for sure overall with my productivity!

title: A Welcome Surprise
review: Forest ended up being surprisingly helpful for my studying needs! It allows me to keep up with how long I’ve studied and helps with my accountability for the time I SHOULD be studying. I love that I can visually see how hard I’ve worked for classes and it makes me happy to see it in both numerical and natural form (I love my little forest!). This may not be for everyone, but there’s no reason to NOT give it a shot!

title: Plant Together feature is the best!
review: I normally study by myself because I get distracted easily (wanting to talk to friends) and I like to move around a lot; but with plant together, I can get work done and feel accomplished together with my friends because we’re all accountable for keeping these cute plants alive! It’s also really convenient because everyone can study in their own comfortable study spaces.

title: So Good
review:
This app is so pure. I use it to make sure I’m taking breaks from my phone and I’ve been getting so much more done. I even set it an hour for each class I sit in so I’m growing these cute virtual forests while being mentally present in class. 
What made me give this app five stars is that the coins you earn taking breaks from your phone, can then be used towards planting an actual tree in the world. I love this app 100%

title: Great app for studying
review: If you really need to stay focused while studying and not look at your phone, then use this app! I personally find it fun to grow my own forest as well as have a dedicated amount of time of focused study. It’s been really helping me not get distracted from what I’m doing. I’ve also used this app while working on novels, and it’s kind of like a fun game to play to see how focused you can be on the task at hand.

title: Best App Ever!!!!
review: This app is no joke!!! Not only does this app keep you focused, but gives you a chance to help a real life organization with no out of pocket expenses. It helps you stay focused by planting a tree and if you exit the app it will die. You can create a list with the labels to make sure you get everything you need to do done. I would recommend this app to anyone who is looking for a new way to be more productive.

title: It’s a great tool for prioritization.
review: As a college student there are many points in my academic career we’re that extra 2 hours or so can make a big impact in getting a higher grade. Through the use of this app, I can 100% assert that those two extra hours needed will not be wasted thanks to the satisfaction that prioritizing my academic goals also brings to life a tree that is ultimately a testament that signifies my goals as a student.

title: Best $2 I’ve Ever Spent
review: It was between Starbucks and this, I chose the second and I’ve gained so much time. There’s something about not wanting to your tree to die/wanting to fill up your forest and wanting to start the timer as much as possible to plant real trees that gets me. I’m off of my phone and experiencing life that much more. I have time to do things now.. like enjoy a slow evening with my family where I’m PRESENT. 💗

title: Love!!!
review: I albsolutely love this app and it’s definitely worth the money I payed for it a couple years ago. It helps me stay focused because i can’t use my phone when it’s going. I also love that you can plant a real tree just by being productive. The only thing i would like to see added is the ability to see the time you’ve spent on a certain tag, not just the percentage of time you’ve spent on it.

title: Pretty Useful
review:
It’s a pretty useful app, great for motivating you to stay off screen and do work. 

Shame they don’t let you use a whitelist of apps if you need to do work on your device. Also, it would be nice if the in the store, you could see a kind of grid view of all the items you could get, instead of having to swipe through them all to get to the one you like. 

Overall, the user interface is intuitive and clean. Worth it.

title: Amazing!
review: as a young student, like myself, it can be hard to focus and not procrastinate. with this app, it takes care of that and helps the earth by planting real trees. trust me whoever is reading this, no i am not some bot or someone from this company. i am a real user of this app and it is worth your money. it would be nice to have the option to go into certain apps like calculator or calendar, but otherwise this app is life changing!!

title: Amazing App
review: Not only I more productive but the added benefit of working towards making real change by planting a tree is huge! With other focus apps I use I had no incentive but with this I feel obligated to remain true to my timer. I have had the app for a week and I study (medical student) 5-7 hours a day. I have only broken my focus once (keep in mind I only do 30-40 study intervals) Definitely recommend!

title: Great app for school
review: This app is great I am an high schooler and recommended this to everyone. Just to let u know the free one I almost bought but then read if ur tree dies u pay 5 buys to plant a knee one but on this one u het enough coins u can plant a real tree. And also I think they should make there coins a little easer to get because if u want to buy a tree that’s like 2500 but for ten minutes u get 5 but other than that love the game and the music.
developerResponse: {'id': 5382388, 'body': 'Hi,\nWe will consider modifying the formula of earning coins in future updates. Currently, you can earn extra rewards by unlocking achievements! Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions or suggestions! :) Forest', 'modified': '2018-10-06T15:51:24Z'}

title: SUPER HELPFUL!
review: I have found this app to be super helpful in my school studies. It helps me to be productive during study time and not be on my phone. You leave the app, the tree dies. It sounds dumb but, it’s really great motivation to stay focused for the time that you need to be and then be able to take a break with a feeling of freedom and not the weight of all your work still on your shoulders. I would definitely recommend, this app.

title: Just what I was looking for
review: This app really helped me regain and train the ability to focus on a singular task. It’s been great to use when I know I need to devote time to one task, I’ll get distracted if not for setting the timer and building some trees. The great thing is that overtime and regular use of it, I find that I’m able to better focus without it too. It literally has helped me regain the ability to focus. To hone a skill that I had lost.

title: This app is not for me
review: This app is meant to be, maybe a positive reward system by seeing your tree grow, but for me, it is negative reinforcement, by watching my tree die. If you “make a mistake” aka, getting a phone call or message from work, you get penalized. Yes there is a setting where you can allow for things like important texts, but then it’s a gamble..you may or may not need to step away from the app yet you are forfeiting rewards you could earn. I don’t want to use the app at all bc I don’t want to be responsible for killing one of my trees. I’m sure this app works for some people though.
developerResponse: {'id': 2844168, 'body': 'Hello, we will put more thought on our choice of words. Thank you for the feedback. Forest', 'modified': '2018-03-16T09:53:21Z'}

title: Excellent
review:
This app has really helped me improve my focus and quality of the work I need to do. The new update that helps track how much time spent on each tag is also really helpful as it helps me track how I divide my time between tasks. I really recommend this if you always get distracted by social media/the Internet/etc. :)
Literally have been using for two+ years now, 100% worth it

title: Best app for focus
review: I have tried many things to reduce my general phone use, this is by far the best app I e come across for that. Having the challenge of watching your Forest grow greatly reduces the urge to pick up the phone as you have an actual visual representation of your progress being stunted. Plus the company gives back by planting actual trees. Win win.

title: Best app ever
review:
I am a student and i am totally obsessed with this app. This helps me a lot to focus on my studies and don’t be distracted with my phone. And it also make me super excited to study more and more everyday just to plant a real tree in real world. 

But it would be even better if we could buy jems for limited edition tree types with that coins that we earn by being focused.

title: Sometimes my trees just died for no reason
review: I really like this app and it has made me very productive. But sometimes my trees died after I work for a while. I might check some messages while I’m in the app, but I didn’t switch app. I just read the message from the Lock Screen, but when I unlock my phone my trees all died. And I was on the app the entire time. I had to restart the timer and delete the dead trees. Please try to fix this bug. Thank you so much.
developerResponse: {'id': 22046691, 'body': 'Hi, sorry for the inconvenience. Please contact us via our in-app feedback system for us to assist you further. Please provide details (for example, screenshots or videos) of the problem if you can.\nTo visit our in-app feedback system, please go to Settings, enter our FAQ, tap on the top-right icon and go to "contact us". Thank you. - Forest', 'modified': '2021-04-05T09:27:40Z'}

title: I love this app
review: I use this app everyday to track how much I study for each subject. I thought it was awesome, until they released the stopwatch update— now I think it’s BEYOND AWESOME! I appreciate not having the background sound (café noises, forest noise) automatically shut off when the timer ends—I get completely immersed in studying and the timer stopping is no longer a distraction. 😁

title: I love this app
review: This app has been tremendously helpful in reducing my screen time and increasing my focus. It provides a fun incentive to stay off of your phone and is also cooperative so you can enjoy focusing with you friends. Highly recommend if your looking to spend a little less time on your phone and a little more time in the real world.

title: it helps to motivate me!
review:
I usually prefer having a deadline of some kind to push me to complete work, but this helps me out with tasks that don’t really have any deadlines.

I feel more motivated to grow my forest and earn more coins to unlock other plants. I really like that most of the plants can be unlocked with time spent well, rather than just money.

title: Discipline
review: As someone who has battled with Inattention and hyperactivity for most of my life, I am so grateful to have found a new way to challenge the “doddling”.  Now in adulthood with a demanding career and graduate school life, not to mention adding the stress of a pandemic, I have struggled to sit down and focus on the things I’d rather not do.  This app has helped me regain some self-discipline at just the time I needed it most!

title: I really like this!
review: Forest makes it so easy to focus and be motivated to get your work done.  It’s awesome that you can customize and make your own tags, and it’s motivating to work longer to earn more trees.  There’s also this setting that if you leave the app you lose all your progress and I think that that setting is even more motivating to not give up and keep going through your study.

title: Key in my daily routine!
review: I should get a commission for how many people I’ve gotten to download this app lol. I advocate for it whenever possible because, as a medical student and millennial, it’s a good (and sometimes competitive) way to leave the phone distractions at the door. As I don’t have social media, I really like how you don’t need one of those avenues to sign up for it (unlike flora). All in all I give this a 10/10!!

title: Achievement you can see
review: The thing about Forest is it shows you a visual representation of the time you spend working. As you keep your hands off your phone and get some heads-down work done, you grow a tree, and the trees become a forest, and you see it add up. It’s very motivating. It also provides line graphs and timelines, which help me compare days and stay consistent. Definitely worth the price!

title: Amazing
review: Forest 🌳 is really helpful. I used to have trouble with homework and distractions; my phone was a big part of that. I tried make restrictions for myself but I could never live up to them. When I got forest not only did my grades go up but my self confidence because I wasn’t worried about not having an assignment done. I feel cleaner. And there are all of these beautiful trees you can unlock. Best focus app ever!!😄

title: First impressions
review: Really cool concept and not for a bad price. I have started off with low sets of time away like 15-30 minutes but I want to build up to an hour of straight studying. However, some parts of the app are a little finicking and navigating is a little weird, definitely there can be some changes to make the app easier and prettier to start and navigate through.

title: Stop procrastination & distractions!
review: I love using this app because it helps me stop mindlessly scrolling on social media, for no good reason. Living in a world full of technology & distraction, it’s easy to waste so much time when we could be spending that time being more meaningful and moving toward goals! This app just helps you take a step toward putting the phone down and being present in the real world!

title: Helps me concentrate!
review: I, like many people, spend far too much time on my phone. I have a hard time staying away from it, which can be very distracting when I’m trying to work or study. This app has been tremendously helpful! I like the rain sounds you can listen to, and also that you can still listen to music while the timer is going. Definitely recommend!

title: Great for Students
review: This app is perfect for students who can’t seem to leave their phones alone while studying. Rather than set a timer on my phone for 20 minutes, I just set my time on this app and leave my phone alone until my tree is grown. The incentive of growing trees is what makes this app so effective. I definitely recommend this for college students, or anyone who needs incentive to focus!

title: Best App for Studying!!!
review: I've used this app ever since I started college. I'm now about to graduate from my Bachelor's next summer (fingers crossed), but this app has been with me through it all. It's definitely the best way to avoid getting distracted by my phone because I never want to kill a tree!!! Just do yourself a favor and get this app to stop you from procrastinating and getting distracted. I definitely recommend :-)

title: Great productivity app!
review:
This is my favorite productivity app and my go to for when I want to get things done. It’s really cute, and I love the different plants I can grow. I get really motivated when I see all of the different trees I’ve planted in my forest for the day! 

Please continue to create new plants! 
I think it would be cute to be able to grow a koi pond or add some animals! I like how some trees give you birds if you do 60 minutes.

title: Breaking Phone Addictions
review: Great app to help disrupt the amount of time we’re glued to our phones. I know it’s helped me do more deep, focused work. It’s especially helpful if you can get friends to use the app, or join the Forest discord, findable via the Forest FB page. Those group trees, having other people counting on you to not check your phone and kill the group tree...it sounds ridiculous, but it’s surprisingly fun and effective.

title: AMAZING!!! PLEASE READ!!!
review: I use my phone for about 6-7hours a day on average. Even during the school week. I noticed that my grades were lowering so I starting looking into apps that would satisfy my need to stay off my phone and get some work done. This app was the one! I could not be more satisfied, now my average amount of hours spent on my phone has decreased to 2-3 hours and there is a significant improvement in my grades!!!

title: Good... but just a few things
review:
1) I wish trees for my forest were cheaper jut so I could get more (or at least have them not increase in price)

2) I wish you could select a few apps that you can use while planting a tree because i like to use this while practicing flute and I can’t use my metronome while it is going on

3) everything else is really great about this app and I enjoy it every much

title: A little difficult to unlock new items, but satisfying.
review: I use this app a lot to motivate myself to focus, which is hard for me because of my ADHD. I really don’t want to cause any plants to die so it keeps me off of my phone while I’m supposed to be working on something else and gives me a sense of satisfaction when I see, visually, how much I’ve been able to do what needs to be done each day. Thanks!

title: Favorite app!
review: This app is really helpful when I failed to focus no matter because of laziness or nervous. It makes your effort visible. The countdown feature make you realize how much more/less time you spent than your expectation. Really helpful to improve the efficiency. By the way, the white noise are also awesome, especially the rain sound, it can easily block out the outside noise even with normal Apple earphones.

title: Super helpful!
review: I have found the forest app to be super helpful in completing tasks in various aspects of my life. There’s something about setting a timer for a task that really settles my focus (although I’m thankful it functions as more than a timer!) It also feels encouraging to look at my trees which act as visual representations of how I invested my time that week/month. I love this app and have recommended to many others already!

title: Improve your focus!
review: I have only used this app for a couple days and I already love it. Not only because it keeps me from using my phone to procrastinate whatever it is I am doing, but also because you can actually see how much time you are giving to each task. Helps to see you have been working hard when it feels like you didn’t do much during the day.

title: Fun and motivational
review: This app is great for getting yourself to get things done in a certain time frame. It’s fun to be able to plant a tree while you’re working on a project. I use the method of working for 25 minutes, then taking a 5 minute break, then doing another 25 minutes, and so on. Bottom line, great app for keeping yourself on track and in the game.

title: UPDATE THE WATCH APP
review: I am sorry but in 2022 it makes no sense that you can still not start a timer from the Apple Watch app. Especially since this is supposed to be a way to limit distractions while you’re working on stuff. It seems incredibly simple to integrate you don’t even have to put the trees up there just to allow people to start timers on the app and the trees can go on the phone when it’s done or whatever way you want to do it but it’s ridiculous that you cannot start a freaking timer on the watch app the only thing you can do is view it.
developerResponse: {'id': 21901702, 'body': 'Hi,\nCurrently you cannot start a planting session from your watch because we cannot sync the planting progress on phones and watches simultaneously, meaning that users could still use their phones if they started planting on their watch.\nWe will continue to work on syncing these plant sessions nevertheless. Thank you for the feedback! :)', 'modified': '2022-05-10T00:46:21Z'}

title: The Perfect Way to Stay Focused!
review: The incentive of planting trees if you stay focused is helpful enough, but this app takes it to the next level! Joining a focus group with your friends plants more trees, and if one person fails to focus, everyone fails, making you more focused to avoid killing everyone’s trees! I love this app, and I’ve gotten so much more done because of it!

title: A must have app
review: It really makes you focus more by entering Deep Mode. I easily lose focus but once I turn this on, I feel like I am working while playing game at the same time. That keeps me from touching my phone and end up getting more work done. So yessssss this is an absolute must have for anyone having problems to focus out there

title: This app is a lifesaver!
review: This app is wonderful for studying and school in general. As a college student who’s got plenty of work to do, this adorable app really helps me focus. I’ve had a bad past with procrastination, lack of motivation, and dedication to school, however this app has really helped make studying relaxing and even a bit fun! 10/10 would recommend ⭐️

title: Good App
review: This is a good app to stay focus and enter the state of flow. The only thing I wish it improved is implementing the timer on the WatchOS. I love using my Series 6 watch but sadly this app can start the time. I do hope this plan is in development. I rather use my watch on this app to start my study session without using my phone than to use my watch just to look at what I planted, which is usually just 1-3 plants.

title: Love the app, but it’s inconsistent sometimes
review: This app has definitely helped improve my focus and get work done, but I’ve found the “deep focus” setting to be pretty inconsistent. I still check notifications on my notification screen in case I get an important text from my boss or colleague. Most of the time, this doesn’t affect deep focus, but sometimes it does. Just wish it was a little more consistent

title: Amazing help with online classes
review: This app is absolutely amazing. As a person who easily gets distracted by their phone in online classes I can easily set a timer with a tag for school on deep focus mode and it helps me not get distracted. It also is very satisfying when you have a forest filled with almost no dead trees. Definitely would recommend to a friend

title: Great for putting your phone down
review: This is a great incentive for putting your phone down. It gives you the option to listen to music while leaving your phone on the app. Does not kill much of my battery! Also I let my phone sleep, and when I open it again it still counts down. Absolutely love this app.

title: Useful app, one criticism
review: It’s been useful using forest to help me stay focused on work for set amounts of time, my only criticism is that it needs a good sound effect for once you finish with your focus session. It often finishes without me knowing and I then am missing out on starting it over to earn more trees. If they do add that feature they should allow for sound customization like they have with the custom phrases.

title: Keeps me accountable
review: As a student in the tech age you have a million notifications coming at you from social media, texts and calls all the time that continually distract me. Forest allows me to keep my phone out of my hand while studying especially being at home learning. I would like a timer though to notify me when I’m done.

title: Helps me focus in quarantine!
review: I love this app!! I’ve been losing focus in quarantine a lot lately but this really helps me stay on track. I don’t even tend to play on my phone a ton, but just knowing that I have a set time to focus and seeing how much work I’ve gotten done has made my work days much less daunting! Definitely recommend this, especially if you’re working from home.

title: Productive
review: As someone who’s constantly checking her phone while studying, this app has helped me be more productive in my studies gearing my attention away so my trees could grow! I use it almost every time I’m working on assignments and once the time is up, I know I can take a small break before restarting the timer & continuing notes. I love the aesthetics of the app, and think it’s a worth purchase! :)

title: Fantastic! But here’s an idea.
review: I love this app so far, it’s already pretty helpful in managing my phone time. However, it may be more motivating if there was an extra benefit to using Deep Focus Mode (which prevents you from leaving the app if you wish to keep your tree alive). I’m thinking the amount of points you get should be more than unregulated focusing. To prevent people (such as myself 😰😳) from cheating the system).

title: I’ve never been this focused
review: Of all the other phone apps I’ve tried, this one has, hands down, been the absolute best. Not only is the idea of growing a tree cute but the way it is presented it very helpful. Whenever I click out and my tree dies, I always feel so bad. I also like that you can reply to important messages and still listen to music while still keeping your tree alive.

title: Undoubtedly Amazing
review: I'm not someone to leave reviews on apps, however this app is truly something. I have a hard time focusing on work (being as I'm 20 in college and love to stay glued to my phone), but this app has made it so easy to not want to pick it up while working. Having a goal (your tree growing) really helps keep me motivated when the assignments may be boring. I definitely recommend!

title: Exceptional App
review: I have ADHD so that means staying on task is next to impossible. This app not only helps me keep track of time, I can measure exactly how much time I’ve spent being productive by seeing a whole forest. Instead of telling my friends that I’m putting my phone down, I say that I’m going to plant a tree. Usually an explanation would follow. I really appreciate this app and I have no idea how I’d get anything done without it.

title: Good, just one little thing
review:
I just wish that there was a way to develop the white list feature on the app on iOS! There’s deep focus mode but if I’m on my iPad working on one app I wish I were able to whitelist that single app instead of disabling deep focus and basically not even needing Forest then in the first place

I love the app, it’s mission, and it’s features, and I even have it on my phone too! Just that one little thing I wish they could improve.

title: Obsessed
review: I love this app to track my studying and keep me focused. I also admire how it can lead to even bigger accomplishments like helping to plant real trees. My only suggestion would be if you could have an option to run a timer and stop it when ur done, rather than pick how long it’ll be set for ahead of time. Sometimes I don’t know how long a smaller session of studying will take and I want to accurately track my work. Otherwise, I’m just obsessed!

title: Great productivity app ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
review:
Whenever i feel addicted to my phone and can’t get anything done , i open forest and then i have plenty of time to do everything ♥️♥️♥️
I also get excited to unlock new trees 😍😍 that keep me motivated and most importantly away from my phone 😬🌚👍🏻
I’ve told all my friends about it as we all suffer from wasting time on useless stuff on phone so 
 thank you for this great app 💘💘💘

title: amazing for work!
review: I am a hardcore procrastinator, and this has helped me work well!! I love that it’s designed like a game, with little trees and rewards you can win. By the way, the trees and shrubs are really cute, and I love seeing them and working to get them. I never buy apps for money or write reviews for them, but there’s a first time for everything and this app just deserves to be used by everyone! Well worth the $2.

title: Helpful
review: This app is a really nice gentle reminder to stay focused and leave your phone alone. I especially like it in the morning to keep from getting distracted and have a better and more mindful morning routine. I’m sure I’m in the minority here, but as a biologist I was hoping for more real tree species so I could create a Forest of my favorites like tamarack, basswood, etc. in addition to the imaginary trees. otherwise I have no complaints.

title: So helpful
review: This app has helped me study so much! I was always the person who checked on their phone every other second while studying but after Forest I’ve only twice killed a tree in three months and planted about 150 trees. I never thought a virtual tree would help me study! (But one con is that everytime you buy a new tree the price of a new type of tree goes up but overall a perfect app)

title: Fun and really does help
review:
It really does help to stop picking up my phone. Somehow I care enough about my tree dying and I put the phone back down. 
I like that the times are customizable, so I can start with a low amount of time and work up. 
There are cute special things for holidays etc 
And I just realized I can set reminders, which will help me. 
I don’t use the social features but I know it has them.

title: Really Motivating!
review: I have used this app on and off for years. It has worked so well in the past and I recently began using it again as my college graduation gets close. It’s renewed a desire to be focused and get stuff done. It has helped me feel ahead of my studies instead of behind. By taking my phone away I am able to get so much more done distraction free! Truly worth the small price for this app!

title: Best app I own
review:
This app has been life changing. It is the only effective thing to control my phone use because not only does it block my phone so I can focus rather than wasting hours on social media, it is so visually pleasing as well!
My friends and I grow trees together when we visit and I wait for each new update and tree with excitement. Get this app, it will help your life and make you happy, too! 👍😊🌲

title: Awesome
review: Really enjoy using this app to track my study time and of course to stay productive and focused on my study sessions. I like that u are incentivized to not use your phone to get coins to upgrade to new trees and shrubs for your “productivity garden” it would be nice though if the cost for new trees didn’t go up when u upgrade though. All in all def recommend if you’re looking for a way to stop looking at your phone and be able to track your focus time.

title: Great way to keep being focused
review: I use this app daily and I love it. Every time I have the urge to grab my phone I remember how strong my virtual tree is growing. The last thing I would want for that tree is to kill it because of my lack of focus. In the end it’s kind of satisfying to see how your forest keeps expanding as well while at the same time doing something productive by keeping your mind out of the phone.

title: Really good, but I can’t whitelist apps
review:
I kept hearing about the ‘Whitelist Apps” feature, which is why I bought Forest, but I can’t find the whitelist feature in settings.

This is frustrating because most of my schoolwork is on the Kindle App, and anything I do on the Kindle app is highly productive for me.

This app is still helpful, but it would be orders of magnitude better if I could whitelist the Kindle app, Bible app, Prayer app, Quizlet, Language learning apps, meditation apps, the Great Courses etc.

title: Exactly what I needed
review: Just started using this and I think it is wonderful. I am the kind of person that will dart around doing 30 things at once and wonder why I didn’t get anything accomplished, or have so much on my mind that I cant just STOP and DO. I think this is exactly what I needed. This is a fun way to create a physical trigger to stay focused in the moment and also track and show ones progress.

title: Excellent app
review: This app has really helped me to tone down on how much I use my phone. Only downside (which I don’t think is the app’s fault but rather my phone’s) is that sometimes I’ll leave my phone and come back and sometime in the middle of the planned focus period the tree has died... but I was able to fix that by enabling an iPhone feature called “Guided Access” and haven’t had an issue since.

title: Great! But I have an advice
review: This App is really good. However, after planting a tree and set up the rest time, I would play the phone for a while and I always cannot return back to the app on time. I hope the developer can add a feature such like if the rest time is up but the user does come back, there will be some penalty. Through such way, I hope I can be more efficient. Thank you!
developerResponse:
{'id': 3786811, 'body': "Hello,
We'll consider implementing this feature in future updates. 
Thanks for the feedback.
Please feel free to contact us if you have further questions or suggestions. :) -Forest", 'modified': '2018-06-10T15:19:16Z'}

title: Great focus tool! Even for adults!!
review:
I’m a grown woman and have no idea why watching a virtual tree grow helps my productivity and focus, but it does!

Having the timer with a visual aid that allows me to see my progress helps me stay focused and motivated while working on projects and study sessions.

I also really appreciate the reminder to take breaks and enjoy having the option to play ambient sounds in the app as well.

As someone with ADHD tools like this seem to help me a lot with focus. Watching my trees grow and collecting coins for new ones is strangely motivating as well.

I think it’s a great app for students, adhd’ers, and anyone who could use a little help/motivation with focus.

Thanks Forest!

title: Struggle to study
review: I have always struggled to study without leaving my phone behind. Some days I need my phone for flash cards or group meet ups but don’t need it the whole time I am studying but the temptation is always there. The motivation of growing trees paired with the ability to pseudo block access to my phone makes this app wonderful!

title: simple, eco-minded, & satisfying
review: i love absolutely everything about this app except one tiny gripe regarding the cost of new plant species & the cost to buy into the “plant a real tree” initiative. i bought this app to aid/encourage me to study without as many breaks, which it has aptly achieved. but it would be much more fun if i were actually able to afford these other advertised aspects of the app. as of now i have been using the app for about a month and have still yet to earn enough to buy any high end plants - & its not like i could even if i had enough because the cost to join the “plant a real tree,” which is arguably one of the main reasons i got this app, is so astronomically high that i will likely never achieve that goal.

title: Really motivating
review: Makes studying a lot more fun! I am totally guilty of checking my phone way too much and having that eat away at my study time. This app not only allows me to time block much more effectively but the whole tree/forest concept makes it also seem like more of an accomplishment when you actually keep your focus :)

title: Works really great!
review: I’ve been have a hard time staying motivated to work, so I tried finding a website where I can self study with other people, but I don’t think such a thing has been created yet. Fortunately, I found this app which doesn’t quite keep me motivated, but it does keep me focused. I love it when the app tells you “Go back to work!” because I find it hilarious.

title: Extra motivation!
review: Loving this app! It has the extra incentive of planting actual trees, and on a smaller scale adding trees to a little virtual forest. I like that it gives me a pretty reminder to connect with the natural world, as I focus on my priorities. The virtual forest gives me a clear visual of how much focused time I am spending on things and you can use it as a time tracker as well by using tags to see exactly what you are focusing on.

title: This app really changed the way I study!
review: It might seem silly, but with all the distractions we have today with our phones, Forest has been helping me in the last 2 years with my concentration. The only thing missing is an option to select all of your friends to join a room... i have a lot of them and take a lot of time for me to choose one by one hahah

title: It’s adorable, easy to use, and motivating!
review: I tend to get easily distracted by social media apps, but this app has definitely given me incentive to stay focused by motivating me to plant more trees. The design of the app is concise and cute, and I did not have a hard time understanding the app and using it to aid me in my life. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to get away from distractions whilst studying, working, or even doing chores.

title: Could work at home without this app
review: With my classes being moved online and having to do all the work for my courses and internship from my bedroom, this app really helps me focus. Just setting 30 minutes for my to get into a work mood and not look at my phone helps me stay product and complete assignments on time. This is a necessity if you’re working from home!

title: Helps fight procrastination
review:
This app has really helped me fight procastination. That is because , these smart phones are the sole reason why people procastinate, it maybe coz you are having a chat, playing a game, on social media  , or maybe something else,forces you to sit relax and postpone the work.
The trees and plants in this app are so beautiful that you want to plant more.
In love with it right now. Will recommend to others too.

title: Beautiful color scheme & gentle accountability.
review: The tale is old as time - you glide effortlessly thru primary and make it to college without ever needing to develop actual study habits. Now that you’re there tho, procrastination does more damage than ever before. That being said, this app doesn’t exactly help you get started on your work any sooner, but it’s a pretty way to remind yourself that you have to get your task done!

title: Wow. This app is gooooooooooddd
review: I sometimes have trouble focusing on my boring homework. My mom bought me this app and I love it. I helps me focus and get my work done. I love how you can see your little virtual forest, and how you can get different plants, and how there is relaxing sounds. I really love that they REWARD you for focusing on your stuff. I can’t list everything, or this review would be like a book. To summarize, I love the app. It’s awesome.

title: Must have when it comes to focusing or studying!
review: I absolutely adore this app, it has been so helpful to me when it’s come to college. Sometimes you just need to take the option of using your phone away and this app does that in the perfect way. With the different options of plants to grow and the coins you get as rewards it makes studying fun and the app keeps it simple.

title: Beautifully designed app, works amazingly!
review:
This app is perfect for those who struggle like myself to pay attention. You find that you become very attached to your tree and it keeps you from using your phone for ANY reason (or ahem, excuse) you might have.

It also always keeps you coming back to earn coins to unlock more trees and I love that you can plant real trees using coins as well.

title: Gamified Daily Efforts
review:
Very simple but it hits just the right button to motivate. You want to build your forest, so you focus for 20 minutes here (small bush) or 30 minutes later (basic tree). You then earn credits to unlock more interesting trees. I’m looking forward to unlocking the bonsai tree! 

I enjoy looking at my days results, and the weeks forest, and month?? Only been using a few days and love it!!

title: It helps, but its the same-old thing every time
review: I use this app throughout the week to help me put down my phone and concentrate on the work I need to get done, without distraction - and it works for me.  I have been using this for weeks and I just wish I could unlock new trees and new features, I don't understand their point system at all.  I also have no idea how long it would take to plant a real tree- maybe a year or more worth of time.

title: love it!!!! helps me concentrate
review: i’m a NOTORIOUS procrastinator and i really struggle with applying myself. forest helps me stay concentrated when i need to get work done!!!! i dont want my forest to die </3. one thing that i would like to be added to the app is if we made a few apps accessible like google docs because i have some school work on there. i can see how i abuse that though so im kinda glad it isnt on there at the same time

title: favorite app!
review:
this app is aesthetically cute and that helps me with using it to stay focused. I like to complete things for its app that helps me reinforce the behavior I want. worth the money. 

seeing my statistics of my progress has been so helpful as well. I had this app on my wish list for a couple of months. so glad I decided to give it a shot. if you're on the fence about getting it, I highly recommend it.

title: Best studying app!
review:
I am a biomedical major in college and this app is amazing! I love the concept of the trees dying if you leave the app or if you answer a call/text message. It is very rewarding, and I really enjoy the aspect of being able to save my coins made from successful study sessions and purchasing a tree life tree to be planted, it’s really awesome!!

Thank you for such an amazing app! Next, I’m going to try the alarm clock app by the creators!

title: Simple, helpful and fun
review: If you just need a little push to stay off your phone this app is a fun way to help.  It does not prevent you for seeing a message pop up or the time, and you can quit anytime, but not wanting your cute tree get killed is surprisingly motivating! My kids will ask me to “grow a tree” at times like game night or in a restaurant, or I will tell my fam “I am growing a tree” when I need time to work.

title: Super simple, aesthetically pleasing and use it all the time
review: Probably one of my most used app of my phone. Its design is simple and nice to look at, and I really enjoy when they add new trees. I also like the feature that allows you to exit within ten seconds of planting your tree. It's nice that your phone is still accessible if you need it, but there's a gentle reminder to stop mindless using and checking.

title: Amazing App!!!
review: This app has helped me stay motivated to finish reading my assigned books!!!! It is a great way to have fun and feel accomplished after any task! The variety of things you can use this app for is just outstanding. Anything from cleaning a room, to homework that is due the next day! There are a couple of things I would change about the app, like a pausing feature, and etc. However, I am overall extremely satisfied with the app!

title: If you want to be more productive and less distracted...
review:
If you want to be more productive and less distracted by your phone, consider purchasing this app.
It's been working very well - I plant my trees and leave my phone alone during hours. In the end of the day I have produced more than usual and I also have a little forest. I also like saving the money (reward) I get to buy different types of trees.

title: Pomodoro & Customer Support…
review:
Summary: great idea but underwhelming Pomodoro and Customer Support

I purchased this app because I was excited about the idea of planting real trees while being more focused during the workday. I specifically saw the details that Pomodoro working styles were supported, but after actually being in the app, it’s a very manual process to follow by pressing a bunch of buttons unlike other apps that do it automatically.

I reached out to customer support asking about this functionality and they never got back to me.
developerResponse: {'id': 27386241, 'body': "Hi there, we apologize for not being able to get back to you sooner. \nWe typically reply within 1-2 workdays. If you don't hear from us after 2 days, you may consider your email has gone missing. Please reach us again via the in-app feedback system, thank you! ", 'modified': '2022-01-12T03:49:43Z'}

title: Everyone should have this
review: Whether it be work, personal goals, studying, writing, reading, or just trying to regain focus when your addicted to your phone this is 100% worth more than $2.00. I adore this app and the goals behind it to plant trees and help farmers. It’s a great motivator to rack up points and have an adorable little Forest of accomplishments to show for it!

title: Dubious privacy practice
review: I like the idea that forest builds on and it’s UIUX a lot, but I absolutely hate the fact that it demands users to sign up to get full functionality which it promised to deliver upon purchase. With Apple’s mandatory disclosure of privacy practice, it is even more obvious that Forest collect and will exploit your personal information. Oh and just discovered that it’s also a Chinese company, even more so. Will file a complaint to apple and I urge anyone who needs to study & focus tool to try out noodles or other alternative app which show more respect to customer’s privacy.
developerResponse: {'id': 27392485, 'body': "Greetings,\n\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We are an independent developer team from Taiwan. In order for your data to be saved, some features in the app require an account to use. Your privacy is our priority, and we are taking every step to protect our users and their data. We don't share the data with any third parties but instead, attach great importance to their protection. Read our Privacy Policy here: [https://www.forestapp.cc/privacy/](https://www.forestapp.cc/privacy/). If you have any more concerns, feel free to email us at support@forestapp.cc and we’d gladly address them for you!", 'modified': '2022-01-12T09:33:08Z'}

title: Only my second day but 🥺💕
review:
This app is so cute and I love it so much. Definitely worth the money. I had an essay due at midnight today and it was thanks to this app that I stayed focused last night and got it done. The plants we can plant are also just so so cute 🥺💕 wow
It’s only $1.99 so why not get it? I’m going off to college in August and I’m sure this will prove to be very beneficial.

title: Surprisingly not bad!
review: It’s a cute app to stay focused and it challenges you by not letting you fail and kill your cute trees. My only wish is for there to be a way to whitelist apps that allow you to use certain apps because most of us require to use school/work resources online. This way we can be more productive while studying. Even if you don’t need to study, this app is a good way to social media detox and just focus on ourselves and the world around us.
developerResponse:
{'id': 23107340, 'body': 'Hi,
Because of the limitation of the iOS system, we cannot detect which app the user is using, and therefore we are unable to implement the App Allow List feature in the iOS version.
As a workaround, we've made the "Deep focus mode" which you can turn on in the Settings page.

With the "Deep focus mode" off, you'll be able to use your phone without killing the tree, but you will also have to refrain yourself from using distracting apps.
With the mode on, you're expected to stay fully focused while planting, and thus you won't be able to use other apps. The mode can only be enabled when your device is secured with a password.

If you see features like an App Allow List in other iOS apps, please let us know and we will try to figure out how they did it.
Feel free to contact us again if you have any other questions or suggestions. Thank you. :) ', 'modified': '2021-05-31T13:20:57Z'}

title: Amazing study app!
review: I LOVE forest. I’m a huge procrastinator and I tend to get very distracted while I do homework. Forest keeps me from using my phone during study time, and rewards me for being productive. It has a deep focus mode where you absolutely can’t get on your phone, and a normal mode where you can. I definitely recommend this app! It’s motivating for sure!

title: Simple Design, Big Impact
review: This app is great. It’s a cute and clever way to tackle the issue of phones being a huge source of distraction while studying, reading, or hanging out with friends. The interface is appealing and easy to use, and there are lots of different trees. There are also events, special trees, and sometimes free trees. It is definitely worth the small price!

title: AMAZED at much more productive I am!
review:
I believe in the phrase “We do what we measure.” 
I also believe in Parkinson’s law which states “work expands so as to fill the time available for its completion”
This app will show you how productive you really are and will definitely help you manage your time much better than ever before

RECOMMENDATION TO DEVELOPERS:
I would love to have the option to customize the artistic aspect of the tree. Or to perhaps include some low poly 3D models of some of the trees available in the store currently- I think that would be awesome to have the forest we grow be fully 3D and explorable from ground view during the breaks maybe? It would encourage me to want to gather more coins and purchase different trees at least :)

title: This is app is a LIFESAVER!!!
review: It’s helping me so much! Not only to stay focused, but also to organize my activity and the time I spend doing each individual thing. The fact that you can create a FOREST account and it doesn’t ask for an already existing account like Facebook makes me even happier. I seriously recommend it to whoever wants to be more organized in their daily life.

title: Low graphic, not enough options to edit jungle
review:
1. The trees in my jungle change location when I plant new ones or when I open the app next day. I don’t have a stable jungle it changes shape every time.
2. My jungle graphic is low I can’t plant my trees where ever I want. I can’t edit my jungle.
3. I can’t view my friends jungles to see how much they have accomplished.
4. I would like a better visual graphic of my jungle with 360 degree view and zooming in and out.
5. I would like to have animals in my jungle.

title: Focus Helper
review: I didn’t realize how often I reached for my phone to check social media while I was “trying to get work done.” There is something about this app that helps to enhance people who have already adopted a self-accountability mindset and are looking for tools to help along the way. This is one of many tools I use to stay focused and it’s great to have one for my mobile device.

title: I love this app!
review:
I always want to put my phone down, but somehow get wrapped up in social media instead of doing homework.

Forest has been very helpful! The second I get the idea to put down my phone I go directly to forest and have no choice but to do my work because it is too late for me to come up with a reason to stay on my phone longer, keep up that great work!

title: Simple, effective
review: This app has been great at keeping me off my phone, which is all I really wanted. I like seeing bushes and trees in my forest and the ability to unlock different types. I like that you can add tags and notes to what each period off your phone. The deep focus mode, where you the tree withers when you leave the app, is really helpful. I also love that this app supports growing real trees. :)

title: I’m staying focused!
review: Shockingly, the one thing that keeps me off my phone is when there’s a risk my fake tree will die. I use this for EVERYTHING, and it not only helps me keep my attention on homework by blocking out a distraction, but it helps me keep my phone closed to save the battery. I’ll use it to stay off my phone in class, when with friends, at the gym, in the car, it’s always with me.

title: LIFESAVER
review: This app has changed my life!! As someone who struggles to concentrate, I find myself getting easily lost down the rabbit hole of social media, web browsing, texting, etc. With Forest, when my mind wanders I’m snapped back to reality and am reminded of the task I need to be working on. The app is also beautifully designed and has an easily accessible interface, making me want to use it even more!!

title: Best App Ever!
review: I’m in graduate school and it can be really difficult to concentrate on my studies whilst trying to balance the many facets of life. This app is a godsend. I’m able to focus so well knowing I can break my time up incrementally, allow myself breaks, and track both numerically and visually how much time I spend studying. If you’re in school and have trouble devoting adequate time to your studies, this is the app for you!

title: So helpful!!
review: This app has been so helpful! It challenges me to not pick up my phone every time I get a notification of some kind. It helps me to focus on what I’m doing and surprisingly (I guess I shouldn’t be surprised) I get more done! You’d be surprised at what you could get done in 25 or 30 minutes when you don’t automatically respond to every notification on your phone.

title: Love it !!
review: Keeps me focused whenever I have to cram for studying. I have a problem with checking my phone while studying and then getting distracted but this forces me to stay focused. Plus, I love seeing my trees and everything. I really like what they did for their birthday event, so cute to see little cakes growing and not knowing which one I’m going to get. You guys should do something like this again in the future !!

title: Focus helped me greatly
review: I am a junior in high school and I do college courses along with high school courses so I have a lot of work. I have trouble focusing on the work at hand and I tend to procrastinate greatly when I got this app, it forced me to focus and it really has helped me. I didn’t want to kill my tree so I worked to keep it alive, and it was a great motivation tactic and it kept me off my phone. This is 100% worth it

title: Worth every penny
review: I bought this app on a whim while searching for ways to stop me from procrastinating. This app turned out to be such a bliss. The coins took a bit long to gather, however that makes every purchase of a new plant, bush/flowers or sounds a more treasured and thought out experience. You can sync your records to use across devices as well. Would totally recommend it.

title: Worth the Price
review: I hardly ever pay money for apps. I’ve gone years and years relying on free until I decided to buy this one. I thought it would be great for my procrastination. While no app ever could cure that, it does encourage me to stay productive during the time my tree is growing. Nothing I could change, except maybe that the bushes were a little cheaper, but that’s just a personal opinion.

title: Great app! One suggestion.
review:
It seems like this app has been around for years, and it’s clear to me that improvements have been made by your development team.

If I were to include another small feature, it would be to add the ability to ‘finish early’ while your timer is still ticking. You obviously don’t have to give full rewards when this happens.

title: Tags should be accessible before a session
review: This is a great motivational app to limit using the phone during work. However, I find inconvenient to not be able to choose a Tag before starting a session. I think Tags should be on the same screen with the “plant” button. Also, having a break feature would be helpful. Thanks for this useful app.
developerResponse:
{'id': 5907187, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app
feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-12-03T20:15:10Z'}

title: Great app, slight bug :/
review: The app was working 100% until this recent update. With the counting exceeded time option on, sometimes after my trees are done growing (even at 120 minutes) it will count the exceeded time and give me coins for the time. Sometimes the coins will stay and sometimes the coins will not. I'd like it if this could become consistent. I plant many trees a day and become confused when my coin balance changes throughout the day. Thank you!

title: I've stopped procrastinating!!
review: This app has worked wonders! After school, I would procrastinate and not do my homework. I would be on my phone a lot, and I would ACTUALLY start my homework at 6 pm. After getting this app, I don't procrastinate anymore and now I finish my homework early. Creating my own little forest has driven me to study and concentrate and I absolutely love it. Get this app right now, you won't regret it.

title: Surprisingly Helpful
review: I was a little worried that I wouldn’t love this app. However, I found myself really wanting to keep my plants alive... which kept me off of my phone while doing homework! It made me so much more productive because I wouldn’t be taking 5-minute “breaks” every time I got bored. The added bonus of being able to help people and the environment in real life is amazing as well. Love this app!!!

title: I love this app!!!
review: This app has helped me so much to focus. Before, I couldn’t stop using my phone and checking it every second while studying, but now I can finally concentrate because thinking that the tree is going to die if you use your phone makes you not even look at it! I love it, everyone should get this app.

title: Great for ADHD
review: I’m an adult with ADHD and as you’d probably expect, I have a hard time focusing. That usually translates to me being on my phone entirely too much (my stats say my average use per day used to be 14 hours, so yikes) but Forest is really really helping with that. Just from yesterday, my screen time was lowered to 8 hours in a day. SUCH a huge jump from where I was. Thanks, Forest!

title: Nice, but no support for landscape on iPad
review: This app has terrific design, works great, and I’m really starting to get the hang of when and how to use it. Being able to add a “start timer” option to your widgets is wonderful. However, it’s just poor-planning on the devs part that it doesn’t support iPad in the most commonly used orientation: landscape. Makes it really difficult to fully recommend.

title: This app keeps me productive through quarantine
review:
Make me being productive fun with Forest 🌳✨ Through quarantine this is exactly what I needed! 

I’m that kind of person that needs a little incentive/reward to keep me motivated. And honestly to know I am growing my own little forest each time I complete some work, it really keeps me on task.

Love this app, and highly recommend 🤍✨

title: Seems to work for me, which is good
review: Not really a fan of these miracle cure apps or toys that claim to help focus or study habits. They always seem to mostly just distract me more, or prove pointless in the long run. But this seems to do the trick. Wanting to not mess up my tree is enough extrinsic motivation for me to not look at my phone, and with online classes being essentially unaccountable for focus, I use this a lot.

title: Student’s review
review: I am a college student who purchased this app last week and I have been loving it. It makes it much easier to avoid distractions on my phone while studying. One of my concerns was that I would not be able to play music in the background but I found that I am able to play my studying playlists in the background without destroying my tree.

title: Life Saving!
review: I have ADD and have been having to work-from-home due to COVID 19. I’ve had a terrible time regulating my distractions since at home. Something about Forest’s simple design really worked to keep me off of my phone, and break a cycle of bad habits. It feels good to be back in control of where I spend my attention 🙌 Hope any ADD sufferers out there can find a little help through this.

title: Great app for students!
review: I use this app very regularly for keeping myself on track for classes, and to keep myself focused in other situations. I love the Forest app. It keeps me from procrastinating until the last minute. I also love using it to focus on quality time and use it to focus on a TV show I’m watching. I just think this is a great and beyond helpful application to have in your pocket. ☺️

title: Love it
review: Great app! I have a hard time focusing on cleaning especially. This app taps into my super sensitive side 😂 I really get attached to the plants and set obtainable goal times to get things done around the house bc its so easy to just sot back on your phone but not when you’re killing something! If you’re a sensitive little plant lover who has a hard time staying off the phone please get this app!

title: Great app
review:
10/10 would recommend.
I’m addicted to my phone and constantly use it, so I thought I’d give this app a try to help me focus on my work more. It ended up working like a charm. Everytime I have the urge to use it and pick up my phone, I see the screen and the little trees growing and I’d feel guilty if I were to chop it down so I would end up putting my phone back down.

title: Super helpful!
review: Love this app. Got it to help increase my focus and study time at home since being quarantined due to the coronavirus... It’s definitely helping me study way more. Easy to use, love the concept of planting the trees, regardless of how silly it may be. Gives you nice goals to work towards, and the graphs tracking your focus time are awesome. Highly recommend ~ worth the couple bucks for sure

title: how did i ever function without this app?
review: i was reluctant to purchase this app, since there’s so many out there that do the same (or so i thought) thing, but i caved in because, what the heck? it was one the best decisions i’ve made this year. it doesn’t only keep me focused when i need to be, but i can see where and how i’m spending my focused time & for how long. this app was the rude awakening to me for showing me how much i used to pick up my phone when i should be studying/doing chores/reading/anything else i should be doing. i literally use this for everything, including getting ready in the morning/night, eating dinner, studying, etc.. this app is totally worth it for what you get from it!

title: Helps Me Read More
review:
I learned early on that ebooks were not for me because of my tendency to get distracted by the other features of the device. Even dedicated e-readers failed to keep me focused on the page because of their tempting note-taking and highlighting features.

So I stuck with time-tested paper books. But even then the nearness of my phone made reading more challenging.

Forest helps me ignore my phone. It’s such a seemingly simple psychological trick, but it works: pick up my phone, kill a tree. It doesn’t matter that it’s not a real tree. The app successfully games my mind into behaving as if it were.

I highly recommend Forest if you, like me, feel your phone takes up too much of your attention.

title: Real trees!
review: Super motivating that if I get enough points, real trees will be planted! It’s the same reason I use the Ecosia web browser app. I was thinking about downloading their new SleepTown app but just don’t think I would be motivated without a tangible action such as a tree being planted somewhere on Earth! I also love sharing my progress! Loved the winter snow on the pictures of the trees too! The badges earned makes it fun as well!

title: It’s keeping me away from social media
review: I had to completely uninstall all my social media in order to get my work done. It was all or nothing for distractions. I didn’t think this would work for me but using the function that will kill my tree if I leave my app has helped me SO MUCH!!! Def recommend it and appreciate how you have to earn coins to get what you want, like ocean sounds lol

title: Always a Tree-t
review:
I’ve been using this on and off for several years. Forest can be really nice when you’re having trouble focusing. Nice to have something to discourage you from using your phone. 
The in-game store, which uses coin generated by your patience and not real money, is a little costly. Trees and shrubs all cost the same. 
Overall though, Forest is a nice, painless way of helping you maintain focus.

title: Absolutely amazing if you’re a procrastinator
review: I have a tough time focusing on certain tasks especially when it comes to studying or just doing homeworks. However this app is very useful in keeping me in check by “preventing” me from being distracted. Overall 5/5 definitely worth the money and you can plants more tree just by studying and getting off your phone :)

title: Amazing!
review:
I’ve always had trouble with being mindful and remaining on task for periods of time. As a PhD student who constantly reads academic articles and 100+ textbook pages, this app has done wonders for my productivity. 

Did a bit of research on the company that plants actual trees and they seem legitimate in my opinion! Being able to plant trees in real life with the in-app currency you earn is a huge motivator as well.

title: Good UX design
review: I like this app, it’s simple and easy. The experience design is very good. There isn’t much to it, and I love that. It helps me stay off my phone, and forces me to keep working. It was pretty cheap app to buy, and I’m fully against buying apps but I gave this one a try and it has disappointed yet. Cute concept with little effort. Can’t wait to get enough coins to grow a real tree. That will be nice and fulfilling :)

title: Simply said . . .
review:
This is an app for people who care about getting work done or doing things in an organized, timely manner. It does it’s job well at keeping you determined to focus on whatever you’re doing otherwise, your tree dies and costs a lot of coins to clear up :(
And who wants to spend their coins ok clearing dead trees when you can award yourself with prettier and more aesthetic ones!!

title: Great Concept but more could be done
review:
The concept of the app is great, but there are things that could be done to make it better! 
Few ideas: 
show the growing plant on the home screen to remind the user not to unlock phone.
Make the new plants less expensive to buy from the store. It takes a lot of work to get to a new plant.
Provide the option for a task list so that we can obtain points when we finish a set of tasks.

title: Strongly Recommend
review: At first I was skeptical about this app because of its simplicity, but when I started using it for myself I began to realize that it is way more helpful than a lot of people may think. This app is now the only way I get my work done on time. It's a good app for procrastinators and people who have trouble concentrating on things for long periods of time. Definitely a must have.

title: pretty good
review: this app is prettttt good at stopping u from using ur phone but there is one loophole. u can leave the app for around 2-3 seconds and still go on social media before a notification pops up telling u to go back. in the next update i wish that u keep it to one second or have the notifciation pop up immediately so i have ZERO temptation or ability to get to social media ahaha. other than that, this app is w!o!n!d!e!r!f!u!l! at its job and most definitely worth the money!

title: I think I'm addicted to this app...
review: Its like exercise. A good addiction. I can still check email and facebook, but not doing that every 5 minutes really helps me focus. I find the trees so cute and the forest so satisfying that I am eager to find things to get done wihout the device so I can grow more. And the group feature was lovely over the holidays. A special tree planted with my daughter reflects the time we gave eachother.

title: Cut incoming and/or present music
review:
With the present ambient sounds, o often hear the cut and the moment that cut occurs, my ears ache from my headphones (the volume is rarely up high). In the rain and thunder ambient sound, there is a single high pitch noise before the cut. 

Is it possible for the ambient sounds to be looked over once more and edited slightly to be more “smooth”? 

Other than that, amazing app! Lol, I really can’t wait for incoming trees too!
developerResponse:
{'id': 5658587, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app
feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-10-25T09:21:05Z'}

title: Great app! Great for getting errands done & studying
review: I have tried the Pomodoro (25 min work, 5 min break; 1 hr of work & little bit longer break) technique on my own, but didn’t stick to it very well. This helps me be more cognizant of my studying time and how many times I reach out for my phone. I am now using it to make sure I am off my phone to get things done during the day not just for studying.

title: Keeps me motivated to stay focused
review: I have tried a couple of apps for self-improvement and this one is the only one I keep coming back to. The concept is engaging and motivates you to use the app often. Strongly recommend for those that struggle to put their phone down when they should be studying or paying attention in class! Definitely worth the price!

title: Effective and flexible to customize types of work
review:
Great motivator to get going on time-bound projects with all the environmental consciousness we need today. 

Makes me wonder how many trees have been planted by the apps’ developers but will take it for what it’s worth. This effort can only help!

Great implementation and easy to use and happy to pay only once.

title: App needs to be more streamlined.
