review: The purpose of this app (to keep me focused) is spot on. One issue I have with the map is the menus and navigating everything else but the main function (planting a tree for a certain time and what type of tree). Why start the monthly view of your forest at January? Why can’t we navigate between year/month/week/day forest view easier? I don’t want to have to sift through every single month or week all the time.

title: Barely compatible with Apple Watch
userName: act up u can get snatched up
review: I love this app and what it does but I wish it more was compatible with Apple Watches.  I am only able to view my forest, but not set timers or stopwatches on my watch like i can on my phone.  Especially since Forest is a productivity app, being able to use it solely on Apple Watch would be very helpful as I don’t have to reach for my phone every time.

title: Good App for Studying
review: The Pomodoro technique is very important to studying and helps immensely with learning. Set aside 25 minutes and use Forest to plant a tree while you study, and then take a 5 minute break and take your mind off of it. Come back to it for another 25 minutes and you’ll be able focus more than if you hadn’t taken the break!

title: Great for pomodoro sessions
review: This is my go-to app for when I study. I get easily distracted by my phone when I get bored while studying, but this app keeps me in check and keeps me focused. You earn coins when you finish a session which you can save up to plant an actual tree! (pretty awesome). Overall this is a great app and I highly recommend it!

title: Definitely needed when working from home!!
review: This app is excellent to help promote working efficiently from home!! It helps to take away the distractions of the TV, books, and video games that might otherwise tempt us. The app is also excellent to help prevent distractions when spending time with friends and family. Worth the money!

title: Helps me focus!
review: I just need a little extra incentive to focus when studying and stay off my phone. The fact that I paid for this app makes me more inclined to get my money's worth. I also love that with enough coins, I can plant a tree!! The plant with friends feature is fun too because we have to hold each other accountable!

title: Wonderful in helping my focus!
review: I came across the forest app initially on accident. I needed help with my productivity and time management. I was NOT expecting all of the help I’ve received with focusing on the tasks at hand. An added bonus is growing my own virtual forest! If you want an app that will push you to keep your focus, complete tasks and have little to no distractions... This is definitely worth it!

title: this app is a gamechanger
review: I check my phone way more often than I’m comfortable with. I tried using downtime and app limits but I’d always turn them off when I wanted to use it. This makes it easier and cute to not check your phone. Also, this is the first app I have ever paid for because I never spend money in the AppStore but this was so worth it. I love it! :-)

title: Great app!
review: This app provides accountability and makes you feel like you’re moving forward while doing something good for the environment. We all need digital detoxing and if you leave the app and you’re connected to your friends everyone’s tree dies. Statistically if you try to reach a goal with friends you do better so my husband and I both downloaded this app. Awesome! 🌲

title: Amazing app!
review: Been using it for years and continue to be happy with it. Issues fixed promptly. Very helpful timer, great interface, and a dev team that really cares about their product. Tags and analytics are well worth it for me, and with forest you get an actual physical representation of the work you’ve done. Best timer app I’ve ever used and plan to stick around for years to come.

title: Good for finals
review: I’ve had this app for a couple years now and have been using it on again off again. I’ve been having a hard time staying focused while studying for finals and this app has been a great help in making me leave my phone alone for short periods of time while I study. I would recommend if you get really distracted with your phone!

title: Homework Helper
review: I love this app, because before I had a hard time focusing on tasks. But this app reminds me that I have a reward coming at the end of the task! I would love to plant pumpkins for more time but at the same point I understand why it would be the shorter timeframe! I absolutely recommend this app for people who want cute plant rewards for keeping on a task when you set the time for it! 😁

title: Study or die
review: This app truly puts positive pressure on you to stay focused! If you open your phone while a tree is planted, but not grown, you will get a dead tree and that dead tree will be in your forest. A consistent reminder to do better. I have a horrible attention span and this app has been so helpful! I use for work too. I suggest buying coin multipliers if you are interested in many different types of trees :)

title: Fantastic app!!
review: When I got this I thought that it wasn’t quite worth the money, but it’s been really useful in staying on track while studying & reading :) I would rate 5 stars, but the “coin” system is a messed up. It’s significantly too hard to get coins. Since it’s so hard to get coins, none of the trees really seem like reachable goals, which is discouraging. Otherwise it does what it’s supposed to! I get my reading done and I’m less distracted.

title: Absolutely Splendid!
review: I cannot express my gratitude! It’s a beautifully designed and constructed app. It definitely helps me as a student get things done, it’s difficult to stay off of my phone for 5 seconds but this makes it fun! Ever since I’ve started using it I have improved and gone past my own limits! I will definitely be using it a lot more for my upcoming school year :)

title: An app that helps me break the phone habit
review: I used to lose all sorts of productivity time because I’d pick up my phone to check Twitter, Facebook, etc. “for just a minute.” Same with losing sleep at bedtime or first thing in the morning. Forest has helped me break my iPhone habit! Setting the timer for as little as ten minutes is often all I need to get focused and working on something else.

title: Amazing app!!✨✨
review: This is the best app I’ve ever used to help me keep focused! I HIGHLY recommend this to those who have a hard time getting off their devices and want to be more productive. You not only do good onto yourself, but you can also plant ACTUAL trees for your efforts :))) and help the environment! I’ve already recommended it to a lot of my friends and they enjoy it too. Easy to use and will not disappoint 🤩

title: This program is the best
review:
No spammy ads, no forced connection to a specific social network. Just pure productivity. Seeing your own little production forest grow is a treat, and really helps you see visually how much progress you’ve been making.

I use it every time I study and I can honestly say that I think it has improved my grades and general satisfaction from goal-setting. Get this app!!!

title: Great app to keep you on track
review: I’ve enjoyed the gamification of my focused sessions with this app. It’s great to look back and see a visual representation of what you did each day, week, month and year. There’s also a graph that shows you where you spent your time during that period. As a creative person that can be easily distracted, this app has given me a great structure to help channel my energies.

title: Nice, Peaceful Little App
review:
I really enjoy using this app, and find it incredibly helpful in keeping my focus on a specific task, like reading or studying or anything that doesn’t require my iPhone.

I pick a tree (my favorite is the Apple Tree), set the timer for how long I’d like to focus, and get to work. It’s very simple, as it should be.

Then I get to work. And many times I’ll forget and absent-mindlessly reach for my iPhone to check Twitter or something, and this app will remind me to stay focused. (Of course, if you NEED to use your iPhone, just use it normally, and the only penalty is that the “tree” you were growing that session will die, and be part of that day’s yard.)

One of my favorite and most important apps on my iPhone. 😀

title: It helps more than you’d think
review: You know when you NEED to do homework or study or get back to work or you’re with friends and want to be present but you can’t get off your phone... WELL this app will change that. It’s dumb but yes it helps a lot. And if you get enough points (by not using your phone) you can buy a real tree that will be planted somewhere in the world. It’s a win-win.

title: Thanks!
review: This app looks fantastic. We just got it, so I can’t comment on its effectiveness yet, but I love the concept. We homeschool our children, and keeping them on task can be very frustrating as we try to allow them opportunities for independence and responsibility. What would be super cool is to add a “competition” feature with a friend group.  A little healthy/friendly competition can be a very effective tool.  ;-)

title: Amazing Productivity Tim Management Tool!
review:
I have tried many timer tools in the past and this by far is my favorite. This app makes focus time so fun with it’s gamification and accountability features. 

Highly recommend if you need extra help with focus and managing your time effectively (while also giving back to the global community!)

title: Worth the $2
review: I totally recommend this app, it helps you to make focusing a game and the incentive of cute little trees and bushes makes it feel like you’re accomplishing things even if you don’t have a very long attention span. It’s a nice little reward and you don’t feel lost in studying. You feel in control of your time.

title: Perfect for online school!
review: Since everything’s online now, it’s hard to not get distracted and go on my phone all the time. Using this app incentivized me to not go on my phone when I am doing school work, as to not kill the tree 🥺 I highly recommend for those who wish to gain a grasp of control over their phone habits!! :)

title: great app
review: I've only been using the app for a few days and it's kept me way more organized and motivated to do my work and stuff. I do wish that there could be like a way to set a schedule or something so you don't forget what you have to do. Maybe like a built in calendar/ planner or something would be cool.

title: Gets Rid of Procrastination Guilt
review: Before, I really procrastinated, or felt guilty taking what would be reasonable breaks. With the app though it’s felt much less guilt ridden to reward myself after growing a tree. However, maybe a bit more selection of plants at the start would be motivating, just like doing short work keeps momentum up for longer work. That’s how other games typically function.

title: Another Repetitive Positive Review
review: I think forest is great! It’s been really useful to me and my friends throughout our grade school years. We use it whenever we want to unplug and/or focus and it’s been extremely helpful. Being someone who struggles with mental health and general motivation, forest has really helped me not only in education but also my everyday life. Thanks awesome nerds! Keep up the good work!

title: Great iPhone app, not so much Apple Watch app
review:
Please update the Apple Watch app to be able to start a timer (at least) from the watch. I like that on the watch you can see how many mins are left as a complication, however the app on the watch is not useful— it only shows the trees and time left. 

The ios app itself is wonderful, no doubt about that. Keep the new species coming!

title: LOVE IT
review:
I love this app
 it makes me focus while studying since if u leave the app the plant will die, and when I think about this, I’d think how long I focused already, is it worth it to let the plant die bc I want to play? Also, if u want to unlock better looking plants, you’d hv to use this app more often in order to earn coins. This app just made me more productive and I don’t regret buying it

title: Great!
review: As a stressed out highschool student this app helps a ton. I can keep track of what I work on and for how long, and get a little tree along with it. I do wish more free plants were available or a break option since the app if pretty minimalistic. I just think there could be more options like colors of the trees or background colors and such. But overall it’s a really useful tool that’s helped me get through my school years!

title: The only thing that stops me from mindlessly scrolling
review: When I catch myself procrastinating studying by scrolling mindlessly on tumblr, Twitter, Instagram, reddit, etc... I know it’s time to plant a tree in this app. Even just setting a 20 minute timer helps me break the spell and stay focused on something meaningful. I’ve never killed a tree once and I’m gonna keep it that way lol. Such a cute app, I totally recommend.

title: Helps me
review: I use this app whenever I need to finish my work fast, helps me get focused without using my phone and then forgetting to get back to my homework. I think this app overall is effective when trying to focus but it’s hard to motivate myself to actually start working sometimes. It could actually be helpful if the app has a notification that can help motivate someone to use the app and do their work.

title: Great App ☺️
review: This app is simple, sweet, and does exactly what I bought it for! It makes me more efficient and I can even compete with my friends to see who has the most grown trees (which adds to my motivation). I’m not exactly sure if it’s worth paying for, but I’ve loved using it and I can’t wait for new updates 🤗 Plus, when you earn enough coins, you can spend them to plant REAL TREES! 🤩🌳

title: AWESOME!
review: I will admit, in the begging I was really really bad, I would either click the “Give Up” button, or ignore the notifications that Forest gave me about my poor little dying tree. Now, I am currently getting a jumpstart for the college course I want to take, by studying the subject on my own, early, and Forest helped me with that! I’m so glad that I got this app, it has kept me motivated and really excited to study.

title: trees are too expensive to be motivating
review: Love this app and have been using it for years, but I feel like every time I log on to use it the price of unlocking new trees increases. This is super unmotivating because the rate at which you receive coins for your focused time compared to how much the trees cost is pretty unreasonable. Used to be great, but isn’t encouraging anymore, which defeats the purpose of the app 😞
developerResponse: {'id': 8705996, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for the feedback. Currently, the first tree purchase will cost 500 coins. Every additional tree purchase will increase the cost by 100 coins, with the limit set at 1000 coins. We will consider modifying the formula of earning coins in future updates to make it easier to unlock new species. You can also earn extra rewards by unlocking achievements! Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions or suggestions! -Forest', 'modified': '2019-05-16T15:42:05Z'}

title: Has definitely increased my focus
review: I downloaded Forest to help me break the habit of mindlessly scrolling on social media, and I’m glad I did. I’ve been enjoying every feature of the app except the increase of price to unlock the next tree/bush. However, I guess maybe they do that in order to encourage you to use the app more. Nevertheless, I’m grateful for this app and will continue to use it.

title: Improvement advice
review: Should take back the function of automatically counting the over time. When I set a 30 minutes’ clock, and I keep untouched for 60 minutes, it should recognize as 60 minutes. It was an old function that I really like, not sure why it goes away when I update the app. Still a 5 stars though cuz it is a very good/useful app

title: Fantastic app for productive days!
review: For someone like myself who will walk past their phone and pick it up and just scroll by habit, this app has extended my days and made me stay more present. There have been many times I look at the clock and am so surprised that the day has gone. You don’t realize how much time you waste on scrolling until you use this app. I love it

title: Little custom features
review: It’s a nice app but it’s not customizable nor does it promotes the Pomodoro Technique well.  You have to keep counting your own benchmarks which can get confusing.  It automatically set 25 min on task and 5 min break but it does not account for how many times you’ve done a 25 min session. Other apps allow you to set custom times like I want 4 rounds of 25 min with 5 min break in between and then a 15 min break after 4 rounds. This doesn’t do that it. It’s disappointing. Not what I was looking for.

title: Very helpful!
review: I have been using Forest for about three weeks- without Forest I am very easily distracted from my work by my phone, or more specifically apps and news.  With Forest I can still have my phone available if I need it (or if someone in my family needs me) but I am discouraged from playing when I should be working.  Totally worth the $2 or $3 I paid for it- totally.

title: Such a Motivation
review:
This has been the best productive time motivator for me!! 
Also, my little kids have a forest, and when they came in from outside after only 5 minutes (it was a beautiful day), I told them their tree would die unless they went back outside and they literally ran for the door and played for 25 more minutes. Yay for outside play time instead of whining for iPads!

title: Love it
review: I pretty love this app! It helps me stay from games in my phone. I couldn't stop opening my stupid games and wasting my time. Forest works fantastic to manage myself and make me more productive! I finally can start my paper and do something good! I do hope my friends use it, so we can use the room function. However, I can't find some hard working friends... sad about it.

title: So grateful!:)
review:
Super effective! Helps keep you off your phone and studying, where we need to be. You can reply to texts but not initiate. Diff settings, too, but I'd rather keep the default so it keeps me OFF my phone:) Would LOOOOVE more tree "species" pleeeease:) happy growing!!:)
-UPDATE-- STILL LOVE THIS APP!!! They added more tree species!! And during Christmas, most of the trees are holiday themed! I can't praise this app enough for helping me stay off my phone & study!

title: Nearly perfect.
review: If this app never changes, that'd be fine with me. As it stands, it provides just enough incentive to keep you from absent-mindedly browsing your phone. Combined with the difficult to achieve but real reward of getting a real tree planted, Forest has enough utility to keep me interested for many years. Fantastic product!

title: LOVE IT!
review: It’s help keeping me focused and it’s awesome. I would love if they had a feature where you can “risk your forest” or something like that where if you get out of the app during your set time then your entire forest would die and you would have to start from scratch! This would be an optional feature obviously!

title: Increased productivity for sure
review: I have always had a hard time and I’m focus mode being unable to leave the screen without losing my points has really pushed me to look at my phone less and work more. I highly recommend! And if you plant enough trees in the app eventually you can plant real life trees!

title: Awesome study app!
review: This is my first study app & it does a great job to help you focus, especially when you’re using the “Deep Focus” option. I find that I concentrate better when there’s a timer and of course waiting for the little surprise at the end when my plant sprouts. Great app! I would definitely recommend this to a friend (:

title: Just starting
review: It’s pretty good for now, what I didn’t know coming into it is that I would have to pay to buy trees. It would have been nice if we could unlock them by actual focus achievements. You do get added bonuses like forest sounds which I didn’t expect. It’s a nice niche little app. I downloaded it because I struggle with staying focused while working from home. So 4 stars.

title: Such a good app for productive sessions.
review:
I’ve been using the app since around 2018 I think? 

It has been a go-to for when I need to sanction time out of my day to do work, be productive, so on. 

The concept is fun and the app has a nice UI. It has looked great for a long time. I love the new widget options and versatility of all 6 types - honestly one of the best new widgets out there, I’d say. 

Every thing about it is clean and simple, while promoting productivity.

My only suggestion would be the ability to start planting from the Apple Watch app (synced to the iOS app). To me, being able to only see my forest on the watch app is kind of useless.

Great app all around. Would recommend it to anyone!

title: THIS APP IS THE BEST!!
review: Perfect app with easy user interface. I highly recommend to anyone that has trouble focusing for long periods of time since this app implements the Pomodoro Effect (productive periods of 25mins followed by a 5 min break). My favorite feature is the part where you can add friends and check the amount of trees they have planted for the day! That way we can hold each other accountable 😆

title: Forest can be the best app... that I ever had!!!!!!
review:
I’ve been using this app for less than one month and I already love it, using forest you can easily forget about getting the phone or playing games. Just the idea of you planting trees or bushes that grow depending on the time you use the app can distract you.

So if you want to play less games when you could be studying, THIS IS THE RIGHT APP!!!

title: Must have for college students
review: I absolutely love this app. It helps keep me focused on my school work, or when I need to implement a break from my phone to get other tasks done. I even use it as a timer for my assignments, so I don’t waste time and it pushes me to be more productive. I’ve been using it for years, and if you haven’t downloaded it yet, I highly recommend you do!!

title: Thank you!!!
review: I’m a student and I have a very hard time man having my school work and time. Thanks to this app, I spend less less time on my phone and more time studying. Not only that but the sounds in the app, such as the rainforest sound are very relaxing. The overall design of the app is very calming and pleasing to the eye. This app makes my life so much easier. Thanks a million!!

title: Can’t figure out notifications
review: I love this app. It’s super cute. My only thing is that I can’t get the notifications to work. I was hoping there would be some sort of alarm or noise that would indicate that the work time was up. But I can’t seem to get that to work. And clicking on the FAQ triggers the spinning wheel of death. But other than that I love it. Definitely worth the $2.

title: Great for studying and cleaning your room!!!
review: You set timers and then if you don’t look at your phone then you grow a cute tree or bush. You can get different adorable species of trees and there are different types of festive trees for the holidays. You can spend some of the coins you earn to plant real trees in the real world. Other than the initial purchase, there is no need to spend any money. Great app overall!

title: So far, so good!
review: I have been using this app for a couple of day now and it’s been keeping me motivated to study. I love the concept of my hard work resulting in a cute virtual garden. Also, this app is actually doing good by helping others plant actual trees! I also took the personality quiz and I unlocked a cute bamboo tree as a gift. I would definitely recommend this app if you are feeling unmotivated!

title: Grad School - Gamed!
review: I’m an environmental law student and needed some help focusing (sometimes law school just starts to get ya). I hardly ever pay for apps, but this was worth the small charge FOR SURE! It’s helped motivate me. Getting a tree feels like getting a little prize. I also really like that you can tag each tree—it helps make me feel like I’ve accomplished something even if it’s just slogging through readings.

title: Great for managing distractions
review: I struggle with ADD and I absolutely love this app. I use it not only for my phone but on my computer as well (it offers a Firefox and Chrome extension). It is well worth the money just in the time it has saved alone. Would be nice if it had a blackout mode for the internet on computer, maybe that’s for a future update but as for now I’m certainly content.

title: has helped me a ton!!
review: This app has really helped me in my school work and really does help keep me focused. Since it has all the different unlockable trees and bushes, it also makes me want to study and do work more! and whether i’m just wanting to get some work done or i’m cramming my summer reading in last minute, this app is insanely helpful across the board! totally worth the download ;)

title: Get this app!
review: This is a super cute and helpful way to get me to focus. I’m using it during finals and I’ve been able to get so much done since I can’t look at social media. Would highly recommend for students!! I also love having a little forest after I’ve been productive all day, and it’s nice seeing how long I’m actually able to buckle down and get done what I need to.

title: This app single handedly helped me pass my finals
review: I love this app! It’s absolutely amazing, it helped me so much when I was studying for my final exams. The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is the amount of coins it takes to buy new trees in-game. It takes forever to download a new type of tree or bush, and sometimes a forest of pine trees can be a bit bland. Overall though, amazing app, very useful for productivity and focus. 100% would recommend.

title: Almost perfect!
review:
I love this app so much but there are some things I thing that the developers could add/fix. 1. Stopwatch time, sometimes I set the timer for too little time and don’t just want to start over. Stopwatch time would fix this because you could set the timer and when you were done you could stop it instead of having to preset the time.

2. I wish you could add some apps as productivity apps for example weather or if your packing and someone sent you a list what to wear on your text app! 

3. The costs, I get your supposed to have to work for the coins and everything but 500 coins take so long to make. Also, bushes should not cost the same as trees!

Other than those few problems I love this app so much.

title: Good enough but could be much better
review:
Effective for keeping your phone away from distractions. With the chrome extension, this app is good for fighting distractions. 
Good for tracking “focus time”. However, the tree reward is not really much of a reward. Not sure if it’s worth the 1.99 price tag especially because the app can’t sync automatically with the chrome extension so if you’re using both at the same time it doubles the amount of time recorded scaling back the feature that made it useful in the first place.

+5 stars for effectiveness — gives you a goal for focusing and tracking/visualizing focus times
-1 Star for not syncing 
-2 Stars for 1.99 price tag and stingy coin rewards: need 500 to buy a tree but focusing for 30-40 minute intervals (optimal focus times) got you only 10-20 coins encouraging users to do in app purchases. For a paid app, this seems greedy.
developerResponse: {'id': 8705754, 'body': 'Hi, we will consider automatically syncing the current session with Chrome as well as modifying the formula of earning coins in future updates. Currently, you can earn extra rewards by unlocking achievements! Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions or suggestions! -Forest', 'modified': '2019-05-16T15:26:47Z'}

title: Goal Oriented App
review:
What I love about this app is that it promotes a goal oriented environment and there’s an actual goal for it, plant trees or unlock other tree types and background noise, there are even bushes.
I also love the badges; every time you achieve “something”, like planting three days straight, you get a badge. My only suggestion is that there should be more badges because it’s really motivating to keep unlocking them!

title: soooooo great!!!!
review: this is soooooo easy to use and is super helpful! i have been getting better grades recently because i have improved my study habits. the only problem i have is i want to be able to buy the music with the points i have, you need 500 points to buy a sound/song and it takes FOREVER to get that many points. but overall TOTALLY suggest the app.

title: It is really helpful for people who want to study but hard to control themselves
review:
When I want to do my assignments or study for exams, it is hard to leave my phone aside. Forest helps me a lot to stop thinking about everything about my phones. And the fun of planting trees and environmentally friendly meaning to plant real trees are really interesting!!!
I will keep using to better arrange my time.

title: Addicting
review: I study a LOT, and in order for me to focus I use this app. I’m in love! I love how you can grow a variety of trees and other plants and make your own forest. My other favorite feature of this app is that once you get enough coins, you can actually plant a real life tree! I’m all for saving the planet and prevention of deforestation so this is such a huge bonus for me. Keep up the great work developers! 👍🏻

title: A super fun + charitable way to focus!
review: I absolutely love forest! It seriously is the best app I've ever used to help me concentrate. I guess because I'm from the Giga Pet/ Nano Pet era I can't stand to watch my trees die lol! So I stay focused so my little forest can thrive. Now that I know how to use tasks I can see where my time is spent. Seriously thank you for this app! I also love the fact that with enough coins I can plant a real tree! How awesome is that?!

I like this app a lot, and planting trees to stay focused is surprisingly motivating! I also like how you get rewarded for staying off your phone longer than you had set the timer for.

The only thing I wish were different is to have the price scale lower for the bushes, or have it scale separately from the trees. Paying 1000 coins for a plant with a limited time associated with it seems silly!
developerResponse:
{'id': 4415026, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app
feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-07-27T01:49:31Z'}

title: Keeps me in discipline
review: I had another app, I guess, it’s called flora which asked me to log in with face book. That totally didn’t work for me coz I always logged on to FB. This app is perfect and independent. Simply start the timing and if we study with an additional time w/o noticing the completion of the set time, it still calculates how much additional time we spend after the set time. I totally recommend it.

title: The only app I’d write a review for
review:
This app is fantastic. I never write reviews but this app has done so much for me that I feel like it’s the least I can do.

Productivity levels while studying will absolutely soar. It’s not worth it to just “kill a tree” to check a text or scroll through insta. The incentive to have a beautiful garden and stay focused is fantastic.

Get this app, and USE IT. It will help you tremendously.

title: Simple, but it works!
review: I've tried other apps for focus, but it's too easy to override then without a sense of consequence. The points and little digital trees are enough to make me feel guilty and keep me productive. I wish you could set goals and opt to plant a larger first over the course of a week (instead of a new one each day), but that's just a preference thing. Overall, it's a great app!

title: Limited number of trees
review: I love using this app because growing the little forest is cute. However I got this app because being able to use points to plant real trees was very appealing. Pocket points could let me get discounted pizza. But I wanted the trees. Well after 6 real trees, the app told me I couldn't use points on real trees anymore. Not sure then what these points are for. I have more than enough to buy every tree in the store. I'm accumulating points with no real goal anymore. Wish I could plants real trees again.
developerResponse: {'id': 2650205, 'body': 'Hello, since the cost of planting real trees is donated by us, we have to limit the amount of real trees every user can plant otherwise we will be running out of budget soon and forced to halt the tree-planting campaign. We hope you can understand. Forest', 'modified': '2018-02-22T11:06:27Z'}

title: Motivating!
review:
Definitely helped me stay on track while studying or focusing in school. Wish I discovered this sooner! 

Knowing that I’ll kill a plant if I exit the app is super tragic lol. I get excited to see my weekly results because you get this overview of how many plants you’ve grown. Also love how much it tells me I’ve studied daily, weekly, monthly!

title: Good app but a paid app shouldn’t have microtransactions
review: I paid for this app, but unlocking new trees is agonizingly slow (like you have to use it for months to unlock a single new tree species) and not a fun process….unless you PAY to speed up progress. No thank you. This app should be free if you’re going to have to pay to unlock content. It’s fine if you just use it as a time management app, but not fun if you want to experience all this app has to offer. Do not recommend getting it.
developerResponse: {'id': 31357130, 'body': 'Hi there, sorry if any inconvenience is caused. However, as independent developers, we have to strive hard for the operation of Forest app. In order to provide better services and operation as well as for the long-term product plan, Forest is currently a paid app on App Store and in-app purchase is also implemented but not mandatory, hope you understand. Forest is designed to encourage users to stay away from their phones when focusing, and thus, we develop the coin mechanism where users can use their hard-earned coins to unlock the pretty trees to flourish their Forests. Thank you so much for the feedback. We will forward your request to our internal and see if any adjustment to the current coin mechanism can be done in future updates. :)', 'modified': '2022-08-09T07:36:59Z'}

title: Great app but I wish they would implement more features
review: The trees are very pretty but I really wish that I could have the option to plant one tree at a time. How do I only plant one tree at a time for the 4 stage trees? I want the beautiful last stage of the tree without having four of the same trees there. It doesn’t make much sense to me that in order for me to get one tree in the last stage I’m forced to plant 4?

title: In-game currency is ridiculous
review: I really appreciate the app it helps a ton. I wish the ‘coins’ came faster. I think it’s pretty harsh to have to use the app for 10+ hours just to be able to purchase one of the cheapest trees available in the store.  That would really approve the app for me if the things in the store were attainable without spending extra money for more coins

title: :( exclusive trees
review: I love this app and usually buy gems and stuff just to support it but i’ve missed a lot of the exclusive or limited release trees due to glitches. it would be nice if they were added to the store after all the app is about focus and we should be able to do that with any tree that helps us to be productive!

title: This is very useful!
review: I love doing this with study groups because it helps keep everyone in the group focused. I love seeing my forest grow. It is so tempting to use my phone when my timer is on but I have to focus on my assignment or else my plant will die and I’ll be charged 60 coins to get the dead plant out of my forest. Overall, great way to focus.

title: Study break
review: This app really helps me put down my phone to focus on homework. I thought I had a lot of self control until I started my online classes. I would sit for hours “trying” to do my homework but only getting distracted with things like facebook, and text messages. With this app I can now put my phone down and make sure I do my homework.

title: Cute app!! Need more discipline
review: It’s a super cute app that lets me set it aside however long I want to study in college.  A little more discipline comes in where you can turn off and on the setting whether you can leave the app or not and do other stuff so it’s easy to want to turn it off and let it go in the background.  I can’t figure out how to unlock the other “classic” trees so hopefully I can figure that out soon.

title: So Helpful
review: This app is really helpful for me as I am a serious procrastinator! I especially love the feature to do this with friends as it is a tool my fellow student friends and I can use to focus together while not together.  Only complaint is that creating rooms can be difficult with what appears to be a lag in app response time? Regardless, this is sort of a tangible way to get a hold on the time I focus per day and I love the concept!

title: Super helpful for staying on task
review: I actually DO have the time to accomplish what I need to do, I just don’t use it productively. This silly little addictive phone throws me off track more than I’d like to admit but growing my forest is motivating and helping me establish better habits so I can keep hustling. I appreciate it. It’s also easy to use, cute, simple, and reliable. Great app for productivity and crushing goals with focus.

title: Love this app
review: Wow this app has been revolutionary for my nursing school career. I just graduated with my BSN and this app was super helpful in helping me to focus when I needed to most. I still plan on using it to spend more quality time focusing on studying for my license exam and during other times when I want to stay focused on those around me. Also what a good cause to help the planet! All around win win!

title: Pretty good Idea! But stingy!
review: I love the idea of this app, it makes it easier to study and it kind of makes not using your phone feel like a game. Its a three star though because I payed to get the app and there’s more in app purchases! Every time you unlock a new tree the price (the game coins) for all the trees goes up like 100 or 200 coins and you’re stuck with the same boring trees forever unless you buy them with real money. They need to pick reasonable prices for the trees and keep it that way.
developerResponse: {'id': 8935980, 'body': "Hi,\nAs long as you plant trees regularly in Forest, there is no need to spend real money since you'll have enough coins to purchase new species. Nevertheless, we will consider modifying the formula of earning coins in future updates. You can also earn extra rewards by unlocking achievements. Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions or suggestions! :) Forest", 'modified': '2019-05-30T13:11:17Z'}

title: Amazing and helps me stay focused!!!
review: This app really has helped me stay focused and continue to study and do work without getting distracted. The concept is amazing since who wants to be a tree killer lol. I’m so happy I’ve been using this app for over a year now and recommend it to anyone who gets distracted easily on their phone and wants to become a more disciplined and proactive person.

title: Makes use of your brain’s reward systems!
review:
I can not recommend this form of procrastination deterrent enough. Rewarding you with points is a good mechanism to abide by the rules of the no-touch game. If you have a hard time keeping off your phone, I recommend this app. Try the desktop version too! 

My recommendation to the creators would be to create larger time durations. I like a challenge. ;)

title: Great motivator
review: This app is not the silver bullet for productivity, but it has been one of the greatest enhancers for motivation. There is a special feeling when you look over the past month and see a virtual forest full of trees. Also if you are committed to reach it the coin amount you can help plant trees just by being productive. This app has been a real help to me in the past several months.

title: Cute and helpful app!
review: This app has been great for my productivity! I’m a compulsive phone-checker, and will often waste hours playing around on my phone. With this app, I plant a tree and know I will be productive (or at least find another way to goof off...) ;) for at least that long. The little trees are so cute that I want to see them grow and earn coins to buy more! Highly recommended!

title: Money to get more coins
review:
The app is great and does a great job in getting me to just do things without always checking my phone.
I wish the rewards had a lot more to them because it feels like it’ll take a while before I get a lot of shrubs or even before I get any songs. I don’t think everything should be priced at 500 coins. Maybe songs can be 200 and shrubs can be 100, some trees 300 and then 500+ for special trees.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4501704, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app
feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-08-02T13:48:59Z'}

title: Simple app to get me super motivated
review: I love Forest! It really encourages me to focus because of the good incentive- grow a tree give a tree. I haven’t used other focusing apps, but I find this one very simple and straightforward, also it’s fun to grow my own forest. I like that you can adjust your own time limit. I highly recommend this to anyone who needs encouragement to stay off of their phone and to study.

title: Needs more color
review: I for one love this game and it's helped me so much with getting work done, from exercise to study. I love the accomplishment of having more trees than my friends. But the one thing the game is lacking is color. I would love an update for the fall where the leaves changed color, and the same for the winter. And maybe have some forest animals in there too maybe?

title: Wonderful for studying
review: Keeps me from using my phone while studying for school and working on projects. I love all the plants you can choose from and it helps me remember to focus on what I need to be doing. I like that it shows the different sections you’ve focused on and how much time you have focused overall.

title: It’s really cute and effective
review: I don’t necessarily struggle with studying as much as I struggle with staying focused whilst working. I got this app at the recommendation of a friend and it’s really fun to use whenever I’m studying with friends or YouTubers (I watch Justxn). Setting deep study mode is by far the best thing since your tree will die if you leave the app and your forest will ha e dead trees in it.

title: Love this app
review: Helps everyone being motivate and concentrate. Also you stop using your phone. The best part is planting a real tree 🌲 🌳 for future with every 2500 point that you can easily gather in a week of work or studying. It’s worth the money you pay. I just hope the really plant the real tree when you gather 2500 point.

title: Amazing and helpful!
review: I used to always be on my phone playing games like.. don’t judge me... blob runner... until one day I found this game and I absolutely feel in love with the demos at the bottom, I needed to get it. Now the present day I have the app and I went from using my phone 24/7 to only a few hours at most. ^-^

title: Makes it fun to focus and stay away from my phone
review: I’ve always struggled using focus timers, but with this app it makes it exciting to step away from my phone and get lost into studying or whatever I’m focusing on. I love seeing how much my little plant has grown and expanding my garden. The only focus timer I’ll ever use again.

title: Please include pause function
review: Love this app and design!! My only complaint is that I wish you could have a pause option because I often plan to work for two hours but unexpected things happen in the middle of a session, so I let it run even though I was not working on the task. Flora also has this function, and I am still toggling between the two when recommending apps to friends. Thank you!
developerResponse: {'id': 21157609, 'body': 'Hello,\nThank you for your feedback. We will forward your suggestion to our team.', 'modified': '2021-02-19T07:40:39Z'}

title: Love this app
review: I seriously love this app. When I need to study, or am in class I turn it on and it helps me stay focused. I don’t want to kill a tree and I want a happy forest like so many others I can’t get myself to use my phone. I enjoy this app a lot and it’s super handy for students, I would suggest everyone try it at some point.

title: A game changer
review: I have ADHD. This is a very helpful tool to keep me on track. Absolutely fabulous. I love how you can chose to enter deep-focus where if you exit out of the app to use your phone your plant will die. That’s some motivation right there! Also the time remaining will count down so you can tell yourself- ah- just 19 more mins, etc. Wonderful.

title: Great App!
review: I actually downloaded this app a while back but as of recently I’d been utilizing it and it’s proven to have great benefits especially for a huge procrastinator like myself. I also really love the design and graphics is an easy to use app and it’s clean cut there isn’t too many buttons so the when you open the app there isn’t too many distractions.

title: Cute, fun, still confused
review:
Still navigating the app. I am still trying to figure out how I help make a real difference. It’s not very clear. 

Not sure if you are planting a real tree every time you focus and plant your virtual tree, or if you need to make an actual monetary purchase in the store, or if when you use the coins made (by planting trees) in the store you are planting a real tree. 

Due to this confusion that’s why I rate this 4 stars instead of 5.

title: Honestly one of the first apps to help me
review: I’ve tried a lot of productivity apps in the past and had a hard time sticking with them. But lordt help me if I’m killing a tiny pixel tree just to scroll Instagram. If you are hesitant to pay for an app like this, I promise you’re paying with the free ones too, just in other ways. This one is worth it. Four stars because I want the fancy trees but they have to be unlocked with in game currency.

title: Fun to use
review: The app is good for keeping you on track, and off your phone when you need to be focusing. So congrats it does what it’s designed to do. I think it could put better sounds to listen to in the app, that’s why I didn’t give it 5 stars. Most of the sounds seem like they are meant for sleeping. Not necessarily something I would want in the back ground when I need to focus, sleeping definitely, focusing not so much.

title: Great Concept
review: I strongly recommend Forest over Apple’s built-in Screen Time feature. When I was using Screen Time, the limits often felt too restrictive on some days, and useless on other days. However, Forest helps you stay focused and be present, whenever it is needed. Definitely recommend for those who prefer spontaneity and focus in their lives

title: So far so good!
review: I have a hard time keeping focus. After a few attempts at finding something that will work for me a tad better than your typical pomodoro, this seems to be the one! It would have been perfect for me with the white list implementation, but there’s no point penalizing the developers for apple’s weird lockdown on their OS features. Thanks for making an awesome app!

title: really great app, cool idea
review: I just downloaded Forest and I really like it and think it’s such a cool idea. However, I wish there was a way you could click to hide the timer counting down while you’re growing a tree. Sometimes I just want to check in and watch the little tree and listen to the rain sounds without looking at how much time has gone by or is left.

title: Thank you for helping me focus, forest!
review:
The cute little trees and plants are a cute digital “reward” for studying. I like the feeling that I have when I’ve finished study sessions with this app. 

The deep focus mode is good for not allowing you to be on your phone. And the adjustable study timer is nice. 

It’s rewarding to have a visual log like this to show your progress and effort, and it encourages moving forward.

title: Love this app
review: This app is great if you have trouble staying focused and your able to leave the app without your tree dying if you like. But if you are trying to stay off your phone you can put a setting for that too. I love this app and would highly recommend it especially if your in school and trying to stay focused on your homework.

title: Helps me study
review: I have trouble focusing on studying sometimes and this app has kept me on track better than a regular timer. It prevents me from wanting to pick my phone up so I can get coins to plant an actual tree and helps improve my focus! I highly recommend it to any college student in need of a way to stay on task and away from distractions like technology...

title: Great App! ✨
review: I use this app often during the school year when completing homework, a project, etc. Even though I usually am good at staying focused, this app insures I'm not going on my phone for too long. The more coins you get from time focused, the closer you are to planting a real life tree. Now just doing something as simple as focusing on your work can help then environment a little. :)

title: This app is everything I didn’t know I needed.
review: I don’t write reviews for apps normally, but I really truly love this app. It’s the only productivity app that I’ve found actually works, because even if I do want to go on my phone before the timer is out, I don’t have the heart to kill my little tree to do so. I also love that the app has a real world impact as well. Truly worth every penny.

title: I love it :) a suggestion!
review:
Thank you for making this app! I love cultivating my forest as I cultivate my mind and work. 

One thing I would suggest is to allow us to plant the full 2-hour version tree if we achieve 4 consecutive 25 minute focus blocks. I like to break mmy focus time up into blocks, so I don't want to set the Forest timer to lock my phone for a full 2 hours. But I would really like to see the beautiful full pictures of trees!

Thanks so much!

title: So far so good!
review: It took me a while to get into using it, but I have been trying to use it regularly for a few days and it has really been improving my productivity! I do wish it was a little easier to get coins or purchase upgrades though. The standard plants get a little boring quickly! Otherwise really enjoying it so far. :-)

title: It works!
review: This app is awesome and adorable. It actually works!!! No joke. Whenever I set the timer, it really does help me be away from my phone for that time and do work more effectively. I feel motivated to let my trees grow (the sight of them dead is just so devastating), then collect coins to buy new trees. This is definitely the most effective way I’ve found to help curb my phone distractions!

title: I love it!
review: This app really helps! It’s good for helping to block out times of studying, and you get a cute little tree or bush afterward! With the designs, it kind of encourages you to work in even just slightly larger chunks to get that cooler looking tree than what the smaller chunks of time offer. Forest has really helped me be more productive- I feel like I’ve actually done something when I use it!

title: Great if you are a competitive person
review: If you are competitive, get this app and get your friends hooked on it. During exam season it’s really motivating to see how much (or how little) you have achieved in a day. Also, the fact that I would never kill a tree to check Instagram means that the work I do is always 100% focused. Thank you to the app creators - I won’t fail my exams!

title: BUY NOW
review: I am a high school student and i use this app frequently when i have to read and annotate large amounts of text. it does a great job of ensuring my focus so that i can maximize productivity and efficiency when reading. it certainly helps manage time for studying and it also allows the user to give back to the environment while doing so. 5 star rating from me!

title: Great app
review:
Great app for motivating you on not using your phone while you study/work. Daily streaks and incentives (like being able to earn enough points to have an actual tree be grown in Africa) really gets you to use the app more.
One thing I would improve on the app is it being more apple music friendly, it would be great to be able to quickly change songs you’re studying to while on the app.
developerResponse:
{'id': 6389313, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app
feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-12-14T15:08:51Z'}

title: Great for focusing
review:
I love how it lets you customize the quotes, and it somewhat motivating. It’s cute, and I’ve been studying a lot more than I used to. A great idea and creation. Love.

Edit: I will start a tree, and close my phone, and then when I open it back up it’ll go to my home screen, then I’ll open the app after it said my tree has grown, and it didn’t grow?? But I pressed start. Very weird.
developerResponse: {'id': 5435024, 'body': 'Hi,\nSorry to hear this is happening.\nPlease provide us the details and the screenshots of the problem via our in-app feedback system. We will look into this issue. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-10-10T06:57:25Z'}

title: Love this app
review: It’s is worth the price. It definitely keeps me from procrastinating, and I have already noticed that I have been more productive since I got the app. It shows all of your progress, and gives even gives you incentive by giving you more coins when you work longer, that you can spend on unlocking more trees and even planting real trees.

title: Positive reinforcement to stay productive
review: It’s proven science that positive reinforcement is the best way to develop a habit. I’ve been using this app for several months, more actively this last couple of months to write my thesis, and I’m now in the habit of using it every day to stay productive and it works. You’d think that “killing” your virtual trees would not be enough incentive to not play with your phone, but it is!

title: helpful for staying dedicated & managing time
review: this app is super helpful for staying focused on my work.  It has a ‘deep focus’ mode, which forces you to stay in the app until your work time is over.  The timer helps me work in concentrated sessions, take breaks, and gage how long tasks should take.  there’s no annoying kinks and the app does as promised.

title: Surprisingly great and helpful
review: I was skeptical at first but someone recommended this app and I decided to give it a shot. My phone is normally a huge distraction during studying / work but this made it much easier to focus. Seeing your trees grow and competing with friends is more motivating than I would have expected. 5/5!

title: Would love to be able to answer calls
review: I understand it may be an Apple/privacy issue, but it would be fantastic to be able to answer calls without losing progress. Maybe an option to add exceptions so that you lose the time but not the tree? I love this app. Haven’t been able to use my watch with it, but I still love it.
developerResponse: {'id': 26520891, 'body': 'Hi there,\r\nThank you for the feedback. Though as mentioned in the App Store, we cannot detect which app the user is using because of the limitation of the iOS system, and therefore we are unable to implement the App Allow List feature in the iOS version. As a workaround, we\'ve made the "Deep focus mode" which, when disabled, enables users to use other apps while planting. It can be found at the top of the main page. :)', 'modified': '2021-11-29T02:16:27Z'}

title: Looking to increase your productivity, this is a gamechanger
review: This app is wonderful as it helps you practice the pomodoro technique as well as have a sense of immediate gratification after it has been done. Would highly recommend it if you are trying to improve your focus and depth/quality of your work.

title: Best app for studying
review: So I haven’t had this app for very long but something I love about it is that it allows me to focus on my work because it won’t let me close out of the app without my tree dying. One thing I struggle with is focusing for more than 30 minutes and this app has really help keep me on track.

title: Amazing
review: I’m a huge procrastinator & it’s usually because I’m on my phone. This app has actually helped me stay clean off my phone and study. I love that it has an adjustable timer so if you only want to take it slow and study uninterrupted for 10 minutes, you can. Plus growing the forest is fun. Amazing app overall !

title: Forest App is Awesome
review: This app really helps me get off my phone and accomplish the tasks needed to be done. When I turn the timer on, I can’t leave the app which forces me to not go on social media and get my work done. Without this app I would not have gotten half of my work done in the amount of time I actually did it.

title: Keeps Me Productive
review: Whenever I use Forest it always helps me to stay off my phone when doing schoolwork or heading to sleep. It helps with my self control and I would recommend spending the small amount of money on this app, totally worth it. You don’t know how much you need it until you have it!

title: 3 yrs l8r
review:
I downloaded this app in 2017 back when it was free & have been using it religiously since, I am a nursing student so my classes requires hours of studying but I struggled with staying focused. Since using this app, I went from studying 3ish hours a day to 10+ hrs a day! 

Only requests: more color options for tags, bring back the cakes!

title: I love it
review: Trust me I’m a pro at procrastinating so I downloaded this app to help me out and it sure did not disappoint. There are so many beautiful trees to chose from; however, they’re not free but it makes me want to keep staying in focus to earn more coins in order to buy more trees. You should really download if you’re a pro procrastinator like me who want to fix this horrible habit.

title: My Forest Review
review: This app is amazing!! I bought it on the app store yesterday so I can stay focused all year on my school work for Online school and it really worked I did 5 hours of non-stop homework because of this app so thank you!! 5 star rating from me! ❤️ I will make sure to use this app a lot now. I totally recommend it

title: Great app!
review: I’ve had it forever but never used it really much. Then I watched a YT video of a girl using this app, and I start “planting”. Honestly, it’s kinda fun to stay focused now because I can see my progress. I don’t even have to focus for a long time like a fee hours. I can do like 15 mins of focus, and step away, and then come back to it. It’s fun to study and work this way

title: Great App for Focusing
review: I love this app for helping me stay off my phone. The first time that I used this app, I checked a text message while my tree was growing. When I went back to the app, my tree had died. After that, I made sure to not mess with my phone while being productive. It really helps if you are one that wants to have an incentive for being productive!

title: Great app! :)
review: I recently bought this app because I want to become more focused and on task with my work and with school. I’m really not great at setting boundaries for myself when it comes to my phone, so this app is really great. I like the sound feature that lets you listen to rain. It’s all around so cute and I wish that I had found out about it earlier.

title: I love the concept
review: It’s an amazing app and it really does motivate you to get your work done, I just wish there was a way that it could complete block everything off until the time was up. I understand that’s not possible but it’s just something that I can’t help but mention! Overall, a great app and definitely worth the price!

title: It’s ok
review: I like that it keeps track of the cumulative time so I can look back and see how much I have worked this week. I don’t like that it’s only in 25 minute increments. I want to be able to change it based on how I am feeling that day. I like that they have messages of encouragement. Part of my interest in the app was that you could block your phone and I’ve followed the instructions on how to do it but I can’t. Maybe it’s because my phone is really old.
developerResponse:
{'id': 15903854, 'body': 'Hi there, 
Thank you for your support! 
Please contact us via our in-app feedback system and we will be able to assist you further. :)
To visit our in-app feedback system, please go to Settings and enter our FAQ first. 
Once there, please tap on the top-right icon and you should be able to contact us. Thank you and sorry for the inconvenience.

-Forest ', 'modified': '2020-06-10T14:35:34Z'}

title: Cute and effective
review: The little sayings are nice reminders to keep off your phone. Once you’re finished with your task you’re rewarded with a fully grown tree. If you exit from the app (or cut it before the task is completed) your tree dies, and you’ll have a dead tree in your forest. After completing multiple tasks you’ll see a forest full of them. It sounds silly but it’s oddly motivational!

title: Helps me stay focused
review: I love Forest because it truly does help me stay focused. I use it when I am filling out my planner, have a pressing deadline at work and when I am in lecture. The app keeps me focused on what I am doing and stops me from getting distracted. When I set the time, I know that there’s no point in going for my phone until I get the notification that I’ve planted new trees!

title: Super Useful!
review: I have been using this app for over 4 month and already have grown over 200 trees. This app is so helpful to not waste time and make sure I stay focused because if i leave the app my cute little tree dies, but if I do my work and not use my phone the sapling becomes a mighty oak! 100% worth the small price of the app for the huge amount of time I saved!

title: My favorite study tool
review: I absolutely love this app, I am the world’s worst procrastinator and out of everything I’ve tried, this has proven to be the most effective, time after time! Also love the intention and motive of planting real trees, it just adds to my love for this app. Would recommend to anyone who struggles with concentration, or just wants a better, more efficient way to study.

title: Worth It!
review: It’s a win-win situation! I study and then a tree is planted. Definitely worth the money, especially because I’m a huge procrastinator. The deep-focus mode is especially helpful. Sometimes mid study I just go on my phone and my homework ends up unfinished and late or I’m unprepared for a test (it’s extra hard for me because I care about my grades way too much). Thank you Forest!

title: Love this app!!
review: Just knowing I have a little tree depending on me to survive as long as I stay focus and study is enough to keep me going. Simple to use/user friendly and a lot of wonderful little trees and bushes to choose from I absolutely just LOVE THIS APP and helps me stay off my phone and just focus. Even if I just want to watch a tv show uninterrupted it works. Don’t hesitate get the app now.

title: Lifesaver for any person striving to be productive!
review: I'm a freshman in university so it's hard to study let alone concentrate since I am barely learning what study methods are right for me. This app has helped me visually see my productivity but also appreciate my work more without procrastinating or getting distracted. Would recommend this app for college students like me who struggle to concentrate!

title: Definitely recommend
review: This is one of the few apps that keep me on task and off of my phone, and being someone who works well in a work environment this apps makes any environment into a work one very easily. The only complaint I have is that on androids the app is free but switching to an apple phone recently and having to pay was something I really complemented on doing but I know that for me it will pay off.

title: Great for phone detox!
review:
I am sure that I am not alone in becoming addicted to my phone. I use it for games, entertainment, and social media. I feel that I waste most of my day on trivial activities on my phone. 

I use the Forest app to be more productive, and I love the customization of planting and unlocking different kinds of trees. It was a life saver while I was in college. I can’t recommend it enough!

title: Cute trees make me happy
review: I really like how the tree dies if you pick up your phone. It’s extra satisfying to grow a mini forest after a work session. My favorite thing is how you write what you did AFTER the tree has grown. I have a bad habit of obsessing over things I haven’t done, and this helps me focus on work, and then feel accomplished when I look back. Highly recommend!

title: I’m so surprised
review: Ok so I will honestly say that I am so surprised at how much this app has helped me. It really has kept me away from my phone and on top of it the rainforest rain sound is amazing and really helps me stay focused and block out all other noises. Definitely recommend it to those who are having a hard time focusing on homework and tend to focus more on social media.

title: Essential tool for productivity
review:
Matched with an ad-less music services, this app is absolutely essential for my productivity. Without it I end up getting extremely unmotivated and undisciplined, but with the app I can know honestly how much I’ve actually been producing something. 
Best of all, it’s free!!
BTW it’s also great that you can quickly respond to a notification without ruining it

title: Really helpful for avoiding the urge for distraction
review: This app helped me notice that when I’m working, I often tend to turn to my phone the moment my work makes me feel uncomfortable.  It’s so automatic I don’t even realize I’m doing it.  This app helps me be more aware and realize that distracting myself with my phone doesn’t actually help me.  It’s also so cute and feels good to grow trees!

title: Helpful
review: I’m awful about using my phone to procrastinate. This app is a nice way to prevent that with a little extra incentive. It’s easy and straightforward to use, and I often use it to get myself not to pick up my phone when I’m trying to sleep. There’s a nice, small, selection of sounds you can play as well. The forest rain is great when trying to fall asleep.

title: Speeding the process
review: I believe this app to be amazing! In my personal opinion, I feel strongly towards the helpfulness of this app! A simple reading that would take me two hours or three to finish due to procrastinating, was cut into 35 minutes because of this app!! I simply turn it on focus on my reading, finish and have more time to write papers. As a college student this app is a must have!

title: Great for studying for exams!
review: I’ve been using this while studying for the bar exam. It’s the only thing that helps keep me away from distractions during marathon study days! Earning coins, buying new trees, and planting colorful virtual gardens/forests makes it feel like a game. Love that you can sync up with friends to help keep you accountable. My study group & I “go into the forest” together for virtual study sessions!

title: Forest changed the way I work for the better
review: The app design is beautiful and it’s never worked anything but perfectly. Using it for focus sessions has helped me start to actually get stuff done and pairs perfectly with the Pomodoro technique. Love being able to create my own categories and filter my forests to see how I’m spending my time. Can not WAIT to unlock more trees!

title: Really helps me focus
review: The accumulation of trees and gentle ability to compete against friends/other users is really motivational for me in terms of setting up this focus time. I have a bad habit of checking my phone frequently throughout the day, using it to procrastinate on work and entertain me when I’m bored of focusing. This app is a really helpful solution to motivate me back in the right direction!

title: Maybe I’m missing something
review:
The main thing to focus on is to put your phone in silence or do not disturb and don’t get distracted by notifications. But then I cannot hear the app for my breaks and keep the productivity high or to set another time to work.
Besides that it will be great to have an app for Mac. Than maybe I will be notified according to pomodoro technique.
You guys had a great ideia with this gaming achievements. But there is some points that I mentioned above that could be improved in my opinion. Thanks
developerResponse:
{'id': 4640176, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-08-14T03:44:21Z'}

title: Turns studying into a game!
review: This app invokes a competitive instinct that makes it effortless to avoid looking at your phone, because if you do – you lose! For me, this kind of challenge is almost a necessity for motivation, and this app has totally achieved the feat of placing a sort of game-like challenge into whatever it is you should be doing other than looking at your phone.

title: Productivity godsend
review: I love this app! Is it possible to be addicted to an app that makes you keep your phone down? My only qualm is that the Planter achievements don’t seem to be accurately counting my time. I’ve successfully planted 51 hours worth of trees, but it says I’ve only done one days worth. Perhaps it’s only counting hours and not hours and minutes? I would also love a quick place to check how long total I have used the app.
developerResponse: {'id': 2681283, 'body': 'Hello, we would want to invite you to contact us by our built-in feedback system so that we can help solve the problem for you. We apologize for the inconvenience. Forest', 'modified': '2018-02-26T14:19:48Z'}

title: Really beautiful app
review: So helpful and useful! I love all the additions -- it's clear that they work very hard on this app. There are tons of new trees and features that have been added since I first checked it out. (I hope that someday we will be able to buy different types of ground, too -- can you imagine having a sandy beach under your palm trees? Cute!) Keep up the great work!!!

title: Break Option?
review: The app is brilliant, but why isn't there a break option while the timer is going? I should be able to do homework, set the timer and have a limited number (maybe 2) of breaks. Because we all take breaks and this apps ours our productivy into kind of a tangible form and it's not truely a visual representation of how much we focus if we take a 5 or 10 minute break but it doesn't say that that we did because we didn't have an option to. Feel me
developerResponse:
{'id': 2173678, 'body': "Hello,
We'll consider implementing this feature in the future updates. 
Thanks for the feedback.
Please feel free to contact us if you have further questions or suggestions. Forest", 'modified': '2018-01-01T11:29:29Z'}

title: Please come to MAC!!!!!
review: This app is well amazing. A lifeline. But please please please come to mac! I don’t use chrome for many reasons. Please! The use of a phone to set up distribution timers is kinda useless when your work is on laptop or desktop. It just adds to the risk of distractions by having to open my phone. Please bring to Mac!

title: AMAZING!
review: I truly do love this app! It’s help me put into perspective how much time I really spend using my phone instead of being present in the moment. It’s also been a godsend as I’ve been studying for board exams. As an added bonus, I’ve already acquired enough coins to plant my first real tree and am close to a second one!!

title: Love this app!
review: It’s so good for helping me study. I have had issues being on my phone too much and this app helps so much because if you leave the app you kill your tree. I know it sounds silly but it gives you a little something to look forward to when you are done studying !

title: Perfect!
review:
Helps me focus on studying for my final exams ! I’m a junior this year and seeing the cute little plants and earning “coins” to buy more plants encourages me to study longer. 
There’s also a setting where you if you leave the app you’ll fail growing the tree! Which helps for focusing on books or paper homework.
Excellent app!

title: Very Nice
review: I enjoy seeing how much my forest grows. I like how you can have it leave the app and not kill the tree because when I’m ‘resting’ it’s a good timer, but I might want to play a game. Or when I’m studying I might have to look something up. I do keep it pulled up anyway for it’s little encouragements to stay off of the phone.

title: Great App
review:
I have a tendency to grab my phone for a quick second, then look up from the screen 2 hours later wondering what happened.

Fortunately, this app has been helping me to be more singleminded during tasks that require focus. I also enjoy that it has different rewards to unlock, so there’s always a new challenge to conquer.

title: Loving it
review: I am loving the app so far I’ve had for a couple of days now and seeing my little tree grow as I am doing a task and putting on the timer and helping me keep in focus of the task I am doing. I am in love with this app it helps me manage my time and when it comes to studying I look back and noticed that I have not looked at my phone since I started.

title: This helps so much
review: This app really helped me, its sad to admit but I’m sorta kinda addicted to my phone. This app lets me set a timer for sometime that I need to spend on school work or just time for me to read, it mutes my notifications which is so good because when I get a notification I am so tempted to look at it but with this app I don’t even know I got it. I HIGHLY recommend this app, LOVE IT!

title: Really works!
review: The tree dies if you leave the app. It’s that simple! There is no magic cure to procrastination or distraction and the only way to focus is to use your own willpower. This app is a tool that provides an incentive to have that willpower. I love to watch my forest grow with all different trees and i love that I can have a visual representation of all my productivity. 5/5! Put on a playlist, plant a tree, and get busy!

title: Do good, well. Must download.
review:
Forest has allowed me to enhance the time I spend on projects. By focusing in Pomodoro style, I am much more productive. Knowing that every time I complete my forest I am contributing to something tangible and GOOD gives me a good feeling. I appreciate what the team at Forest has built here.

This is a must download for anybody who is ready to challenge their ability to remain in the present.

title: Useful
review: Honestly, I really like this app. If I’m inclined to waste time, it gives me the push I need to just put my phone down. I choose my time, and my incentive is to not let a little fake tree die. The plants are saved by the day, week, month, and year, so if you let a plant die, it stays with you forever (seemingly). I’m a new-but user, but I haven’t found any problems yet.

title: Only way I’ve found to study!
review: Phones are such a distraction now and this is the only way I have been able to pass my classes. Love the virtual forest concept and the real trees you can plant as well as the optional sounds and motivational writing. Just wish coins could be earned around 1 coin every two minutes rather than 1 coin every three minutes.

title: Amazing
review: This really does work great to keep me from playing on my phone when I need to focus on my work. I know I could just stop the app and not care but you really do start to care about your tree and don’t want to kill it! If you have a hard time getting off your phone while studying, then I seriously recommend this app for you!

title: An invaluable aid for any students trying to focus
review: I’ve been using this app basically every day for almost a year and a half now, and it’s completely changed how I study. I recommend this to every college and high school student who feels like they’re having trouble focusing as they work. An incredible app and definitely worth the money!

title: Helps me focus, rewards are nice
review: This app definitely has increased my productivity and is worth the low price. It’s nice to have a pomodoro app that tries to stop you from using your phone when you need to focus rather than just serving as a timer. The rewards are also nice and help motivate me to keep using the app since I like to use the app’s white noise sounds while I work.

title: Bought it for my iPad
review: This is a great app. I really like the way the settings and options within the app. The only thing is that I can seem to adapt to using this app in my iPad because I always have it connected to a keyboard which is seen in landscape mode. Well this app is not in landscape mode so, my head tilts every time I have to use it. But, I am sure it will come with the updates soon. Keep up the great work!
developerResponse: {'id': 7304457, 'body': "Hi,\nThanks for the positive feedback! We will further improve Forest overtime. Don't hesitate to contact us via our in-app feedback system if there is anyother questions! :) Forest", 'modified': '2019-02-15T01:33:31Z'}

title: One of the most important apps I’ve ever downloaded
review:
Very few apps in the world are a net-positive on your productivity. That being, said, this one is. It’s simplicity is incredible, but more important than that, it works. 

If you legitimately want to take your time, focus and attention back from the thousands of distractions present on your cellphone, download this app and do what it says.

title: Seems simplistic, but fills a need well
review:
I wouldn’t have thought that “giving up” or killing/ growing an animated tree on an app would be an actual lasting boundary to prevent me from thinking twice or three times about whether I really need to use my phone but it does! 
I also like how this defaults to 25 min chunks of time (like the pomodoro technique)- good for being more accountable to my tasks.

title: Charming and effective!
