review: I love this app so much! It works much better for me than traditional pomodoro / timer task apps. It's helped me be more productive at work and more mindful at social events. I also really enjoy the art in the app. The trees and bushes are cute, which motivates me to look back on the last week or month's accomplishments because I can see all the little cats and octopuses and coconut trees at once.

title: Lacks auto break and watch controls
review: I absolutely love this for the motivation and ambient sounds it provides. But I’m pretty disappointed that it doesn’t automatically begin the next round or let you control the planting and from the apple watch. If they could add these features, this would be by far one of my favorite apps. I had this expectation because it said it followed the pomodoro method. Which it does, but many other pomodoro apps provide these features.
developerResponse: {'id': 2557235, 'body': 'Hello, it is currently not possible to launch apps on the phone with the Apple Watch. Even if users plant down a tree directly on the Apple Watch, he or she can still use their phone, which violates the main concept of Forest. And we will consider adding an auto break/start. Thank you for the suggestion! Forest', 'modified': '2018-02-12T06:30:39Z'}

title: Totally worth more than 99¢
review:
I love having a reason to put down my phone and focus on the things around me, and growing a beautiful digital garden is just the reason I need. 

I especially like the "white noise" sounds that help me focus even more.

It's a flexible app which you can use in multiple ways, even working with your cell phone if you need to.

title: I love this gamifying app
review: It’s really satisfying to watch the image change as the work block continues. And, you can modify how many minutes the work block is!! When you finish a work block, you get points which allow you to unlock more plants. It’s an intuitive app. Thank you, Forest Team!!

title: Great for procrastinators and easily distracted people (like me)
review: I’m loving this app so far. I’m really happy that I’m able to even study with my friends and stay focused when usually I would get distracted by a bunch of things. I’ve been working on using some new study techniques, and this has really helped me jumpstart it!!

title: Amazingly Effective
review: This app is a great way to help keep me focused when I need to get work done. My only complaint is that our forest is never “full.” Like no matter how many trees I plant there will always be open spaces. I wish they would pack the trees in more tightly before they expand the forest. Other then that, though, you should definitely download this app!
developerResponse: {'id': 24376948, 'body': 'Hi, thank you so much for your support and suggestion! We will relay your request to our team. Have a nice day. :)', 'modified': '2021-08-08T09:32:37Z'}

title: College Procrastination
review:
Thanks to COVID, all my freshman college courses are online, and procrastination has been the devil on my shoulder. 

This app has helped me eliminate my procrastination, and I didn’t realize how much my cellphone was distracting me. The feature of “deep study mode” kills the tree you’re attempting to grow if you leave the app, and the stress of accidentally leaving the app is surprisingly immaculate. I spend less time thinking about going on social media, and more time focusing on growing my tree. 

It’s also allowed me to grow the tree, and reward myself further with a timed break the app suggests. 

This is the first review I’ve ever typed, I get a sea coral tree from typing a review, I’m pumped.

title: Amazing App
review: Loveee this app. I used it in undergrad, studying for the LSAT, and now law school. I love the feature that allows you to change it from being able to access other apps while focusing. Definitely a great app to use to focus in general.  I recommend this app to my friends all the time. Definitely worth it!

title: Stop requiring the phone’s passcode to be enabled!
review: I got this app to use for motivation to stay off my phone when studying. However, it only allows the deep focus setting if a passcode is turned on for your phone. If I had known this I never would have paid for the app. This should either provide the ability to select this feature and override the need for enabling your phone’s passcode or this should be made apparent on the app page. If not for this I would rate the app five stars, but for me this renders it useless.
developerResponse: {'id': 16791956, 'body': 'Hi,\r\nRegarding data access, we do not use it for commercial. Forest requires permission just to ensure that "Deep Focus Mode" can run smoothly when users open apps that are not in the whitelist.\r\nDeep Focus Mode is developed because of the update of iOS and Android System which makes trees die for no reason, or not die while users use other apps.', 'modified': '2020-07-22T00:43:47Z'}

title: Close to being a great app (not yet)
review:
The app is well designed and aesthetically pleasing. However, the default settings seem to suggest that this app is advocating for the pomodoro method (25 minutes of focus and 5 minutes of rest), but locks the highest tiers of a planted tree behind a non-stop 2 hour focus session.

Perhaps there’s another way for pomodoro method users to earn the most developed trees, but I, as a user, can’t seem to find out how.

title: Needs a simple thing
review:
I use this app for about a year, it is really cool, it helps me to get more focus when completing homework, especially the deep focus mode, but maybe developers have to work on adding the feature (pause and resume) sometimes when working with this app necessary things happen so I have to leave work in  Meanwhile, the pause feature will be great.
Keep up the good work!

title: Amazing!!!
review: This app genuinely helps me stay off my phone and complete homework assignments like no other. I’ve always had a hard time with being distracted with social media, but having my trees die if i leave motivates me to continue working and let my forest grow. I always feel so accomplished when i have a new tree grow!! 10/10 recommend!!!

title: Would recommend
review: I’m a junior in high school and this app helps keep me off my phone. You can listen to music while using the app which is great if music helps you study 👌 you get to build a little forest which makes the hours of homework at least a little worth it. If you have AP classes I’d recommend it’s worth the two dollars.

title: Great for Procrastinators! Will Help You Focus!
review:
I procrastinate a lot, I also get stuck on my phone a LOT more than I need to. This app helped me stay off my phone when I needed to work. I love the sounds that you can play while growing your trees, just wish I had access to a couple more without paying. 
Overall love the app and seeing my little “Forest” grow! :)

title: Love this app!!❤️🌱
review: I purchased this app to help keep me focused while studying for finals. I wasn’t sure how it would work because I tend to get distracted very easily. However this was not the case. This app was phenomenal and kept me focused! I finished 3 hours and 30 minutes later with a task that would have taken me 5 hours! Forest works and it works exceptionally well! 🌱🌲🌳🌴🎄

title: Fun to stay focused
review: This app is a great way to stay focused. It still makes you have self control in that it doesn’t lock you out of other apps but encourages you to stay focused so you can grow your forest. I’ve had it for a week and have reduced my screen time by about 25% and been more productive throughout the day just by setting this up.

title: Great App!
review: Forest is a simplistic, beautiful app that inclines users to concentrate at certain tasks, whether it be completing those heaps of assignments from your Calculus class, or writing essays for your English class, or even your basic household chores, you can grow many trees (even real ones for a good cause!) and customize them as long as you stay productive for a certain interval of time!! :)

title: Really like this app!
review: Some youtubers recommended this app so I gave it a try. I will say it does keep me motivated to ‘grow my tree’, get coins in order to buy more trees lol and also save up to plant an actual tree. The thing is I haven’t reached the point where I’ve accumulated enough to plant a real tree just because the amount of coins needed is so high for me... idk if it’s just me? But yea idk maybe lower it a little? Other than that I’m rlly satisfied. :)

title: A Beautiful, creative way to focus
review: I love that it doesn’t force you to start growing a plant a specific time. Yet just the simple idea of “planting” something and having it grow while I study, workout, or simply read makes it a compelling reason to do all of them! I’m hoping to start categorizing my plants to what I’m doing once I’ve unlocked a few more!

title: EXTREMELY HELPFUL
review:
Whenever I try to focus for reading, writing, or just working in general and I don’t wanna get distracted, I open this app. This is extremely helpful because it reinforces the self-control and makes less procrastination.
THANKS A LOT TO THIS APP I’ve been benefited from it and I hope other could be benefited from this too. It truly improved your life in all aspects.

title: I love forest!
review: Forest has helped me quantify time in a way I’ve tried tracking with a bullet journal and it’s so much more effective - I LOVE that it keeps me off my phone. Funny how often we can forget we’re trying to focus and get distracted by notifications constantly fighting for our attention. I also really appreciate Trees for the Future is forest’s sponsor! Morally down with that!

title: Actually works
review: I’ve been using this app for quite a while now and it’s been very helpful for those times when I can’t seem to find the motivation to be productive. It’s weirdly satisfying to earn points to redeem for various trees to add to my “forest “ or even to have a real tree planted!  I recommend this for anyone who needs help getting started on dreaded tasks.

title: Procrastinators need this
review: This is a really good incentive for me to get my work done. I can lock my phone for an hour or so and the tree will grow. I’m usually constantly touching my phone to go onto social media but forest makes it so I “kill a tree” if I try to open a new app. It’s a smart tactic and I highly recommend it because if you need things to get done, you can.

title: Couldn’t have done it without this app
review: I’m a medical student studying for my board exams and I seriously could not have done the 8+ hour study days without Forest. On days when I just couldn’t get myself to focus, having Forest on my phone and on my browser made it so much easier to convince myself to study. I’ve recommended this app to everyone I know!

title: Best app
review: For a person that studies all the time, this is the app that I use the most. When I sit down to study I get to have a garden of little trees that track my progress. Some days I get a lot, and some days I don’t. And the days I don’t have a plethora of trees, I still get little decorated trees that make me happy. Recommended for anyone who wants to keep track of their study time.

title: More personalized
review:
Its not overly bad but wish one could change the height to wish the plants grow, as well as the width.
It will also be nice to be able to grow multiple types of plants at once, for example one of one type and two from another one. 
It will also be really good to be able to organize the way the forest is layed out.
However it does help to use less your phone.

title: Amazing app
review:
I use this app and at home.  In fact, I find it a great way to stay focus with my family after a long day of work where I want to turn off my brain and relax.  I haven’t seen my family all day!  So I turn on forest to help remind me to be present in the most important part of the day.

Get this and stay focus.  Plant trees and make the world a better place.

title: Amazing
review:
Great app, love the idea and all the features. Definitely helps with motivation. 

I do wish that there was a button during planting that could give you a break for a minute, for example, so that I can reply to texts or emails that come in that are important, even if I can only use that function once every ten minutes or so.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4806682, 'body': 'Hi,

We are glad to share with you that we do have the feature!
Every time you finish your session, you could click the "clock" icon to set a break.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further question. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-08-26T04:17:26Z'}

title: I love it 😍
review: OMG this is the best app ever! I can do my studying and homework without stopping to play with my phone. I’m in middle school, so this is a biggie with all the work a girl gets. I really like the feature where you can listen to some calm sounds while you are doing work. It is definitely worth the money I paid. I hope you developers can keep on improving this app. 😁

title: I am a great tree grower!
review: I love this app. I’ve used it for over a month or two now and I am more productive! The concept seemed silly to me at first, but I’m beginning to understand that there’s something to adding a routine (and fun) action (planting a tree) to the words, “it’s time to focus.” It just works. What also works, earning points for the pleasure of planting a different tree species. My desire for tree variety makes me work even harder, really great for all!

title: I enjoy it~
review: I tend to get distracted by my phone while lying in bed at night. This app forces me to stop looking at tumblr, instagram, etc. and actually try to get some sleep. It's nice waking up to look at your phone and see you have 4 trees in your forest to start the day. It's also very helpful for staying off your phone while doing homework. It's a very cute and simple app.

title: Cute little reminder
review: It’s a cute way to both focus yourself away from technology but also keep up with your goals. I have tags for studying, reading, yoga and meditation, journaling, etc. I like that it forces you not to go searching and getting distracted (other than when it asks for a review 😉)

title: Forest Focus Spot On For Homework + Breaks
review: I had this before and rarely used it; when I started Bangtan Academy they have a channel of Forest ARMYs so we can collaborate focus time. I love all of the pieces of this app, especially the Tiny Tan ones, I just wish there was a way to earn or buy Tiny Tan ones with coins or rewards i stead of just gems.

title: Genuinely helps so much
review: I am a person that gets very distracted by my phone. I have tried everything, but really all it took was this app!! Seeing my forest continue to grow makes me very happy, and I am motived to stay off my phone because I don’t want my tree to die. Must have for college students!

title: The app provides a good cause for motivation
review: When I try to focus while this app is turned on I try to finish off my business since I can help for a good cause and also achieve my goals. So it is kind of like a one shot two birds . Excellent for someone who wants a minimalist and intuitive timer. 5 stars

title: I love this app
review: I always find myself on my phone when I should be doing work. This app is a cute way to help keep me off my phone and get my work done. It has little rewards to keep you motivated. I highly recommend this app to anyone who needs time to focus away from their phone.

title: Incredibly Cute and Fun way to Stay Focused!
review: I 💗 this app because with the amount of distractions our world throws on us daily, this app has helped me stay off of my phone while studying for my classes in college. I love the way it tracks your time focused by planting trees! I definitely recommend this app to anyone with a cellphone! 🌱🌳☺️

title: Best study ever!!!
review: This app makes me feel so much more motivated!!! I like to use it with my friends and classmate to see who can get the most amount of work done. We also use it during our zoom class to see who can get be the most focused. It’s so great to just put my phone away and do work.

title: Better than free analogs
review: I tried couple free apps and they didn’t worth it. I better pay less than cup of coffee and have this cool app with all features. Really helpful, every single action you turn into game and become more productive at the same time. I love it and recommend to all my friends.

title: Love this app
review: It’s only a few dollars and totally worth it! It really helps keep you off your phone cause you get to purchase little plants with your coins and you don’t want them to die! It’s helped my boyfriend and I work together from home during Covid without being so distracted. Love the concept!!

title: Game Changer
review: I downloaded this app as a result of the pandemic and me only having online classes without lecture. I had difficulties motivating myself to study and I am glad I found this app. It helps me to focus and it is fun to see how my little forest grows. Sometimes I still forget to turn it on! So I put the app on me front screen !!

title: Amazing app for med students!
review: Im currently a med student and I get easily distracted when I have my phone around. This app has helped me so much! I love how I can also study with my friends through this app making sure they also aren’t getting distracted on their phones with the plant together mode! Totally recommend!

title: Great study tool
review: I was a bit skeptical about how an app could help me focus more, but decided to try it out anyway and I’m pleasantly surprised! This app actually helps me focus on studying so much more because I’m not tempted to go on my phone and my productivity has improved so much! 100% recommend to give it a try :)

title: Helps me keep focused on school work
review: This app helps me keep focused on school work. I set a plant to grow for 15 minutes or however long I want to keep focused for, I also set the option to have my plants die if I leave the app. This gives me a motivation to keep working because I don’t want my plant to die!

title: Already so happy :’)
review: I literally looked up “study lock” to find something to just keep me from touching my phone. Although it DOES NOT have a lock your phone feature or anything which would be preposterous tbh, it is SO effective in keeping you motivated to stay off your phone to get what you need done. This app is genius. Seriously genius

title: Great for staying productive!
review: As a college student, I have to study for long periods of time.  Even though I need to get the work done, I often find myself taking multiple “breaks” on social media or other apps that end up distracting me.  I’ve found with this app that I’m able to stay focused for longer since I know I’ll get a cute tree out of it!

title: Amazing little app
review: This app is stunningly helpful. It has more interest than the most basic pomodoro apps, but isn't a complicated game either. I actually look forward to sitting down to study and plant some trees! Totally revealing when it comes to my study habits, too. Four stars, two thumbs up, and a big hey thanks. Runs beautifully and is strangely motivating. Love it.

title: A Must Have for Productivity Geeks
review: I rarely purchase apps but Forest is a $2 well-spent. I HIGHLY recommend this to students or anybody who finds their phone getting in the way of their tasks too often. The design is clean and minimalistic making it easy to use. My favorite part of the app is the tree planting aspect which has a real life impact making it even cooler.

title: This app delivers what it promises
review:
Once I began upper levels in college I learned how much trouble I had maintaining focus during long readings. I haven’t paid for an app since I was in middle school but this seemed worth it— and it was. 

I find this app works better than free pomodoro timers or self timing for productivity because of the incentive of planting a real tree. If you’re struggling to be productive, invest in Forest!

title: Love it!
review: I have always had a hard time focusing on school work because it is so tempting to pick up my phone and start looking on other apps, but with this app I am able to leave my phone out and still do my work! I am still able to “play a game” while doing my homework! I am just really glad I purchased this app!

title: Stay Focused at Work!
review: I’ll admit I have a slight problem keeping focused... Especially at work or when doing homework. The idea of planting trees and setting it to where the tree dies if you leave the app has been a game-changer for my focusing! I really thought I had ADHD and was about to see a therapist and seek expert advice, but now I know that I’m just distracted and that this is all I need.

title: Love this app!
review: The Forest app has fun incentives for users who need to focus on the work. Deep Focus mode makes sure that your tree dies if you have left the app for more than 15/20 seconds and it honestly helps me so much. I’m also able to see how much time I’ve spent on each homework subject and how my productivity can improve in the future. Highly recommend!!

title: Great for studying
review: I start this app right before I start studying and it helps me think “ok now it’s time to work,” and then when my tree is grown, I take a short break before planting another. I had this app before it was a paid app, but on my new phone I still bought it because it’s SO WORTH IT, especially if you love plants and trees (I could never kill one!)

title: Super helpful
review: I have a lot of school work this year and when I feel overwhelmed I don’t want to do any homework. I didn’t think that planting virtual trees would be effective but it’s been so helpful to keep me off of social media when I have to be productive. I also installed the forest extension on my laptop (via chrome). Would definitely recommend!

title: Productivity at its finest
review: I love this app! As a college student, I spend a lot of time reading and writing papers. With the constant distraction that technology causes, its nice to load up this app and plant a tree. It’s a really good way to work in 30 minute intervals and then take a small break with your phone if you want (this is what I personally do). Has helped me a ton! Highly recommend!

title: Great app
review: I am a high school student and I’ve always had a hard time with procrastination and distractions from my phone. This app is so helpful for keeping me focused. The trees and bushes are so adorable, I couldn’t bear to let one wither! Planting a real tree with enough coins is an amazing option. It helps the real world forests while helping people with their goals. I recommend it to anyone!

title: Love
review: I love this app, I’ve been using it since highschool and have continued using it while in college ! I’ll probably graduate still using this app 😂 I use it for studying and also when spending time with family and friends. It’s useful in every situation I’ve bought this app for my girlfriend and we use it together all the time. It’s just a fabulous app.

title: Amazing app!
review: Maybe it’s pathetic that I need some kind of motivation to put down my phone but this app is really amazing! I use it most for tracking my study sessions. Although I try to log my time elsewhere it can help me easily track an accurate amount of how many hours I’ve spent studying. My screen time has gone down quite dramatically.

title: excellent for fighting procrastination
review: i’m a grade A procrastinator (with enough panic-motivation to get things turned in mostly on time) and this app has helped immensely with forcing me to work. I get sucked into my phone & if i can’t distract the procrastinating part of my brain for 30 seconds so i can set a timer on this app it helps me do so much more that i imagined could be accomplished!

title: Great App With Friends
review: I previously had this app and did not find it helped me stay motivated and would just prevent me from switching playlists until I connected with friends and we could compete for who could use this app the most. My motivation is through the roof and the time spent on my phone is getting less and less.

title: Love it!
review: I got this app just before my finals started but have used it for so much more than studying! I plant a tree before class so i’m not tempted to check my phone, at the gym so I can focus on my workout, and before bed and have already noticed that my quality of sleep has improved. Definitely worth the money and it’s so fun to watch your forest grow :)

title: so productive!
review: I’m in love with forest! It truly does keep me off my phone and makes sure that I stay focused and finish my schoolwork. My phone is my biggest distraction and I  waste SO much time mindlessly scrolling through social media when I should be studying and doing hw. However, Forest helps me stay on track and prevents me from doing that. I love the plants too! they’re so cute!

title: Seems silly, but it works
review: We all need to lock our phones or our browsers more to keep us engaged and productive, but knowing that never seems to quite be enough to make us do it. This app somehow does. Why should I care if a cartoon tree shrivels up and dies because I couldn’t keep my hands off my phone FOR A PERIOD OF TIME I CHOSE? I don’t know, but it does and I am so thankful for it!

title: Essential
review: This would be in my top 10 must have apps if I had to choose! It helps me focus during work, class, study, etc. The motivation of building my little forest and unlocking new cute species and having as little “dead” trees as possible really helps me put my phone down when I need to be focus. Also love how simple the app it- no frills! Just focus!

title: I love it, but it’s not for everyone
review: Personally, I love the app because I like keeping my tree alive and not getting distracted by my phone. However I also do realize that it’s not for everyone, as it doesn’t lock you out of not going on your phone for a couple of seconds, and only gives a notification that your tree is going to die.

title: Very helpful for when you just need to put your phone down and start working
review:
Often I find myself mindlessly scrolling social media to procrastinate working. I find that putting a timer on, even for 5 minutes is enough force me into the working mood.

Works perfectly. I’ve never had any glitches. Cute art as well.

title: Great if you can get yourself to use it
review: I love this app, but I don’t use it as much as I’d like to. If you’re motivated to not kill a virtual tree, then it will work great for you. If you’re indifferent to killing a virtual tree, this app isn’t going to help you. It’s a good way to keep track of how much time you are spending being productive and it can bring your awareness to how often you mindlessly check your phone and social media.

title: Love it!
review: I have started using Forest during work to help keep me off my phone and I love it!! You set a timer for how long you want to stay concentrated and get a notification that your (virtual) tree will die if you try to use it during that time. The coolest part is that you can save up the coins you earn each time you plant a virtual tree to plant an actual tree!!!

title: Self-Discipline Sold Separately
review:
Love this app. And I think it can definitely bring a lot of value to people’s lives. 

The idea behind the app is the utilization of the pomodoro technique except that it removes the sterility from the process. I don’t have a blank timer, I have a tree that grows as my time moves closer and closer to its appointed completion. And if you use your phone, it Kills the tree. 

This tiny feature which seems superfluous requires you to think twice about importance of using your phone at that very moment. In spite of the understanding that it’s just a virtual tree, it actually does deter you from pausing your timer or using your phone. 

Very smart app that works weirdly well.

title: Auto texts to select contacts
review: This app is amazing. Really helps kick my phone addiction. Wondering if there could be some sort of automated message to select contacts that I have a tree planted and won’t be responding to texts for however long. I have a wife and kids and if I plant a two hour tree it would be nice to have the app let her know I’m going green.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4832504, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-08-28T01:56:11Z'}

title: It has helped me and motivates me to be focused
review: I love the app. It is very simple to use. It has helped me to be focused I don’t text or look at the phone any more at least for those 25 minutes. The only thing I would like to improve is the sound in the alert when I finish a task. I would like to be able to have more loud sound effects because sometimes I cannot hear it and I keep working...
developerResponse:
{'id': 5171818, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We are planning to release more background sounds in the future. 

Thanks for contacting us! :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-09-22T09:31:57Z'}

title: Just got it
review: It worked like it was supposed to and it also has the option to play this nature noise into my earbuds and it worked to keep my mind more clear. I can’t focus while listening to music because I’m a musician and it isn’t really something I can tune out.

title: LOVE
review: It keeps me focused so well omg and I love it so much the only complaint is that it should be a little easier to get coins bec 10 for 30 minutes isn't a lot especially since everything costs 500 coins and to plant a real tree is like 2,000 so maybe like double (or triple) the amount of coins we get. Also being able to add minutes while the timer is three is already growing would be great !! pleasee
developerResponse: {'id': 1786274, 'body': 'Hello,\nThank you for the suggestions. We would encourage you to obtain more coins by unlocking achievements. Nevertheless we would consider modifying the price of the trees.', 'modified': '2017-11-18T15:06:31Z'}

title: Amazing
review: Honestly I’m a very unproductive person and forest help me make sure that I have a time to do something and to not get of task and I even take breaks which get me motivated to do my work cause i am really trying to change my life around and forest help me get my things done which make me feel accomplished.

title: Easy to use & motivating!
review: This is a great app to use for studying. I like that it shows your tree growing as you spend more time undistracted by your phone! I used it often in high school and have just redownloaded to get me through my last year of college. Highly recommended and simple to use!

title: I miss the overage counting
review: The new update with timers is nice, but I miss the feature of the timed trees that would count over your set time until you acknowledged the tree. When you get into flow, it’s easy to forget about your phone and not have even an inclination to touch it. Removing this feature creates one, and that’s really unfortunate considering the goal of this app.

title: Good app for focusing
review: Good app for getting yourself into work mode. Wish you could change your music without the tre dying when using the focus more that stops you from using the rest of your phone without killing the tree. That’s my only complaint because I accidentally killed one of my trees changing my music. Otherwise this is a good app

title: You have to put in the work to focus and this app definitely helps
review: This is a good app overall I appreciated how they visualize the time you spend focusing (whatever it means to you! Personally, this app is not going to bend your willpower to make you focus. You have to put in the work and the app is a great facilitator and fantastic for record keeping’

title: I love it!
review: I love this app. I’ve only had it for a week, but I’ve already used it multiple times. I struggle with focusing on my studying, and this app helps a lot with that. It keeps me from scrolling social media or texting when I should be doing more important things. And I love the idea of growing a forest! It really makes it a lot more fun. I recommend it!

title: Love this app
review: I downloaded this app two years ago, helped me control my time of using iPhones and studies effectively, and makes me feel good when I looked at how many tree I’ve built over the past two years. What’s more, this app actually plant trees in the real world! I’ll definitely continue to use this app and recommend to my friends.

title: Decent app but with a few issues
review: The app does its job to keep me focused. However when I tried to edit the tag of intervals through the timeline/forest pages, the app shut itself down. There is no way to edit the tag once the interval is completed. Additionally, I can’t access the help center/FAQ thru Settings, the page loads endlessly.
developerResponse:
{'id': 11669911, 'body': 'Hello,
Sorry for the inconvenience. This issue has been resolved in the latest version (4.11.2). Please update to the new version and see if the problem is solved.
 Thank you.
- Forest', 'modified': '2019-11-05T15:05:05Z'}

title: It helps me study
review: This app helps me stay off of my phone really well, and I’m in online schooling so I really need that extra push to stay on track. The only problem is it costed money, and I have to have it on quite a bit to get more coins in order to get different trees. I really love this app though, I really recommend for anyone who needs something to help them stay off their phone!

title: Study with Forest
review: I’m working on a master’s degree and the Forest app is a wonderful tool to keep myself focused. The different types of trees serve as just enough of a reinforcer to interest and challenge me. The ability to look back at all the trees I grew is a great way to feel a sense of accomplishment. If you are working through a degree, then I highly recommend downloading Forest to help you study.

title: Perfect for making me focus on work
review: I procrastinate a lot, and this app has helped me put my phone aside and focus on my work! I hate killing my little trees, so this is a good reminder to get back to work whenever I mindlessly pick up my phone when I’m supposed to be concentrating. The only thing I’d like is for it to be easier to get different types of trees!

title: Best Study App!
review: Forest is EASILY the best retrictoion/pomodoro app there is. Well worth the money. I use it every time I want to stay off my phone when I’m studying, or just to track how much time I spend on a task so I’m not distracted. The more you use it, the more trees/bushes you can purchase! Forest also helps to support the environment by planting trees! Definitely one of my all time favorite apps.

title: Works for me!
review: I’m an easily distracted individual but I ALSO love keeping virtual things alive. This app takes advantage a very silly psychological part of my brain that would rather do just about anything for half an hour than let a virtual tree die. I finally did my laundry because I wanted a forest. I no longer spend 6+ hours every day using my phone. A+

title: This app is really wonderful
review: I really appreciate this app. Of course, you have to have some self-control to begin with or you’ll find ways to circumvent the app. But if you have the drive to get something done and just need a little assistance staying focused, this app does a great job! Plus it’s fun to collect new species and the graphics are adorable. Happy to support this app :)

title: Thank you Forest!
review: I have awful ADHD and Forest is the only thing that keeps me from scrolling through Tumblr or Reddit when I should be working. I wish you could pay $0.99 for more tree species instead of having to wait until you have enough coins to but I guess that’s me needing instant gratification. It’s worth the small price to download this app.

title: This is an amazing app
review: This app is amazing it keeps u on track and helps u dart focused. One thing I love about it is that it has background noise so if it’s to quite wear u are u can have rain noises or people talking and many more and it’s also Christmas themed right now so that means when you grow a tree or a bush it shows up with snow on it and I personally think that’s a lot prettier

title: So helpful!
review: I have a really hard time leaving my phone alone to focus. I run my business off of my phone so I’m constantly picking it up. Between work and social media I struggle to stay focused on whatever I’m doing. This app is a GAME CHANGER. I love it so much! It has helped me get back to reading & I’m so so grateful. Thank you, Forest App! 💚

title: Love the app makes the pomodoro method work for me
review: I've done timer methods in the past but they haven't worked for me because i would simply ignore the timer. Now if I leave the app to try and use my phone i get punished by the withering of my tree and it stays there as a monument to my lack of commitment. This app arms itself with this to make you actually focus. I like it very nice!

title: I love this app
review: I have had it for many years and across devices and really I want to make it more of a habit to keep my eyes off my phone. I never made an account until now so I have lost coins but it is okay because I like my trees and I like the concept even more. It helps me manage my time.

title: Very cute means of motivation
review:
I haven’t used it for long but I’ve used it for personal reasons, like writing and even to keep me focused during dnd. 
I wish we’d get a few more coins for the trees we grow but that’s just because I want to buy more trees and I’m impatient with how long it would take to earn enough for one new tree
Otherwise I think it’ll do well!

title: Great for forcing you to focus
review: This is a fun way to get you to focus. You get to feel like you’re almost playing a game in that once you’ve accomplished your goal time you earn a reward (one of the trees). I use it both for studying and exercising as both tasks tend to find me easily distracted

title: Better Than I Thought
review: I’m not a person who can never stay focused or am overly addicted to my phone but I do find myself like most of us wasting a lot of time. This app is the perfect app to nudge you in the right direction. I don’t know why but when I plant a seed I gear in and focus for whatever the amount of time I have it set for. Well worth the price.

title: Greater if more interaction between friends!
review: I love this app and its lovely UI design. It is a bit slow using it but not a big deal. I hope there could be more interaction between friends. For example, user could see if friends are planting trees or not, and see what kind of trees others have. By doing this, there is more sense of community. Users will like it more and stick to Forest and be more efficient!

title: Help in studying
review: This app is very helpful for anyone that needs to stay focused on and important task, especially if that involves work for school because it helps to stay off your phone. By doing this you are not only staying on task but helping to actually grow trees for this dying environment. Overall the app is definitely worth the purchase.

title: Help me concentrate on studying
review: Help me concentrate on studying. When I first enter in the college, I cannot control myself although I think I really should study more. This app use a creative and gentle way to push me study since I really want new trees and make them stay alive! I am also grateful because they will plant real trees every time you plant some trees in your app.

title: Effective
review: I appreciate that they added the feature to turn off deep focus mode since I sometimes need to use my phone to access files. The only downside I could think of is that it crashes when I try to unlock a plant. Hope this will he fixed soon. Overall, it’s simple and I personally think that it is also effective in accomplishing its purpose.

title: Worth it for focusing.
review:
I actually really like this little app. It’s unfortunate that there’s in game microtransactions to help unlock trees, cause the rate of gold earned is kinda poor.

An app about growing different trees through productivity is great but growing the same tree 8 times isn’t very fun... 

But the app works. I look at my phone to check the stock market and my positions, plus Snapchat way too often. So I use this to help me focus on work or whatever for a good 45 min to an hour.

Got a few different trees in my Forest now, so I’m having a good time watching it grow. Just wish it was a little faster. Almost encourages you to just let the app run all the time.

title: So focused!
review: Love this app. You set a timer on the app to “stay focused” and plant a “tree” during that time. I am more focused when I’m motivated to finish out the timer. If you leave the app, your tree dies! For that little reason, I don’t just pick up my phone during my focus time because I don’t want to kill my tree and I want to finish my timer! Excellent motivation.

title: Great cause for you to Concentrate
review: I really enjoy this app! It’s a great way to say distracted free and if you earn enough coins actually plant a tree! I find it to be a non-invasive way to help me think twice before I distract myself with my phone, it also lets you set the time so whether you need 5 minute or 65 minutes to two hours this is the app for you!

title: Enjoying so far
review: If it was able to essentially mute my notifications and could stay on/active while running, it would be awesome, but I certainly understand limitations of access in the system you have available.  I really do like the idea and have been using it for focused writing and beat-making sessions.

title: This app is the reason I’m able to read again
review: I’ve tried using the built it focusing section on the iPhone but it doesn’t work for me like this app does. I actually don’t touch my phone for the time I have set instead of clicking the app and saying “remind me in 15 minutes” like I do with the built in application

title: Great Motivation to Disconnect
review: I enjoy using this app when I am studying to doing a lot of school work for extended periods of time in which I know I could get distracted. The idea of killing the tree I’ve planted in motivating enough to keep me off my phone. I would recommend this app to anyone who enjoys procrastinating school work by checking social media or fiddling on their phone.

title: I just wish I used it more
review:
When I’m motivated it gives just enough support to keep me on track. I wish I were motivated but this is still good. 

One request would be for something epic for the longer periods. Two hours ought to give more than a bench. Considering how much effort goes into a two hour work slot I want something amazing.

title: Extremely Useful
review: This app has actually ensured I keep a 4.0 GPA despite being extremely pressed for time during my busy school year (while working full-time and commuting 3 hours per day). Every time I want to study, especially immediately before a test, I turn on Forest. It has helped immensely as I am SUPER easily distracted by my phone. Thank you Forest!!!!

title: Great app
review: I use this app all of the time when I need to get my stuff done - and as a busy student, I always have stuff to do. I think that it’s well worth the price tag and the app is very well built. I love the tree options they offer, and my favorite feature is that if you use it enough, they will plant an actual tree. I think that’s amazing!

title: I️ really like this app
review: I really like this app because it encourages me to stay off of my phone. The only thing I don’t like about this app is that you can’t take a break once the seed is planted which is really frustrating because it kills your plant. But other than that it’s a great app and I will continue to use it throughout the years to come❤️

title: Exactly what I was looking for
review: Got it so that I put my phone down and focus on the task at hand or focus on some mediation. Cool that it has a relaxing sound feature, comes in handy when I take a 15 min break to meditate. You can also track how much you’re putting your phone down and focusing based on the forest feature. Def recommend.

title: Great
review: This keeps me off my phone and locked in and if I do pick up my phone I don’t want to see my tree die so it makes me go right back to the task at hand.  This has allowed me to up my output of ten pages a day to 100 pages.  Best pomodoro app, especially with the achievements and making focus points the currency to unlock more trees and environmental sounds.

title: Changed my studying
review: The idea that if I switched to Instagram I’m going to have a dead tree in my forest for the day is somehow a great incentive to stay focused! It’s really satisfying to look at all the minutes I focused on at the end of the day, and see how full (or empty haha) my forest is at the end of the day. It’s a really great way to measure your focus on any task and help you grow things along the way!

title: Fun way to stay mindful/productive
review: This is the only app that has led me to leave reviews in over a decade of being an iPhone user. Love this app. Keeps me productive at work and helps me stay mindful and not get distracted by my phone when I’m chilling outside of work. If they charged ten times as much, I’d still pay it tbh.

title: very positive for productivity
review: You forget about the app since it subliminally pushes you to not use your phone. It’s a great app and they’re doing a really good job. I think the level of arcade is good where it’s at. It’s fun but not overly time consuming. I hope they continue to update the trees but keep it simple as it is!

title: Great
review: I love this app. It keeps me accountable and whatnot. My only complaint is that there isn't an option to grow a random tree out of the various types of trees I own. I like mixing it up but I'm also too lazy to pick a tree and I wish there was a way to choose it for me haha. Otherwise it's incredible, though.

title: Great focus app
review: This app honestly makes me put down my phone. I love my little garden and the fact that my tree dies is so sad it makes me so motivated to not break the focus. I highly recommend this app to anyone who has trouble putting down their phone to work, read, sleep, be present, etc.

title: Wish it could turn
review: I love the app and use it a lot more now since my school year started. I also use it on my iPad, which is usually in landscape mode. I just wish the app could turn with the iPad and iPhone settings. It’s harder to see the timing turned over. Regardless, I love the app and will recommend to friends looking to focus!

title: Helps me study
review: With college being online it’s hard to find motivation to study or to even concentrate when studying. The simplicity of watching my tree grow as I study helps to give me satisfaction in not being on my phone as often during studying. I love the big Christmas tree 🤩

title: Good Enough
review: I loved the idea of this app, but the goals are so unrealistic that I feel like I’m never going to be able to get enough coins to plant a real tree. It goes from focusing for a total of 4 hours to focusing for a total of 72. Then using it for 7 days to 30 days. I wish the achievements were more realistic and manageable so that I could plant more real trees or at least be motivated enough to unlock more trees in my forest.
developerResponse:
{'id': 23834500, 'body': 'Hi there, 

Thank you for the feedback. You can get more coins by completing longer planting sessions, unlocking achievements, or inviting friends to join Forest! 
The followings are the explanation regarding achievements. The "7 Days in a Row" achievement, only requires you to plant at least 1 healthy tree each day for a week. It doesn't matter how long you focus a day (could be 15 minutes or 2 hours). As long as you plant a healthy tree or more for seven days in a row, the reward will be given. It is not as difficult as it seems! 

Hope this explanation helps. If you have any other questions, feel free to contact us via the in-app feedback system.
Hard work will pay off in the long run. Stay focused! :) 
-Forest', 'modified': '2021-07-09T06:29:23Z'}

title: Great app for staying off your phone
review: This app motivates me to not mindlessly scroll through social media when I have work to get done. It’s simple, cute, and effective. I also really enjoy the group planting feature as it further motivates you to not click off so you won’t disappoint your pals lol!

title: Stay Focused & productive during stay at home work
review: At first I was skeptic whether an app would help me stay focused during school at home. but it proved to be incredibly helpful. This app helps me stay off social media while i’m working at my desk. It also tracks how much time you devote each day to focusing!

title: Recommend
review: Forrest has helped me put my phone down, and socialize with the people around me. I truly recommend if you are having phone usage problems. It also doesn’t consume a lot of battery power when it’s on! A huge plus for my old phone.

title: Great app to help you focus
review: So many cool features: pretty trees and ambient sounds are my favorite! I always plant a tree when I begin a studying session and it helps me not touch my phone the whole time. I also use it at bedtime so I can go straight to sleep without spending extra time on social media. The rain and thunder sound helps me fall asleep. Amazing app!

title: Awesome Study App!
review: I get easily distracted when it comes to doing anything productive and it can be really hard to put my phone down sometimes. Flora has made it not only easy, but fun to study! The plants are so cute and I love how you can plant real trees with the coins you earn by studying. I recommend this app to anyone who needs more motivation to study!

title: Change the leaderboard!!
review:
This app is pretty good. Being finals week I appreciate seeing some little notion that my time off of my phone is visually working. The one thing I cannot stand is the world leaderboard is topped by bots. There is no way someone is being productive and growing things 20 hours a day. 
Also, some of the plants need some flair with their growing time. I don’t like having the same little cactus for no matter how long I study, no matter how cute it is.
developerResponse: {'id': 15903941, 'body': "Hi,\nThank you for the suggestion! We'll let our team know about your feedback and see if we can work on it in the future as it may probably take some time. Your patience is highly appreciated. Please feel free to let us know if you have other questions or suggestions. ", 'modified': '2020-06-10T14:39:34Z'}

title: Great App
review: This app has helped me focus a great deal. As a person with ADHD, I get distracted VERY easily. I’ll think of something random and go on my phone and then I end up on my phone for 2 hours completely forgetting about my work. This app has helped me from wasting hours scrolling through my phone instead of doing important things 👍🏻

title: New Update Issues
review:
The App released a recent update and the update has caused some serious issues. I primarily use Forest to stay off social media and other distractions. Until the most recent update if I got a call on my phone or a voicemail I could use my Apple Watch to answer or listen. Not anymore. I have never had a tree die until this update. I am very upset that I have had two trees die and I never touched my phone.

As an aside the barrier to get new trees are a little to high. To many coins and diminishing returns.
developerResponse: {'id': 10188363, 'body': "Hello, sorry for the inconvenience. The issue has been resolved in the latest version (v.4.10.2). Please update to the new version, and your trees won't die again because of lock screen navigation or notifications. We'd really appreciate it if you update the review and rating when you've seen the improvement. Thank you! :) - Forest", 'modified': '2019-08-15T18:50:32Z'}

title: Best app ever!
review: I have tried many focus-oriented app. This is absolutely the best! I feel so much motivated with this app and have a better control of my time. I could both track the task completed with the phone and without the phone! Totally deserve the money! Super recommend for people who are looking for time management and focus improvement!

title: The best app to help you to stay off your phone!
review: I love this app! Every time I need to get homework done or simply take a few hours away from my phone, I plant a tree! It feels good and rewarding which helps me commit to the task I need to start. I highly recommend it for people that need to study or need to focus on a task without the need to look at your phone!

title: Surprisingly Effective
review: I’m in medical school and often get antsy when studying and scroll through insta, etc. Even though you can “kill” the tree and continue browsing on your phone, that slight push not to is actually quite convincing. Also, looking back at your forest at the end of the day gives you a satisfying feeling!

title: Simple but useful
review: This app is simple to use and relies on some pretty basic psychology but it’s so useful. I get motivated knowing my breaks from my phone while using it means I can plant a tree in real life or more personally, fill up my forest. It’s also nice to see how much you’ve used it in past years because you get motivated to do more the next year.

title: Amazing!!
review:
I’ve been using Forest since December of 2016 and I can honestly say that I’m so much more productive when using it. I have it on my computer also as a Google extension and it honestly helps tremendously. My only wish is that it would automatically friend you with Facebook friends.

My friends at college have really enjoyed planting trees with me!

title: Worth every penny
review: I’ve had this app for three years now and it was definitely worth the purchase. When studying, I constantly check my phone when my mind wanders and doing so further distracts me. When I plant a tree, I don’t want to kill it so I put my phone down and get back to work. The different types of trees makes it fun as well.

title: Fun way to stay focused! & productive
review: This app is a fun way to stay focused and productive. I tried it after hearing Carrie Poppy  describe it on the podcast ”Oh No, Ross and Carrie.” Growing your forest helps you stay motivated — and using different tress allows you to see your productivity over time or across various projects. I like that you can also use different sounds during your focus sessions. I’d love to see a classic clock ticking added in the future.

title: Used for two year in college
review: Unique in the fact that spending time studying will contribute to a digital currency that will actually help buy a tree. Just wish you could get a picture of that tree idk something dumb like that would be fun. Also killing the tree makes a good incentive to keep going. 10/10 would recommend

title: Extremely Useful & Humanitarian Return
review: This app definitely does what it advertises by helping me stay off my phone so I can have uninterrupted study. It also has a generous side that plants a real tree when you reach a certain amount of points, I haven’t reached the minimum yet so I’m unsure if there’s confirmation or any way to track if it actually happens

title: One of the few apps I haven’t delete.
review:
I usually delete apps after a week because I usually realize that I’m not using them or they don’t make me feel productive. This has been a game changer for me, especially when I’m doing morning pages! So simple yet great motivation for me to focus and find moment of flow.
Highly recommend.

title: Very useful
review:
I don’t have much basis for comparison for apps like this but I really like how it helps me focus and keep off my phone. 

Maybe this is available in the pro version or something but it would be nice if there was the option to make a “safe” app that you could use while the tree was growing, like texts or email, because sometimes I need to access those while working.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4768404, 'body': 'Hello,

Due to the limitation of the iOS system, we cannot determine what app the user is currently using. Therefore we cannot implement the whitelist feature for the iOS version. As a workaround, we built a "Work with Phone" feature, which can be enabled in the settings page. This feature enables users to use work related apps during their planting periods, but users will have to be honest with themselves when using this feature. 

The trees planted with this feature enabled will not be counted towards the leaderboard, and users will only receive half the reward if they exit Forest during the planting period. 

Currently, the whitelist feature cannot be implemented for iOS. If you see features similar to whitelist on other apps, please let us know so that we may figure out how it was implemented. 

Thank you for your suggestion. :)', 'modified': '2018-08-22T13:38:37Z'}

title: How could it be this good?
review: Whenever you open your phone and see the tree growing, trust me, you won’t interrupt the process. Also, the fact that “You must pay to delete canceled processes” will double the effect of not using your phone. Even if you delete the process, your jungle will still look the same with does non green trees.

title: The Only Thing That Keeps Me Off My Phone
review: This app is an absolute gem! I used to have the hardest time staying off my phone even while working on projects for fun, but the motivation that comes with watching a tree, and then a forest, grow because I took the time away has been a revelation. Please keep up the good work, the new tree species, and the seasonal events!

title: Love it!
review: I absolutely love this app, it keeps me off my phone and focused on my work! however there is one thing i would like, which is to be able to have a 1 minute break or pause button so i can look something up or use my phone calculator. other than that i totally recommend this app, it is SO worth the price

title: Great
review: I love this app, it really does help and I also like that I have the choice to turn off the setting where you can’t leave the app or else your tree dies. It is also great for when I have work or I’m exercising so I can just grow trees and earn coins for different types of trees and planting real trees

title: Changes
review: I wish the design change of the plants when more hours are put in becomes better. For some of the plants 15min of focus vs 120min of focus- there’s barely any design changes that you can tell. Like for a tree I wish they’re seedlings first or saplings. Other than lack of design changes the app is by far great. Awesome user experience!

title: Fun and addicting
review: This is a cute little application. You build a little forest, many trees available. I’ve spent about $6.00 and am very happy- being more relaxed. I would have spent much much more money on other games- but this one is keeping me focused and letting me get other things done.

title: Love the snow theme!!
review:
I really love the new snow theme. Every tree gets a new snowy look and it’s like the unlocked tree catalog get doubled!

Also the widget get updated!

I will be excited if I can plant a tree through Apple Watch directly without using my iPhone so that I can detach from my phone even more when I try to focus.
developerResponse: {'id': 26614001, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for the suggestion and for supporting us! Planting from Apple Watch sounds awesome, we will let the rest of the team know. :)', 'modified': '2021-12-03T02:43:14Z'}

title: Great for studying
review: This really helps me set down my phone to study! I have a hard time with picking up my phone “just to check” on apps which end up being 15-30 minute breaks, having the reminder to wait until the timer is done is super helpful.

title: Helps me focus
review: This app has helped me concentrate a lot and break my habit of taking “phone breaks” as an excuse to stop studying. I think the prices for unlocking other trees, bushes or flowers is a bit high or maybe it’s the rate at which you earn the coins. Other than that I would recommend this app.

title: Really Does Work!
review: If you’re thinking about getting this app, definitely do! I’m a student and on my phone way too much, but this app actually keeps me from spending unnecessary time on my phone when I know I need to study. The trees are all so cute and aesthetic, and it’s great to see your forest grow!!

title: Very helpful!
review:
Pros: can study with friends, has nice background sounds to tune out to, helps you see progress when you dedicate your time to focusing.

Cons: gotta do some focusing before you could purchase the sound, glitches out and kicks friends out of the group sometimes.

title: Helpful when you need it
review: A great app that really helped me get through some long nights in college. I would use it and feel a connection to the little tree i was growing and it would help me stay off my phone when I really needed to by earning me I was killing the tree. They’ve gamified it since then but I just stick to the basics.

title: Overall Great
review: This app is very useful for staying on task while I do my schoolwork. My only suggestion would be to have a feature where we can sync the timers on the chrome extension and the phone. So, if I start a timer on my phone, it would also start on my computer. Other than that, it’s a good app with a great design :)

title: Nice Incentive
review: I think this app is a wonderful for myself and others that might share my experience with concentration. I will allow myself to get distracted and the app gives me an incentive to put my phone down through the rewards. I really appreciate how you’re given the option to choose ambient sounds

title: Great app
review: This app definitely helps me set aside my phone. It still allows notifications, phone calls ect to go through which is good in the case of emergencies. I also wish certain apps could be blocked at a given time. For example if i want to access my notes or web browser but dont want to be able to open texts and social media.

title: I didn’t know I used to check my phone that often
review: This app helped me to realize how much times I try to pickup my phone and it really helped me to stay focused on my work. The rain sound is relaxing and hearing it with the noise isolation of the AirPods has been really helpful for me. I feel that this has been a really productive day ;)

title: So helpful for procrastinators!
review: I am the procrastinator! I also get super side tracked by everything! My phone is a huge temptation! Now, having Forest, it helps me to stay focused and if I pick up my phone, i see the tree and think how much it is growing and how much I will grow if I put the phone down and do my work! So, this is a life saver! It’s also fun and a great visual!

title: This Train Has Departed From Procrastination Station!
review: This app is the only thing that has kept me on a single task for more than 15 minutes! Even if I finish one task early, if I have time left it encourages me to start another task so I don’t kill my tree. I’m so focused on my trees that all my household chores don’t seem overwhelming and completing them is a lot more fun and rewarding!

title: Awesome App!!
review: Love the Forest App... My only suggestion is to create a chat room for the Rooms you create a chat room-that only works when tree has not yet been planted-or something like that so that the host of the room can state in how many minutes he/she will start. Or something that when the host send the invitation it will say “Join 60min room starting in X min. ect”

title: Very cute!
review: I like that it guilt trips me into not leaving the app LOL but it would also b cool if they added a function like a pomodoro timer where after 25 mins of working it goes straight into break time where u can leave the app and then after 5 mins back to work or smthn! (And after 3 or 5 reps a longer break and it’s all customizable idk)

title: Good
review: Ive only had this app for about two weeks but I am a huge procrastinator and will do anything to not do my homework. This app prevents me from answering texts and snaps or going on other social media apps or games. One recommendation I have is turning off notifications for apps that you will be distracted by(I turn of my snapchat notifications) while using the app to make it a little easier.

title: Motivational App
review:
I just need the app to actually track progress I’ve made on my to-do list—not just the time I had “stayed focused”.  Ha!  

I love the feature of having consequences for your forest for distractions.  It helps keep me focused.  And the ability to whitelist websites is an absolute MUST in an app like this since most of my time studying is replaying recorded lectures online.

title: Fantastic for Students
review: I love the motivation I get to not open my phone from having my own little online forest. There’s two modes so if you need your phone for certain apps you can leave and if you don’t it has a mode where if you leave the app your tree dies. It really help you get on focus and stay focused with goals.

title: Motivates me to work!
review: This app is great! I love that it forces me to put my phone down and focus on my tasks that I’m doing. The best part is that it all goes towards a good cause and allows you to plant REAL trees for charity! It’s also really reward to see your own little virtual forest and see how many trees you earned through periods focused productivity. I definitely recommend this app!

title: Perfect for Studying
review: I honestly love this app it really keeps me focused when studying so that I can’t go on my phone. Sure just powering it off could work but the temptation would linger. Creating a little forrest makes me happy and helps me keep working hard. Also totally worth actually paying for i use this app way too often.

title: Simple, beautiful and effective
review: I have been really enjoying using this app. Not only is the design aesthetically pleasing, but the in-app currency can actually be used to purchase a real tree to be planted in areas affected by heavy deforestation. It’s mutually beneficial, and it feels like a game which helps me stay engaged while I’m working on a project or work. I highly recommend it!

title: Almost 2 years; Absolutely Worth it
review: For the amount of time this app will save you, you definitely will get your money’s worth back. I would highly recommend for students (like myself) to ask their friends to join and compete with them in the rankings. Thank you Forest app for being absolutely fabulous.

title: Great App to stop procrastinating
review: I think this is a great app for me personally. I use this to study and do homework, and my phone never distracts me when I'm using the app because I hate killing the tree that I'm growing. The big variety of trees and plants is also very cool, it gives you something to look forward to and work towards when using the app.

title: Brilliant
review: I love this app. It’s really helpful for keeping off your phone or whatever device you install it on! It even has a group option, so if a group of you have the app and choose to stay off your phones, you can grow a tree together. I’ve used it on and off for two years, and I’ll probably never stop.

title: Amazing tool for productivity
review: Forest has helped me to keep track of my progress, and has definitely made focusing much more fun. Always happy to show my 'forest' to friends and family. I have designated one tree for a particular type of task; at the end of the week, I can get a general sense of how I used my time, and where I need improvement. Love it!

title: Spectacular Focus App
review: This is such a great app, and a superb way to focus during the day. It doesn’t matter what you use it for, the interface is super easy to use, and the ability to plant a real tree from my own concentration feels like using the force. I’m so glad I have this, I use it every day. I also love the aggressive messages if you kill a tree 😂

title: Fantastic useful app!
review: I love using this app when I need to get stuff done. It’s super simple to set a timer and the motivation to not kill your tree is surprisingly strong. I also love that the trees have variations depending on how long your timer is set for. It makes me want to be productive for longer in order to get a fuller tree. Can not recommend this app enough!

title: Fun and useful — everyone could use it.
review: I never would have thought that this app would be so useful when I work from home or when trying to balance life and my job. And to stay focused amidst the zillion distractions that come through the phone. I think just about everyone could use Forest in their lives.

title: Amazing!
review: I love this app it keeps me from playing Fortnite so I can study without thinking about it. I use it a lot especially with the finals I am in the middle of. I recommend this is anyone who can’t leave their dang phone alone for more than 2 seconds. Anyways, works great and I have no complaints. It does what it says it does and I use it a lot.

title: Good App, Needs Some Tweeks
review: I really love this app, because I’m one of those people that needs some help to stay off her phone when I should be studying. But I don’t know if it’s just me but when I got a new phone I couldn’t get back into my account and lost all the trees I had bought and all the hours I had logged. It kinda sucked but it’s still fun to play. Wish it was either to compete globally too.
developerResponse: {'id': 5658640, 'body': 'Hi,\nPlease provide us the details and the screenshots of the problem via our in-app feedback system. We will look into this issue. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-10-25T09:22:57Z'}

title: You NEED this!!!
review: Never spent money buying an app before but this one was worth the $3!!! It may seem silly but the reward of tiny trees happily keeps me off my phone like nothing has before. I’m currently studying for the LSAT and I’m so excited to see how many trees I have planted by the end. I’ll be the queen of a whole LSAT forest!

title: Huge changes in my ability to focus!
review: I never realized how often I open my phone to look at nothing in particular (probably to avoid work 😅)! This app has made me more efficient and increased time management ten-fold. Plus the little trees are so cute and I love watching my forest grow!

title: This is a great app!
review: Title says it all, but I have one complaint which gives this four stars instead of five: I cannot split screen Forest on my iPad with another app, or use Forest in horizontal/landscape mode! It would make my relationship with Forest so much better with these two functionalities.
developerResponse: {'id': 25023441, 'body': 'Hi, thank you so much for your support and suggestions! We will relay them to our team. Have a good day. :)', 'modified': '2021-09-10T11:26:17Z'}

title: Wonderful App
review:
This app helps me stay focused and achieve my goals. All of the plants are absolutely ADORABLE and make it worth studying!

Suggestions:
- Study events (earn coins and such through events tracking study hours)
-Easier to earn coins and unlock plants (takes a very long time)

title: Amazing useful app
review:
This is easily the best couple dollars I’ve ever spent.
This app has helped me focus on my studies and keep track of what I’ve done. The graphs and pie charts of what work I’ve done over a certain week, month, or year have yielded some great insights.
If you’re on the fence about buying this app, buy it!

title: Helps with studying for school
review: Read about this app on Reddit.  A student posted about how it helped him stay disciplined when studying, and so far, so good!  Used it for 4 anthropology reading sessions, and it kept me from getting up, walking around, or surfing the Internet.  Will keep using, I’m impressed so far.

title: Really helpful and motivating
review: I love using it. Seeing a tree die makes me sad enough that it motivates me to stick to it. I wish there was a way for it to lock my computer as well, but this is still helpful to at least be a reminder and keep track of my attention

title: Stopwatch mode is the best!
review:
I've been waiting for this feature, and now that it's here, I love it! 

I have to keep track of my time for billing purposes at work, and stopwatch mode makes it so much easier. I created tags for each of my billing codes, and now time entry is a breeze! 

Thank you!

title: Surprisingly motivating
review: This app successfully turns concentration into a game through the use of cute graphics and good mechanics. While I generally enjoy working from home, it definitely has more distractions than the office, and using this app to motivate myself to focus so I can grow a cute forest has made me way more productive. Highly recommend.

title: Great app, one feature request
review: I really like this app! It has been great for limiting time spent on my device. The main feature request I would like is a smaller shortcut widget for starting a session. Currently there is only the medium size widget which has both the shortcut and the forest view which doesn’t fit as nicely in my widget view.

title: Good for focus
review: My husband and I each have this app, and have been using it to grow trees together to help each other keep on task with our work during our time working from home. It helps to have focused, productive work times during a time when it’s hard to have a consistent schedule.

title: PLEASE ALLOW ROTATION ON IPAD
review: I really want to use this app as I love the idea of having a “reward” for doing my focus sessions. However, I primarily use my ipad for note taking and doing other work mainly in landscape. Having to rotate back to portrait to use this app is a huge inconvenience and messes with workflow. Also, allowing ipad multi tasking would be a huge plus as I could have it off to the side while I work. I want to use this app, but I can’t with it stuck in portrait
developerResponse: {'id': 18023460, 'body': "Hi,\nCurrently we don't have a complete landscape mode interface for iPad users, but you can view your Forest in landscape mode by going to your Forest page and then rotating your device.\nThank you for the suggestion, we'll relay your request to our team. :)", 'modified': '2020-09-22T11:59:44Z'}

title: Adorable and very fun!
review: If you’re dedicated to being productive (even just a little) this app is plenty to motivate you to avoid using social media and stay focused. The only thing preventing me from giving it five stars is that it’s very easy to cheat and get coins without working (i.e. sleeping). It would also be cool if there were punishments for NOT being productive a certain amount of time every day.

title: Really loving this app so far
review: I’ve had Forest for 3 days and it’s been a huge help. I have ADD and a phone addiction, and growing trees has been a great motivation to put the phone down for a bit and get things done. I definitely would like to see more ways to unlock new plants in the future but for now it’s perfect for my needs!

title: Helps me focus
review: Helps me focus, but it only works if you let it. If you don’t actually try to focus or care enough about your task you won’t care about your forest. But for those who just need that extra barrier to remind them not to instinctively pick up their phone, it’s incredibly effective (with deep focus mode turned on).

title: Good for the Pomodoro Method
review: I like this app to help me focus. I’m a lawyer and I sometimes have hard deadlines by which I have to get things done. I used this method in law school with a timer but this app helps me measure how much time I actually spend focusing. I would like a loud timer buzzer, though. Maybe it’s there and I just haven’t played around with the app enough.

title: Love it!
review:
This is a great app for focus. The little bit of extra motivation to not kill my tree does the trick for me and keeps me from getting distracted. It’s so easy to open up another app on autopilot without even thinking, this has really made me stop and consider: ‘Am I being intentional right now?’ 

Often not. 

Highly recommend!

title: Super cute!
review: Usually don’t write reviews for apps, but this is one I actually enjoy. I like how it actually keeps you away from using your phone and helps the environment in the process. Mainly use this for when I’m studying, but pretty sure you can use this if you just want to be in the moment w friends or on a date.

title: Overall good. A little confusing
review: Nice concept and love the idea of planting trees, but not sure it keeps me focused, just less likely to use my phone as a distraction. Also, you have to do a little reading and searching work to maximize benefit and fully utilize app (like how to access locked trees or when you can unlock them). Visualizing forest with a quick click would be nice as well.

title: A Collage Student’s Best Friend
review: I’ve been using this app for years now and it is an awesome tool. When I have trouble with executive dysfunction, I can turn the timer on and force my brain to unplug from technology. That helps me take a moment to practice some self care, which lets me come back to studying refreshed and focused. I definitely recommend it!

title: Best focusing app
review: If you’re really bad about reaching for your phone when you should be working or driving I highly recommend this app! I setup a few podcasts and just leave my phone alone. The incentive to leave it alone is very helpful and I love that the more I plant the more coins I make so I can plant real trees and make a difference.

title: Great app!
review: I got this app a few years back and have loved it ever since. Really makes you feel accomplished at the end of the day and holds you to your goals. Perfect for preventing distractions during class or studying, or even during time with friends. Has helped me bite my technology addiction and focus better! Worth the payment.

title: Great productivity app!
review:
Used this all the time to get me through studying and am still applying it in my engineering career.

Set for initial 25 mins to get yourself to focus. Keep going past your final timer for an intense work block. I have 2 different “work intensities”. The second type of work block, after the 35 mins I break for 5 mins. This is for the more boring work that doesn’t required that much focus but “needs to be done”.

I like the game aspect. Getting different trees and forcing you not to click away from the app are very helpful in making you want to do your work and keep you off your phone. 

Highly recommended

title: Saving the world while saving your mind
review:
Sometimes we take our attention spans for granted. We lose sight of just how much time we put into our devices.
