Tree App has given me renewed focus. It’s helped me prioritize what is important by forcing me to live in the moment.

More importantly, it incentivized my good behavior with helping save the world. It’s a win for Mother Nature and for me.

title: I love it ! Helpful and it really works
review: I love it. Has been incredibly helpful and has allowed me to be productive and proactive for studying and while working. I love the feature of group studying where one person using another app while growing the tree will kill everyone’s tree lol it has good options . I took away a star because I want to grow other things like the pumpkin 😭 but it’s too pricey .

title: It helps!
review: It is ridiculously easy for me to get distracted, especially when I have a million things I don’t want to do. This app forces me to keep focused! It breaks my heart when I’ve planted a tree and then something important comes up, forcing me to let it die. However, it makes the less important things seem really not worth it.

title: Almost a 5 out of 5.
review:
This app is great for any student trying to reduce his/her time on their cell phone and manage how much time they spend on a certain topic or activity. 

How can it be a 5/5 for someone like me?

It would be nice to be able to export our data. 

Also since a major driving factor is competing with friends and earning medals maybe add more metals to the list as well as making competitions between friends. (Most logged hours per day or week etc.)

One last addition could be a fire crackle sound effect. 

The app does a great job in most other aspects though. As a current med student I use it a LOT to track my studies.

Update: exporting data has been added (nice)

title: helps me focus
review: I really find this app helpful. It has helped me focus on my work for 60 min intervals without getting distracted on my phone. I also like how you can unlock different types of trees as you get more coins. I find that seeing the number of hours of work I got done is very motivational and has helped with my studying.

title: Decent but not perfect
review: It has lots of cool features like doing forest with your friends (I haven’t tried it yet). The trees and bush designs are really nice but it’s unfortunate that you can’t whitelist or blacklist apps in iOS. Also sometimes it gets glitchy and places multiple trees for ones session. I hope that they add features in the future that allow you to design and decorate a garden with trees you’ve grown.

title: Great app - really helps with concentration.
review: Grows a cute variety of trees and bushes based on the amount of time you spend growing (not using phone) and what you unlock with your earnings from that. If you interrupt it, the tree dies and you have the saddest collection of pixels in the shape of a little dry tree. Surprisingly strong motivation to not get distracted by your phone. Optional relaxing nature sounds are awesome.

title: Works well, does its job :)
review: Forest helps me work on things I know I should, but just don’t want to. Only issue is that sometimes when I leave it as I work for a while, when I come back, it’s like the app has been closed and I lose my excess coins. That said, I’m not sure I would have even finished my Extended Essay for my IB Diploma if not for this app :)

title: More motivation
review: I love this app because it truly makes me put my phone down. I get to look back at all the trees I've planted and look at how long I've studied for. I've gotten friends to buy this app and we'll plant trees together. It's just overall motivating when I have no motivation to study. This app makes me feel good about my studying habits.

title: Best app to keep me focused!
review: I wish they allowed us to extend the time past 2 hours because I generally study for longer periods of time without checking my phone and sometimes that isn’t factored into the coins. Other than that it is a great app for students or those who just have difficulty focusing on a task in general.

title: the best app EVER
review: I love love this app. It has seriously helped me develop better study habits along with being present and mindful of how I am spending my time. Not only that, I love the feature that you could use forest with other friends ❤️ although, sometimes the inviting friends feature hardly works, you can join their “room”. Overall, LOVE!

title: Good to block reflexive phone use!
review: I got this app so I could focus better at work. It is very helpful, especially for those moments when I think, "oh, I should check whether such and such is happening those week," or message a friend. Now I write those things down and do them during breaks in the forest growing. I like the app a lot!

title: Focused!
review: I started using this about three years ago and I get work done! It locks my phone so I won’t be tempted to use it, and it also records the amount of time you have stayed focused throughout. The time adjustments make it easy to work either in increments or longer (breaks can be even be timed in!).  As a student it’s nice see my dedication as a forest! ^____^

title: Great for all situations
review: I love this app! It’s wonderful to be able to set a “reward” based timer when I’m trying to focus on something. I’ve started setting it if I’m watching a show with my partner, before we sit down to eat, and when I lay down for bed as well. It has greatly helped curb my impulse to grab my phone whenever I’m frustrated or bored.

title: Great for anxiety relief
review: I have been using this app to work for thirty minutes and have five minute breaks. It’s great for helping my stress and anxiety over large projects. It’s also nice to be able to see your progress in trees if it seems like your project isn’t going anywhere. I highly recommend it, even if it’s a couple dollars out of pocket.

title: Super helpful
review: I’ve been looking for ways to force myself to stop using my phone while I should be working. This app gives a little more incentive behind staying focused & off my phone. I’ve recommended it to like 5 people & gifted it to my younger brother, who is addicted to social media. Hopefully we all can increase our productivity.

title: Great app
review: For someone with ADHD (meaning, difficulty not only focusing on one thing but also with task transitioning and starting work) Forest has been a godsend. The goals of getting new trees with increasing gold needed for each one is help for wanting to use the app and the tree immediately dying of you leave the app has help to boost my productivity immensely. Well worth the price.

title: Why Forest works for me
review: I have tried using many app to help me stay on task in the past and none work as well as Forest. What Forest has done is roll the habit and reward into one. Before using Forest I had a great app for focus, but wasn’t invented to keep using it. With Forest I’m planting trees, which feels good and is enough to stay away from distractions during work sessions.

title: Lifesaver
review: I’m an actual person who is actually writing this but this app has helped save my relationship. I have been able to get away from my phone and actually spend time talking and listening to those who are important to me. It seems like a silly concept but it has powerful effect in your life.

title: Great App for Focusing
review:
Wonderful app for staying focus and trying to curb the habit of habitually reaching for your phone. I find I try to lean on my phone when I am
overwhelmed or stressed about a project, and Forest has really helped me correct that habit by just adding a moment of reflection every time I pick up my phone.

title: Helps me keeping time and staying more focused!
review: This app takes the time management from me which makes me more focused on whatever I am doing at that time. And knowing that a real tree is gonna be planted after I reach 2500 points makes me believe that I am making a difference

title: Fun way to keep on track
userName: Best game ever in da world
review: I enjoy having the chance to represent my studying time and also make a difference by planting trees! I recommend this app to anyone who finds pleasure in seeing their progress on what every they spend time on or if you need some motivation to focus!

title: incredible!
review: Having ADHD is super difficult. I’ve gone through oodles of these apps to try and focus correctly. But the fact that I kill a tree when I leave the app really hit me in a certain way that just makes it work. 10/10 recommend!!!

title: Beautiful
review: I love this app for its simple beauty. It’s really well designed. I don’t think I understand how it would be useful if you don’t have “deep focus” mode on. I guess it would be like an honor system thing. But I have really enjoyed using this app and have recommended it to several people!

title: ADHD has nothing on Forest
review: I can’t recommend this app enough. I have struggled for my entire life to focus. This app is truly life-changing for me because it applies my love of the earth and conservation efforts to motivate me to do what I should have been doing in the first place. 😂 My only regret is that I didn’t find Forest sooner!

title: Gamification of focused time
review: This is great motivation to try and stay focused. It’s amazing how effective some i g like this can be by making it cost even something as insignificant as a digital tree. Not to mention the cost associated to remove a dead tree from your forest if you’ve lost. So far I’m really liking this app.

title: My secret weapon
review: I’ve been using this app for years to force myself to study and I force it on anyone who will listen. When I was a nanny using this app was the only way I could get my 13 year old boy to get off his phone to do his homework. I recommend for you and your mom, child and dog.

title: Really helps me focus
review: I would be on Instagram even more way too much if not for this app. I use it when I’m working, when I’m watching a show, when I’m journaling, so I can focus on what I’m actually doing and not mindlessly scrolling. I can’t wait til I get to the point where I can plant a real tree!

title: i love this app
review: other productivity apps are too complicated for me— the planting a tree idea makes it easy to block out time to focus and then take a break for however long you ACTUALLY need to take a break. it’s especially efficient when learning is asynchronous and you have huge chunks of free time to get work done.

title: Great app for studying
review: I really like this app as it makes me more productive. I also really like the feature where you can choose to kill the tree if you quit out of the app or not. I wish that it wasn’t so hard to get more trees and I wish there were more options, because it seems like there is not a ton of variety. Regardless this app is really simple and useful.

title: Amazing, wish there was more functions
review: I love the app, but something I’ve always wished was a function was forming groups and being able to join groups of people. I really like it when you can join study and productivity groups in the app and see each other’s progress and forests, it will definitely encourage me SO MUCH MORE if there is a group function.

title: First day - a success!
review: I’ve only had this app for less than a day, but it’s already motivated me to study more. I did a total of 3 hours of studying today, which I broke up throughout the day in 25, 35, and 60 minute intervals. I found it was easier to return to working after a break and so I used more if my time studying.

title: Love this app
review: I feel so much more focused while I study. I feel like my brain is growing with knowledge as my forest is simultaneously growing in the process. The idea that my study time is planting real life trees in the world motivates me more and makes me feel like I’m making a difference and not really “wasting” my time. Beautiful concept and amazing application to the world.

title: I’m a bit concerned about privacy
review: It’s a Chinese country I think so I am a bit concerned as to why it asks for personal info when I make an account. Otherwise it is a good functional app that has helped keep me focused. Note: I was asked to write this review by the app in order to unlock a new tree. You get coins for staying focused which you can use to buy new trees. You can also buy them outright but I can’t imagine why you would do that.

title: Literally the Best. Def worth the money.
review: I have been using this app since high school and I’m now almost a junior in college. It is so helpful to keep me off my phone and it’s such a great incentive since you’re actually doing something good for the world!? It makes me feel so much better about being away from my phone.

title: Great for increasing productivity for students
review: I’m a college student and I love using this app to motivate me to put my phone down and focus on doing my homework, which often involves a lot of reading. I like how I can set the amount of time I wanna work and then set time afterward for a break which is nice. This is a great app, definitely would recommend!

title: Good for studying
review: This app is really helpful for those who spend too much time on their phones and as a college student with little time this app helps you to get things done and save time. I also just love the premise of this app and how simple this app makes it to make a difference in the world while helping you focus.

title: I love this app
review: This app really helps me focus on not texting my friends while I’m working, I love that they updated it so that you can still access the rest of your phone without your tree dying, because I’m still able to use Google and my calculator, but I want my tree to be the main focus so I don’t text.

title: great to have an incentive!
review: this app pushes me to be productive in my normally-lazy day-to-day routine. it gets me to finish my responsibilities and stray away from procrastination, which is an amazing feat because i used to be an avid procrastinator. the plus side as opposed to other apps is being able to change the tags which label each task that i perform without limits! me being the simple person i am, receiving a small reward every time i focus, even just a digital tree, gives me incentive for sitting down and tuning in to my productive mode. forest has been a great tool for me and i hope it continues to serve me and the rest of its customer base well!

title: Didn’t believe it’d help at first, pleasantly surprised
review: I was suggested to use this app by my so, who found it useful to stay focused while reading and annotating for school. Upon trying it (combined with the ever-useful Do Not Disturb), i realized i can stay on task for upwards of an hour without even glancing at my phone. Highly recommend, thank you for a beautiful app.

title: Good for being & staying productive.
review: I've only used the app for a few days and it's allowed me to stay productive. I always struggled with going on social media when trying to accomplish something. But i decided that paying the 2 dollars (i think it was) that this app is, was worth it because it would help. And it did.

title: Best focus app!!!
review: I am ADHD and to concentrate on one thing at a time is difficult which means my productivity can suffer. This app helps me stay OFF my phone and keep me focused on whatever I need each time I pick up my phone and try to distract myself for whatever reason the screen encourages me to stay away!! Don't look at me!! I absolutely love this app!!!

title: Great for studying! Stop losing those 5-10 min
review: We all do it, stop reading, grab our phone scroll social media for a second then *bing* 10 min is gone. Sure, 10 min in an hour study session is fine but we do it more than once and there’s another 10 gone and another....get it back and commit with this app.

title: Love it!
review: I adore this app! It is my preferred way of getting myself to focus on one thing at a time. I also love that when I am setting my phone down to be productive I can also track where the majority of my time and energy is going. This is helping me to really balance my life and not get stuck in the world of social media.

title: Helpful!
review: I’m not sure how, but this app does keep me accountable. When I do set it the messages of “keep going” or the stop button which says “give up” makes me feel bad about considering stopping and so I make sure all my little trees go. Would never have thought that fake trees would make me so guilty! Hahah but it’s great for what it is meant to do.

title: Great App for Staying Focused
review: I’ve had this app a little over a year and it’s been instrumental in helping me stay in the moment when I’m out and about and keeping me focused at work by turning leaving my phone alone into a game. Have almost collected all the trees and hoping for more soon! This app would be worth it at ten times the price.

title: Love what Forest does for the Planet
review: I love this app. It’s cute & simple & really does help me from checking social media or whatever may be distracting me at times. I will say you become a little addicted to trying to collect all the plants but at least in the end you can actually start putting your coins towards growing real trees. I believe I’m on my 4th now!

title: Making the overwhelming manageable.
review: I’m a creative mind who has a lot of big thoughts and dreams but I always get stopped by the details because they seem overwhelming. This is a terrific way incentivize your efforts. If forces you to take a deep breath and only work on one thing at a time. All I can say about this app is I wish I found it years ago!

title: More in app purchases
review:
This is a fest app and it really does help me stay focused. My only problem is how long it takes to get coins to get different variations of trees. After having two new trees it takes almost 72 hours of focus for a new tree. It only rises so the time to get new trees increases.
Also, it would be cool if they added a feature that keeps counting time after you meet your goal!
developerResponse:
{'id': 6193038, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app
feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-12-01T16:36:41Z'}

title: Improvement points
review:
Great tool, using it daily since years now.
The main point I would like to see improved before giving 5* is to include a real Pomodoro cycle setup, including pause and automatic restart.

Other than that, a web version that sync with the mobile one, better task assignment and the ability to link to a tool like Zapier would be the cherry on the cake.
developerResponse:
{'id': 5071453, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-09-17T05:16:09Z'}

title: So much more productive!
review: I love this app.  Apparently I value the life of these little trees more than I do my own.  It really does give me the motivation to keep off my phone no matter the temptation.  I’ve been able to study without distractions, pay attention in class more, and keep off my phone before bed!  It’s honestly such a great app.

title: Best app
review: This app has helped me since I was a middle schooler. I’m 21 now and it’s still helping me. Now, I share it with families I meet and babysit for and it turned out to be the perfect motivator for one student I tutor with ADHD. He said to me “I’d never kill a tree!!” And just like that his focus during our sessions went from 10min to 1hr.

title: MUST KEEP FOCUSED
review:
As someone who loves trees deeply, this is the perfect focus app. Forget other focus apps and tomato timers, this is it. 
If you break concentration, YOU KILL A TREE. And if you keep concentration, YOU GROW A FOREST. Absolutely lovely. 
Has a reward for my ADHD and a setting where if I leave the app (not if my phone’s display just turns off), then the tree dies. 
Must. Plant. Forest.
Thanks guys :)

title: It’s alright. A few things I noticed
review:
- rest mode should not be count towards total time focused. This should be it’s own category 
- there should be option for 5 minute interval. Use case here would be for breaks. 25 min focus -> 5 min break 
- there should be a streamlined way of going into a rest mode directly after a focus session

title: Essential.
review: It has all of the features I could ask for: a timer, stopwatch, aesthetically pleasing graphics, and eco efficient!! wow, just wow. it's hard to get board with all of the customisable upgrades with tree options you can get :) also the personalisation of it all is just so worth it !!

title: Genuinely Surprised
review: I was skeptical at first about using an app to help me focus, but I’ve found this to really help. I like that not only to I earn virtual rewards for not playing on my phone and completing my tasks, I like that you continue to earn rewards if you exceed the timer you set.

title: Great for ADHD
review: I just got this app and I suffer from ADHD and as a college student, this has been incredibly helpful. It’s a great way to motivate yourself to study or focus on a task! You just set the timer and you grow a cute plant, and you can set it to where if you use your phone, your plant(s) will wilt. I highly recommend:)

title: Essential
review: Forest is an incredibly useful app! The best feature is that it keeps track of how you spend your time throughout the day, and there is a feature that makes you stay on track/ off your phone. 11/10 recommend

title: Love it!
review: I have a small business, and I always find myself picking up my phone and getting distracted, even when I’m in a rush and behind on orders. This app has fixed that problem! It gives a little incentive for avoiding my phone and I just love the simplicity. 5 stars!

title: great app overall!!
review: There should be an option of apps you can access even when a growing tree is in session. But the apps should be limited by the app itself. For example, there should be an option to use the calculator or calendar or other apps that won’t take forever to use. Besides that, I love this app! It’s very helpful
developerResponse:
{'id': 6219174, 'body': 'Hello,

Due to the limitation of the iOS system, we cannot determine what app the user is currently using. Therefore we cannot implement the whitelist feature for the iOS version. As a workaround, we built a "Work with Phone" feature, which can be enabled in the settings page. This feature enables users to use work related apps during their planting periods, but users will have to be honest with themselves when using this feature. 

The trees planted with this feature enabled will not be counted towards the leaderboard, and users will only receive half the reward if they exit Forest during the planting period. 

Currently, the whitelist feature cannot be implemented for iOS. If you see features similar to whitelist on other apps, please let us know so that we may figure out how it was implemented. 

Thank you for your suggestion. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2021-02-08T23:41:14Z'}

title: Looking forward to using it
review: I have a lot of trouble staying on task and keeping focused on schoolwork when I could easily spend time on my phone, so I’m excited to try this because it somehow seems like it will work. I’m not sure why the consequences of not doing schoolwork don’t motivate me and growing a little virtual tree does but cool.

title: Really helpful when i’m trying to study.
review: This app really helps me focus on studying, reading, exercising, etc. Any time i want to look at my phone i read the little message telling me to focus, or to put my phone down, and i realize i’m getting distracted. It’s nice seeing the little trees grow too. One of my favorite apps.

title: A must get productivity app
review:
I was looking for a police in my home office and this app brought me one. 

I think it is the app that you ought to buy if you look into more control over your time while studying, reading, working on a project, training and so forth. 

The idea is so impressive, effective and fun and also it is so satisfying when you see your achievements, have a broad view on how much time you spent, when, where and on what with a very simple and intuitive way.

I can’t stress more on the necessity of getting this app in your top 10 apps list.

Many thanks go to the creators for their efforts and well done.

title: pretty good
review: I like this app a lot, it’s just not that practical since you might get texts during it that could be an emergency and to check them you have to kill your tree :( but i don’t see a way around this issue so it’s still a good app, also I wish stuff in this wasn’t so expensive it’s so hard to unlock new trees bc they’re so pricy and you barely get any coins

title: Great idea (needs more features though)
review: Love the app and the idea but it has very few features. Flora has a to-do list system and flora is free. i havent trued flora yet but i do believe this app could add things in an update such as a calendar to plan out your month along with a to- do list. So much more they could give the user and update this app with. Great idea though i like it. All for planting trees.

title: I love this app!
review: I love this app a lot- helps me stay focused and off my tablet/phone when i need to be doing work. 8 love having the ability to turn deep focus mode on and off as well. I just wish there were a few more forest options, like a coral reef, tropical forest, etc. Either way, love the app, keep doing what you’re doing.

title: Absolutely love ❤️❤️
review: I have only used it for a day, and I feel a huge change in my day. I don’t get my phone too much. I could focus on my homework, studies, family, and live stream without using my phone. I feel so much at peace and determined. I love the forest feature and able to see what you have accomplished. I love it! 🥺❤️

title: Best $1.99 study investment ever
review:
This app has allowed me to focus with the incentive of planting trees and also calculating the time I spend studying one different subjects. 

It gives you the virtual plant mom feel as well. You don’t want your trees or flowers to die so you stay focused on your task, and feel the motivation to put your phone down. 5 stars!

title: Love it!
review: In my pre quarantine life, I used it help me take a break from technology for a period, so I could read a book or puzzle or something without looking at technology. During quarantine, I use it to help me focus on my work, so I am not constantly checking my phone for coronavirus updates and actually doing my work!

title: Amazing
review: This app is so helpful. I’m so distracted on my phone doing random things and as a student I’m so motivated by studying so I can make a beautiful forest and I definitely recommend it to students and to working adults. Study/work and take a break because there is a break option. Thank you Forest for saving me from being distracted!

title: Love this app!
review: I’m someone that’s constantly on their phone and I get pretty distracted easily and for long periods of time. This is such a lifesaver when it comes to doing any type of schoolwork done because you feel some sort of guilt if you kill a tree. Definitely would recommend this app if you need to be productive 😄

title: Love!
review:
I adore this app and use it all the time. One of very few apps that I pay for the voluntary subscription, not for added features but because I want to support the developers making similar mindful and life enhancing new products.

In a future update, I’d love the ability to see how often I’ve planted each kind of plant.

title: AMAZING
review: this app is the only app/software that has allowed me to put the phone down and actually get to work. I have a huge procrastination issue, but Forest makes things so much easier for me. I am SO glad I spent the $2 on this app (I never spend money on apps, BTW).. I've gotten things done quicker and easier because of this app.

title: Great for focus
review: Whenever you need to focus on something just use this app. It really allows you to concentrate on the task at hand. I have loved this app from day one. You don’t have to pay in order to use it if you don’t want to. Definitely give this app a try and grow a forest of fun plants while getting so much done!!!

title: Productivity Boost!
review: I have been using this for keeping my studying/homework time at home more consistent and I have found it has helped me immensely. Not only with keeping me off my phone but with keeping me motivated to do work. Watching the little plants grow is always so cute and a great addition versus other timing/phone restricting apps!!

title: it actually really helps !
review: I thought it wouldn’t help and i would just let my tree die but you also get coins if u plant ur tree and it grows and you get achievements. With those coins you can eventually plant a real life tree which i think is down right heart lifting. I absolutely love this app and thank you for helping me finish me summer assignments :)

title: Helpful and calming
review: Forest has helped me stay on task, recognize how often I “just check” my phone during momentary lulls - turns out it’s a lot! - and to give me a little plant-growing confidence. The first time I used it I didn’t focus well since I just wanted to read all the cute phrases telling me to leave it alone, but since then it’s been great!

title: In love
review: I absolutely love this app. It is worth the price without a doubt simply because of the instant reward of getting a tree and the consequence of killing it. It offers many treats like music to help you focus and you can plant a REAL TREE when you get enough coins. This app really helps me study and helps me track how much I actually study. I love this app.

title: Amazing!
review: This app helps keep me motivated and FOCUSED when studying and I love it! My studying had improved so much and I enjoy the cute trees I get to grow! The size and number of trees you get to grow during one session depends on the length of time you set. This makes me want to do 2 hour study sessions now, just so I can get the biggest tree possible for my forest haha 🤓

title: Love it!
review: This app really helps me stay off my phone when I need to do work! It’s a bonus cause you get to plant extra trees when you have enough coins! And the little trees are very cute! This app has really helped me get work done and stay focused. At first I thought it wouldn’t work, and I would end up killing all my trees... but it does!

title: Personally, I didn’t waste money
review: I like the Forest App. It comes in handy when I’m finally ready to be productive with my life. If you feel like your phone is a big distraction for you, no matter your scenario, this app should help with that— only if you think you’ll actually open the app. Personally, I didn’t waste my money.

title: Helped me with my procrastination problems!
review: I was honestly the worst about sitting and just studying. Everything would distract me and I don’t have enough willpower to just ignore my phone, until I heard of the pomodoro technique and found Forest. I feel so bad about killing my trees that I end up doing my best to avoid that, as a consequence I complete my tasks haha

title: Forest is cute and helps me be productive
review: I love forest and I like saving my coins to buy the trees. I like how it plants trees because it also makes me feel bad if I kill my tree so I usually don’t. I do stop using it after a while though it would be cool if they added a goal or something so I would feel more motivated to use it more often

title: Best productivity app!
review:
Often it’s hard to focus on studying. This app helps get rid of distractions. I love the sound effects, like the Paris cafe and the London street, but I wish there were more! 
The plants are super cute and I’m looking to collecting them all. It’s hard to save up enough coins to unlock things, maybe more rewards would help? Thank you ! 🌱🌎

title: Incredibly Helpful
review: I am a doctoral student and I use this app to help me with my work. I find it highly reinforcing when I earn enough coins to buy a new plant or tree. Additionally, I can't get over the fact that my productivity creates sustainability for others by growing real trees in communities in need. Excellent app. One suggestion would be to add more plant and tree varieties.

title: Great for motivation
review: This app has constantly helped me finished my homework because when I see it, it reminds me “Okay now I need to get this done and I want it done in this amount of time”. The trees are very adorable and cute and my only problem with them is that buying trees and bushes can get very expensive after a while. Otherwise, it’s a great app to help with motivation and time management.

title: Im more productive with this
review: The app really puts you in a corner in the best way. It may feel childish but it will end your session if you use your phone and it kills the tree when you give up. But it works, i must humble myself before i can be productive and this app humbles you. A beautiful app with a beautiful reward for success. Love the rain sounds so much

title: My experience with forest app
review: Forest app is my new favorite app! I have been using it for about a month and I have inspired a handful of friends to download and use it as well. It has helped me to detach from my phone and I love the aspect that I can devote time to actually plant a real tree 💓 thank you to the developer and anyone else who has helped this be a reality

title: Great tool
review: This app has really helped me focus! I’ve tried other study timers but this one prevents you from going on your phone which is big along with a great UI and some interaction between you and your forest. I would definitely recommend this app to anyone who is picking up their phone constantly while studying.

title: Very useful so far
review:
It really helps me when I’d like to stay off my phone, especially when I’m studying. 

The only improvement I’d suggest is adding an option to “whitelist” selected apps. For example, I want to study using my flashcard app but avoid other distractions. I can have Forest allow me to switch to my flashcard app to study without killing my tree, but if I go anywhere else, the tree dies.
developerResponse:
{'id': 5279988, 'body': 'Hello,

Due to the limitation of the iOS system, we cannot determine what app the user is currently using. Therefore we cannot implement the whitelist feature for the iOS version. As a workaround, we built a "Work with Phone" feature, which can be enabled in the settings page. This feature enables users to use work related apps during their planting periods, but users will have to be honest with themselves when using this feature. 

The trees planted with this feature enabled will not be counted towards the leaderboard, and users will only receive half the reward if they exit Forest during the planting period. 

Currently, the whitelist feature cannot be implemented for iOS. If you see features similar to whitelist on other apps, please let us know so that we may figure out how it was implemented. 

Thank you for your suggestion. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-09-28T14:27:21Z'}

title: Outstanding
review: 'I absolutely love the app. As a middle schooler enrolled in 10+ activities throughout the year, I have a lot of work and a tendency to procrastinate', I write while avoiding doing my math homework. 😂 In all honesty, the app has gotten me motivated to do things that I haven't wanted to do before, like organizing my closet. It really does work and is well worth the two dollars.

title: The greatest productivity app
review:
Pros:
-Trees are cute
-Neat visualizations of your forest to track how consistently you’re being productive
-Fun achievements
-Plant cute trees with friends!
-Can put on Google Chrome too, with a site-blocking ability similar to Cold Turkey for the duration of the tree
-Trees are cute, making you really want to plant for a whole two hours
-Work with phone mode is really neat if you MUST
-Notification for leaving the app makes you really want to go back and not kill your tree—p r o t e c c
-Came first, unlike the lesser knockoff, Flora
-Only a couple bucks and handles in-app purchases REALLY well

Cons:
-Killing a tree you planted feels REALLY horrible :( So, work hard and stay on task!

title: Best App on my Phone
review: I honestly love the concept of this! I’m addicted to cacti, so I bought the cacti to plant and I make sure I plant everyday to get the achievements. I’m pretty close to planting a live tree as well! Only suggestion — maybe make a few more achievements? It’s pretty difficult to earn coins and I think the only positive reinforcement we get for planting is coins.

title: Very useful but improvement needed
review: It’s been very useful since I have started using this tool to track my focus time . I can know how much time I am being productive on daily basis . It let’s you categorize time you spent like Study, Work , Reading etc but it would be great if we can drill down further to understand where exactly the time was spent with respect to those categories
developerResponse: {'id': 3954592, 'body': 'Hello, when you start planting the tree, you can tap on the button with a pen icon at the upper-left corner. There you can make notes to write down any note you wish to tell or remind yourself. We hope this helps! -Forest', 'modified': '2018-06-24T14:50:31Z'}

title: Focus Time
review: I like to say that I don’t always use this app, but once I use it, it actually significantly increased my focusing time. Also, I can see my other friends who are using this app. The only issue I think is that you can not use the white list for the deep-focus mode.

title: Great little app
review: This has really exceeded my expectations. I’ve been using for years and it has helped me log thousands of undistracted hours and building my little forest is surprisingly fun. Settings and options (stopwatch vs timer) useful and intuitive. Highly recommend
developerResponse: {'id': 32352738, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you so much for your big support! We really appreciate your positive comment and are thrilled to hear that Forest has been a helpful partner in your focus journey. :)', 'modified': '2022-10-03T08:10:38Z'}

title: Motivational
review:
Reminds me of the promodoro technique but with cute visuals of a little forest that helps motivate me to continue studying and plant more trees.

It would be a neat feature to add the possibility of planting a real tree after you reach certain amount of time studying though! 

Nevertheless, very helpful with studying and time management :)

title: Productive Habit Making Machine!
review: I recommend anyone who cannot stay focused for anything longer than 5 minutes to pick up this app and begin using it. The interface is simple to understand and rewarding you for doing the work you must do!! 5/5!

title: Rediscovered this Gem of an App
review:
This is an app I had briefly used quite a few years ago.

Recently, I gave it another shot after seeing YouTuber “Kharma Medic” use it. I’ve since realized how fun it is to use (now that I have a more disciplined and strategic work/study schedule than I did previously).
developerResponse: {'id': 26551808, 'body': 'Thanks so much for sharing your experience with us. We hope you continue to enjoy Forest! :)', 'modified': '2021-11-30T06:48:20Z'}

title: Productive With Friends!
review: I’ve only had this app for a few days and the amount of things I got done with friends online has been unbelievable! I wish I had tried this app out sooner. I will definitely recommend it to all my friends!

title: Simple but effective
review: This is a very simple concept but if you actually use the app properly, it’s really effective at keeping you focused and off your phone. I downloaded during the covid pandemic and it helped me adjust to staying focused while working from home.

title: Completely focused and having fun!
review: I am LOVING this app! Since losing my job, I felt like I couldn’t get myself to sit down and focus on one single task. A friend recommended this app to me and it has made my day more manageable, tasks are actually being completed, and I feel like I’m being productive!

title: Surprised it took digital trees to get me to focus
review: A friend recommended this app so I thought I might as well try it. Keeps me focused mostly be reminding me of the goal I set for myself at the beginning of a study session. Great for keeping track of time studying with a nice degree of adjustments and rewards for sticking to your routine.

title: Love My Forests
review:
I use this app to keep me focused during class and while studying! The only reason I don’t give it 5 stars is because there isn’t a way to end early without killing your tree. So even if you complete your assignment, the tree dies if you “give up”.
I’m gonna keep using it and I’ll update the review if I find a work around!

title: Love it!
review: I use this when doing hw to keep from getting distracted. I have tried many apps like this, and this one is definitely the best! Not only is it helpful, when you buy it the money and your time goes to a great cause! 10/10 recommend.

title: Thank you so much!
review:
Like many others, I work from home. I work for a tech startup, and I wear so many hats that I have a hard time keeping up with all of my tasks. 
This app has helped me show my employer exactly how much time I spend on projects and how best to designate my time and tasks.

title: This keeps me focused
review: I hate to admit that at times phone-use can be addicting and seriously get in the way of performing productive tasks and just living life in general. This apps gives good incentive to stay off the phone. Hopefully I can stay consistent in its use and kick my phone addiction.

title: Really, it’s great!
review: Honestly, Forest has become a part of my daily routine as a college student. I would not have been able to study and get 👏 things 👏 done 👏 without this app! It motivates me to stay off my phone and get into “productive-mode!” I could not recommend it more!

title: Keeping the momentum
review:
I’m disciplined but even so - in this day and age it’s easy to get distracted.  This app is my friendly librarian making sure I’m being quiet and attending to my work

I don’t want to disappoint her or the trees growing fully.   Though I’m tired - this app eases the tension from working the day job so I can focus on my own work.  Thank you

title: Love It!!!
review:
As someone who has tons of trouble staying focused, this app is a blessing. I have it on all of my devices and love that it syncs up so well. I also love that you can add notes to your trees! 

I wish there was a way to only block specific apps while a tree is growing, instead of all or none, but that's the only suggestion I have. Overall, a great app I definitely recommend!

title: Great app!
review: Very useful if you use it right, worth the money. It’s fun to plant all of the different trees and see your forest grow over time. My only complaint is that there isn’t a way (to my knowledge) to show the time in a notification banner on your lock screen (like the Apple clock app does with timers). It’s small, but I know it would make my experience significantly better.

title: Love forest app
review: I really enjoy this app. It’s easy to use and has helped me be more aware of some of my phone habits. I can’t believe how many times I try to pick up my phone for no reason when I’m growing a tree. It’s not pushy about in-app purchases or leveling up, so it lets me focus, just what it’s designed to do. I use it almost daily.

title: Very Helpful!
review: I really like nature so this app is a win for me. I usually keep it on deep focus and I study for at least 30 minutes. The forest really inspires me to make more trees thus study more.I also want a lot of diversity but to get more species I need coins, so that also motivates me to study more. I really like how this app also allows you to plant real life trees.

title: This app is so crucial for staying focus
review: Forest will help you stay focus all the time, and pls remember to turn off all notification while using this app. I am a very easily distracted person, but this app has helped me to stay focus all the time. The money you spend will worth for your development of focus ability.

title: ADHD is a Superpower....
review:
and this App has helped me stay on task, undistracted, and know I will be doing the planet some good as I work. Highly recommend for that are looking to be more intentional about how they manage their
blocks of time. This has helped improve my productivity and accomplish tasks and has increased the number of meaningful tasks I fulfill. win win win!!!

title: Incredible, totally worth it
review: As a college student who is on her phone too much, this app has been an invaluable resource. This may sound like an exaggeration, but I was able to write long two papers in a week thanks to this because it kept me off social media and games. It’s totally worth the $2, plus it’s super cute!

title: Helpful and Motivating
review: I’ve been using Forest for about 2 years now, and it truly does help. I’m a high school student and sometimes we really lack motivation to do homework, but I hate seeing that little tree die! I’ve raved about it to my friends and I absolutely love it. It makes me not want to use my phone which is so helpful.

title: Get it! Love this app
review: It’s so satisfying to see the hours you put into your work visualized - and the audio is great, too! I like the nature sounds and always play them in my headphones while I’m working. The sound of all the trees flourishing at once is also fun to hear! Lastly, it’s great that you can donate points you earn toward planting actual trees.

title: I love this app!
review: Forest has made me actually sit down and get my work done. I am a major procrastinator and this app really helps. Due to social media i’m on my phone constantly and Forest actually motivates me to keep going and to get my work done. I highly recommend using this app to actually stay focused because it really helps me.

title: Best app for focusing I’ve ever used.
review:
I have the attention span of a goldfish most days. But setting the app on Deep Focus and realizing I will kill my digital tree if I deviate has done wonders for my productivity. I won’t pretend I don’t check Facebook on my computer, but it at least takes my phone out of the equations for at least an hour. 

Love the app.

title: A great app for keeping yourself productive
review: I love using this app to keep myself focused on my work and programming. I think the killer feature this app has compared to other pomodoro like apps is seeing the forest you build. It helps you visualize the work you are doing towards your goals. Also, it helps motivate you to grow your forest!

title: Yes!
review: I love forest. I’ve recommended it to dozens and will recommend it to more. Not only does it help me focus, the fact that the tree withers and that is RECORDED when you leave the app (not recorded as in video, but recorded as in it says that it died) also, there is the incentive that if you get enough, you can plant a real tree. If you are on the edge about this, get it! It is worth EVERY SINGLE PENNY!

title: Amazing!!
review: For an odd reason the tiny tree makes you want to keep it alive and get off your phone. And once your off and doing something else, it's easy to stay off of the screen. I especially like it because it allows me to contribute to our environment by benefiting myself with productivity. It's a win-win!

title: Perfect Study Tool
review: It is very satisfying to see how much you can grow. Also when you fail, the tree dies and you have to use your money from succeeding to pay to get rid of your dead tree. Also weekly and monthly feedback gives you a grasp on how good your productivity has been compared to other times.

title: Saved my productivity
review: This app is responsible for 50% of my major accomplishments in the past year. At this point I just need to turn it on and once I hear the music I settle in and focus. As a professional procrastinator with enough anxiety to kill a small dog not having the option of using other apps reduces the stress of working.

title: Growing is Great!
review:
I love how easy to use this app but it also helps me snap out of the monotonous flow of grabbing my phone and checking it. The fact of knowing that’ll I eventually “plant” a tree is satisfying. 

The only reason I say eventually is because it takes way to many coins in order to produce a tree. I’m curious to see how many hours it takes plant a tree & once I know I’ll update my review lol

title: Favorite Productivity App
review: Absolutely lovely! Really makes me want to stay off my phone. Gaining coins for working over the amount of time set is a great motivator. I love all of the different types of plants and bushes you can plant. And even better, absolutely no ads. Overall, just an amazing app that really makes you focus on your work.

title: Love this App for focus
review: I have a massive and flighty workload (gotta love fundraising) and there are a hundred shiny objects every day trying to steal my focus from the true needle movers. This app has helped me focus on one task at a time much more than any of the web-based options that can’t tell when I’m responded to a text or looking up a personal item, etc.

title: Good app. Could be better
review:
I like this app, really helped me to me more efficient. 
It would be better if you guys develops a “white list” function. For example, sometimes I just want to use dictionary or calculator on my phone. But I can’t because my tree would die. So it would be better if we have this white list.

title: Focus and save the planet!?
review: I really do love this app. It’s a lot of fun to use. I like the ambient sounds that it gives you to play in the background, I find them more helpful for staying focused than listening to Classical Music. And customizing your Forest is so cute. Great app for students, people working office jobs, or anyone who just wants to be more present.

title: Relaxing way to focus
review: I love this app because it keeps me motivated to stay off my phone. I love being able to look back at all the days and seeing which days I was the most focused. I also love that it keeps track of how long you’ve used the app each day because it feels nice to visual your progress.

title: What a wonderful app
review: I absolutely love this app. I’ve convinced many of my friends and family to download the app and have had some very immersive and involved experiences as a result. I’ve actually recommended the use of this app as a attendance/no phone reinforcement app for my Uni classes, maybe something for the devs to consider? Love this app, keep up the great work

title: A clever way to manage your screen time
review: This app is very helpful in managing your screen time. While focused on the real world, you also earn coins that could be converted to planting real trees on the earth! Everyday, you know you are doing something better to yourself and others in this world, which is a great feeling!

title: Good app, need some improvements
review: Good app. However the coins needed for the other plants are way out of reach until you’ve been using the app for a long time. Also I think there should be an option where you can disable notifications for the time you are studying for.

title: good stuff!!!
review: at first I was hesitant I must admit; paying to watch plants grow doesn’t exactly seem worth it, at least as far as my phone activity is concerned. But, I was not disappointed, and am generally satisfied with what this forest thing brings to my studying. Without the app’s requirement to stay off your phone, I would hate this thing because it would never get used

title: Great!
review: This app really helps me focus. My only complaint is that you get just one focus soundscape (rain). To unlock more (beach, cafe, etc.), you have to use coins to unlock more, which forces you to choose between boosting the functionality of the app or planting a tree in real life. I wish these two features didn’t have to compete.

title: Very good!
review: I’ve been really stressed recently with the amount of work I have so I looked for a productivity app today and I found this to be the best option for me. This is such a good way of studying for me because I always get so distracted on my phone when I get discouraged or bored.

title: Has really made it easy to stay focused
review: Gamified focus app. Love it. Turning the phone to a do not disturb zone has taken away my biggest distraction.  I have been using this for a few years now and it has helped me manage stress by helping me get things done. Thanks for the app.

title: yesss!! Love this app
review: This gives me such a fun way to organize my study time and keep me on task. I feel like it occupies my phone well so that I’m not tempted. Also, seeing your little forest grow after a couple uses is just too cute. Highly recommend from a junior in high school!

title: Finally breaking my bad habit of checking my phone!
review:
Do it  pay for it  it's worth it  

Of all books I've read on building good habits it's hard to do if you keep checking phone. Sure there's other distractions but most of them exist on my phone

title: Love this App!
review: ImJemm, the youtuber, recommended this app before in one of her videos and ever since, i’ve been using this app all the time! It makes me 10x more productive than without this app. I recommended it to my friends and they are also using it! Totally recommend downloading.

title: Focus on school
review: I do college online (even before covid) and my phone has always been the biggest distraction. This app has seriously helped me cut down on that and focus in! I use it in conjunction with the chrome extension to really get work done! 100% recommend.

title: A good habit-forming tool
review: i’m still getting used to it, and having some sort of “pause the timer for this many minutes” would be very helpful, but all in all its been very useful for keeping me of track while i work from home

title: Productivity, but make it green
review: I’ve been using Forest for the past few years now, and I haven’t stumbled upon another app that keeps me away from my phone when I need to focus. I love the concept of Forest and highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a simple but effective way to stay productive.

title: Clever Way to Increase Productivity
review: This is a unique spin on the Pomodoro system for improving efficient use of time and increasing productivity during the day. It works essentially the same, allows more versatility in choosing your time blocks, and does something for the environment while you’re at it. No down side.

title: Simple But Effective
review: I’ve tried a lot of productivity apps but Forest works best for me. It’s so simple. You could use a timer, but being its own platform makes it a little special. It’s not an organizer, not a datebook, it doesn’t do anything but help you focus on what you’re trying to focus on. And it does that very well.

title: I love this app.
review: I used to struggle a lot with procrastination because I could not stay off my phone, but this app has helped me a lot! The different plants that you can grow keeps me motivated to study longer to earn more. It is totally worth the money to buy this app!

title: Great app
review: When I read this on Pinterest it grabbed my attention because it was a something that benefitted me and it is affordable. When I actually got the app there was this section on the app where it let you plant actual trees!  It was shocking to find out that this app was not only for profit but to help people who are in need.

title: Help me focus
review: I like to use this to do my homework because I constantly check my phone and see that I can’t exit the app, making me go back to work. I have started to pick up my phone less and less because of this. I like being able to disconnect and grow a garden in the meantime!

title: Lovely app
review: I’ve been very into gamified productivity tools lately, and this fit in perfectly with my arsenal. I have a strong collecting drive, so the desire to accumulate enough coins (earned through focused work time) to access new varieties of plants really motivates me to get things done! If you’re similar, this app will likely work for you!

title: The Forest App
review: I really enjoy this app. It helps me focus and allows me to set my phone down for a certain amount of time to get work done. By using this app, I have been able to work much faster, more effectively, and am overall more motivated. This app also helps plant more trees around the world, which is really awesome.

title: First Day Review
review: I have many goals, but often get distracted by social media or other random apps. Today is the first day I use Forest and I am in love! I can’t wait to grow my forest! I’ve already stayed focused for 75 min and I can’t believe it! I will update this review in a week to provide an update on my progress! Thank you developers!

title: LOVE this app!
review: I use this app when doing my work at home or when I’m just trying to stay off my phone. It’s worked wonders for me and according to my phone analytics has helped me reduce my phone use by 89%. I also love the cute forests you can build and the option to plant trees in real life. I highly recommend this app!

title: This is a good app!!
review: I really like this app, it helps me actually focus. Because rather than just locking my apps, which makes me want to go on them more, it just tells me that if i’m not on the app and leaving my phone alone, my tree will die. And because I don’t want the tree to die, i get my work done. I don’t want mr. tree to die so i get my work done, AND i get a forest to look at my productivity!

title: It’s helped
review: Honestly, I was skeptical to pay for it at first but it really helps. It makes you feel responsible for the tree growing, and no one wants to kill a tree, so it works for me. It’s a very simple and cute format so it’s easy to use as well. I now use forest when I want to stay away from my phone for homework, etc. I love this app

title: Recommend
review: If you tend to procrastinate on your phone then get this app. It prevents you from using it through the incentive of building a cute forest. If you use it during the time set you will kill your tree. It has helped me stay focused so far in college and I would highly recommend this app to students!

title: lovely
review: This app really works with my desire to see finished products, so focusing on anything that’s not my phone to getting a cute lil tree to go is perfect for me. Looking at my forest for the day and week and then month is so satisfying, and really makes me want to plant more and focus more. The simple design and aesthetic is wonderful. I really do love to use this app.

title: One of the best apps I’ve ever bought
review: Highly recommend this app to anyone who’s looking to maximize their work efficiency as well as track time. I use this app every day for various skills I am trying to improve on, the progress is not only noticeable, it’s astounding. This app is a complete game changer, get it, you won’t regret it

title: Love it!
review: I used to use the pomodoro method. It works well except sometimes I still can’t stay focused. A friend introduced the forest to me - i realized that if you care about an object (like a tree!), you’re more likely to stay focused even if it’s using the same methods! (I still time myself for 25min intervals). Great app! Can’t wait to unlock the beautiful trees!

title: Changes are frustrating
review: I liked the app before it changed so that you need a passcode on your phone in order for Forest to work properly. The whole point of using this was to keep me from looking at other apps. I never have a passcode on my phone, and it’s a hassle to set one every time I want to use the app. I realize the change had to do with the way iPhones work, but please—find a way around this!
developerResponse: {'id': 10519273, 'body': "Hi,\nThank you for the feedback. We understand it could be inconvenient for users who don't have a passcode on their devices, but at the moment it's required so that Forest can work properly. We'll continue improving our app and trying to find an alternative. Thanks again for sharing your thoughts with us. :)\n- Forest", 'modified': '2019-09-04T17:13:52Z'}

title: Cute and Effective
review: I always procrastinate on starting big assignments and forest forces me to. I like to just put my music on shuffle turn on forest for an hour and get it done. I think we've all grabbed our phone to skip a song and ended up on Twitter for twenty minutes before, so it helps me just let my phone be and focus.

title: cute and charitable time saver
review: I absolutely love Forest (and their sister app SleepTown) because it makes me excited to compartmentalize my life and actually be productive. it’s fun to do group planting with my brother. Plus if you get the coins (albeit a lot of coins) you can plant trees in real life. It makes any money I’ve spent on the game and the use worth it to help something bigger

title: I love this app!
review: It keeps me off my phone (so I’m being productive and not scrolling through Instagram) and it lets me play my music at the same time. It also feels really great when I make it to the end of the clock and grow a little tree. The more I use it, the less I’m on my phone, even without setting a timer.

title: Great app - only way to get off my phone
review: I started using this on my web browser and realized it would be a good tool for my phone. It’s the first app I downloaded in years that I feel like actually makes me more productive. The fact it’s a game really brings in a psychological factor that works for me personally.

title: I love this app! 🌳🌲🌴🌱
review:
This is the best thing to keep me focused at work. Or in any situation where my default mode with a moment of down time is to reach for my phone. It’s training me to focus and to not automatically look at my phone whenever I get a chance. 

It is easy to use, and really adorable. I can’t say enough good things!

title: Extremely well done.
review: Pitch perfect. Thanks for your extremely thoughtful, smart, and enjoyable app. I’ve used a few other methods from a watch timer, post-it notes, and other apps with some success. But this app has easily been the most helpful and most enjoyable. Highly recommend it! Good luck everyone!

title: gettin that education
review: im a big procrastinator. im awful at focusing and a prey to social media. i fall for all things social and all things media. thankfully this app exists. not only do i virtually grow trees, but i also contribute to “planting trees irl”. the best app if u are a procrastinator and is tryna cop that education. get ur education quick and ezpz without frantically finishing until the deadline. get this app ASAP, get ur degree ASAP

title: Very helpful!
review: I love the concept of it. It helps me study and I like how you can choose the increments of time. It has never glitched out on me, and I use it often. I recommend this for anyone who has trouble staying focused. It helps you stay off of your phone and possibly study, socialize, or whatever you might need to do.

title: Yay
review: I like forest it helps me be focused, wish it had a feature that allows me to use certain apps to such as my calculator app or music app. They have this feature on the laptop version and I would like to see it on the mobile version as well.

title: Boosts Productivity
review: This app has helped me so much. As a junior college student who gets distracted so easily, I owe my completed assignments to the Forest App. Today alone, I’ve studied for 5 hours and gotten so much done thanks to wanting to keep my tree alive. If you struggle with concentration…just get it already. You’ll love it!

title: Easy and effective
review: This app is really effective at helping me shut down electronic distractions.  Easy to use and the graphics are so cute.  I like the ability to do it with others as added incentive when I’m having a hard time staying on task.

title: A game changer
review: I love to fiddle with my phone and had a bad habit of looking on social media when I’m trying to focus on my work. This app is a game changer. The simple resistance of not wanting to “kill the tree” keeps me from even touching my phone until my timer is up. Love this app.
developerResponse: {'id': 31399230, 'body': "Hi, thank you for the feedback! Glad to hear you found Forest helpful and we're so proud of you for staying focus without touching your phone. You're doing such a great job! Your support and feedback has become our motivation to keep improving the app! Let's keep it up together :)", 'modified': '2022-08-11T05:17:04Z'}

title: Pure brilliance
review: This app is a demonstration of pure brilliance. What a beautiful way to keep yourself focused, present, and conscious. I’m amazed at the creativity of human beings. To the developers, stellar job. To the investors, thank you. This is truly helping me be more efficient. I’ve already gotten a friend using it and plan to tel many more about it.

title: iPad app forgotten
review: I love Forest and have been a user for many years on iPhone. The app has helped me stay focused through medical school and now in residency. I would love if the app was able to be displayed in landscape mode on the iPad, since I use the magic keyboard most of the time. Hope the iPad app gets this much-needed functionality.
developerResponse: {'id': 25419848, 'body': 'Hi, sorry for the inconvenience. The feature is now under development. However, adding new features or making adjustments to current ones takes time and deliberate consideration. Therefore, it cannot be implemented immediately. We hope you understand. Thank you and sorry for the trouble.', 'modified': '2021-09-30T13:45:42Z'}

title: I Want That Star Tree
review: To be frank, the only reason I am writing this review is because of the star tree, but I will admit that this app has helped me quite a bit in my pursuit. It’s well designed and visually appealing, as well as a great tool for college students and high schoolers that need an extra push.

title: Such a good motivator!!
review: When you use Forest you never want to use something else. It’s so fun trying to unlock all the possible trees. By doing that you’re constantly studying to get more coins. It’s such a great motivator, trying to get more trees, trying to stay away from your phone so your tree can grow. It’s such a great app!

title: Cute and functional!
review: This is a great app for people who have a hard time putting down the phone to get some work done. The theme is just cute enough so that I can guilt trip myself into not touching the phone (I dont want to kill a tree!) but it doesn’t make you feel too horrible for not achieving a goal.

title: The Cutest
review:
This app is the cutest.
I was introduced via HeyFranHey of The Friend Zone, a Mental Health & Wellness podcast a few years back but I didn’t need it then.
Now...I’d become addicted to my phone 🥴 & felt like this was a nice, gentle reminder for me to leave it alone.
I truly do enjoy it and hope to introduce some of my phone addicted friends as well.
Thank you 🙏🏽

title: This app is the best
review: I would definitely get this app if you have a hard time working on school or work stuff because it helps get you off your phone and it has helped me so much. I use this app all the time to help me get my school work done and it is one of the best apps i have on my phone

title: Great for focusing!
review: I’m addicted to my phone and currently in college. That’s a problem. This app has helped me so much with getting off my phone and doing my schoolwork. There’s a little sense of accomplishment that you get by planting these trees because you’ve worked hard for them. Would highly recommend!

title: Enjoying time with my spouse
review:
This has been great for us to be. Husband and I grow a tree while we have conversations so we aren’t tempted to pick up our phones. I am enjoying this app. I just wish the trees would grow larger for longer times and maybe get more
Coins for longer times so we would be encouraged to set the timer for a longer period.

title: Great app for my grad student life!
review: As someone working and in grad school, this app has really helped me to stay focused on one thing at a time. I use it to carve out time to study, clean, etc. without being tempted to respond to friends texts, google things that are really not that urgent, etc. I've already recommended it to friends!

title: Great app for a little extra motivation.
review: This app is perfect for a little extra motivation and a great way to track your focus. My favorite feature is the tag system showing what you spend the most time on. I’m making a process of prioritizing the things that are truly important to me so it’s great!

title: One of the best purchases you’ll make
review:
If you’re a fan of the pomodoro method and care about efficiency, this will be one of the best purchases you’ve ever made.

If you’re someone who gets distracted by their phone easily, this will seriously help you stay on task as the app constantly guilts you out of the app by praying on your love for the trees

title: Love it!!
review: As someone who wastes lots of time on my phone and has trouble focusing on what needs to get done, this app helps me to really concentrate and stay off of social media. I have the app in deep focus mode, and the first time one of my trees withered, I felt so bad I decided not to let it happen again. I already feel so much more productive!!

title: It really makes you want to focus!
review: The idea of studying is one i struggle with. But this app makes me stay focused for the set time, and gives me the option to take breaks in-between. Not just this, but the fact that you can contribute to planting a tree somewhere also intrigues me and makes me want to work harder.

title: PLEASE Make it go LANDSCAPE
review: I absolutely freaking love this app. The only problem with it for me is that I primarily use it with an iPad Pro and my Smart Keyboard while I work on a laptop. Therefore, I am always turning my head all funny all the time. Other than that, I have tried like 50 apps for the same purpose. This one is definitely the best.

title: This is literally the only thing that can keep me off my phone
review: As a proud member of generation z, I admit that I’m thoroughly addicted to my phone. On the days I urgently need to do work and kick my addiction, I use this app. Letting the little virtual trees die are something I’m unwilling to do, which leaves me with time to actually do what I need to. I absolutely love this app.

title: Fantastic App!
review: This app. paid for itself within the first 24hrs. It’s simple but genius - hands down one of the greatest productivity tools I’ve seen. A must-try for anyone addicted to their phone (which is most of us). EDIT: I’ve been using this app. for over a year now, and I still use it almost every day. I love it.

title: Lovely
review: This is just a nice app for making yourself set your phone down. I like using it when I go to sleep to resist the urge to check my messages one more time. My other uses vary but it’s never not been nice to have around. The plant designs and regular updates thereto are also great. It’s pretty, simple, and pleasant. No complaints.

title: Love!
review: What an adorable way to encourage screen free work time. Though the price of the app may seem substantial, I believe it is worth it for the quality of the app. There are achievements to earn that encourage frequent use of this app, and the trees are so gosh darn adorable I’m trying to find every moment I don’t need my phone so I can grow more trees.

title: Strongly recommend！
review: It’s a very useful application for me to focus on my work. I cannot leave my phone by myself. Before I used forest, every final week, I didn’t dare to bring my phone all day. It made me miss many important things. But now I can bring my phone and just open this application and to work efficiently.

title: Wonderful App
review: I don’t often write reviews but this app deserves some of my time and energy. This app has helped me manage my time better, helped me break my large projects and tasks into smaller chunks, making them less daunting...for anyone struggling with being productive or getting motivated, I think this app is a great tool.

title: Well worth the small cost
review: Don’t normally write reviews but for only a few bucks this app has dramatically improved my productivity by making me very aware of how I use my time and allowing me to break it up into small focused chunks to increase my productivity. Well worth it and I’ve recommended it to my family :)

title: I love this
review: This not only keeps you from looking at your phone, but it also motivates you to study (if that’s what you’re using this for). Knowing that you can plant a real tree keeps you from giving up, and, as a procrastinator, helps you stay on track. That way, it is more satisfying when you plant a tree

title: Love it!! Extra benefits of focusing on work
review: It works as well as other similar method apps but this one gives you the benefit of gaining points for the time you focus and you can use those points to plant trees in places in need around the world. Makes me focus so much more not only for me but for a bigger objective than myself.

title: Best app on my phone!
review: This is a great app for people who struggle with short attention spans, procrastination, and distractions. The UI is great, the visuals are beautiful, and the cute gameification of deep focus labor is a low stress way to focus back on RL activities. They’ve grown a lot since the app first was released, and dev team has been great at incorporating user feedback. 15/10 always recommend.

title: Can we have more sound options...
review: Great app, wish there was more of a variety of sounds. It’s also pretty hard to earn coins.... 500 seems like a lot for different sound, could u have different types of sound like piano music or classical music when studying for example.

title: Please add a widget
review: This app is very helpful. Please add a widget. A widget would be very convenient for setting and checking the focused time during the day without having to unlock the phone and open the app. Also please allow for the timer to continue for longer than 2 hours. Sometimes I work for longer than 2 hour periods and it is not counted as time.
developerResponse: {'id': 3183154, 'body': "Hello, we'll consider implementing this feature in future updates. \nThanks for the feedback.\nPlease feel free to contact us if you have further questions or suggestions. :) -Forest", 'modified': '2018-04-19T06:04:37Z'}

title: BUG in new version of iOS
review: I am disabling background app in iOS. After updating to iOS 11 it gives you the whole 2 hour (I always set in 2 hour) without finishing it when you lock unlock the phone. I haven’t figured it out what is the reason behind this bug. But it occurs repeatedly.

title: Very helpful with homework and tasks
review: I’m a bad procrastinator and I found that using a timer helps me get things done. Not only is this app a timer, but also gives you rewards like coins. It becomes rewarding and gives you a goal of collecting more trees!

title: Love the idea of the app
review: I think it’s an amazing idea to defeat phone addiction, with the incentive of planting trees. Who can argue that planting trees is a bad thing. We need more of them, and most people won’t go out and plant them themselves. Yet this app allows you to do that and tackle your addiction to your phone.

title: Amazing App
review: i have a hard time focusing most of the time, especially when trying to control my habit of grabbing my phone in class. However with the forest app i use it to help grow trees while in class and focusing away from my phone.

title: Saved my life!
review:
#1 App out there! 5 Stars!
I downloaded Forest over 2 years ago and yes I continue to use it every day! This app has literally transformed  my time management & productivity habits. For this reason, it will remain on my home Screen of my iPhone & Apple Watch forever.

title: Effective
review: I’m surprised at how this app helps me maintain focus at work. I didn’t think it would work, but it does, and I’m very happy with it. Would highly recommend downloading it if you need to keep away from your phone when working or studying.

title: It’s okay. I like the concept.
review: I like the idea of planting trees while studying, learning or doing any task. Just being honest, there’s nothing different from this to your regular phone timer. So, if you don’t want to spend the $2 for the app, you’re not missing of much.

title: A lot of Fun!
review:
It actually motivates me to study since I always want to to collect more virtual money, complete challenges and track how much I studied each day! 

Great app and worth the 2 bucks since everything in the app is bought with virtual money! 

Enjoying it a lot!

title: Good for procrastination
review: This is such a cute and fun way to stay off my phone! I have trouble getting distracted and this app motivates me to stay off of my phone during times of productivity. There are soothing sounds and beautiful trees that you get to grow while you grow your produtivity!

title: Really helpful
review: Keeps me more focused than other focus timers, probably because I hold a little bit of affection for the little trees and timers otherwise are easy to ignore/not care about. Brilliant idea and wonderfully executed. Can’t wait to unlock more little tree options 😊

title: No idea what the fuss is about
review:
This app is basic and boring. You start with access to two trees and, from my rough calculations, you have to spend 14 hours for each new tree and plant type you want to unlock. Sure, you can pay to double or triple your earning speed for coins, but seriously?

My poor planted forest looks extremely boring and I’ve had absolutely no real mental payback since using the app. It just annoys me to stare at my boring forest filled with two types of trees. That’s not a forest. It’s a garden.
developerResponse: {'id': 21159361, 'body': 'Hello,\nSorry for causing inconvenience. Thank you for your feedback. We will forward your idea to our team.', 'modified': '2021-02-19T08:31:32Z'}

title: This AMAZING app helps me a lot
review: I have been using this app since my sophomore year. It magically makes me want to focus on my work instead of using my phone. I enjoy the feeling when I see I have forested a healthy tree and gradually I devoted a real tree in the world! Thank you to your team!

title: Encouraging
review: I have found that I am a news junkie and was constantly on my phone trying to get news updates. Now that I am growing trees, when I go to pick up my phone, I stop, think and go back to work. My productivity is getting better.

title: Actually super helpful.
