review: My friend recommended me this app because she said it helped her stay off her phone when she was doing homework. It does exactly that and I truly love it. Very cute and gives you planted trees if you successfully stay off your phone while studying. Loveeeee!!!

title: Awesome & Helpful
review:
This app helps me focus on my schoolwork & helps me combat my procrastination. The synchronization between the app & the Chrome extension is super easy & user friendly & the overall aesthetic of the app is super pleasing. Not to mention they have a campaign of rebuilding forests & planting trees !!
10/10 recommend

title: Pretty good
review: For me I’m someone who likes to get on my phone and say oh in five minutes… And then another five minutes and then another five minutes… It ends up just adding up and I end up procrastinating a lot… This app honestly makes me feel guilty for procrastinating and that’s exactly what it supposed to do so Id say it’s pretty good

title: Well designed
review: This app will let you decide if you need anywhere from 10 minutes to 3 hours off your phone.  And it gives you “credit” if you go longer than you pick.  It gradually works towards a great goal of planting more trees, something we all need.

title: best. app. ever.
review: the apple screen time is one thing, but forest app is the BEST THING EVER!!! my phone usage has gone down so much!! i am so worried to wilt my trees that i don’t touch my phone and it has helped me get so much more done!! and you can help real trees be planted around the world!! definitely worth the $1.99!!! if you are hesitating, stop waiting. BUY IT!!

title: Great App
review: Helps keep me focused. Love the fact that I can leave the app without my tree dying because I use my phone for things like reading and studying. The timer also works for when I want to continue to do my work but want a short break. Great to see my work manifested into something so cute!

title: Helps me focus for school!
review: This app makes me feel guilty and bullies me out of being on my phone when I should be studying. I want to grow my forest so I’m even persuaded into studying more to get more coins to buy plants. This app makes studying fun but I’m not sure if it’s worth paying $2 for everyone, it was for me though!

title: Love this app!!
review: This app keeps me on track on my studying time. Then when when I need break I can time myself and go back to working. Would 100% recommend if you’re trying to stay focus. Plus the coins and cute little trees are rewarded when you stay on track is a bonus.

title: Great for staying focused!
review: I’ve been using this app since college and now use it when I’m studying for my actuarial certification exams- the difference in my productivity between when I use this app and when I don’t is incredible.  I recommend it to everyone I talk to who mentions getting distracted easily while studying!

title: Wow wow wow
review: I’m the type of person that can’t differentiate between something urgent and something you can do later and this app forced me to prioritize. If I get a text I know I can wait until my tree grows as silly as it sounds, no one wants to kill their tree! I completely endorse this app, I think everyone should have it!!

title: Nice!
review: As a plant lover and master procrastinator, this app helps me stay off my phone and get down to studying. It’s sad to see your little tree wither and with the multiple options available for plants and trees along with the background sounds available, it makes being productive a little easier.

title: Great for keeping focus
review: As a law school student I spend a lot of time studying but it’s also very easy to get distracted and tempted to use my phone. This app helps me resist the urge to use my phone and helps me stay on task when doing my readings for school. Definitely recommend it to everyone looking to maximize their study time.

title: Great app
review: I have tried other applications in the past to stay on track and this one is by far my favorite. It makes studying easier by keeping you on track with your forest growing. If I leave the app then I’ll have a dead tree and I have stayed on track by ensuring my tree grows to it’s full potential.

title: :D
review: i rly like this app and as simple as it is it rly helps me. only thing id like to add is a way to add more time to it without having to cancel and kill the tree :(. or maybe if theres an option where if i go to another app instead of instantly killing it it adds the ammnt of time to my timer that i spent somewhere else. and then after a couple times of me getting distracted it dies lol

title: Such a fun way to stay focused
review: Forces me to not use my phone and in game coins can be used to buy real world trees. It takes a long time to earn coins but that just means more time off my phone. My only qualm is that it’s really expensive to buy different tree types (and the price increases with each one you buy!). I’d rather buy real life trees but I also want the cute in game ones...

title: Motivational
review: This app is so much more motivational than it has any right to be. The limited event with the cakes to unlock a tree has been really good for encouraging me to be productive. FOMO being used for the better, I think limited time events like this should happen more often! The app itself is very simple yet very satisfying, I love my forest!

title: My Favorite App
review: I’ve had this app for years and it is so wholesome and useful. Highly recommend for anyone trying to avoid distractions or use their phone less ( my phone has been calling me out for my daily averages) Seriously I never buy apps but this is one of the few that is worth the moneys!!!

title: Sad we need apps like this, but it really works!
review: The reality is most of us can’t just leave our phones locked up during the work day.  But this thing really does work!  Losing a tree kind of feels bad and really guilts you into staying off your phone.  Use it at the gym, at work, at home, whatever.  Love it!

title: Great app for college studying!
review: I use this app all the time when I study on campus! It helps me stay off my phone and in the zone while I study. I like to use the group feature with my friends while we study together because it’s a fun way to stay accountable! Plus, the trees are so cute to share with your friend’s forests :)

title: I stay so focused
review: I honestly did not think this app would help me at all, but I was blown away at how the white noise helps me stay focused. It also makes it really hard to leave the app because you know you’re going to kill a cute little tree, plus it will stay in your garden just reminding you of your failure.

title: Love!
review: I have been using this app for the last two years and it really forces you to focus on whatever task you’re doing, while making it fun! You can also buy REAL trees with their partnership with Trees For the Future! I really enjoy what this app is helping us do, get off our phones, and to enjoy and help the environment.

title: SO Useful for Homework
review: This app is so useful for being present during study times, work, or even studying with friends. This app gives my friends and I have study parties, and this app gives all 5 of us the ability to stay committed and motivated together, even from other continents. So happy with this app.

title: Great app, would like an area to write my goals
review:
Great app, straightforward, super helpful during finals. I like seeing my forest grow. I also like that I am working towards growing real trees.

One suggestion is to provide a space for a short public (or private) statement on what you’re working towards (I want to be able to cheer the people on the leaderboards!).
developerResponse:
{'id': 6424373, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app
feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-12-17T16:59:18Z'}

title: Amazing app, really helped me focus
review: I got this app to help me get in track with my summer work for school and it helped me so much!! I usually have problems with getting distracted on my phone when trying to do work but this helped so much with keeping me off of it. Best $0.99 I’ve ever spent! Totally worth it and actually works

title: Very Helpful
review: I like it. Is definitely helpful with keeping me focused but I was looking for the App Whitelist feature and I couldn’t find it so I can apps that I want to access without killing my tree. Maybe it’s an old feature but I don’t like with the phone feature because of course you lose the reward system. I just need to be access some work apps.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4839489, 'body': 'Hello,

Due to the limitation of the iOS system, we cannot determine what app the user is currently using. Therefore we cannot implement the whitelist feature for the iOS version. As a workaround, we built a "Work with Phone" feature, which can be enabled in the settings page. This feature enables users to use work related apps during their planting periods, but users will have to be honest with themselves when using this feature. 

The trees planted with this feature enabled will not be counted towards the leaderboard, and users will only receive half the reward if they exit Forest during the planting period. 

Currently, the whitelist feature cannot be implemented for iOS. If you see features similar to whitelist on other apps, please let us know so that we may figure out how it was implemented. 

Thank you for your suggestion. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-08-28T09:23:55Z'}

title: Simple, eye opening and motivating
review: It's super satisfying to see all the honest hours you've put in into a project or assignment. It also really opened my eyes to how many times I get distracted when I all of a sudden remember something and pick up my phone to text, snap, look up, etc. it's an engaging app well worth your dolla.

title: Love this
review:
The purpose and function of this app is great! I like the variety of things you can unlock and plant, as well as spending “game” currency to have real trees planted.

My only suggestion for improvement is allowing bushes to be grown longer than 20 mins, in which case longer time would yield more than one bush.

title: Love it!
review: I’ve only had the app for 2 days, but have already fallen in love!  Anyone who knows me, knows I’m constantly on it, even if I’m just sitting watching tv. This app (so far) has enticed me to PUT IT DOWN, and really engage in what I’m doing. Next is to get my college aged daughter to try it out.

title: I love this app
review: It honestly motivated me so much! I have trouble focusing but this app honestly helps me because it “locks” my phone, if I get out of the app my poor tree dies TvT and I feel bad for my tree so it forces me to not look at my phone. It’s honestly been the only app that has managed to keep me on task.

title: Sweet way to enable focus
review: I like the idea of being able to ‘grow a tree’ while I focus, and the variety of plants you can earn just by being diligent with your time is rewarding! I suppose having different settings available for emergency contacts that wouldn’t stop a tree from growing would be good.

title: Love it
review: It’s really simple and easy to use but it really helps motivate me. If you have trouble with time management, focusing, or motivation this might help you. I like it and think it’s worth it but if you think you won’t use it there’s no point in getting it

title: Focus+
review: App allows for intense moments of focus away from the phone, I’ve always had trouble putting my phone away when I need to study or work, now it seems like I have this extra motivation to put my phone down... growing my forest!

title: It’s a good app with good intentions but still has problems
review: I like the app and use it when I need to buckle down and get work done but the only problem is about the type of trees you can plant because if you don’t want to pay for different kinds it feels as you don’t get diversity in what your planting.

title: worth the money!
review: i am naturally a very fidgety and distracted person, ESPECIALLY in online school.. BUT i am a huuuuge plant lover and (although i know that these plants are fake) it really motivates me to stay on task! i’ve felt more productive recently and even found myself with more free time than usual!! super thankful! love this app sm :))

title: AMAZING!!!!
review: This app is amazing! i feel so much more focused after downloading it. I love how i can see how focused i am and that it shows me when i am most focused. my little forest is growing so nicely and it looks adorable. anyone who is looking for a study app should definitely download this one.

title: Amazing app - Have idea for widget
review: First off this app is amazing and I use it all the time. I did notice something that I would enjoy having, and that's allowing for different widget options other then just showing today and maybe rendering the week, month or year. Thanks again for the app!

title: An unexpected surprise
review: I’ve been trying to find ways to stay off my phone during school, and for some reason this works? Something about knowing a virtual plant grows when I focus actually helps. 10/10 recommend for any college/high school students right now.

title: Boost productivity
review: I’m a college student. I will study for legit 15 mins and then reward myself by spending 30 minutes on my phone. I’ve only had this app for 2 days and I already see improvements and treat my phone like it’s made of acid when I studying. It’s also really fun to hold sessions if friends while using the app.

title: Focus On Point
review: Focusing on my tasks and staying away from my phone has gotten WAY easier with this app. I know the trees are just virtual but the idea of killing my forest is enough to keep me from picking up my phone and getting sucked in. Definitely recommend if you’re having trouble focusing! Wish there were more species of trees I could access for free tho.

title: great for students!!!
review: i love this app so much!! it is definitely worth the money 😁 i always make sure to have it on Deep Focus Mode so i can get as much work done as possible. since i am in high school, i tend to get distracted, but this app has helped me form better study habits and stay focused! i totally recommend it!

title: Cute and Useful
review: I just started using this and it has been really helpful! My goal is to read 100 books next year and this app is definitely going to help. Every time I try to sit down and read, I end up staring at my phone instead. This app will definitely help me meet my goal!

title: Love this app!!
review: I use this nearly everyday and it has helped so much in staying focused. It’s nice to see my forest grow everyday. Even when i feel like my work is going super slow I can see some progress of my efforts on this app! Haven’t killed a tree yet! My only complaint is that there are only two trees to pick from when you first download the app.

title: Pretty helpful
review: I’d recommend it to be free but from my experience it was still worth every penny. Very helpful when you want to focus and to decompress from all of the stressful and depressing things online. Would recommend if you are willing to spend money but it’s like under $5 and you are getting your money’s worth by staying on track!

title: Great So Far.
review: I've only had this app for a few weeks but I've used it so much already! It works well, it gives me focus reminders, helps me track how many times a week i'm studying. I'm a ballerina while in high school so this helps me plan things out! 100% recommend! At first I didn't like that you had to pay for it, but it's totally worth it!

title: Wonderful app
review: Very inspiring, you can add your own quotes to pop up while the clock ticks! Amazing to use while studying.  The app is super cute and easy to use.  You also get coins every time you successfully go through your time so you can buy different ambient sounds, cute plants, or save up to plant a real tree!

title: Stellar Grades this semester
review: My time management has greatly improved because of this app. I focus deeply for 2 hours and can get so much work done rather than devoting one day towards school work. I remembered always taking small breaks before and now this allows me to succeed and have time for other activities.

title: This app does what it is supposed to do
review: I have really enjoyed this app. I use it when I need to focus and have a problem opening my phone to check crypto currency prices or social media, etc. For this purpose the app works well. The design is nice and beautiful. The user experience is simple and without stress.

title: Visualize focus
review: This has been so helpful for keeping me on task. It is a great way to visualize the amount of time you are actually spending on work, which has made me more efficient. I also like the group focus feature, which can help a chatty study group actually read for a little while haha

title: 100% have to try
review: I’d say anyone who’s looking for something to help them focus (when they have regular distractions) should try this app. Only thing is that I wish you were given the option to set anytime you want instead of having times only in 5 minute intervals.

title: Amazing app
review:
This is the best $5 I’ve spent on any app it’s really good for staying focused and do what you need to do. For me it’s very hard not studying without being distracted with social media and stuff but this app challenges me to do it and it’s very awesome. Also the nature background when you start the timer it’s perfect and relaxing🙌🏼👍🏼

Best app ever!!!

title: Love this app!
review: This app is straight for the fact that when you leave it, your tree will die. This makes it so that you have to stay on the app, meaning you cannot go on any other apps. This has made it so that I can focus on my work more. I’ve needed something like this for a while!

title: Great for Focus
review: Forest really helps me stay on task during school and it keeps things fresh with updated user interface. It really makes working more productive and more enjoyable, because it makes you feel like you are accomplishing something when not on distracting iPhone apps.

title: Solid
review:
Just a fun way to stay focused and help the environment if you’re studying for something major, ie putting a lot of time into studying. 
If you are doing something that utilizes your phone for a resource, I wouldn’t use this. Otherwise, it keeps the focus away from Social media and onto your study material.

title: I Love It!
review: I have only had this app for a few days, and it has immensely aided my studying habits! Only bad thing is that I have found a way of cheating it—texting in the notifications. Maybe try to make sure that doesn’t happen? Or maybe it’s a good thing just in case of emergency texts or calls?

title: Excellent way to gamify productivity
review:
The reward system in Forest really helps to motivate me to remain focused during work sessions. 

I’m giving only four stars because I dislike most of the tree illustrations—apart from the default tree and bush, all other tree illustrations appear childish and have toys or other debris hanging from the branches like Christmas decorations.  

I would love to see a less light-hearted approach taken with some of the unlockable tree types that caters more to mature audiences or those who enjoy realism in gaming.

As a home gardener, I would also enjoy reading interesting facts about the chosen specie of tree if they to appear on the “success” popup that appears if a tree is successfully grown.

title: Great app! but idk about the cost
review: This app has actually helped me so much with being productive. However, I'm not sure it's worth the price. Still, if you need a lot of help with concentrating, this app will work wonders for you. As a teenager that has to deal with 6 AP's and work and clubs, this has helped me immensely on focusing on the work that I need to do instead of going on my phone :)

title: Im saving up to put down a really tree
review: This app is so motivating and worth every penny you paid for! For some weird reason, I just don’t want my trees to die. It has been helping me in my meditation. Look at those trees and I feel a sense of calm, then become less likely to look at my phone and more focus over time!

title: Great app, helps you focus
review: This app reminds me to do my work every time I glance at my phone and has helped me be a lot more productive. The cute forests you end up being able to plant are also great, and if you save up enough coins from completing your tasks, you can plant an actual tree! Get it, you won’t regret it.

title: Incredibly useful and funktional!
review: This is an amazing app that has helped me so much! I think it’s totally worth buying for only two dollars and it’s been incredibly useful for me. The sounds are great, I love the function where you can pay to have real trees planted and think this is altogether a totally worthwhile and all around great app!

title: Fun trees, great goals, very motivating!
review: I’ve had such a positive experience with this app. I use it during work to stay focused, before bed to reduce screen time and I even set it before I drive to cut off the temptation to mess with my phone at stoplights. All of this has helped me cut back on the time I am on my phone. A+ would recommend!

title: Great way to focus
review: Instead of constantly interrupting my work with Facebook and Twitter, now I’m finally focusing on work in hour long sets. Not only do I interrupt myself less but I find myself allowing less other distractions as well. My productivity has gone up significantly since starting to use this app.

title: Great for helping you stay off your phone when you work
review: I never use my phone when I’m using this app.  It does an excellent job of keeping me focused on my work.  I would recommend for anyone who wants to increase the duration of their work sessions as well as improve their quality.

title: I LOVE IT!
review: This app is not only making me focus and get work done while using it, but it is also making me study for longer than I usually would AND making me actually look forward to studying/doing an activity to use the app. This app is really motivating and helping me work towards my academic goals!

title: Really helpful
review: I really like this app, it helps me stay focused when I’m studying. I tend to go on my phone when I’m trying to study, so having something that keeps me off my phone is great. I love the little trees and bushes, and I really like how you can use your coins to plant a real life tree. It’s definitely worth the small price.

title: Best Method of Studying
review: This app keep me on track and it helps me to focus. I don’t have to over study and I don’t have to understudy. it’s a great way for a college, medical student or even high school or elementary kids. To use it’s a great way to practice and use. Plus it’s one time purchase.

title: Amazing app. The only way I can get work done
review:
Love the labels; they allow me to track how much time I'm spending on each subject, which is nice.

Only issue (hence not 5 stars, yet) : Apple watch app does not automatically start the countdown when you start a session AND if u cancel a session on the phone, the watch app continues it's countdown still. Would be sweet if you could fix that :)
developerResponse: {'id': 2858567, 'body': 'Hello, thank you for the support! We would want to inform you that it is currently not possible to launch apps on the Apple Watch. We apologize for the inconvenience. Forest', 'modified': '2018-03-19T03:06:41Z'}

title: Great idea, very well executed..one glitch
review:
Love this app. It's a fun way to nudge yourself to stay focused; and as an interaction designer myself, I have to say both the functionality and the cosmetics impressed me. I love how simple and minimal this is.

I've run into one glitch so far: when the "Work with phone" setting is turned on, leaving the Forest app doesn't kill the tree - no matter what I'm doing or which other app I'm in. Which defeats the purpose of the Forest app.
developerResponse:
{'id': 1730717, 'body': 'Hi,

Because of the limitation of the iOS system, we cannot know what app the user is using. Thus, we cannot implement the whitelist feature in the iOS version. As a workaround, we made the "Work with Phone Mode". You can turn on this mode in the settings page so that you can use some working related apps during the planting. But you have to be honest with yourself when using the working mode.

The trees that planted under the working mode will not be counted in the ranking. And you will receive less reward if you leave the app in the middle.

Currently, to the best of our knowledge, this feature cannot be implemented in iOS apps. If you see features like white list in other apps, please tell us and we will try to figure out how they did it.

Thanks for your suggestion. :)', 'modified': '2017-11-12T16:26:20Z'}

title: The best for studying
review: I love this app it’s giving me a reason to study more and it helps to give you positivity sense your planting trees and other plants the app has no adds very good designed I really recommend it and it’s soo cheap buy it and don’t waste your time on ads

title: Great app!  Want more from Apple Watch app
review: Wish I could start the timer from my Apple Watch!! I want to just put my phone AWAY and just start the timer from my watch.  Whenever I pick up my phone, it defeats the purpose of staying off of my phone.

title: Fun, simple, and effective
review: I’m enjoying this particular Pomo due to the simple interface and the soothing nature of the, well, the nature! The visualization of planting a tree with your time and energy investments resonates with me, and viewing your daily “forest” promotes kind-to-self reflection on the day. Highly recommend. Enjoy!

title: Awesome app!
review: Reallly love using this - way better than the “Focus” app on the App Store because of gamification. I love pomodoros theory and this aligns itself perfectly with that plus adds more flexibility to the process. You guys should include pomodoros in your description to help more folks find you!

title: Helps my ADHD and focus
review: I love this app. It helps me so much with focus and productivity. I would love if I could explore my forest more and interact with it, because that would be a much better reward than just seeing it from birds eye view, but otherwise I have no complaints!

title: A little addictive - which is a good thing
review: I have pretty significant trouble focusing but so far this has actually helped for 4!! Hours today. First day but I have a job that requires focus. So I’m going to keep using it and will update if my feelings change.

title: More time to focus
review: I found this app when they partnered with GoodNotes to do a giveaway and I am so happy I downloaded the app. It is such a great way to stay focused on various tasks and prevent you from using your phone. It is user friendly and I love watching my little forest grow.

title: Fun and amazing
review: It’s such a wholesome wonderful good vibes app. It inspires me to be productive because I get to earn points towards planting real trees in real life. It’s a cute design, many different varieties of trees. All of seekrtech’s apps are quite wonderful and helpful in organizing and being productive in my everyday life. Thank you all!!!

title: 10/10 would recommend
review: I use this for studying all of the time. I started in high school and now use it in college. It’s super helpful and the feature of tagging each study session helps me determine how much time I’m spending on each subject.

title: This app is AMAZING for ADHD.
review: Struggling with getting work done? This genuinely really does help, especially when it’s hard to find things to motivate you. It’s so nice getting to have your own little garden with plants you get to pick. 10/10, definitely recommend.

title: Game changer !!!
review: I love this app. I absentmindedly pick up my phone while I’m studying the moment my mind starts to wonder. Now I see my baby tree doing its best to grow and immediately set down my phone!! The time I “study” has decreased as my studying efficiency has increased !! thank you forest!!

title: Forest is amazing!
review: Forest is an app that lets you work without distractions! It keeps you in the app and you cannot let your tree die, so when you are tempted to go elsewhere you immediately go back into the app. I love it and it is definitely worth the purchase!!!

title: It’s amazing, but what happens with syncing?
review: I had 3 devices synced with my account and because I use Forrest in the three at the same time I only get the same amount of coins if I use the app with only one device. I hope that you will improve it.

title: Perfect to keep focus
review: This app really helps when studying or to spend time away from your phone. It’s good to take a break or to focus and this app will help by making you determined to grow plants and expand your own forest! Also there are a lot of tree or plants to choose from as well!

title: Shelter-in-place life saver!
review: I have been using this app like crazy now that I have to work from home. It’s so easy you be on my phone all the time now that I’m not in my normal work environment. The Forest app has been a GREAT help; I’m not on my phone nearly as much as I would be without it! Plus, I love all my cute little plants... :)

title: Holding me accountable during the quarantine!
review: This app has been especially helpful for me as a student during this quarantine time, it’s been keeping me accountable for remaining focused during my online class time and when trying to study instead of scrolling social media; very thankful!

title: Changed the way I study!
review: My boyfriend mentioned that I had to get this app and I wasn’t sure due to having to pay, but SO WORTH IT. Setting the timer and building a tree has made me so much focused. I don’t want to kill the tree to get on my phone. I love building trees which has made me so productive. I’d recommend this to anyone

title: Amazing app
review: This app is perfect for getting work done. I am a big procrastinator and by using this app I am able to get all my work done and be ready for my finals. It keeps me focused and the background music avoids any distractions. I would definitely recommend this app to anyone who needs to get work done.

title: I love forest
review: Forest has helped me separate from my phone and helped me be so much more productive! This was defiantly the best two dollar purchase of my life! I have recommended this to my friends because of their struggles of being addicted to their phone and they have loved it so far. I definitely recommend.

title: I love it!
review: This app is amazing! I use it almost everyday to keep me focused while doing work. I have recently also started using it to keep me off my phone during social events and at night before sleeping. This has made me so productive and I’m a couple dollars is a small price to pay for focus.

title: It helps!
review: Definitely helpful with staying on top of tasks like homework when you’re tempted by social media and other notifications. Planting virtual trees can be a fun and accomplishing feeling, but getting a task done is even more so gratifying! Download today :) (took 1 star off because trees/shrubs hike up to an expensive price i.e., 2.5k after purchasing a certain amount)

title: Surprisingly motivating!
review: This app has really helped me get through the hundreds of pages of reading I have for my PhD program. A must have for anyone who has low tolerance for boredom (like myself) who compulsively checks every single app on their phone when even slightly bored. So glad I stumbled upon Forest!

title: Love it!
review: I’m a first semester grad student, so I’m reading about 2-3 books a week right now. I’m also a person who gets bored 10 pages in and tries to procrastinate as much as I can, but with Forest I can read for hours a day and it won’t feel like I’ve done much at all. This app has been super helpful to me!

title: Helps with time management!
review: I love using the Pomodoro method for studying and this really helps me stick to that. It makes me feel accomplished when I see the trees growing and allows me to see truly how much I am studying for each one of my classes. I also love the idea of saving up my points to grow an actual tree!

title: Great Productivity App
review:
I usually use this when I’m working on my homework, or doing a task that needs my full attention, so using Forest really helps me keep off my phone and break the habit of scrolling through social media and whatnot. 
Believe it or not, growing a virtual tree is pretty motivating motivating to keep off your phone.

title: Struggling but it works
review: I struggle hardcore with leaving my phone alone. I have real bad issues with leaving my phone and not touching it and this app is helpful when in use. It’s worth the price. It may not work for everyone but Atleast give it a shot. It may and can work for you like it’s slowly helping me.

title: Beautiful App
review: This app is designed beautifully and it really helps me stay off my phone. This is perfect to get you off your phone for a bit, and it makes you want to stay off your phone longer so you can grow bigger trees and a more lush forest. I absolutely love this idea and I love the execution of the app!

title: one of the best ways of motivation
review: I hate studying and when I do, I’m so easily distracted. When I use this app, it gives me motivation to build my own forest and to know that the currency I make in the app can actually plant a real tree in real life, it’s even better. I love the app and now I enjoy studying a bit more.

title: Worth the money!
review: This app is totally worth buying. It’s helped me stay so concentrated on my homework and I have adhd so it’s definitely extremely helpful. I love seeing the little trees that I’ve planted in my garden and I’m saving up coins to plant a real tree and to buy the pumpkin. So far there haven’t been any issues whatsoever and I’m in love!

title: Super useful app!
review: Motivational and frustrating (in a good way.) Having to study a lot makes procrastination and long study breaks tempting, but having an app that blocks your distractions and gives you that dopamine boost from getting to “plant” a tree (and even work toward planting a REAL tree) makes long studying feel more purposeful, and feasible.

title: The Only Reason I Don’t Procrastinate
review: I recently started taking summer classes and I usually find no motivation to keep me on task, except for when I use this app. When I use it, I actually stay on task and don’t drift to snapchat or twitter. Plus it reminds me take breaks so I don’t wear myself out! Best studying/productivity app I’ve downloaded

title: I can actually focus
review: I have ADHD and have a very hard time sticking to one task. This app helps me at least stay away from my phone for a decent amount of time because I feel like I’m working towards a goal and it does a great job of guilting me if I try to check my messages or go to a different app.

title: Very good experience
review: I have been using this app for more than 3 years. The function that allows you to withdraw the app within 5 secs greatly helps you deal with emergency issues without letting the tree die. I believe it is a great app for students and who need to study but can’t control themselves.

title: Best Focus App Available🥳
review: I absolutely love this app! It really helps keep me from using my phone when I’m trying stay focused during times when it’s necessary and it’s all fun to jot down what I’m doing during that time to see where most of my time was spent being productive during the day ! 🥳👏🏾

title: You get what you put in
review: Your effort in using this app is the outcome you will receive. You have to be willing to grow your tree instead and focus on what you have to do instead of giving up all the time. If you keep giving up on growing your tree then this app is useless for you.

title: The most helpful app
review: I have recommended this app to so many people. It has changed the way I work and forced me to be present when I feel like checking out. I love that eventually you get to plant actual trees, but even without that element I find it to be incredibly helpful for staying focused. Best $2 I spent in 2018.

title: Wish you could pause it!
review:
I really like this app! I’m using it to study for law school finals and plan on using it to track my time while I study for the bar exam this summer!

I do wish you could pause it though. I know you can give up, but I don’t want to give up my time just for potty breaks! 

The lack of a pause option is my only reason for 4 stars!!

title: A breath of fresh air
review: In less than a week, this game has helped me break the habit of absentmindedly checking my phone when I could or should be doing something else with my time and that feels great! Now that I have unlocked all the trees in-game, I have begun saving my virtual coins to plant real trees. This app is worth the purchase.

title: I love this app
review: Forest has really helped me take small periods of time away from work and the internet to get things done. It’s remarkable how it adds up, and I find that these focused periods are getting longer. The small incentive of seeing the time manifested in the growth of a garden really works for me. I highly recommended this app.

title: When I use it
review: I’m a procrastinator and always find excuses to not do what I’m suppose to be doing. I’m also competitive and want the best forest in the game. When I actually use the app, it works perfectly! Now I gotta force myself to use it more often and stop finding excuses to “be productive” by using my phone.

title: Okay
review:
I don’t like how there’s no timer when you’re on the lock screen. You have to physically go into the app to see how much time you have left. However, when you unlock your phone to do that, it counts it as “looking at your phone” so your time gets broken up.
I also don’t like how every time you buy something, the prices of everything else go up. That’s the opposite of a motivating factor to me.

title: Your Remedy
review:
The countless of studies that point out how much of our lives we are flushing down our drain should provide this app as the remedy. I kept going down the pointless “rabbit hole”of my phone. Mindlessly stress scrolling, committing procrastination, and ultimately conjuring depression. 
  Ever since leveraging this app I’ve found myself cut free of those bad habits.

title: Effective pomodoro app
review: Been using pomodoro method for approx 1 year and have tried many different online timers and apps. I like this one the best. The gamification makes me feel more obligated not to “cheat” plus there is a reminder each time you go to use your phone. It has helped me exponentially. Highly recommend!

title: Procrastination went out the window!
review: Definitely something great for people who need external commitment! Once you know that you can help by staying focused and plant a tree, you’ll start tackling tasks you postponed for weeks! That’s certainly what happened for me! Love the feeling to do what I actually need to do for a additional great cause!

title: Simple, beautiful, worth it
review: Too many pomodoros over complicate or over corporate the process. Sorry i want something fun to look at! This app has you covered, no long tutorial to figure out or obnoxious ads. Just a little helper forest to show your work

title: Great Pomodoro and non- pomodoro options!
review: Option to not have to work with a specific timer like other pomodoro apps. Great if you want to complete task oriented things instead of a timer and still want to limit access to other apps!

title: Excellent for getting work done!
review: At first I didn’t like the lack of pause or manual stop for when I was done with activities early, but I noticed it forced me to start new activities, which I now appreciate as helping me stay focused for longer.

title: So close to being the best
review:
I'd really love to see custom timer settings. For example, I would like to use Forest for the 33-6 pomodoro method, but they only allow 5 minute time increments. So the app instantly becomes less functional for me than my plain old iphone timer. 

Please give us more granular time control!

title: Need some more updates for iPad
review: This app is wonderful, but would be so much better if they could add dual screen on the iPad as well as landscape mode. I have the magic keyabord and it simply isn’t compatible with anything. Also more sounds!
developerResponse: {'id': 25771256, 'body': 'Hi, sorry for the inconvenience. The landscape mode is currently under development. However, adding new features or making adjustments to current ones takes time and deliberate consideration. Therefore, it cannot be implemented immediately. We hope you understand. We will relay your suggestions to our team. Thank you and sorry for the trouble.', 'modified': '2021-10-19T13:19:13Z'}

title: Great app, but a suggestion
review:
This app has and is currently serving me well. One suggestion though is to add landscape mode, IPhone users dont really need it but IPad users have it tough. I bought this app and it reached all of my expectations, just this small tweak is needed and it would be great!

Cheers.

title: Game changer for my ADHD brain
review: I’m writing my dissertation so having this app to keep me off my phone for 30 minute chunks of time has skyrocketed my productivity! I now use it for get togethers with friends where I want to be present and during webinars so I’m less tempted to get distracted.

title: Nice idea!
review: This is quite interesting, I like pomodoro technique, but it has been hard for me to implement, but looking at my forest growing is a game changer! It’s kind of easier to remember that I want to plant a tree, at the beginning it may not appear useful but you have to give it a try

title: Huge help with work/study!!
review: 2 days in and this app has already made me so much more productive!!! The real forest planting is a HUGE incentive for me as a Mother Nature lover. I have a bad phone addiction so working and studying at home has been tough and I wish I had found this app sooner!

title: Never been better!
review: I love this app. It’s so addicting to be productive away from my phone (social media) and focus more on the things that matter. And have a little something to show for it in my Forest! From time in prayer to cleaning and reading I use my Forest app.

title: Keeps me off my phone which is good
review: I usually get sidetracked while doing work, but now I don’t. I want my forest to grow and I get my work done. It’s a win win scenario. If you are easily distracted on your phone and want to get your work done, this is the app for you.

title: Nice but in app purchases are annoying
review: Would give this 5 stars, but a bit too stingy with the tree options (only 2 to start). Not really an issue for me. I’ll just wait to “earn” more over time, but I find it a bit tacky and predatory to have so many in app micro transactions for a paid app

title: Actually keeps me focused
review:
Makes me put my phone down so I’m not distracted because I don’t want to kill the cute little plants or accidentally kill one of my friends if we’re working as a group. 

The little grown plant acts like a reward and keeps me coming back!

title: So far I like it
review:
Haven’t been using this app too long. I really like the concept but I’m disappointed that a paid app has micro transactions. Unlocking new trees without paying more money seems like it will be possible but will take a while. 

Luckily I’ll be doing productive work and growing my forest as I do that.

title: So Worth It
review: This app is so cute and convenient. When you accidentally kill your plant, it’s seriously such a shameful feeling and then the satisfaction of actually planting a real tree. It’s so cool. While I would prefer they have a different, louder notification when your time is up, it’s such a perfect little study tool.

title: Been using it for years!
review: This app has helped me through endless nights and especially now that I am a senior. It brings me some sort of comfort knowing that not only is my knowledge, depression and fear of failure are growing, but also several little trees in this app

title: Fun way to stay focused
review: Forest makes time management fun! I love watching my forest grow throughout the week as I set goals for getting things done. Being able to label periods of focus by project or activity is also helpful for seeing exactly what I spend my time on. Easy to use, lovely graphics. I love this app!

title: very helpful
review: I use this when I do my school work and study, and just for self care when i need to be away from my phone. this app gives me a cute little reward when i do. i recommend this if you want and need to get away from your phone sometimes!

title: Awesome!
review: this app has totally changed the way I study. I love to procrastinate or hate off task and being a really heavy phone user, that’s where most of that wasted time is spent. so with this it helps me stay off my phone and study for a good amount of time while still giving me time for breaks. i’m in love!

title: awesome! saved my grades.
review: when I was studying or doing homework, I texted my friends to check our answers. I would often wonder off to Instagram or Snapchat “just to check”, then I wouldn’t have my homework done. this app helped me raise my grades to getting all A’s this marking period. and yes, I’m not using caps purposely.

title: Beautiful, calming, simple.
review: This app does exactly what it says it does! Helps you stay focused and reduced phubbing by limiting your access to apps. Planting a tree on Forest has become a part of my routine to getting focused and hunkering down in my work. If you’re already interested then this app is probably exactly what you need.

title: Keeps me in check
review: I’ve been struggling bad with procrastination with school work and getting stuff done at home, and this app really helps with it! It makes me want to get home and start planting to see my progress over time. Great app for students or anyone having trouble concentrating on tasks.

title: Use it a few times for short periods of time to get used to it
review: This app has really helped me stay productive. It takes a few days to get used to it but man it’s so great to be able to set it up and feel like I want my tree to grow far more than I want to mess around on my phone

title: My FAVE app to study with for real
review: I love this app. I started college recently, and I use it when I want to study and focus. I love it, cause when I’m tempted to use my phone I see the time I already put into working and it makes me want to keep going until the timer runs out cause I want to see the tree grow.

title: Great for studying
review: I use this app for staying off my phone when studying. If I leave the app, the tree will die. So it keeps me from getting distracted by texts especially if the timer is almost finished. Unlocking new trees/shrubs encourages me to use this app more often thus eliminating distractions more often. I love this app!!

title: AMAZING
review: Personally love this app and use it nearly every single day. I have a hard time putting my phone down but it forces me to focus for 30 min to an hour at a time. I studied for a week using this app and got an A- on my philosophy exam that I was scared of taking. Well worth the small fee. Plus I love watching my garden grow.

title: Wish I could use a more precise timer
review: I love this app very much. I use it to study for my MCAT. I have no issues with any of its functions, but I wish there was some way to have a more precise time measurements. If my quiz has a time limit of 26 minutes, I’d love to be able to use exactly 26 minutes to grow a tree I stead of using an external timer. Otherwise this app is perfect.

title: Okay
review: First of all, this app gets a lot of things right and helps you focus, but my main problem with it is that it takes way to long to be able to gain coins without paying for them. Another problem I have with this app is that you are unable to take breaks while your tree is growing. So if the developer of this app could fix these issues, I would rate the app 5 stars.
developerResponse: {'id': 8935915, 'body': 'Hi,\nWe will consider modifying the formula of earning coins in future updates. Currently, you can earn extra rewards by unlocking achievements! We will also consider allowing users to take breaks while planting. Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions or suggestions! :) Forest', 'modified': '2019-05-30T13:06:06Z'}

title: Interesting Concept, Great Results!
review: Found out about this app on reddit, and I thought it would be interesting to try it out. Lone behold, I gave it a go. At first I thought the idea was a little funky, however that did not matter to me as I am competitive, so I wanted only perfect trees. As it turns out, it was enough for me to not get destracted.

title: Keeps me productive when I need it
review: Absolutely blown away by the simplicity yet usefulness this app entails. With a busy schedule, I've been able to focus and become more resilient in my studies and projects. The reward system is gratifying as it is satisfying. Definitely has become my most frequently used app!

title: Helped me focus!
review: Forest is LIFE CHANGING. I had a cousin that also used it, and seeing how many minutes of focus she put in every single day helped motivate me to do the same. Not having to worry about checking my phone every so often helped me produce better quality work. Highly recommend!

title: It works
review: Solid app, never crashes, keeps me focused. Wish I could whitelist apps on iOS but I know the limitations. I appreciate being able to keep earning coins even once the timer runs out; lets me stay focused longer. This is the only app I’ve ever bought (I’m a free app cheapskate) and it was worth my pennies.

title: useful for limiting distractions
review: I use this app for keeping me off my phone when are there other things I need to be doing. It’s been a very useful tool for limiting distractions. My only problem with it is that if I answer a phone call (which is not a distraction I’m trying to block) my tree will die.

title: Life Saver
review: Forest has helped keep me sane in a cell phone world. I’ve got my family talking Forest lingo. They’ll want my phone or for me to look up something and I say I can’t because I’m growing a tree. My students see me growing trees, too. Today one asked me how many trees I’d killed this year. I told him but I grew so many more! It’s a life changing app.

title: Cute app!
review:
This is a great app that incentivizes me to not keep checking my phone. All I have to do is see the little treeling growing and knowing that if I ruin it, there’ll be a sad broken tree bit in my forest, helps keep me on task.

I also like being able to track my time spent doing outside tasks by their tagging system.

title: Effective
review: A simple, effective app that keeps me off my phone for fear of killing my cute, little tree! The different designs are appealing and multicultural, and I LOVE the option to spend coins to plant REAL trees. I wish there weren’t a limit of 5 real trees per person, though. :( That said, lovely app otherwise. It’s not mind blowing, so I’ll leave it at 4 stars, but a solid, simple app that serves its purpose well.

title: Brilliant
review: Works well, there are no problems. It it simple for anyone to understand. It really makes you realize how much you use your phone and when you shouldn’t be using it. Before I had this app I used to use my phone for around 8 hours a day but I only use it 2-3 hours!!!!

title: Powerful Motivator
review: This app has been very useful in keeping me focused while I do schoolwork. Because of the responsibility of keeping my trees safe, I can more easily avoid my phone during homework. Because my phone is usually the main distractor, I end up being a lot more efficient with my time.

title: This app is amazing but..
review: This app is amazing and I use it all the time. However, I bought the rainbow flower and I’m not able to grow it yet (it’s not an option on the first screen, only trees are). Please explain how I can fix this. Other than that this app is super useful and helps me stay focused while studying.
developerResponse: {'id': 6173041, 'body': 'Hello,\n\nWhen your planting time is under 25 minutes, your trees will be the smaller ones - bushes. Planting time of normal trees is between 25 to 120 minutes. Please check if your planting time is within the time limit of the tree you want to plant. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-11-30T05:34:15Z'}

title: My favorite app. Period.
review: This is my most used app on my entire phone. My friend group and I use it every day. We compete to grow the biggest forest, but more importantly, we are encouraging each other to spend each second with care.. to tell a good story with our lives. Every moment matters. Don’t wast them.

title: ✨🌱Immensely Helpful🌱✨
review: I have a terrible habit of mindlessly looking at my phone every few minutes. While challenging to abandon that habit, the tactic of utilizing my competitive spirit to keep me from using my phone when I *do* pick it up is phenomenal. I love the different tree options and am excited to see more added.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4624007, 'body': 'Hello,

We will continue to release more tree species in the future. 
Any suggestions of tree species are welcome! 

Please feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions or suggestions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-08-13T02:41:53Z'}

title: Mcat review
review: I’m studying for the MCAT right now and have normally standard, average study habits. However, the days when I study using forest I’m more focused, I’m studying longer, and I’m more motivated until the end of the day. Forest has changed what I think is possible to accomplish for myself. I think everyone should get it!

title: Good app but inaccurate
review: It’s good for keeping me off my phone while growing trees, but if you want something to keep stats on how much time you spend on the phone this is NOT it. It says I’ve only been on the phone 12 minutes today, and I know for a fact that that’s not true. It also underestimates the number of times you open your phone, because I counted. If it had this feature I’d give it 4 or 5 stars but the only OK thing about this is the tree incentive.
developerResponse: {'id': 4341768, 'body': 'Hello, Thank you for your feedback. We will forward your suggestions to our team. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-07-22T05:18:30Z'}

title: Really helpful
review: This has changed my studying routine! I am staying more focused knowing that I’ll be able to take a break after working for 25 minuets. The trees are super cute and I really don’t want to let any of them die. Also I’m saving up coins so I can get more white noises as well as cuter trees. It’s a weird motivator but it’s working!

title: Suggest
review: I really like this app. Very good way to track my time while feeling achieved because of the trees. It could be better if the app can have more white noise options. Otherwise I have to open other app for the sound.

title: Easy to Use, Helpful, and Adorable
review: I always have trouble with constantly checking my phone when I’m supposed to be doing something else and this has really helped my focus on my work and I love planting the cute trees along the way!

title: Nice concept, a bit inflexible
review: It would be really helpful to set custom time blocks of less than 10 minutes. I struggle the most with task initiation, and am trying to set micro-tasks for myself. It would be nice to set, for example, a three minute timer for a task that really only takes that long!
developerResponse: {'id': 26597958, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for sharing your experience with us! We will forward your suggestion to the rest of the team. :)', 'modified': '2021-12-02T08:08:43Z'}

title: Good App
review: It’s cute and since you spend money on it, it makes you want to use it to get your money’s worth. It’s simple to navigate but I wish there was like a introduction navigate guide in the beginning. Still helped me start consistently studying

title: Amazing !!
review:
I never write reviews, but this app is honestly the best. I came to a realization that there’s a difference between being busy and being productive. This app makes you very productive. 
Anyone on the fence of getting the app, just buy it you won’t regret it (:

title: To my ADD friends with no self control
review: When we can admit that we are addicted to doom scrolling and all things internet, this app is here to help by the killing trees in the most appropriate way. A few bucks is a small price to pay to get on track.

title: Keeps me off my phone
review: I like how I could set the timer to focus on my work. If I check my phone, my tree will die so I try not to touch my phone. I’m off my social media and my games which is definitely beneficial because I need to focus on my upcoming exams.

title: So helpful!
review: I love this app, Forest keeps me motivated to study! It’s great! I didn’t even realize how much time I waste on my phone before I got this app!! I will say, saving up coins to buy the plants you want is a bit annoying, but over all the graphics are satisfying and it is very effective! Would recommend!

title: Cute app
review: forest is a super cute app. I like it because it allows me to visualize the hours I work as an artist. Which I feel is a plus because sometimes I think as an artist I tend to not always be so uplifting with myself. So being able to see a visual of the actual time I am productive gives me a bit of relief. 🥰🌱

title: Most Useful Study App
review: Nothing makes me focus more than wanting to grow my forest. And this is coming from a serial procrastinator. I love that you are encouraged to study more by earning points that can unlock new plants - brilliant design. 10/10 would recommend.

title: Makes being focused fun
review: Just a little way to measure your time in flow state vs not being in flow state.  You can use different trees to help you see what is being focused on more then other tasks.  Good app if you want to see where your attention goes.

title: Actually helps me focus + beautiful white noise options
review: A friend recommended this to me and I couldn’t be more pleased! It really helps keep me off my phone with the added bonus of growing cute trees. The hidden gem is the BEST white noise/calming background sounds I have ever found

title: A beautiful way to stay focused!
review: This app is totally worth the two dollars you will spend on it. It has a beautiful interface and a really calming vibe. I’ve been using it to stay focused while working from home and it’s been a huge help!

title: Game Changer
review: The fact that I get to plant a little forest while I focus on school or miscellaneous work gets addicting at times. Sometimes I can be addicted to my phone and not stay focus on my tasks. Luckily this app came along and has assisted me to better myself on not being so attached to my phone!

title: Love it so far
review: A great app to use whenever I’m doing school work. It helps me stay focused on my task and less distracted by my phone. I hate killing my plants so I stay away from touching my phone when I have a timer on. Plus, I love how I can purchase different trees/ plants with my coins to make my forest look nice.

title: Good for focusing!
review: I really like this app! It helped me focus! I like that you can let your phone go into sleep mode and the tree will still grow. I had a problem with another app where if my phone screen locked I would have to unlock my screen and go to the app to save the tree.

title: This app is beyond beneficial
review: I’ve used this app through undergraduate school & now in the beginning of my masters program. May I also add that I have ADHD & a competitive personality. This app helps me to focus & I am obsessed with my tree growing as large as possible. It probably doesn’t help that I’m a gardener 🥴 but I love the app. It’s cute,fun, & helpful

title: Love it!
review: It’s perfect for writers, well for anyone really, who get easily distracted! You can turn on the deep focus mood which holds you accountable to the plant you’re growing. There were times I had my phone flipped over to avoid distraction and I wouldn’t realize the clock ran out! I can’t recommend it enough!

title: Genius
review: This app has completely transformed how I study and dedicate time to my activities. I can focus on a task and decrease the impulse to constantly be on my phone while impacting the real world. It might take a lot of coins to plant a real tree, but the coins add up with the amount of work you do. I highly recommend it!!

title: Updates!!! Let me arrange the trees!
review:
LOVE this app and what it does. But I think so much more could be done!

Here’s some things I think would get people to be more invested and want to use the app even more:

- be able to arrange your trees to make your garden look pretty! (This one is really needed).
- be able to change the colour of the grass / have options for different landscapes
- be able to change the background color of the app (instead of all green we can choose to make it yellow, etc.)

Just small things to help customise the experience. Really the feature I most want to happen is for us to be able to arrange the trees how we want. I want to work and then make my garden look pretty 🥺

title: WORTH THE MONEY
review: I’m currently a student and recommend this app so much for those who (are like me) and always get distracted while trying to do homework and trying to be productive. It has helped me so much and I get to help plant real trees and help the environment in the process! Totally worth the money.

title: Love this app!
review: I started using the app because I got very distracted while studying for exams. When I first started using it I thought it wouldn’t make a difference but it actually helped me stay focused while working on papers,studying,or doing homework. So far I’ve been incredibly pleased with this app. :)

title: Excellent focusing tool
review:
Great way to stay on point for a predefined time. You plant a virtual forest tree by tree (every time you completed a block of time without using your phone for anything else than Forest, you get a tree).
You can define the length of the time period. I like the standard setting of 25 minutes.

title: Helping with studying
review: This had really helped me study. The app keeps me focused on getting my work done and really does motivate me a lot. After downloading this app I feel more on top of things and would 10/10 recommend for a person who wants to stay on task while studying!

title: This is the best focus app
review: This is 100% worth it. I always use this app when I’m studying, working, or just trying to focus and get rid of distractions. Working towards a goal of planting the cutest tree ever is really helpful because it reminds be to get off Snapchat and finish some homework. Seriously, this app is a lifesaver for me.

title: Fun way to unplug and help the environment
review: I love using this App everyday for my cleaning and writing crunch times. I wish there were more time options, like we could pick 13,16,29 minutes since sometimes I know I have 17 minutes to do something and I wish I could use this app to track that. But overall this is a great app and I love I can earn a real tree to plant!

title: This will help you step away from your phone
review: I have a lot of trouble with constantly looking at my phone. It became a problem and this app really helps. My goal is to spend at least 30 minutes reading every night and this helps me maintain that.

title: Amazing app, ONE REQUEST
review: This app is great and all the reviews show it, but can the developers PLEASE add a Pharisee function, when I’m working I have to help out with other things occasionally so I would usually pause the timer but I can’t for this app. Please have it an option in settings, it would be a great help

title: The best app to study ever
review: I really like this app because it makes me focus on my studies or whatever I’m going that I can not be distracted. It’s awesome because you can choose how many time you want to keep away from your phone and it seems so cool planting trees for that. So I really like it and I really recommend it! :)

title: Wow!
review: I downloaded this today and already see a difference in my phone behavior. I feel very determined to stay off my phone because I get a nice reward every time- a cute lil’ plant to add to my forest. It feels like I’m playing a fun game all day while still concentrating on my homework, friends, etc. Definitely recommend!

title: Simple and good
review: Very cute app with a simple and effective interface. Would recommend to anyone! The friends feature is not the most intuitive to me, but it’s not an important feature to me as of right now. I’d love to see the social aspect become more integrated in the future though.

title: A simple but powerful productivity tool.
review: Forest is simple and easy to use, but the experience still gives you a powerful incentive and reminder to honor your commitment to yourself to be more focused and productive. I’m watching my forest grow and feeling much less stressed and down on myself for wasting time. Give it a try!

title: Very Good application
review:
This app is fun, simple, and very optimized.
There could be things to fix, but overall this app is good. 
The tree’s provide a good incentive to keep going.
(Although it is possible to cheat)
As the saying goes, cheaters don’t go far.

This is a very good discipline tool. 
I’d challenge anyone who wants to be better to use this.

Effective at training yourself for time management.

After the year is over you can see how well you did.

Where you put in the most time.

As well as how committed were you to finishing up a study session.

Keep on improving this app!
It’s one of my favorites!

title: Love it
review: Love the app. Great when it works. I do wish you can put more hours in the app. I do a lot of art projects and will go well over the 120min mark. I like to use this app to track my time. But it’s limited. It’s unfortunate not to get the reward for the extra hours just because I forgot to set another timer when I was busy doing my projects.

title: LOVE THIS APP
review: I love this app sooooo much, I'm so glad I found it! It really does help me focus and spend less time on my phone — I'm someone that definitely benefits from having an incentive to staying off my phone, because otherwise it's much more difficult, and I love the idea of planting trees in a little virtual forest! So fun, so cute, and so helpful!!!

title: Almost flunked out if college, now I have A’s
review: I almost flunked our before I found Forest app. Now I plant trees and get my work done. The small motivator of a little growing seed does wonders for my productivity, as does the reminder not to be distracted. Working on a timer is excellent for staying on track and working to completion. I need this app to survive.

title: Works! For me
review: I still pick up my phone sometimes, but seeing my little forest growing motivates me to put it down. I love that they give you a notification when you leave the app to go back immediately and save your tree. If it just killed it, I’d go and start messing around on apps.

title: Great app
review: This app is great! I was not a fan at first cause It bugged me so much that I cannot use my phone. But now that I got used to it, i need in during exams week! And getting more tree in my collection really keep me going! I just wish I have the sameapp for my laptop cause i am really just helpless with attention on work.

title: Great app to stay on track!
review: I only downloaded this a few days ago and I am obsessed. Well worth the $2! It works so well for me. I love the motivation the app give me to not be on my phone. I love the music/white noise it plays for you. I love the fact that they will plant real trees. I have recommended this app to a lot of people.

title: It’s a Good Game to Play With Yourself
review: If you’re finding that it’s too easy opening your phone but you like playing games & can get quite competitive or you just hate killing trees (even virtual ones) this is a great way to keep yourself focused on your work. It’s intuitive, visually appealing & very easy to use! :)

title: Can’t live without
review: So I had bought this once before but somehow lost access to it so I tried something similar that was free. It didn’t cut it I had to have this back. I’m poor and really can’t spend any money at all but this thing keeps me on my game and makes me more productive

title: Great!
review: Great app! I use it almost everyday and it keeps me on track, and despite how simple and childish it may seem, it works! Trust me when I say anyone will stay on track with Forest. The app is also simple to use and has good features. Would 100% recommend to every student trying to stay on task.

title: Nice
review:
Nice way to keep me focused 

Wish I could flip it around though. Set an open ended session that I could end when I’ve completed a task, rather than forcing me to choose the amount of time before hand. The size of the tree would still be proportional to how much time was spent in the session.

title: Amazing
review: This perfect little app provides just the motivation I need to stop trolling through Instagram and actually get my work done. It’s adorable and effective and I think everyone who has anything to do at all with their time and has a phone to distract them, needs this app in their life.

title: Perfect for Study Sessions when I know I’ll get bored
review: This app is perfect for stopping me from mindlessly grabbing my phone when work or studying gets tedious. It’s a gentle reminder of what I’m doing and prompts me to get back to work for just a little longer. Being able to buy trees is what makes me stick to using it.

title: Great for Focusing
review: This app is great for curbing casual distraction! During studying I sometimes just reach for my phone out of habit, and that can take away up to 20 minutes of study time. This app makes it so I only use my phone - press “kill” on the tree - if I absolutely need it. It’s fun and cute and has saved me so much time.

title: My 7 year old loves this
review: My kid uses this as an extra kick of motivation to set goals and get her activities done. She also plants 10 minute bushes to help remind her to take eye breaks when she’s doing a screen activity. Each night before bed she is always so excited to see the forest she’s spent the day planting. 😊

title: Useful study app
review: I used the Pomodoro method before with just my phone alarm, but the loud beeping was annoying. The app’s gentle chime is a great cue without disrupting people around me, plus the growing trees part is fun. I wish there were an option to finish a few minutes early or extend the time five or ten minutes depending when I finish my task— I used to do that with the regular timer.
developerResponse:
{'id': 5153966, 'body': 'Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. 
We will forward your suggestions to our team.

Feel free to contact us via our in-app feedback system if you have further questions. :) - Forest', 'modified': '2018-09-21T07:16:00Z'}

title: Wowza
review: Really great app. I’m not the type of person who loves my phone, but I end up using it awhile when I’m bored. I like how It keeps people encouraged to not be zombified children or adults. It’s truly amazing. Bought the app without knowing what it was about because of the great cause. Happy to see where my money goes.

title: Love it!
review: I really enjoy using Forest. It helps me stay focused when I'm studying for exams or doing homework and keeps me from using my phone, which is one of my biggest distractions. Plus, you get to grow your own cute little forest and you can use the coins you earn to donate real trees through Trees for the Future. Great app!

title: Just what I was looking for
review: I have ADHD, which makes focusing difficult enough, nevermind all the tempting distractions the phone gives. This app provides a gratifying reminder to remove a giant source of distraction and actively engage in the activity you started. Finish what you start, should be this app’s sales pitch. Definitely download.

title: Favorite focus app
review: My absolute favorite way to focus, esp for WHF. I struggle with all of the distractions and with my living space being my working space too. I’ve been using this app for about 6 years (helped me through my BA and MA too). Can’t recommend enough

title: Great app
review: I’ve always been a good student, but this app has helped me put in more work and written out that allows me to really see the amount of work put in to feel better about taking breaks and enjoying life! And the trees are cute!

title: Great app but please make landscape mode for iPads
review: I love using this app as it helps me to focus. However, one thing that bothers me is the lack of support for landscape mode. I use my iPad on my magic keyboard so it is always in landscape mode but it looks weird because it is always upright and sideways. Please add this feature soon.

title: 5/5 Recommend!
review: This is one of the best studying apps out there! I get really distracted when I’m studying with my phone out, and this app keeps me on track with its 2 hour timer. It’s also useful if you want to study with your friends!

title: The money is so worth it.
review: Seriously, all you have to pay is the 2-3 dollars, make a free account and your all set. The app is so simple and easy to use, you can change the trees you plant, and you get coins from focusing for various times. I love it so much!

title: Helps with Productivity
review: This app is great! It definitely motivates me to stay off of my phone and focus on my homework. My only problem with the app is the fact that all the other plants and trees cost a lot of coins in order to get and seems unreachable. If they cost less it would help a lot.

title: It’s great!
review: It’s great! I do like the idea behind this app. And it does help knowing you are helping the environment while you work. I give it 4 and not 5 because the app layout is too messy and crowded. Too many buttons and little features that clutter up the screen. It can be confusing to navigate.

title: Really helpful
review: I’m trying to get back into reading and using this app makes me more disciplined to do so. It’s refreshing knowing that can go through half a book in four hours without having my phone distract me.

title: Exactly what i was looking for :)
review: this app has helped me so much, i always struggle staying focused while i’m working and this was the perfect app to help my productivity. it’s so cute and the reward factor helps so much more than most other apps i’ve tried

title: Quite the resource!
review: This is such a fun way to think of productivity! I get to do this with my friends or by myself and when you get to a certain point in planting trees, you actually get to plant a real tree. Productivity + environmentally friendly projects = a great time.

title: Love it!
review: This has helped me stay off my phone, and thus more focused. I don’t want my little tree to wither!! One thing that would improve the app IMMENSELY would be for cute little forest animals to start showing up in your forest the more trees you grow. OH man would that be motivating!!!

title: This app is amazing!
review: This app is so amazing! It helps me focus and just wanna do something fun. There is a feature where you turn deep focus on and if you leave the app your tree will die.😔 so that makes you want to stay on the app so you can make that tree grow!! I definitely recommend this app!

title: Easy and helpful
review: This app makes it easy and rewarding to track your time working. I really enjoy the feature that compares to pas days, weeks and months—it gives you a strong sense of your overall progress over longer stretches of time!

title: Such a simple, but cute way to stay accountible
review: I don’t use this app very often but I think the idea is so cute. It is not overly complicated and is very user friendly. It really puts emphasis on spending as little time on the app as possible, but giving you a little reward at the end.

title: Best focus app
review: Forest is worth the money. It helps you stay off your phone and it's for a good cause. I've used other focus timers, none have helped center my attention and keep me off my devices as this one has. It's worth your money and it works. I’ve used it for at least 3 or 4 years.

title: So helpful!
review: Forest has helped me stay focused so much over my years of schooling! I will set short timers to break up big projects or longer ones when it’s crunch time. It’s so motivating to see the little trees in your forest and know you are not only helping yourself but also the environment.

title: Amazing App!!
review: I seriously love this app because it allows me to focus extra hard on my studying and times when i want to be distant from my phone. It’s super simplistic, however, it’s so worth it and helps you with distractions. I used to be the worst procrastinator (alwaaays on my phone) but this app holds me accountable & i love it!

title: I love this app
review:
I really do enjoy this app and it makes me super accountable for my studying habits! My friends and I love competing and planting trees together! 
The only thing I would change is how much money you get for each tree planted. I feel like it should be just a little more! Other than that amazing app

title: This app contributes to helping the world!
review: I just wanted to mention that not only does this app greatly help with focus, it has an option to plant trees in real life to help the environment. All you have to do is go to the menu and click “real Forrest” and use your coins to plant a real tree! Help save the world/environment! Really incredible

title: I’m actually doing my work
review:
During the corona virus outbreak, it is hard concentrating on my work, especially as a high school student with a low attention span, but using this made me want to concentrate even more on my work. It actually worked! My grads have been getting better.

Also, I’ve been using this for 2 weeks now.

title: Works if you work
review: You need to have a bit of self discipline to begin with. The app is a good tool to help, but at the end of the day you need to make your self use it. If you are looking to improve your concentration and stay away from your phone. It’s a fun way to keep track.

title: So productive
